name: Comfy Family Home, Central Location
space: I live with my husband and 24 year old son. We have a spacious house with 4 bedrooms. We are offering our spare bedroom which has 3/4 size bed than can be folded into a sofa for extra space. The room is bright and clean with lots of drawer space and a big desk. The house has free WiFi. Guests should expect their own private room and a welcoming family atmosphere. The neighbour hood is very safe and close to the city centre with good transport links, with buses and trains very close by. There are shops, restaurants and bars all in close proximity and the University of Manchester itself is very close. We are easy to reach from most of Manchester including the airport. We ensure that your stay will be comfortable and relaxing and welcome your arrival. As this is a family home we do ask that only members with photos and a brief description about themselves contact us.

name: Very comfortable double in Overlea
summary: A beautiful red brick corner house with big garden, recently renovated & in a quiet but convenient area (near didsbury). 15 mins to Piccadilly/Manchester airport on a direct line from Burnage station. Great host with a warm home.
space: The double bedroom has a very comfortable new wooden double bed, mattress and clean linen. With a wardrobe, bedside draws and lamp. The house has wireless, super-fast broadband throughout. There is a beautiful bathroom next door to your room with a large, deep bath and over-head shower. There is also an additional bathroom downstairs with power shower. The lounge/diner is very comfortable and the modern fitted kitchen with breakfast bar is easy to use. There is a Smart flat screen LED T.V in the lounge and an electric piano. The lounge also features an open fire place. In the summer months the 'wrap around' garden is yours to enjoy full with flowers and two sitting areas. There is also a garden shed for bikes and plenty of parking space for cars.
description: A beautiful red brick corner house with big garden, recently renovated & in a quiet but convenient area (near didsbury). 15 mins to Piccadilly/Manchester airport on a direct line from Burnage station. Great host with a warm home. The double bedroom has a very comfortable new wooden double bed, mattress and clean linen. With a wardrobe, bedside draws and lamp. The house has wireless, super-fast broadband throughout. There is a beautiful bathroom next door to your room with a large, deep bath and over-head shower. There is also an additional bathroom downstairs with power shower. The lounge/diner is very comfortable and the modern fitted kitchen with breakfast bar is easy to use. There is a Smart flat screen LED T.V in the lounge and an electric piano. The lounge also features an open fire place. In the summer months the 'wrap around' garden is yours to enjoy full with flowers and two sitting areas. There is also a garden shed for bikes and plenty of parking space for cars. You will have
neighborhood_overview: Burnage is a friendly mixed area with a community feel. It is close to the lovely high streets of Didsbury and the Heatons. East Didsbury Cinema is within walking distance and Levenshulme/Stockport offer great nights out. There is a nice local pub, restaurants/cafes and take-aways all close by. The local Aldi and Tesco provide easy convenience and Burnage station offers direct trains in either direction to Piccadilly or Manchester Airport. Fog Lane park offers a huge variety of well established trees, conservation area and a playground with sports facilities. It is a quiet location but within easy access to all the areas you may wish to explore in and around Manchester.
notes: I sometimes look after my Mum's dog Oscar, who is a lovely, gentle border collie with a loud bark. He is only here once in a while. However if you are allergic/afraid of dogs please do double check he is not due a visit before booking. On that note I am also happy to discuss pets visiting but on a one on one basis.
transit: Both Burnage and Mauldeth Road stations are about 15 mins walk from the house. The lines take you to Manchester Piccadilly (14 mins) or Manchester Airport (12 mins). Burnage is a suburb of the city of Manchester in North West England, about 4 miles (6.4 km) south of Manchester city centre and bisected by a dual carriageway called the Kingsway. It lies between Withington to the west, Levenshulme to the north, Heaton Chapel to the east and Didsbury and Heaton Mersey to the south. It is easy to find from the M60 and just 15 mins drive from the airport.
host_about: Relaxed, open and considerate.
street: Overlea Drive, Manchester, M19 1LS, United Kingdom

summary: My peaceful apartment hosts a double bedroom with ensuite in a modern new build apartment block. Sleeps upto 2 people and is close to transport links to the city. Enjoy trendy bars & restaurants, golf & leisure clubs or entertainment complex nearby!
space: My peaceful apartment hosts a double bedroom with ensuite in a modern new build apartment block. Sleeps upto 2 people and is close to transport links to the city. Enjoy trendy bars & restaurants, leisure clubs and entertainment complex nearby! I have a spacious 2 bedroom apartment in modern apartment block. My place is clean, bright and airy with a good amount space to walk around and feel comfortable. I am always cleaning and burning candles and incense which visitors say makes it feel homely, peaceful and relaxing. I have lots of cushions and mannequinns so its pretty girly (but not over the top). The double room on offer has an ensuite, fresh bedding, a tv, wardrobe and draws, clean towels, toiletries and a maiden just incase you need to do any washing. In the room there is a double bed, a chair w/ footstool, 2 wardrobes and a small draw set. I can comfortably accomodate 2 guests.  I don't provide breakfast but there is a Tesco minutes away and I provide cupboard and fridge space, s

I don't provide breakfast but there is a Tesco minutes away and I provide cupboard and fridge space, s
neighborhood_overview: My neighbourhood is in a great location and is handy to get to pretty much anywhere. There's the trendy bars/restaurants of Didsbury and The Heatons, a leisure and entertainment complex (gym, cinema, bowling, casino and lots of places to eat), golf clubs/driving range, attractions of the city centre, super close local amenities and great transport links all just minutes away. There are also lots of take-aways if you fancy a late night snack and organic shops and deli's if you prefer a healthier option (Organic shops and deli's open 9am-5pm and are 5-10 mins away by car).
notes: Bad Points:  It's on a main road so maybe noisey if you're trying to sleep during the day between 8am-8pm Floor boards are thin so you may sometimes hear neighbours upstairs walking around.
transit: Only minutes away are train station (4mins), bus (3mins), metro (15mins) and taxi's (1 min). If you need to hire a car Enterprise rentals is just next door.  To city centre: 10mins by train (to Piccadilly Station City Centre), 20-25mins by bus (rush hour 35-45 mins), 25mins by metro and 15mins by taxi.  To Didsbury: 20 mins walking, 5 minutes by car, £3-4 in a taxi Airport: The airport is only 10mins away by car or train and you can get a train direct here from the airport. Taxi cost from airport is £16-18 and train is around £3.30.   Taxi to the airport is £10 and train around £3.30
host_about:
I'm fun, smiley and outgoing with a good sense of humour, but am also very polite, kind, caring and understanding. One thing I can't live without is 'my' brain. It's allowed me to have thee most amazing life so far. Ok so seriously, I can't live without my laptop because I'm super hard working and have recently started a matchmaking internet business.
I've done a little bit of travelling around Thailand, America and Europe and hope to do more one day soon. 
I can pretty much get along with anyone and love to help people. 

My life motto's are:
Live, Laugh and Love
Love is a journey not a destination
True happiness is an inward journey

Hope you book my room, I'd love to be your host whilst you're here in Manchester :)

name: Immaculate flat close to great bars
summary: Chorlton is a great place to live in Manchester. My flat is nice and quiet whilst also being only a couple of minutes walk from all the best bars and restaurants in Chorlton. It is also only a few minutes by car to Manchester United.
space: The apartment is set within a quiet cul de sac but within minutes of the lively and bustling Beech Road, where you will find first class restaurants and bars.
description: Chorlton is a great place to live in Manchester. My flat is nice and quiet whilst also being only a couple of minutes walk from all the best bars and restaurants in Chorlton. It is also only a few minutes by car to Manchester United. The apartment is set within a quiet cul de sac but within minutes of the lively and bustling Beech Road, where you will find first class restaurants and bars. All of the apartment is available for use. I am normally accessible throughout the stay for any questions which may arise. Chorlton is an arty and alternative area of Manchester which is favoured by local people as the place to be in Manchester. The atmosphere on Beech Road is unique and has some of the best places to eat and drink in Manchester. At a weekend a local farmers market can often be found on Chorlton Green, only a few minutes walk away. The apartment is close to bus routes and tram links into and out of Manchester and the surrounding area.
neighborhood_overview: Chorlton is an arty and alternative area of Manchester which is favoured by local people as the place to be in Manchester. The atmosphere on Beech Road is unique and has some of the best places to eat and drink in Manchester. At a weekend a local farmers market can often be found on Chorlton Green, only a few minutes walk away.
transit: The apartment is close to bus routes and tram links into and out of Manchester and the surrounding area.
host_about:
I have lived in Manchester all my life but have travelled a lot, and for me, Chorlton is one of the best places to live. It's alternative and bohemian, has great bars and restaurants and is a really good place to be.

My work means that I am away a lot of the time, so as you can see, I'm letting other people enjoy where I live.

I love travelling and have used Airbnb myself so am aware of what makes a great place to stay. My flat is very close to all of Chorlton's best places to eat and drink (2 minutes walk) and is also close to Manchester United's ground and walks along the River Mersey.

If you have any questions, please feel free to get in touch.

name: Double room in quirky loft flat
summary: Amidst the bohemia and cafe culture of vibrant Chorlton, I have a lovely double bedroom available within a cute and cosy flat with a distinctly unique feel about it. Set on a quiet street with everything you'd want just a few minutes walk away.
space: The bedroom itself is bright and airy with double aspect windows. It is at the back of the flat, so away from the living area making it nice and peaceful. The double bed is from the 1970's and was owned by Derek Jarman, the film director (apparently he made a short artsy film featuring the bed with some friends chilling on it!) It's a bespoke piece of furniture that was made for him by  a carpenter friend and it's pretty high off the ground! The mattress is new and very comfortable. There is an in-built cupboard for hanging clothes,an antique indian cabinet and a large up-cycled vintage set of drawers. Of course, free wifi is available from the room.
description: Amidst the bohemia and cafe culture of vibrant Chorlton, I have a lovely double bedroom available within a cute and cosy flat with a distinctly unique feel about it. Set on a quiet street with everything you'd want just a few minutes walk away. The bedroom itself is bright and airy with double aspect windows. It is at the back of the flat, so away from the living area making it nice and peaceful. The double bed is from the 1970's and was owned by Derek Jarman, the film director (apparently he made a short artsy film featuring the bed with some friends chilling on it!) It's a bespoke piece of furniture that was made for him by  a carpenter friend and it's pretty high off the ground! The mattress is new and very comfortable. There is an in-built cupboard for hanging clothes,an antique indian cabinet and a large up-cycled vintage set of drawers. Of course, free wifi is available from the room. A shared bathroom is adjacent to your sleeping quarter. A three piece suite with a power shower
neighborhood_overview: Chorlton is home to a plethora of independent cafes and restaurants and a sweet, little village green and pub (all within a few mins walk). There's a lovely bohemian community feel here and if you walk along Beech Road it's not surprising to bump into a few familiar faces, sipping their coffee, sampling the tapas, or mooching around the artsy shops. In the Summer there are several local festivals held, and year-round food markets. Also, theres Chorlton Ees and Water Park which is a vast expanse of stunning countryside bearing a wonderful lake and of course the River Mersey.  Also a good library and the new Houghend leisure centre which offers great facilities.
notes: I forgot to mention, the ladder in the photos takes you up to the small mezzanine if you feel like reading a book, listening to music or to simply be swallowed up by the big comfy leather beanbag!
transit: With lots already on my doorstep, I'm also fortunate enough to be only three miles from the city centre. A 5 minute stroll takes you to Chorlton metro-link station (tram). Here is the gateway to the rest of Manchester! 10-15 minutes to the city centre, 30 minutes to media city, and brilliantly, only 35 minutes to Manchester airport. (Or alternatively taxi takes about 15mins and is around £15) There are, of course, buses galore.  If you are driving there's free on-street parking, or private parking if needed.
host_about: I'm a classical musician that plays the clarinet in orchestras and ensembles alongside shows and more commercial projects. I have a passion not only for music, but also for mid century artefacts, vintage markets should beware! I'm very house proud and enjoy just pottering around it. Also, very much enjoy food and eating out.
street: Cranbourne Road, Chorlton-Cum-Hardy, Greater Manchester M21 8GE, United Kingdom

host_about:
Hi i'm Jeorge,  a down to earth friendly and reliable individual from Chorlton, happy to assist with making your stay in Manchester a pleasant one. I tried Air bnb on a trip with four friends and was surprised how easy the service was to use and the quality of the house. So I decided to make my homely 3 double bedroom end terraced  house available for short term rent, providing the same level of service we enjoyed.
Being Knowledgeable about the area (Chorlton) and Manchester city in general, I can help the guests with there plans, allowing your stay to be packed with an array of activities or homely peaceful relaxation.

 The property is Fully refurbished and Modernised with 3 double bedrooms, and 2 standard bathrooms. Full of everything you'll need to make your stay a warm and relaxing one. The house can sleep up to 6 people, with a good size lounge and dining room to relax in Ideal for both families and groups alike. Located in the heart of Chorlton on the main strip, with bars and restaurants at your doorstep. E.g the closest bar/restaurant is less than 0.1 mile away.
Buses are extremely regular, its around 3-4 minute walk to/from Metrolink tram stop and 10 minute drive to Manchester City Centre.

name: Attic single in WhiteRooms,Chorlton
space: I always use the old fashioned word 'handsome' when describing my house. It is a 3 storey, bay fronted, 5 bedroom Victorian semi, with off-road parking. The interior is very simple, with white paintwork throughout, stripped or painted floors. I am an artist, I work here, and the house kinda reflects around that fact. People tell me that my home is artistic and comfortable. Guests seem to like the artworks and blobs of dried paint as adds to the 'arty' atmosphere of the place. There is a strong feeling of space, light, and calm in the house: just imagine an artist's garret/studio (spread over 3 floors) with a sizeable pinch of zen! I enjoy having fun with the decor: like painting bits of murals on walls, or removing doors to be replaced by drapey gauzy material, giving a more open-plan feel. It's theatrical and fun.  As well as a double-bedroom/ensuite (see other listing), I have this sweet, calm and atmospheric ATTIC ROOM with shared shower/bathroom facilities. The Attic Room has a thr

host_about:
I am a very contented 63year old artist with a lovely house that gives me plenty of room to 'breath' and work in. 
Apart from painting, I enjoy singing with my small accapella singing group, dancing Five Rhythms (which is a free-form expressionistic dance/movement practice), and going to the cinema (I've been known to go to see three films in one day!)........Mind you, now that I'm an Airbnb host with 3 listings, and consequently a busy stream of lovely, lovely guests, the cinema going is severely curtailed. But that is more than (URL HIDDEN) meeting all the diverse, and always-interesting people is just sooooo fantastic!! 

And I can't wait to meet some more of you!

name: Single in WhiteRooms ChorltonGreen
space: I jokingly call this room 'Lakeside View'. While it does overlook a froggy pond in my court-yard garden, that isn't the reason for the name. Hopefully the name will be explained if you take a look at the accompanying photographs. It is a simple but ample single room ( 10'5'' x 10'5'' ) with a shared shower/bathroom (there is a toilet in the bathroom, and also a SEPARATE toilet for convenience……no pun intended ).  The room has the usual necessities: large table to work at,  DAB radio, comfy chair,  hair dryer,  towels and shower gel, and errr………a lakeside view. BUT PLEASE BE AWARE THAT THERE IS NO WIFI CONNECTION  IN THIS ROOM, as unfortunately my BT broadband does not stretch to this section of the house. SO HUGE APOLOGIES. There is of course a kettle, with a wide variety of teas.  Besides the normal 'builders tea' there may be camomile, green tea, rooibos, earl grey, fruit teas; plus a cafétier and ground coffee if Gold Blend just ain't good enough! The room is £34 per night. A variet

name: Chorlton-Cum-Hardy, Manchester

name: Spacious residence in Chorlton
summary: Our house is beautifully decorated and features top-quality beds and furniture. The house is a stone's throw from the über-trendy bars and restaurants of Beech Road in Chorlton.   Central Manchester is short cab ride (£9) or bus/tram (£3) away.
space: The whole house is open to guests apart from one bedroom and our storage cupboard.
description: Our house is beautifully decorated and features top-quality beds and furniture. The house is a stone's throw from the über-trendy bars and restaurants of Beech Road in Chorlton.   Central Manchester is short cab ride (£9) or bus/tram (£3) away. The whole house is open to guests apart from one bedroom and our storage cupboard. There is a large garden and patio area, it isn't in great condition but guests are welcome to access it. Only as required by guests!   We'll make sure you're settled and leave you to it :) Chorlton is full of quirky, forward-thinking, innovative and unique places, so you can enjoy something a little bit different from the norm. Chorlton offers the best of everything outside of the city centre. It hosts some of the finest independent restaurants, bars, pubs and cafes in Manchester (take trip advisor's word for it) (website hidden)_cum_Hardy_Greater_Manchester_England-(email hidden)ml  Some of our favourites close by; The Laundrette - cocktails and carbs Serendipite
neighborhood_overview: Chorlton is full of quirky, forward-thinking, innovative and unique places, so you can enjoy something a little bit different from the norm. Chorlton offers the best of everything outside of the city centre. It hosts some of the finest independent restaurants, bars, pubs and cafes in Manchester (take trip advisor's word for it) (website hidden)_cum_Hardy_Greater_Manchester_England-(email hidden)ml  Some of our favourites close by; The Laundrette - cocktails and carbs Serendipitea - tea, coffee and cake! The Lead Station - contemporary English food, great veggie options Moose - meat and cheese platters Bar San Juan - Tapas to die for! The Horse and Jockey - traditional pub on Chorlton Green Corriander Restaurant - delicious, healthy Bengali cuisine  Zaytoon - Lebanese cuisine If you fancy bit more of a walk into Chorlton (10 mins max); Croma - pizza/pasta Palate -  English contemporary The Beagle - Mexican food and global beers The Tea Hive - Breakfast, lunch, tea, coffee and cake. Ther
notes: Chorlton is a residential area.  We ask that you respect our neighbours when leaving the property and coming home from your excursions.
transit: If you have a car(s) there is enough space for two at the front of the property. There is also a lot of off road parking, but this can be quite limited during weekends.  The cheapest way to get around by using the tram. There are two tram stops which are both a 10 minute walk from the house. Chortlon to Market St (city centre) takes approximately 18 minutes and costs £2.80 for a single or £3.10 for a return, per adult, off peak. £3.80 peak (rush hour) Barlow Moor Road to Manchester Airport takes approximately and 35 minutes and costs £2.20 for single journey, per adult, off peak. The trams run every 12 min and start approximately 05:49 and finish at around 0:00 (times can vary depending on your destination) (website hidden) If you are travelling to the airport I would recommend using Uber or a local taxi firm. The airport is only a 10 minute drive and will cost between £10-£13.  A Black Cab from the airport to Chorlton will cost a bit more, around £20. If buses are more your thing, Cho

name: Big Comfy Room in Leafy Boho Suburb
summary: A spacious and comfortable room in a typical semi detached house right in the heart of Manchester's leafy bohemian suburb, Chorlton. Chorlton itself has a host of attractions and there are plenty of buses and trams frequently making the short journey into Manchester. Broadband internet and onstreet parking are available.
description: A spacious and comfortable room in a typical semi detached house right in the heart of Manchester's leafy bohemian suburb, Chorlton. Chorlton itself has a host of attractions and there are plenty of buses and trams frequently making the short journey into Manchester. Broadband internet and onstreet parking are available. Guests have access to the kitchen and bathroom as well as a living room and the garden it looks out on to. There is a fridge, a cooker, a washing machine, a bath and a shower. The rapid wireless broadband is yours to use freely too. The bed is a futon Newport Road is a quiet and friendly street nestled right in the heart of Chorlton.    Chorlton has been home to many artists writers and musicians down the years and up until this very day, indeed, Anthony Burgess, author of Clockwork Orange, said that once you've lived here you'll never want to leave, besides him the likes of writer Quentin Crisp and musicians Niko, Shaun Ryder and Badly Drawn Boy have all been resident
neighborhood_overview: Newport Road is a quiet and friendly street nestled right in the heart of Chorlton.    Chorlton has been home to many artists writers and musicians down the years and up until this very day, indeed, Anthony Burgess, author of Clockwork Orange, said that once you've lived here you'll never want to leave, besides him the likes of writer Quentin Crisp and musicians Niko, Shaun Ryder and Badly Drawn Boy have all been resident.    There is currently a thriving music scene hosted by the many bars with their unique characteristics. There is also a bog standard Wetherspoons along with two little theatres. There are all kinds of shops but Chorlton is especially known for its Vegetarian Vegan and Health food shops and delicatessens, most notably The Unicorn and The Barbakan.    Chorlton contains two town parks, one is just at the end of Newport Road, and a Country park as well as Southern Cemetery immortalised by Morrisey who grew up in nearby Firswood. There is also a picturesque village green
notes: A breakfast of muesli or scrambled eggs and toast and home-made jams, if required,  is offered by your toast at a time to suit you. Tea and coffee offered too.
transit: Both frequent buses and trams are within five minutes walking distance. Manchester City Centre Old Trafford football ground The Lowry and MediaCityUK are all within a half hour away and from the City centre anywhere in the Greater Manchester conurbation or the stunning countryside which surrounds it, including the Peak District National Park, can easily be reached. Your host has lived in Manchester for 50 years and knows it and the surrounding area well. She Is happy to help with ideas for good places to visit and interesting things to do.

Hi! I'm a 26yo anthropologist working as a translator. I love languages immensely, in order to learn them in depth I travel a lot and spend long periods away from home. 
I have been an active member of couchsurfing for 9years (URL HIDDEN) so I have learned how to prepare for accommodating someone. 
My main interests include activity related to feminist politics, music production (hiphop) and zines making. I also enjoy a lot board games, skateboarding and swimming.

name: Nice double room. Great Location!
summary: Lovely double bedroom. Situated in a peaceful, leafy suburb of South Manchester in Chorlton, which provides a lively and vibrant atmosphere. Close to Manchester United FC, Old Trafford Cricket ground and Metro links to the city centre or airport.
space: A lovely room downstairs, with a new double bed and comfy mattress. There's also a wardrobe with drawers for guests to use, a sofa, large TV and internet access.
description: Lovely double bedroom. Situated in a peaceful, leafy suburb of South Manchester in Chorlton, which provides a lively and vibrant atmosphere. Close to Manchester United FC, Old Trafford Cricket ground and Metro links to the city centre or airport. A lovely room downstairs, with a new double bed and comfy mattress. There's also a wardrobe with drawers for guests to use, a sofa, large TV and internet access. Private bedroom for guest, fully equipped kitchen, family bathroom, downstairs toilet, utility room and garden. I work from home most of the time, we'll do our best to make you feel welcome and help in any way we can. Situated in a peaceful leafy village of Chorlton, less than 5 miles from Manchester city centre. Next to Chorlton water park which is a great place for walks. The park offers fishing as well as water-sports including dinghy sailing, canoeing and windsurfing. In addition to the water park there is a fantastic walk down the river Mersey to Sale Water Park. Chorlton village
neighborhood_overview: Situated in a peaceful leafy village of Chorlton, less than 5 miles from Manchester city centre. Next to Chorlton water park which is a great place for walks. The park offers fishing as well as water-sports including dinghy sailing, canoeing and windsurfing. In addition to the water park there is a fantastic walk down the river Mersey to Sale Water Park. Chorlton village, Chorlton Green and Beech Road are a short walk away with its high quality restaurants, bars and shops.
transit: Ideal location for public transport to the city centre, universities and the airport. We're less than five miles from the Manchester city centre, the Trafford Centre, Salford Quays and Media City. There are five Metro tram stops less than 20 minutes walk away, the bus stop is a 10 minute walk and Manchester Airport is a 15 minute drive. Manchester United FC is less than three miles away and Old Trafford Cricket ground is only two miles away.
host_about:
I'm a Graphic Designer living in South Manchester. I love Manchester, it's lively and exciting - came to study as a student, met my husband and stayed. I've lived here for more than 25 years and we have two grown up children. 

I keep busy most of the time between work, family and spending time with friends. As a family we have a mixture of musical and artistic talents. I love to travel, meet new people and experience different cultures. I like to think that I am a kind, honest and an easy going person, so I would like to live with visitors who are similar.

We're situated in a quiet cul-de-sac. Chorltonville is a very special part of Manchester, it's green, leafy and peaceful despite its close proximity to Manchester city centre and all of the universities in Manchester and Salford. Great for public transport - trams, trains and buses are all close by, ideal for transport to the Trafford Centre, Lowry Centre, Media City (BBC), Salford Quays, Manchester Airport, Manchester Central (G-Mex), Manchester United FC and Old Trafford Cricket Ground. On our doorstep are quality restaurants, bars and shops, Beech Road, Chorlton Green and Sale/Chorlton Water Parks for country walks, water activities and the Jacksons Boat pub.

name: Comfortable double room in Chorlton
summary: A bright room in a quiet street, close to everything Manchester has to offer.
space: You will be staying in a light airy private room with a comfortable king-size bed, and have shared access to the bathroom, and the rest of the house.  I like to keep my home bright, cosy and relaxed - many people have commented on its welcoming atmosphere and fantastic location.
description: A bright room in a quiet street, close to everything Manchester has to offer. You will be staying in a light airy private room with a comfortable king-size bed, and have shared access to the bathroom, and the rest of the house.  I like to keep my home bright, cosy and relaxed - many people have commented on its welcoming atmosphere and fantastic location. You'll only be sharing with me (and my cat) and you may come and go as you please while you're here. In the summer, my little garden is a pleasant place to sit with a morning coffee, and the living room is cosy in the evenings. I work from home, running a small catering business. I will provide breakfast, on a help-yourself basis, including home-made items like granola and marmalade, but since I work from home I generally need my kitchen to myself after breakfast time so it's not available to guests after that.  There is off-road parking for your car, or for an extra £20 I can pick you up from the airport - cheaper than a taxi and you
neighborhood_overview: Chorlton is a vibrant neighbourhood in south Manchester; slightly bohemian in character, with lots of quirky shops, bars and places to eat, but located only three miles from Manchester city centre and well-connected by frequent tram and bus services. My house is in a quiet street, with some great local bars, a late-opening mini-supermarket (with cashpoint) and an artisan bakery literally just around the corner. On warm nights you can smell the fresh bread being baked, which is delicious!  There is also a wide range of pubs, restaurants and interesting shops within walking distance - check out the 'guidebook' attached to this listing for just a few of the options!
notes: I am an experienced host, and have had guests stay here from all over the world, some wanting a quiet base for a work visit, some just wanting to relax and explore Manchester - get in touch and let me know how I can make your stay enjoyable!
transit: I am also very happy to give you information and recommendations for things to do, places to eat out etc in Manchester and beyond.  Besides being an exciting, stylish city with interesting history and architecture, and a vibrant nightlife, this is also a good base for exploring the North West of England - it's easy to get to Liverpool, Chester, the Pennines, Leeds and the Lake District from here.  The house itself is within walking distance to Old Trafford - 15 mins to the cricket ground, about 25 mins to the football stadium - for matches, music concerts or the stadium tour.  It's also an easy tram journey to The Lowry arts centre and Media City complex at Salford Quays, and there are regular bus services to the Trafford Centre shopping & entertainment complex.
host_about:
Friendly 40-something, living in Manchester's coolest neighbourhood! 

I came here for university and liked it so much I've stayed for over twenty years. I know a fair bit about the local history of Manchester, I enjoy cooking and entertaining, knitting, theatre and music, and especially singing with my acappella choir! 

I'm gay (so no homophobes please!) a bit 'leftie' and fond of wine & cats.

I've had guests staying from all over the world - feel free to browse my reviews - and really enjoy helping people discover Manchester, which is a great city to live in with loads going on all through the year. 

I manage 4 listings, each with their own unique character:

1. If you're interested in staying with me in the private room in my own home, I will ask you to tell me a bit about yourself and your trip, and I will do my best to answer any questions you have. It's very relaxed at my house - you'll have your own key and be able to come and go as you please. Let me know how I can make your visit memorable.

2 & 3. I also manage a self-contained 1-bedroom apartment in the City Centre, and a self-contained 2-bedroom house in Salford, both of which you can book for your exclusive use. You'll still get my personal service with booking and check-in and I'll be available if you have any problems. 

4. I also manage the bookings for a private room in a large & beautiful house in Whalley Range. Georgia is the homeowner and lives in the property - I will deal with your enquiries and booking arrangements, but during your stay you'll be sharing the space with Georgia and her friendly cats.
street: Ransfield Rd, Manchester, M21 9GZ, United Kingdom

name: Lovely bohemian garden apartment
summary: My lovely little flat sits in the heart of Chorlton (15 min taxi ride to Manchester City Centre), a vibrant alternative area with boutiques, vegan cafes and art shops, nice pubs and restaurants and young professionals galore.
space: My apartment is set in a lovely old victorian house in the basement.  It has a beautiful decked area that you can walk out onto from either of the bedrooms through patio doors.  It is a stones throw from the famous and bustling Beech Rd filled with boutiques, quaint pubs, cafes and galleries.  A 8 minute walk to the tram stop into central Manchester which takes 15 minutes on the tram. You can get here easily from the airport too - a tram every 20 minutes comes into Chorlton and vice versa straight from the airport - estimated 35 mins.  You can also drive easily in 15-20 mins

name: Double/Ensuite in bohemian Chorlton
space: I always use the old fashioned word 'handsome' when describing my house.  It is a 3 storey, bay fronted, 5 bedroom Victorian semi, with off-road parking.     The interior is very simple, with white paintwork throughout,  and stripped or painted floors.   I am an artist, I work here, and the house kinda revolves around that. People tell me that my home is artistic and comfortable.  Guests seem to like the artworks and blobs of dried paint as adds to the 'arty' atmosphere of the place. There is a strong feeling of space, light, and calm in the house: just imagine an artist's garret/studio (spread over 3 floors) with a sizeable pinch of zen!       I enjoy having fun with the decor: like painting murals on walls, or removing doors to be replaced by drapey gauzy material, giving a more open-plan feel. ….. ……. just for the hell of it.  It's  theatrical and fun.           Here I offer the master double-bedroom (en-suite dontcha know?!).   Situated first floor front, with a lock and lovely

name: Cosy double close to city centre
summary: Lovely double features a pleasant view looking over pleasant gardens. Ideally suited for couple or solo traveller. It is well located for both Manchester city centre and the famous Old Trafford football/cricket grounds and popular Chorlton suburb.
space: This is my home and I know the area well. My apartment is bright, and has a well equipped kitchen and modern bathroom /toilet. The room itself will accommodate 2 comfortably.
description: Lovely double features a pleasant view looking over pleasant gardens. Ideally suited for couple or solo traveller. It is well located for both Manchester city centre and the famous Old Trafford football/cricket grounds and popular Chorlton suburb. This is my home and I know the area well. My apartment is bright, and has a well equipped kitchen and modern bathroom /toilet. The room itself will accommodate 2 comfortably. You will have access to all of the above and I am happy for you to cook should you so wish. You can also smoke on the balcony outside the apartment.There is also free off road parking. Happy to interact as little or as much as you would prefer. Though obviously I will be checking you in. I will provide a map and other useful guides should you need them. Whalley Range is a great location. It has a real eclectic feel of Victorian history and 100 year old trees, combined with cultural influences from Asia, Africa, Jamaica and Poland (local people and shops). It is 2 miles f
neighborhood_overview: Whalley Range is a great location. It has a real eclectic feel of Victorian history and 100 year old trees, combined with cultural influences from Asia, Africa, Jamaica and Poland (local people and shops). It is 2 miles from the centre and is on a direct bus route, which takes approx 15 minutes. It is also less than 5 minutes from local bars and restaurants, as well as 30 minutes walking distance from Old Trafford. Chorlton is also close by, with many places to eat, drink and shop.
notes: Only been doing this a few months and guests have stayed several weeks, so only a few  references so far. However I have hosted many times as a Couchsurfer so check out my profile if your still unsure.
transit: The 86 bus takes you directly into town, with gives you access to major train, coach and tram routes. You can also walk to many local places of interest. If driving, very close to major motorway routes which can get you to popular local places of interest such as Liverpool, North Wales, Yorkshire and the Lake district. The airport by taxi takes about 15 minutes.
host_about:
Done a lot of travelling in the last few years, like Thailand, Cuba, Madrid and Stockholm and always try to stay with local people. So I think I have a pretty good idea of what it takes to be a good host. Also done a lot of hosting as a CouchSurfer, and now have a year of hosting Airbnb under my belt. So know the score.
However please make sure you complete your profile section, as I will not accept requests without knowing a little about you. Seems only fair.
I do teach for a living, so arrival and departure times will need to work around my work, but don't hold that against me.
 Love meeting  people, so would consider myself friendly and pretty broad minded. What else - love food, music, art and the occasional 'out of your comfort zone experience'. People also comment on my sense of humour. You will have to judge that one for yourself....

name: Warm large dbl room nr city centre
summary: A spacious quiet room in a wooded bohemian suburb very close to the city centre, our large Victorian semi is the ideal place to unwind and enjoy Manchester and its creative buzz.
space: You'll be staying in a comfortable ground floor double room (16m2), positioned directly opposite the ground-floor bathroom.  Our home is in a great location with a relaxed, bright, welcoming and warm vibe. Everyone who has stayed with us says they feel comfortable and at home straight away. We'll help you have a wonderful stay in our city.
description: A spacious quiet room in a wooded bohemian suburb very close to the city centre, our large Victorian semi is the ideal place to unwind and enjoy Manchester and its creative buzz. You'll be staying in a comfortable ground floor double room (16m2), positioned directly opposite the ground-floor bathroom.  Our home is in a great location with a relaxed, bright, welcoming and warm vibe. Everyone who has stayed with us says they feel comfortable and at home straight away. We'll help you have a wonderful stay in our city. You'll be sharing with me, my daughter and son and are welcome to access the downstairs bathroom (directly opposite your room), the kitchen / dining room, where breakfast is available every morning and the front and back gardens.  There is plenty of parking at the house. We also have WiFi, which you are free to use. We are a friendly, creative family with a long tradition of welcoming house guests from all over the world. Our home is ideal for anyone wanting to explore Manch
neighborhood_overview: Our large Victorian semi is ideally located in the quiet, leafy bohemian quarter of Whalley Range. We are in the heart of a designated conservation area so you are likely to come across bats, owls, squirrels, foxes amidst the local wildlife. We are only 2 miles south of Manchester City centre, with excellent transport links and a twenty minute walk from Old Trafford. Only a 5 minute wooded walk from local arty bars and restaurants, our location combines the best of both worlds: vibrant city life in a friendly, peaceful and fascinating suburb.
notes: No smoking allowed in the house - but there are lovely comfortable spaces in the garden where you can relax and smoke. You are welcome to help yourself to unlimited coffee/tea at any time, and breakfast items will be available in the mornings.  There is also a very wide choice of places to eat in the local neighbourhood, as well as in the city centre and I am happy to give you recommendations. I will lend you a set of keys so that you are free to come and go at any time during your stay. Please don't bring any other people back to the house though, unless you have cleared it with me first. I will carry on my life as normal, so sometimes I'll be in and sometimes I'll be out, but I always have my mobile phone with me, so if you have any queries, just call me!
transit: I am also very happy to give you information and recommendations for things to do, places to eat out etc in Manchester and beyond. Besides being an exciting, stylish city with interesting history and architecture, and a vibrant nightlife, this is also a good base for exploring the North West of England - it's easy to get to Liverpool, Chester, the Pennines, Blackpool, Leeds and the Lake District from here. The house itself is within walking distance to Old Trafford - 20 mins to the cricket ground, about 25 mins to the football stadium - for matches, music concerts or the stadium tour. It's also an easy tram journey to The Lowry arts centre and Media City complex at Salford Quays, and there are regular bus services to the Trafford Centre shopping & entertainment complex as well as the city centre itself. Nearest tram stop is Firswood.
host_about: I have been living in Manchester over twenty years. I studied here and loved it so much I haven't left, except to travel and live abroad myself. I used to teach English to foreign language students but now I am a music / fiction writer. I love reading, film, music, festivals, gigs, travel, food, wine, camping, fires and adventures. I love meeting new people and socialising.

name: Tranquil sunny double WR/Chorlton
summary: In the heart of the lovely leafy Whalley Range Conservancy, an easy commute to the airport or city centre, and on the doorstep of Chorlton, our lovely neighbourhood offers the perfect combination of village tranquility and cool urban vibe.
space: My sweet little home 'Felicity' is a traditional 1920s house and has a very special history. With its original solid wood floors and stained glass bay windows it's sunny, warm and full of the charm of its era while being contemporary and very cosy.  This is my medium guest-room: deliciously sunny and directly overlooking  the lovely patio garden. Drift away to sleep in a wonderfully comfortable small double bed with dreamy duck down bedding and soft yarn sheets and covers. There's plus plenty of storage space for your clothes and luggage, a kettle and teas, coffee and drinking chocolate and your own TV. You'll find a jug of fresh water and complimentary juice waiting for you on arrival. As you may have read on my profile and reviews, cooking is both my great passion and also a core part of what I offer my guests to order: healthy, wholesome and filling, home-made breakfasts and brunches; lunches to go; and suppers. Full details below: Breakfasts: If you wish to have breakfast you can c

notes: A) As you may have read from many of my reviews, our family includes a rather special little dog called Gina: a small 10-year old terrier with lots of character. She loves people and is very friendly (except to the postman...) but won't be licking your face or pestering you. Sometimes we also have our darling former foster dog, Gussie (also a little terrier) with us - for a day visit or holidays when his new family are away. The dogs are not allowed upstairs or in guest rooms, so you won't need to worry that you will return to find a little hairy friend trotting around in your room or curled up in your bed. **B) Please note that I'm afraid the kitchen is not available for guests to use for cooking or preparing meals - unless you are here as a long-term guest (two weeks or more). The reason is simply that as I am already pretty-much constantly busy in a small kitchen space with laundry, dishes, preparing, cooking and serving meals it is simply not practical. You will of course have your
host_about:
I absolutely love having guests. My mission is to provide the happiest, most welcoming and comfortable bnb experience in Manchester. Since I started hosting 19 months ago I've welcomed more than 400 guests from 55 countries into my home - the most enriching, illuminating and exciting adventure! I'm a friendly, happy person with a positive outlook on life and an impish sense of humour. I'm curious and love to learn. Travelling, meeting new people and learning about other cultures and traditions excite me. I've lived and worked on three continents; and my friends come from all over the world, many philosophies and walks of life. I'm a passionate and inventive cook. I love having a full house and feeding my family, friends and guests. I grew up in a place where many people don't have enough to eat, or roofs over their heads, so I am very grateful for these things. 

Here are some other things that make me joyful: my sons; music; reading; the sounds of the African night; beautiful old churches; laughing; star-gazing; hearing my Dad whistling in his garden; sushi; writing; my funny dog; mountains; dancing; macadamia nuts; the sea; going to gigs and festivals; making things; arthouse cinema; playing Scrabble; passion fruit; animals small and large; stained glass windows; falling snow; riding very fast on horseback with the wind in my face; camping in the middle of nowhere; the sound of birds singing and little children laughing.

neighborhood_overview: It is a friendly and safe area with a good community spirit. We have lovely cafes, shops, pubs and restaurants right on our door step and are so close to a vibrant city with great shops, theatres and night life.
transit: Perfect location for access to Manchester city centre and Salford Quays (15 mins on bus or tram, 10 mins drive). Walking distance to Old Trafford Football and Cricket grounds and the fashionable suburb of Chorlton-cum-Hardy. Chorlton is full of specialist shops and excellent restaurants and bars. Also 10 minutes drive to the Trafford Centre and Chill Factore.
host_about:
My name is Sharon and I am a private Science and Maths tutor. I have travelled extensively and have lived and worked in a number of countries including Laos, Costa Rica and America. Myself and my husband Danny, who is a musician and sound engineer, love to travel, meet new people and experience different cultures. We spent 6 months travelling in India and both lived and worked in Laos for 2 years.
I love to cook and Danny loves food, so we like to try different cuisines, as it always gives me new ideas. Danny particularly loves music as he plays acoustic and bass guitar and we both love live music and the theatre.
We love to welcome new people into our lovely home because people have done the same for us during our own travels. We look forward to meeting you!

summary: Enjoy a warm welcome, comfy beds and peaceful base for your stay in our friendly city.Our sweet terrace is located right on the border of Whalley Range and Chorlton: the best of village living with quick access to the universities,city centre & Quays
space: Small but perfectly formed, this is a cosy and bright small double, overlooking my little garden: south-facing and quiet, and the cheeriest room in the house. There is a wardrobe and a seriously comfy small double bed.  On your arrival you'll find a little tray with a carafe of water, along with bathroom essentials to save you bringing basics with you such as shampoo or shower gel. Naturally, all bedding - comfy duvet and pillows, cotton linen - and towels - are provided.  Gina - a small, intelligent, friendly and very well-behaved terrier - and sometimes Gus, Gina's jolly little brother - are part of our home. They are not noisy, dirty or pesky and have even won over some of the most determined animal-haters. However we are quite strict, they won't be in your bedroom!

neighborhood_overview: We're a short walk from the centre of Chorlton village. It's a special place: a village within a city - a friendly, lively, still-a-little-earthy community of determined independence and individuality. Tiny bars, pubs and tea-shops offering delicious homemade meals and cakes, locally-brewed ales and beers; and award-winning fishmongers, deli's, butchers and bakeries abound here. I moved here from London four years ago and just love it here. I really enjoy welcoming visitors to our lovely, friendly city and am happy to provide advice on the best places to visit, eat and relax in the city centre as well as the many lovely local spots.
notes: Gina - a small, intelligent, friendly and very well-behaved terrier - and sometimes Gus, Gina's jolly little brother - are part of our home. They are not noisy, dirty or pesky and have even won over some of the most determined animal-haters. However we are quite strict, they won't be in your bedroom!
transit: We are a one-minute walk to the bus stop for routes into the city centre and universities (about 15 mins off-peak, longer during busy periods) as well as Salford Quays, etc. We're a five or six-minute walk to the Metro station (tram) for a direct route to/from the airport and into the city (about 8mins to Deansgate, 12mins to the centre) west to Didsbury, or south to Altrincham, and connections for Salford Quays, north Manchester, etc. Few local people drive into town as public transport is so cheap and convenient and also avoids parking charges - however, there is easy and free on-street parking in our cul-de-sac; and it's about a 10- to 15-minute drive to town, depending on traffic/the time of day.

The ground floor has living/dining room and a kitchen with utility area. There is also a space under the stairs for bicycles. There is also a backyard with a BBQ, table and seating area. One has a double bed the other will be a family room. At the moment in the photos it just has a double bed but we will be moving my son's single bed into that bedroom when we move out where there are currently office shelves in the photo provided. The table and chair will remain in that room also as office space. Each bedroom has both wardrobe and chests of drawers.

name: Quirky artistic double bedroom
summary: A cosy but cool double bedroom with bathroom access in a 2 bed apartment. Our little flat is located in the sleepy suburb of Whalley Range - only 20mins from the city centre. We promise guests a warm welcome and a peaceful stay in Manchester.
space: The apartment may be small but is packed full of interesting ornaments, artwork, literature and music. We also have a large range of films available to our guests, with a 42" HD TV  in the living room to watch them on. The open-plan living room has a large glass doors backing onto a private garden and a small kitchenette with a large work-surface for cooking.
description: A cosy but cool double bedroom with bathroom access in a 2 bed apartment. Our little flat is located in the sleepy suburb of Whalley Range - only 20mins from the city centre. We promise guests a warm welcome and a peaceful stay in Manchester. The apartment may be small but is packed full of interesting ornaments, artwork, literature and music. We also have a large range of films available to our guests, with a 42" HD TV  in the living room to watch them on. The open-plan living room has a large glass doors backing onto a private garden and a small kitchenette with a large work-surface for cooking. Guests will have their own spacious double bedroom with a private ensuite. A space will be cleared in the wardrobe for guests to put their stuff. Guests will also have full access to the communal kitchen/living room and the garden. Guests travelling by car will be able to park their cars directly outside the block of flats. We are both friendly and sociable individuals who would be happy to w
neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is ideally located in the leafy suburb of Whalley Range about 2 miles southwest of Manchester city centre. Whalley Range itself is steeped in history being one of the oldest residential areas in the city and the streets are lined by mansions, large Victorian-era houses and quaint gardens. It is one of the greenest areas of the city and is uniquely quiet for an area in such close proximity of the centre. There are several shops (Tesco, Co-op etc), cafes and a couple of bars within a short walk from our front door.
notes: We will offer cups of tea/coffee and a basic breakfast (cereal, toast) free of charge. We may sometimes also offer to cook other meals for you if you are willing to chip in for ingredients but this is dependent on what we are doing. We have a coffee machine which will be available for guests to use.
transit: The area is well provided for by local transport links with the bus stop being (less than 5 minutes walk) from our flat. The number 86 bus runs regularly towards the city centre and takes around 20 minutes to get there. From Chorlton there are also regular Metrolink trams to the airport.  By foot you can reach the Oxford Road (universities, Whitworth Art Gallery) and Rusholme (the famous curry mile) in under 20 minutes. Here you are also 5 minutes walk away from the beautiful Alexandra park and 10 minutes from the trendy Chorlton area which is full of hip bars/cafes, artisan shops and restaurants.  By car you can easily reach the city centre (10mins) Old Trafford cricket and football grounds (15mins) and Salford Quays - Media City UK (20mins).
host_about: We are laid back hosts who like to welcome new people into our home! We read, listen to a lot of music and watch a lot of films but also like going out too. We will offer you tips on Manchester to suit your interests and are always up for a brew and a chat. However if you prefer to be left to your own devices then that's cool too :)
street: Whalley Road, Manchester, Greater Manchester M16 8AB, United Kingdom

neighborhood_overview: Whalley Range is a friendly leafy neighbourhood – with a large park, including children's play area and duck pond, local shops including a Tesco Extra and local restaurants and bars within a few minute walk of the house you have all you need on your door step.  There are many cherry trees in the neighbourhood providing a beautiful backdrop and if you come in the right season you may be able to persuade a friendly neighbour to give some fresh cherries from the tree!   The world famous Polish Deli Barbikan is only 10 minutes away in Chorlton where we recommend just about everything to eat from the cakes to cheese and meats but great to get your nice fresh bread (as served in Harvey Nicks and many other Manchester Centre Eateries).  Chorlton is great shopping also for Butchers, Fishmongers alongside its vibrant restaurant and bar scene for all tastes. Old Trafford is within walking distance from the house so very convenient if looking for accommodation for a sports or music weekend.
notes: Free Street Parking Outside the House. 1.Just the Place Ltd trading as "Nick and Andrea", hereinafter called "the Agency", act only as Agents for the owners of the accommodation ("the Owner") and the Contract of Letting is between the guest ("the Guest") and the Owner.

name: single room in Whalley Range
summary: This is a single room in a cosy flat. It is available for short periods and when I am not hosting friends, or away traveling.
space: You will be renting a single room in a two bedroom, cosy and warm flat in Whalley Range.  Your single bedroom is light and airy,with a funky pink wall and a nice window.  The flat is surrounded by communal gardens and is therefore very quiet and relaxing.  There is a hairdryer for your use; complementary bath towels can be provided upon request.  The bathroom and the kitchen are refurbished, with  a bath tub in the bathroom where you can take bubble baths! There is no dishwasher but there is a washing machine.  The flat is on the first floor, there is no elevator.  I offer continental breakfast, but would prefer that you do not use the kitchen.  Towels, shower gel, shampoo and hairdryer are complimentary as well - you can save space in your hand luggage this way! Just drop me a line should you need any more info.

notes: You will be sharing the flat with me.  You are not welcome to bring other people around.  I will give you a spare key so that you are autonomous throughout your stay.  This is a very quiet place and you are required not to engage in noisy activities in your room (loud music, loud movies, loud phone calls).
transit: It is conveniently located five minutes walking from 86 bus stop on Upper Chorlton Road, which takes you to the city centre and the university in 15/20 minutes.  It is very well connected both to Oxford Road and Piccadilly Train stations (bus no. 86) and the airport is just a short car ride away (about 15 minutes).

name: Comfy Double Room in Whalley Range
summary: Double room with private bathroom in a 2 bed Apt.  Set within a secure building in one of the hippest areas in Manchester you'll have a host of parks, cafés, bars & restaurants & MUFC within walking distance,  20 min bus ride direct into the city.
space: This sunny double room has its own private bathroom which is located opposite the hallway.  The room is very relaxing and boasts a comfortable double bed.  I will provide clean towels on arrival and the bathroom will have all the necessary bits and pieces; shower gel, shampoo and toothpaste.  If you have any special requirements above this you will need to bring your own. For any long term guests of more than a week I will clean both the room and the bathroom.  I will change the bedding and replenish with clean towels.  There is also access to the use of the washing machine.  The cost of this is £10 per week and paid in cash during the stay.  This is due to Airbnb not having the facility to set up online prior to arrival.

This is due to Airbnb not having the facility to set up online prior to arrival. Guests will have acc
neighborhood_overview: Chorlton and Whalley Range are located in the nicest part of Manchester.  It has an arty and bohemian feel to it, a lovely walk through the area just a 5 minute walk from the apartment you will find a parade of convenience stores, green grocers, takeaways including Italian, Chinese, Caribbean and Mediterranean foods, a chemist and a Post Office. Another 5 minutes from the parade you will find Alexandra Park, a beautiful fully restored Victorian Park which boasts a beautiful large pond with a population of Geese, Swans and Moore Hens to name a few.  If you look closely on the right day there are a family of terrapins living in the water that like to bask in the sun..!!  There is a lovely café in the park offering snacks, home made cakes and refreshments.  If you like keeping fit there are Basketball Courts, Tennis Courts, Football & Cricket pitches along with a fully marked out running track.  The park is a space which has been developed to bring a more community feel to the area and is
notes: Located close to both Old Trafford Cricket Ground and Old Trafford Football Club ideal for anyone visiting for the games.
transit: The direct bus into town is the 86 and takes around 15-20 minutes, bus stop is a 5 min walk round the corner from the apartment, it runs all day everyday usually 4 times and hour and the route is also part of the night bus route which runs throughout the night from the city centre.   There are also 2 tram stations Firswood/Chorlton close by (25 minute walk from the apartment) and can take you into the city centre or out to the Airport.   If you arriving to Manchester by train and arrive at Manchester Piccadilly the apartment is just a short taxi ride from the station, no more than £10-£20 depending on the time of arrival.  If you are an UBER taxi user, Manchester is set up for this and often using this option is cheaper than getting a taxi from the station.
host_about:
Hi 

I have been using Airbnb for a couple of years now and have met some lovely people along the way.  I have used it both here at home when away for weekends with friends or walking my dog; as well as abroad.

I live in Manchester with my little dog Ruby; a rescue dog I adopted last summer, she's a gorgeous Staffordshire bull terrier.  We live in South Manchester in Chorlton, one of Manchesters hippest districts, a lovely laid back and arty place.

I love music, live gigs and festivals but my biggest passion is travelling.  I have travelled quite extensively in the past, I love to visit places that are a world away from what I am used to at home, I love learning about different cultures.  I have a close affinity to Spain having lived and worked there in the past and still visit regularly to see friends and my little godson Santiago.

I consider myself to be a very open and positive person with a thirst for life and believe your life is what you make it.  Its all out there waiting you.. just have to go and get it..!!

name: Delightful double-W.Range/Chorlton
summary: In the heart of the leafy Whalley Range Conservancy, an easy commute to the airport or city centre, and close to Chorlton, our lovely neighbourhood offers the perfect combination of village tranquility and easy access to Manchester's cool urban vibe.
space: My sweet little home 'Felicity' is a traditional 1920s house and has a very special history. With its original solid wood floors and stained glass bay windows it's sunny, warm and full of the charm of its era while being contemporary and very cosy.  This is the largest of my guest rooms: a really spacious, bright and peaceful haven with everything you need for a relaxing retreat: a heavenly orthopaedic double bed, soft and comfy down bedding and pure cotton or linen sheets and covers, your own little sofa, plus a kettle and teas, coffee and drinking chocolate. You'll find a jug of fresh water and complimentary juice waiting for you on arrival.  If you book this guest-room you'll also enjoy an earlier check-in time of 3pm and a later check-out time of noon the next day, giving you the opportunity for a longer lie-in or more leisurely departure. As you may have read on my profile and reviews, cooking is both my great passion and also a core part of what I offer my guests to order: health

neighborhood_overview: While located within easy reach of the centre of the city via the number 86 bus (or walking if you are intrepid!), our neighbourhood is leafy and peaceful, a short walk to great local independent cafes and bars, 15 mins' walking distance to the delights of Chorlton village, and a few minutes' walk to beautiful Alexandra park. Please note that my house is located in a neighbourhood of the city, but is NOT in the city centre.
notes: A) As you may have read from many of my reviews, our family includes a rather special little dog called Gina: a small 10-year old terrier with lots of character. She loves people and is very friendly (except to the postman...) but won't be licking your face or pestering you. Sometimes we also have our darling former foster dog, Gussie (also a little terrier) with us - for a day visit or holidays when his new family are away. The dogs are not allowed upstairs or in guest rooms, so you won't need to worry that you will return to find a little hairy friend trotting around in your room or curled up in your bed. **B) Please note that I'm afraid the kitchen is not available for guests to use for cooking or preparing meals - unless you are here as a long-term guest (10 days or more). The reason is simply that as I am already pretty-much constantly busy in a small kitchen space with laundry, dishes, preparing, cooking and serving meals it is simply not practical. You will of course have your o
transit: Our neighbourhood is served by a direct bus route to the city centre. We are located an easy walk from/to the nearest bus stop (about 5-6 mins'). We are also in walking distance (about 12 minutes) to the nearest Metro (tram) station, on a direct line into the city centre as well as Manchester International Airport, plus easy links to Old Trafford, Salford Quays, and further afield.
host_about:
I absolutely love having guests. My mission is to provide the happiest, most welcoming and comfortable bnb experience in Manchester. Since I started hosting 19 months ago I've welcomed more than 400 guests from 55 countries into my home - the most enriching, illuminating and exciting adventure! I'm a friendly, happy person with a positive outlook on life and an impish sense of humour. I'm curious and love to learn. Travelling, meeting new people and learning about other cultures and traditions excite me. I've lived and worked on three continents; and my friends come from all over the world, many philosophies and walks of life. I'm a passionate and inventive cook. I love having a full house and feeding my family, friends and guests. I grew up in a place where many people don't have enough to eat, or roofs over their heads, so I am very grateful for these things. 

Here are some other things that make me joyful: my sons; music; reading; the sounds of the African night; beautiful old churches; laughing; star-gazing; hearing my Dad whistling in his garden; sushi; writing; my funny dog; mountains; dancing; macadamia nuts; the sea; going to gigs and festivals; making things; arthouse cinema; playing Scrabble; passion fruit; animals small and large; stained glass windows; falling snow; riding very fast on horseback with the wind in my face; camping in the middle of nowhere; the sound of birds singing and little children laughing.

name: Tranquil room in the Hidden Museum!
space: My house is called Hidden Museum after 'the museum of their encounter' a quote from Djuna Barnes 'Nightwood'.  The house is full of art, books and music. My garden is lovely. The bedroom is tranquil and when I have people staying my own stuff is removed so it is very neutral.  You can rent the room or we could house swap!!  Whalley Range is very close to the City Centre of Manchester. I cycle to my yoga classes and have two bikes here that one can be used by a guest. I know a lot of good yoga teachers and will be able to show you a good time! Namaste :) ****  Whalley Range is an area of Manchester, England, about 2 miles southwest of the city centre. It was one of the earliest of the city's suburbs, built by local businessman and banker Samuel Brooks. It was one of Manchester's first suburbs and called "a desirable estate for gentlemen and their families".

neighborhood_overview: Whalley Range is very close to the City Centre but has its own shops and cafes. Very close is a place called Chorlton which is very trendy and filled with independent shops, cafes, restaurants and bars.
notes: I have a key safe and you will need to contact me for the code to get keys to access the house as I may be away.
transit: I am 2 minutes to the bus stop into city centre, its a short walk to the bus to Old Trafford and a little further to the tram to Manchester Airport.

name: Small Cosy Flat in Manchester
summary: A colourful, warm & comfortable flat in the heart of whalley Range and a stone throw away from Alexander park and Chorlton Water Park.  Many of the things that make Manchester a great place to visit are just a short walk away :)
space: Hello people of Airbnb,  Looking for somewhere quite, easy going and relaxing, then I have the ideal place for you. I have a two bedroom flat to share with four lovely cats, in a quite, leafy, beautiful area in Whalley Range, Manchester. You will be sharing with my lovely self, as I live in the property and work from home. However you will have your own private room. Or if you prefer the sofa bed in the living room, its up to you :) The flat come with all you will need, Bathroom with clean towels, Living area, comes with TV and wireless internet. Kitchen with all working appliances and a well stocked fridge. There is also off road parking at the front and back of the building where you can easily see your car. There is good transport link from the house to Manchester town centre (Piccadilly) which only take 20 minutes, Old Trafford, Chorlton Water Park and loads of bars and cafe, plus takeaway shops.  There are also buses that goes to all the Universities, plus all the tourist attracti

transit: There is good transport link from the house to Manchester town centre (Piccadilly) which only take 20 minutes. However, if you take the train as it is only five minutes for the same price. Loads of bars and cafe, plus takeaway shops.  There are also buses that goes to all the Universities, plus all the tourist attraction in and around Manchester. A hop skip away to Stockport and the Curry Mile. Loads of good night life and mini festivals.
host_about:
Well what can I say, am a very easy going person so no drama please... Student slash self-employed, am an artist, designer and singer so very creative...

I have many interests but that does not mean I get round to doing them all. These include taking salsa classes (basically anything that allows me to jump around like a crazy person is fine with me)

I enjoy hiking, camping and I am not afraid to get grubby in the mud when the weather is crap - after my summer of chasing festivals, I figured I could tackle anything. Music is my passion, whether I am playing, singing at a festival or just relaxing at home listening to some Bossa Nova jazz am content.  

Okay so the things I cannot live without are:  My Family, Friends, Good food and wine (this is very important in keeping calm, happy oh and quite) A good book, Music and Humor.

My quote for life : ''Life is too short for regrets''

Quote for the year : "For I am a sinner in the hands of an angry god. Bloody Mary full of vodka, blessed are you among cocktails. Pray for me now at the hour of my death, which I hope is soon. Amen." - Sterling Archer

Quote for the day :  "Her ass is like an onion. It makes me wanna cry'' - Breaking Bad

name: Cosy bedroom in warm, friendly home
summary: Beautiful Edwardian house close to the busy hub of Manchester (approx 30 min by bus or tram) hidden away in a quiet, tree lined cul-de-sac. The house mixes modern amenities with old fashioned charm. Use of modern bathroom with walk in shower.
space: Own private bedroom with shared bathroom. Welcome to relax infront of the woodburning stove and use the kitchen to prepare and cook in the evening. Breakfast such as bread, cereal, tea, coffee provided on a 'help yourself' basis.
description: Beautiful Edwardian house close to the busy hub of Manchester (approx 30 min by bus or tram) hidden away in a quiet, tree lined cul-de-sac. The house mixes modern amenities with old fashioned charm. Use of modern bathroom with walk in shower. Own private bedroom with shared bathroom. Welcome to relax infront of the woodburning stove and use the kitchen to prepare and cook in the evening. Breakfast such as bread, cereal, tea, coffee provided on a 'help yourself' basis. No access to the TV lounge, office, other bedrooms or second floor. Please do not walk on the grass in the back or front gardens. Willing to help with travel around Manchester, advise on places to see and restaurants to eat at. Beautiful tree lined streets. Quiet glade on the Green with bird song and squirrels.  Variety of independent restaurants, bars and shops 20min walk away. Three restaurants and bars 10 min walk away. Half an hour drive to beautiful, wild walks of the Peak district and a few NT properties and walks.
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful tree lined streets. Quiet glade on the Green with bird song and squirrels.  Variety of independent restaurants, bars and shops 20min walk away. Three restaurants and bars 10 min walk away. Half an hour drive to beautiful, wild walks of the Peak district and a few NT properties and walks.
notes: If you are driving up on a Friday, leave early to avoid congestion.
transit: Free parking on a quiet cul-de-sac. 10 min walk to Firswood tram stop then 20 mins on tram to City centre. 5 min walk to bus stop then 20 min on bus into city centre . 40 min walk into city centre. Door to door 40 mins by tram to Media City.

name: Bright and comfy double room
summary: Spacious double room in a cosy apartment conversion that is part of a stunning Victorian mansion. The complex is situated on a leafy street of Whalley Range; it is within walking distance of local shops, cafes and bars. 15 minute bus to city centre.
space: The apartment is a cosy space within a stunning converted Victorian mansion. We like to think of the apartment as having a somewhat shabby chic style. It has a large living room with plenty of seating and an awesome TV and Playstation 4! The bedroom is spacious, with a double bed as well as a wardrobe and drawers for storage.
description: Spacious double room in a cosy apartment conversion that is part of a stunning Victorian mansion. The complex is situated on a leafy street of Whalley Range; it is within walking distance of local shops, cafes and bars. 15 minute bus to city centre. The apartment is a cosy space within a stunning converted Victorian mansion. We like to think of the apartment as having a somewhat shabby chic style. It has a large living room with plenty of seating and an awesome TV and Playstation 4! The bedroom is spacious, with a double bed as well as a wardrobe and drawers for storage. Guests are free to chill with us in the living room or retreat to their bedroom. We're happy either way! You can use any facilities in the flat. Feel free to use the fridge/freezer, cooker and washing machine: for yourself of course, we don't expect you to use those for us! ;) All we ask is that you keep things clean, and tidy up after yourself. You can ask either of us any questions you have and we'll do everything we
neighborhood_overview: This Victorian building is set within a quiet and leafy part of Whalley Range. Most people that live in this area are young professionals or young families. There are a number of large parks close by.
notes: There are local shops within two minutes walking distance and local bars, cafes and restaurants, in Chorlton, within 15 minutes. The city centre is also very close and is easily accessed by bus, which takes 15 minutes and costs £2.30 (single) or £4.10 (day ticket). The apartment is also very close to Old Trafford Football Stadium. You will have your own set of keys and are free to come and go as you please.
transit: There is free car parking on site in the secure compound. The bus stop is a two minute walk away and the bus takes approximately 15 minutes to get to the centre of Manchester. There are a couple of buses and they come every 10 minutes. It is £2.30 for a single or £4.10 for a day pass. The tram station is also accessible and is a 15 minute walk away. Chorlton centre is also only 15 minutes walk away and boasts a selection of trendy bars and a wide range of restaurants.
host_about:
My name is Robbie (the guy on the right) and I live with my partner, Scott (the other one).

We love cooking, going to the cinema and having a good time. Meeting new people is important to us and because of this, socialising, hosting parties and spending time with friends are things that we value.

We are confident and outgoing individuals that embrace new experiences. Road trips to different cities are great and we also recently went to Amsterdam, which was awesome. We love adventures as well as spending quality time together, watching TV on the sofa.

We are secretly geeky, with a love of sci-fi movies and Doctor Who. We do, however, love to party as well. If we're heading on a night out, it will be somewhere playing House or Electro tunes. We can be found in a quiet bar doing a pub quiz, or in a mega club, dancing all night. We're pretty easy going when it comes to a fun night out and we're happy to try new venues or music styles.

In a nutshell: we're chilled, fun and happy people!

Hmm, a life motto... 'Dream as if you'll live forever, live as if you'll die tomorrow'

name: An urban retreat in Manchester
summary: A beautiful double room with a huge bed and guest bathroom in a large, comfortable home. A peaceful haven in an exclusive gated courtyard development in Whalley Range, 2 miles to the city centre, close to the lively areas of  Chorlton & Didsbury.
space: The guest rooms are on the top floor of this three-storey townhouse. There is a separate bathroom on this floor, your own smart TV in the bedroom, free WiFi, plenty of wardrobe space and facilities to make hot drinks.    The house is situated in an exclusive gated courtyard development in the lovely conservation area in Whalley Range and so is private and secure. There is a parking space for guests on the drive.  The house belongs to Georgia, who lives there and will make you feel comfortable during your stay. Bookings are managed by me (Helen) and I help out with guests when Georgia is at work. Let me know if you have any queries, and if you are arriving from the airport I can also provide a pick-up service for an additional fee.  The house is spacious and comfortable. Georgia loves to create an environment in which people can relax and unwind. There is pretty much everything you'll need whether you want to work, rest or explore Manchester.  You are welcome to use the kitchen, dining
