A peaceful haven in an exclusive gated courtyard development in Whalley Range, 2 miles to the city centre, close to the lively areas of  Chorlton & Didsbury. The guest rooms are on the top floor of this three-storey townhouse. There is a separate bathroom on this floor, your own smart TV in the bedroom, free WiFi, plenty of wardrobe space and facilities to make hot drinks.    The house is situated in an exclusive gated courtyard development in the lovely conservation area in Whalley Range and so is private and secure. There is a parking space for guests on the drive.  The house belongs to Georgia, who lives there and will make you feel comfortable during your stay. Bookings are managed by me (Helen) and I help out with guests when Georgia is at work. Let me know if you have any queries, and if you are arriving from the airport I can also provide a pick-up service for an additional fee.  The house i
neighborhood_overview: Whalley Range is a lovely, mature neighbourhood with beautiful old villas and tree-lined streets, just two miles (3km) from the city centre. There is a Co-op grocery and a Tesco just a few minutes' walk from the house, a post office and plenty of local takeaways. Alexandra Park, only a minute's walk away, is a great place for a stroll, to feed the ducks or a safe place for a run during daylight hours.  The lively areas of Chorlton & Didsbury are also just a quick drive away with their characterful restaurants, bars & independent shops.
notes: The house is in a private gated development with secure parking. There is good, fast WiFi coverage throughout the house and garden, which you are welcome to use free of charge.  The smart TV in the guest bedroom is set up for all the normal on-demand services including Netflix, as is the TV in the living room. Breakfast is included and you'll find everything you need in the guest cupboard and fridge in the kitchen. There's a selection of cereals, toast, jams, juice, fruit and yoghurt. Help yourself to teas, coffee and hot chocolate on the top floor.
transit: The fast & frequent No.85 bus service can take you directly into the city centre, or the university district, in about 15 minutes. Manchester has an excellent bus and tram network, so it's also easy to get to nearby Old Trafford, Salford Quays and the Trafford Centre.  The airport is around 20 minutes away by car - just ask if you would like to arrange to be picked up/dropped off, for an additional £20 cash fee.
host_about:
Friendly 40-something, living in Manchester's coolest neighbourhood! 

I came here for university and liked it so much I've stayed for over twenty years. I know a fair bit about the local history of Manchester, I enjoy cooking and entertaining, knitting, theatre and music, and especially singing with my acappella choir! 

I'm gay (so no homophobes please!) a bit 'leftie' and fond of wine & cats.

I've had guests staying from all over the world - feel free to browse my reviews - and really enjoy helping people discover Manchester, which is a great city to live in with loads going on all through the year. 

I manage 4 listings, each with their own unique character:

1. If you're interested in staying with me in the private room in my own home, I will ask you to tell me a bit about yourself and your trip, and I will do my best to answer any questions you have. It's very relaxed at my house - you'll have your own key and be able to come and go as you please. Let me know how I can make your visit memorable.

2 & 3. I also manage a self-contained 1-bedroom apartment in the City Centre, and a self-contained 2-bedroom house in Salford, both of which you can book for your exclusive use. You'll still get my personal service with booking and check-in and I'll be available if you have any problems. 

4. I also manage the bookings for a private room in a large & beautiful house in Whalley Range. Georgia is the homeowner and lives in the property - I will deal with your enquiries and booking arrangements, but during your stay you'll be sharing the space with Georgia and her friendly cats.

name: Large modern cosy flat
summary: A bright bedroom in a cosy flat found in a desirable suburb of Manchester. 15 minutes by bus or tram to the city centre, same by bike (I have one you can borrow or can recommend a hire company).  Just on the border of Chorlton. The flat has a garden
space: * Please note I am no longer taking advanced bookings, only last minute bookings will be accepted* Your room is a double with a brand new bed and mattress.  The flat has underfloor heating in some rooms.  Located on the border of Chorlton and in a green suburb very close to the city centre as well as all the (many) bars of Chorlton. Immediate amenities include a couple of nice modern bars, and a new bakery and cafe that serves good breakfasts and coffee. More bars and restaurants can be found 15 minutes walk away in Chorlton or of course, in the city centre.  The flat is part of a block that is centred around a shared garden, there is also garden space to the rear of the flat that is shared with others but is very large. This gets the morning sun so is nice for breakfast in summer.  Sometimes the block has garden parties and other events that you'd be welcome to attend.

neighborhood_overview: This part of Manchester is the green residential area, once the wealthiest part of town during Manchester's industrial revolution before the houses were converted to flats. My block of flats are a 1960s development and purpose built.  Neighbouring Chorlton is the hotspot in terms of suburbs with over 30 bars and restaurants, access to the nature reserve for cycling, and the famous Southern Cemetery where Tony Wilson and LS Lowry are buried. Beech Road is a beautiful cafe strip. A little further on is Burton Road and Didsbury which can be found on the same tram line as Chorlton so is quick to get to, but can be walked if you're feeling energetic. Burton Road is home to Rose Garden and Greens - two amazing restaurants, better I'd say than many in the city centre.  Manchester city centre itself is close by and as a tour guide I can show you around if you like and have many tips for your visit!
notes: The neighbourhood is a nice one with a mixture of families, single people and older people so please be mindful of neighbours (no loud music late at night etc).
transit: The easiest way to the flat on public transport is to take the number 86 bus as it stops right next to my road. It is only a 20 minute bus ride but more in rush hour. The tram line services the general area but the nearest station is Firswood and is perhaps 10 minutes walk or more, so it might be more convenient to use this after you know the area a little.
host_about:
Writer, curator, location scout and tour guide. 

I love to travel, especially to learn more about history, architecture and languages or to go to music festivals. 

I am learning Spanish, and I love animals.

space: We live in a two-storey terrace house in a lovely area. Our rooms are spacious and bright.
description: This is a quiet room facing the back yard. It offers a comfortable double bed, wardrobe space and beautiful wooden tiles. Our house is located in a residential area close to Chorlton and Old Trafford. LGBT friendly. We want you to feel at home! Our guests have access to all common areas including the living room, the dining area and the kitchen. We do not provide breakfast, but please feel free to prepare food in our kitchen. There is usually tea and coffee for your use. Most likely I will not be around during your stay. However, you will probably share the house with my lovely housemate. I try to make sure to be there on the day of your arrival and I am happy to show you around the house and to help you get a sense of the area! I can always be contacted by phone. You will also find an excellent vegan supermarket and a large Morrison

transit: We are conveniently located close to public transport: the bus stop is only five minutes away (bus numbers 85 and 86). You can reach the tram/ metro stop in approximately 15 minutes (the stop is called 'Chorlton').

summary: Single bed in large ground floor room of vegetarian family home in a leafy suburb of Manchester (Female guests only).
space: Bright, large room with comfy single bed and couches on ground floor of friendly family home in Whalley Range, Manchester. Extra bedding and towels provided. Desk and chair for working. Nice view of church from window.  Breakfast, wi-fi, bedding and towels included. If you require an evening meal or lunch, we can pre-arrange this at a small extra cost - just let me know in good time. It's a family home, so expect some noise, and then quiet after bedtime! No guests or noisy music etc for this reason. I read, watch i-Player or work at night. We're vegetarians, and eat healthy organic food. We try to live sustainably, and walk, ride bikes, get buses, recycle, etc. You can borrow a bike to use locally if you want. I can show you the local bus routes. The nearest town is Chorlton, which is nice to hang out in - bars, cafes, library, sports, shops etc. Local bus services into the centre: 5 minutes walk then 10-20 min journey to centre, and train connections to rest of UK. Chorlton (25 min walk) is nice to visit and hang out in cafes.

host_about:
I'm a single parent with three daughters living at home. We are vegetarians, and we try to live a low-impact lifestyle. We cycle and use public transport, and eat organic food. I am a PhD student at the University. I like films, cooking, walking and singing.
I will welcome you into my home and provide your breakfast. I can show you the quickest way to get into Manchester, and lend you maps etc.
Manchester is an interesting city, with plenty of contemporary and historic places of interest.

name: Twin Bedroom in serviced apartment
space: Here we present a more serene alternative to the hustle and bustle of central living. Set in one of Manchester's greenest districts, this apartment is perfect for a visiting family or a quiet getaway for a few days. This apartment is just a stones throw away from Alexandra Park, where you will find lush open fields and enchanting coppices. There is also a large pond which is a home to many species of ducks and a well equipped playground for children to play in. Located in Whalley Range you are just a 10 minute drive away from Manchester City Centre and just 5 minutes away from Chorlton Cum Hardy where you can find a wide range of bars and restaurants. Here you can choose from wonderful cuisine and cultural experiences from across the globe. Within walking distance you have plenty of popular shopping choices such as ASDA, Tesco and Co-op, and there is also a multi facilitated gym offering casual use and a large variety of classes for non-members. name: Cozy room in Victorian terrace
summary: Have your own characterful space within a spacious Victorian mid-terrace in a quiet street of leafy Whalley Range. You will have a private toilet with washer/dryer and enjoy full use of our bright country-style kitchen and large south-facing garden.
space: Your room has various advantages and features that you won't find anywhere else: you can lock the door to your room for privacy, your own private toilet is right outside your room. In the toilet are also a washer and dryer, which you are welcome to use to wash your clothes during your stay. Aside from a beautiful exposed-brick chimney breast, there are also some cute Victorian period features such as original larder doors and a "sheila maid" which is useful to dry towels and clothes on. On a more modern note, there is a TV with proper external speakers and a DVD/VCR player which can also be used for CDs. The TV has Astra 19.2 satellite reception, so if you're interested you can watch loads of German, French, Italian and Spanish channels. For those of you, who, like us, travel with their dogs, you have come to the right place. Your dog has its own "brick cave" inside the chimney breast to sleep in (if he wants). In the old days of the early 1900s your room was used as a kitchen, so this
description: Have your own characterful space within a spacious Victorian mid-terrace in a quiet street of leafy Whalley Range. You will have a private toilet with washer/dryer and enjoy full use of our bright country-style kitchen and large south-facing garden. Your room has various advantages and features that you won't find anywhere else: you can lock the door to your room for privacy, your own private toilet is right outside your room. In the toilet are also a washer and dryer, which you are welcome to use to wash your clothes during your stay. Aside from a beautiful exposed-brick chimney breast, there are also some cute Victorian period features such as original larder doors and a "sheila maid" which is useful to dry towels and clothes on. On a more modern note, there is a TV with proper external speakers and a DVD/VCR player which can also be used for CDs. The TV has Astra 19.2 satellite reception, so if you're interested you can watch loads of German, French, Italian and Spanish channels. Fo
neighborhood_overview: Whalley Range is a quiet, leafy neighbourhood (a conservation area indeed) boasting beautiful old Victorian houses that you won't get tired looking at.  Just around the corner from our house is the small shopping precinct of Whalley Range with several supermarkets, green grocers, pharmacies, take aways (Chinese, Caribbean, Pizzas, Mediterranean) and a post office. Still within walking distance are a couple of Whalley Range bars that we can thoroughly recommend - the Nip and Tipple (LGBT friendly), the Hillary Step (great British ales and beers and live Jazz on Sundays) and the Jam Street Café (nice for your weekend breakfast). Across the road from there is a small independent bakery and café that does European style sourdough breads (for those who can't stand what passes for bread here in the UK). While there's greenery, wildlife and nearby Alexandra Park in Whalley Range, you are also not far vibrant Chorlton village with your choice of trendy bars, coffee shops and restaurants of eve
notes: Since this is a musician's household, there will be some occasional saxophone and piano practicing going on. But never past 9.30pm. Just so you're aware. Oh, and since we have a dog, it would be perfect if you could tolerate the odd dog hair and a bit of residual mud in the hall that we track in from our walks in the nearby Mersey Valley. The dog will sometimes bark at night, the upside of which is that there's somebody always standing guard. So it's nice and safe here.
transit: The 85 bus is only a 7-minute walk from our house. It runs 4 times per hour and takes you directly into the City Centre in 15-20 minutes. From the Airport you can get to us by cab, costing you 20 GBP and getting you here comfortably within 15 minutes. Or you can take the tram/Metrolink to Firswood or Chorlton station and then walk for another 20-25 minutes (not ideal with luggage, obviously). From Piccadilly Station just take the 85 bus to Alexandra Park. From there it's a 5 minute walk.
host_about: My name is Anja, I'm 36 years old and live in Manchester/UK with my boyfriend and our dog Dixon. I work as a freelance journalist for German newspapers writing on British life and culture. I'm into woodwork, interior design, cooking, sociology, david bowie, don't mind a bit of jazz, yoga and love a good ense of humor. As a guest I'm low-maintenance, respectful of your place and stuff, and love to get inspired by other people's spaces.
street: Whalley Grove, Manchester, M16 8DN, United Kingdom

name: Bright & cosy crashpad
summary: In the heart of the leafy Whalley Range Conservancy, an easy commute to the airport or city centre, and close to Chorlton, our lovely neighbourhood offers the perfect combination of village tranquility and easy access to Manchester's cool urban vibe.
space: My sweet little home 'Felicity' is a traditional 1920s house and has a very special history. With its original solid wood floors and stained glass bay windows it's sunny, warm and full of the charm of its era while being contemporary and very cosy.  Small but perfectly-formed with a cosy small double bed, this guest-room is a sunny little gem, overlooking the garden. Enjoy soft and comfy down bedding and pure cotton or linen sheets and covers, a kettle and teas, coffee and drinking chocolate. You'll find a jug of fresh water and complimentary juice waiting for you on arrival. As you may have read on my profile and reviews, cooking is both my great passion and also a core part of what I offer my guests to order: healthy, wholesome and filling, home-made breakfasts and brunches; lunches to go; and suppers. Full details below: Breakfasts: If you wish to have breakfast you can choose the 'basic': pastries, yoghurt; juice; fruit; cereals, bread and preserves, with tea or coffee for £3.50 pe

My sweet little home 'Felicity' is a traditional 1920s house and has a very special history. As you may have read on my profile and reviews, cooking is both my great passion and also a core part of what I offer my guests to order: healthy, wholesome and filli
neighborhood_overview: While located within easy reach of the centre of the city via the number 86 bus (or walking if you are intrepid!), our neighbourhood is leafy and peaceful, a short walk to great local independent cafes and bars, 15 mins' walking distance to the delights of Chorlton village, and a few minutes' walk to beautiful Alexandra park. Please note that my house is located in a neighbourhood of the city, but is NOT in the city centre.
notes: A) As you may have read from many of my reviews, our family includes a rather special little dog called Gina: a small 10-year old terrier with lots of character. She loves people and is very friendly (except to the postman...) but won't be licking your face or pestering you. Sometimes we also have our darling former foster dog, Gussie (also a little terrier) with us - for a day visit or holidays when his new family are away. The dogs are not allowed upstairs or in guest rooms, so you won't need to worry that you will return to find a little hairy friend trotting around in your room or curled up in your bed. **B) Please note that I'm afraid the kitchen is not available for guests to use for cooking or preparing meals - unless you are here as a long-term guest (10 days or more). The reason is simply that as I am already pretty-much constantly busy in a small kitchen space with laundry, dishes, preparing, cooking and serving meals it is simply not practical. You will of course have your o
transit: Our neighbourhood is served by a direct bus route to the city centre. We are located an easy walk from/to the nearest bus stop (about 5-6 mins'). We are also in walking distance (about 12 minutes) to the nearest Metro (tram) station, on a direct line into the city centre as well as Manchester International Airport, plus easy links to Old Trafford, Salford Quays, and further afield.
host_about:
I absolutely love having guests. My mission is to provide the happiest, most welcoming and comfortable bnb experience in Manchester. Since I started hosting 19 months ago I've welcomed more than 400 guests from 55 countries into my home - the most enriching, illuminating and exciting adventure! I'm a friendly, happy person with a positive outlook on life and an impish sense of humour. I'm curious and love to learn. Travelling, meeting new people and learning about other cultures and traditions excite me. I've lived and worked on three continents; and my friends come from all over the world, many philosophies and walks of life. I'm a passionate and inventive cook. I love having a full house and feeding my family, friends and guests. I grew up in a place where many people don't have enough to eat, or roofs over their heads, so I am very grateful for these things. 

Here are some other things that make me joyful: my sons; music; reading; the sounds of the African night; beautiful old churches; laughing; star-gazing; hearing my Dad whistling in his garden; sushi; writing; my funny dog; mountains; dancing; macadamia nuts; the sea; going to gigs and festivals; making things; arthouse cinema; playing Scrabble; passion fruit; animals small and large; stained glass windows; falling snow; riding very fast on horseback with the wind in my face; camping in the middle of nowhere; the sound of birds singing and little children laughing.

name: Spacious sunny double - Chorlton/WR
summary: Our sweet Victorian terrace is located right on the border of Whalley Range and Chorlton: the best of village living with quick access to the universities and city centre. Our friendly home has been host to people from all over the world.
space: The largest of the guest bedrooms, this is a spacious bright double overlooking our little garden: south-facing and peaceful; There is a wardrobe, chest of drawers, and a wonderful orthopaedic double bed.  You'll find a little tray with a carafe of fresh chilled water, kettle, milk, teabags and coffee, along with a bathroom pack, to save you bringing any basics with you. Obviously, all bedding - comfy duvet and pillows, Egyptian cotton linen - and towels - are provided.  If you are a party of four and want to book both guest rooms I regularly offer a special price - just send me a message and I'll do what I can to help. If you wish to have breakfast you can choose the 'basic': pastries, yoghurt; juice; fruit; cereals, bread and preserves, with tea or coffee for £3.50 per person; or the full works: the basic plus eggs, sausage, etc for £5.00. Also, if you're on a tight budget or here for work and don't feel like going out for food in the evening I can also provide simple, wholesome supp

neighborhood_overview: We're a short walk from the centre of Chorlton village. It's a special place: a village within a city - a friendly, lively, still-a-little-earthy community of determined independence and individuality. Tiny bars, pubs and tea-shops offering delicious homemade meals and cakes, locally-brewed ales and beers; and award-winning fishmongers, deli's, butchers and bakeries abound here. I moved here from London four years ago and just love it here. I really enjoy welcoming visitors to our lovely, friendly city and am happy to provide advice on the best places to visit, eat and relax in the city centre as well as the many lovely local spots.
notes: Gina - a small, intelligent, friendly and very well-behaved terrier, and sometimes Gus, her jolly and happy little brother - are part of our home. They are not noisy, dirty or pesky and have even won over some of the most determined animal-haters. However we are quite strict, they won't be in your bedroom!
transit: We are a one-minute walk to the bus stop for routes into the city centre and universities (about 15 mins off-peak, a bit longer during busy periods) as well as Salford, etc. We're a five-minute walk to the Metro station (tram) for routes into the city (about 8mins to Deansgate, 12mins to the centre) west to Didsbury, or south to Altrincham, and connections for Salford Quays, north Manchester, etc. Few local people drive into town as public transport is so cheap and convenient and also avoids parking charges - however, there is easy on-street parking in our cul-de-sac; and it's about a 10- to 15-minute drive to town, depending on traffic/the time of day.

I enjoy meeting new people and through my job have traveled lots

The house is shared with my boyfriend, niece and baby (he very good sleep through the night) and mother, The house is very homely. My mother is a legendary hostess!!!
 
The room is a very cosy room and very clean

You can cook here, we give all guest a shelve in our fridge and cupboard space so you can buy and store food

We are a short bus ride from the city center

Had lots of people stay with us from all round the world !!!

name: Lovely room near the city center!!
summary: I'm offering my room to rent during the holidays as I'm going back home during that period. It's a very nice room in a fully renovated big house (the renovation has been done this summer, so it is all truly brand new)!!
space: The house is a traditional house, over two floors, fully renovated. Very big kitchen, large leaving room, 1 bathroom-1 toilets (distinct) right next to the room. And other toilets on the ground floor between the kitchen and the living room. For more details about the room, you will find : a double bed + desk + chair + large double cupboard. (I will remove my personal stuffs)
description: I live with housemates (they are all absolutely adorable, clean and tidy; they study quite a lot but truly are a good laugh). Sarah or Priya will give you the keys and will be there during your stay, so if you need anything, or have any questions, someone will be there :).
neighborhood_overview: Fallowfield is 15 minutes by bus from the city center, and 10 minutes from the University of Manchester and MMU! Its a very convenient area, with bars, restaurants... There's always animation! However the house is in a very quiet street, so no loud music, no smells when you'll want to go to sleep :).
transit: Loads of busses going towards town or withington (opposite way) on the main road.

name: Lovely double-room @ Laura's place
summary: A well-loved home; a charming space, full of colour & character. A well-travelled & experienced host who genuinely enjoys sharing her home with people from all walks of life. A comfortable, clean bed, & plenty of tea, toast & jam for breakfast...
space: Hi! Welcome to my profile! I have a simple and clean double-room to rent to either a single guest or a couple. I would describe my home as comfortable, colourful and just on the right side of cluttered! I live here with my cat, Ariettie (a lovely soul). The house is situated on a pretty, tree-lined and quiet avenue, not far from Manchester city centre. You can walk to the centre of town from here in about 40 minutes or you can take 1 of several local bus routes and jump off in Piccadilly in about 20 minutes. For those wishing to go in the other direction, there are also bus routes to Didsbury village and Withington a short walk away, and no matter which way you're going, you can always stop in at the Curry Mile for a plate of  thali and a cup of  chai before you go. Delicious! For those of you coming from the airport, I live about 6 miles away and a taxi ride will cost you between £15 -  £20 to get to my door; there is also the Number 43 bus which leaves the airport and comes through m

notes: Please may I just ask any potential guests to ensure that they have some sort of Airbnb profile up and running before making contact. We hosts need to be able to see who wants to come and stay in our homes! Please have a profile with photos and information, and ideally a few references from friends. This helps us to feel more confident about offering you the room, otherwise you are a complete stranger and it's not so easy to approve accommodation requests. Many thanks. x
host_about: Just a little something to get us started... Things to love... travel, firstly. India is a particularly special destination for me and I returned there for the fifth time in November 2012; Cuba, Japan, and Hawaii are next on my list! My attitude to travelling is definitely pretty spontaneous... I'm not much of a planner and like to just figure things out as I go. My attitude to hosting is 'Minha casa é sua casa'... I want you to feel at home. I also love music and live gigs and summer festivals, camping, and taking photographs.
street: Rosford Ave, Manchester, M14 7BW, United Kingdom

name: Spacious double room near Oxford Rd
summary: A brand new, fully equipped, cozy apartment located beside Platt Fields Park in Fallowfield.
space: The room is warm, tranquil and bright with a comfy double bed, fresh sheets, towels, wardrobe and drawers. Tea & coffee making facilities + everything you need for cooking are in the kitchen, which is shared with me as well as the bathroom. There are car parking spaces in front of the building, though not secured but free.  The place is only a few minutes away from Oxford / Wilmslow roads where all the famous bars, cafes and take aways can be found. There are many grocery shops (Tesco, Sainsbury's and other cornershops) within  5-7 mins walk. Also, there is a 24hrs petrol station (groceries, ATM) just round the corner.

I'm relaxed and open to help or give some advice about directions though I'm quite busy as I'm a postgrad student at UoM, so most of the time I go early in the morning and come back around 6 pm.

name: Double room, Chorlton breakfast inc
summary: A double room to rent in our friendly shared house, a quiet spot close to the centre of Chorlton & to metro and bus stops for the city centre. With full access to a cosy living room, well-equipped kitchen, bathroom, separate wc, wifi and breakfast.
space: Our house is perfectly located just a few mins walk from the centre of Chorlton with its shops, eating places and bars for a night out. Or hop on a bus or tram to the city centre for universities, gigs, galleries, culture and shopping. I'm not around much in March so I'm offering big discounts for longer stays: £163/week and £600 for the whole month! Minimum booking is 1 week/7 nights, I think the booking discounts will apply automatically when you book - thank you!
description: A double room to rent in our friendly shared house, a quiet spot close to the centre of Chorlton & to metro and bus stops for the city centre. With full access to a cosy living room, well-equipped kitchen, bathroom, separate wc, wifi and breakfast. Our house is perfectly located just a few mins walk from the centre of Chorlton with its shops, eating places and bars for a night out. Or hop on a bus or tram to the city centre for universities, gigs, galleries, culture and shopping. I'm not around much in March so I'm offering big discounts for longer stays: £163/week and £600 for the whole month! Minimum booking is 1 week/7 nights, I think the booking discounts will apply automatically when you book - thank you! Feel free to make yourself teas & snacks in the kitchen or even cook a whole meal! Then chill out in the living room, watch tv or a dvd and catch up on emails on the wifi. In the summer sit out in the quiet back garden or take a stroll by the river; we're about a mile from Chorlt
neighborhood_overview: Chorlton is a great little suburb about 3 miles from Manchester city centre: it has its own character and every shop, eating place and bar you could imagine - perfect for a night out and only 10-15 mins walk away. Good access to open spaces too: Chorlton Pk has pitches and a playground, the Water Park is further afield but has lakes, open spaces, the River Mersey and plenty of space for roaming.
transit: Public transport is easy: the Metrolink tram stop for St Werberghs is 7 mins walk away and the no 85 bus stop is 5 mins in the other direction; bus services run right past the Universities if you're here to study. Manchester itself is very well-served with Virgin train services taking less than 2hrs from London and about 40 mins to Liverpool.  And this is a great stopping point if you're flying in or out: the tram will take you direct to Manchester airport in about 30 mins, or take the bus to Liverpool airport, about 50 mins ride. Save yourself an early start by staying nearby instead!
host_about: avid traveller and snowboarder; love music, the outdoors and life in general; complementary therapy is my business and family is my rock.
street: Withington Road, Manchester, M21 0YA, United Kingdom

notes: Please be informed that we have a baby (3 years old) in the house! So please expect some baby activities during your stay such as baby babble, crying baby, baby knocking on your door, etc. Our son is a shy but curious one, but we promise to keep him tucked away during your stay. We hope you'll enjoy your stay!
transit: Getting around is very easy: - 24 Hours public transport access. 5 mint walk to bus stop - Go to University: 10 mins bus ride, 5-6£ with taxi - Go to city centre: 20 mins bus ride, 10-12£ with taxi - Go to Airport: 45 mins bus ride, 20-25£ with taxi - Go to Park n Play Ground: 5 mins walking

name: In the Park
summary: Newly built 3 storey town house overlooking Wythenshawe Park. Moor Rd metro station just 150 meters.  15 minutes to airport, (10 by taxi) 20 mins to city centre. Double and  single room available. Private bathroom and lounge. Shops and gym nearby.
space: My home is in a new  estate overlooking Wythenshawe Park. The house is bright and colourful. It is perfectly placed for Manchester Airport and you can leave your car for an extended period of time in our private car park (at your own risk) The small pretty garden is a great chill out zone. I have double bedroom and  a single room available.
description: Newly built 3 storey town house overlooking Wythenshawe Park. Moor Rd metro station just 150 meters.  15 minutes to airport, (10 by taxi) 20 mins to city centre. Double and  single room available. Private bathroom and lounge. Shops and gym nearby. My home is in a new  estate overlooking Wythenshawe Park. The house is bright and colourful. It is perfectly placed for Manchester Airport and you can leave your car for an extended period of time in our private car park (at your own risk) The small pretty garden is a great chill out zone. I have double bedroom and  a single room available. You will have sole use of the bathroom and lounge with TV. Tea and coffee available all day. Continental breakfast You can join me any time in the kitchen dining room for a cosy chat over a glass of wine or keep yourself to yourself. I'm happy to share information  The estate is bright, safe, green,  friendly and  quiet. Easy access to supermarket and shops. Altrincham with its thriving market is just 10 m
neighborhood_overview: The estate is bright, safe, green,  friendly and  quiet. Easy access to supermarket and shops. Altrincham with its thriving market is just 10 minutes away as is Sale and trendy Chorlton.
notes: DIRECTIONS. The numbering system on the estate is very confusing! Enter the estate. Turn RIGHT. Follow the road round and cross over. My house has a grey door next to a large patch of green more or less opposite Abbotsfield. LAST CHECK IN 10pm (unless by prior arrangement) Two friendly cats Cosita and Karma.
transit: There is a very good network of trams and buses to the airport and to Manchester city centre. Metro link is just 200m away. (Tram stop Moor Lane) Places to visit are Dunham Massey and Tatton Park and of course the historic Wythenshawe Hall with its tea room  in the Park.
host_about: Travelling, walking and exploring new places have always been a passion of mine. I have just returned from a 4 month trip to SE Asia having had an amazing experience. I had the chance to do some volunteering on a community project in N Thailand. I enjoy meeting new people and sharing stories but if you prefer your privacy that's ok too. I have an allotment and grow a variety of vegetables and fruit. I enjoy cooking so if you want to share food that would be good. I love to sing and have sang in various choirs for as long as I can remember in some amazing places.
street: Lawnhurst Avenue, Wythenshawe, Manchester M23 9SA, United Kingdom

name: Double Room - South Manchester
summary: Our home is situated in South Manchester close to Didsbury.   The city centre is 3.2 miles from our home and  we are very close to the airport.   Linda is 53 and Clyve is 59.   Our home has 5 bedrooms and we have two double rooms and a single.
space: We have a large 5 bedroom detached property.   I have two double rooms and one single room available to rent.     The single room is small.  There is a small double bed in the room, with small desk and wardrobe.  There is not a lot of floor space however it is perfect for one person.   Two people could sleep in here but it is very "cosy".     The cost is  £25.00 per night.  The double rooms sleep two persons and both rooms are  £50.00 per night for two persons.  £35.00 per night for one.  Both double rooms have double beds, wardrobes and desk and chair.     Please advise if you would like twin beds and this can be organised.
description: Our home is situated in South Manchester close to Didsbury.   The city centre is 3.2 miles from our home and  we are very close to the airport.   Linda is 53 and Clyve is 59. The single room is small.  There is a small double bed in the room, with small desk and wardrobe.  There is not a lot of floor space however it is perfect for one person.   Two people could sleep in here but it is very "cosy".     The cost is  £25.00 per night.  The double rooms sleep two persons and both rooms are  £50.00 per night for two persons.  £35.00 per night for one.  Both double rooms have double beds, wardrobes and desk and chair.     Please advise if you would like twin beds and this can be organised. The house is very spacious and we have a large family bathroom with a free standing shower and bath.   You are welcome to j
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is very safe and our home is in a conservation area so there is plenty of open space to walk.   Near to our home we have a large park where they offer a variety of activities horse riding, tennis, running track.  We have 3 golf courses within walking distance of our home.   Our village has a selection of shops  ie bakers, chemist, supermarket, restaurants, bars etc and again, all within walking distance.
notes: If you need transporting from the airport, train station or to other location in Manchester we can arrange to collect you for a cost of £12.50 per trip.  We have internet throughout the home and guests can tap into this.   We are all animal lovers so pets are not a problem as we have an enclosed garden and plenty of space outside for walking etc.  However you must take care of your pet ie cleaning, feeding etc and we do not  allow pets in the bedrooms.       Bed linen is changed on a weekly basis.
transit: The bus stop into the city is very close to our home and the journey takes 20 - 30 minutes depending on traffic.  We are also very close to Manchester Airport.   We also have two tram stations within 10 - 15 minutes of our home.  Manchester is a vibrant city and it is very easy to use public transport to move around landmarks such as Old Trafford Footbll stadium and Trafford Centre.  In our village we have a good selection of restaurants and bars.   if you want something a more lively than very close to our home is Didsbury,  Chorlton or Manchester City Centre with something for everyone.
street: Homewood Road,  Northenden, Manchester, England M22 4DG, United Kingdom

name: Gorgeous rooms with a lovely host
summary: This gorgeous room is in the attic of my stylish Victorian Semi. There is a garden front and rear and a drive. The house has 3 bedrooms, 2 living rooms, bathroom, dining room and kitchen / diner. It's a short walk to Didsbury and ten minutes to Manchester Airport.
space: My lovely Victorian House is a short walk away from Didsbury. Ideally located less than 5 minutes away from the M60 and M56 it's also only 7 minutes away from Manchester airport. The house is spread over 3 floors. Your bedroom is right at the top in the attic space. The whole house has been undergoing a major overhaul and I have turned it into a lovely relaxing place to live accessorised with things I have picked up on my travels. Decorated in a mid-century modern style the walls are graced with Hockney and Lichtenstein and I have a penchant for vintage finds and bright colours to contrast against the grey walls. I have a front and back garden and am trying my hand at growing vegetables for the first time this year. There appears to be an abundance of rhubarb and potatoes so if you come and stay you can help yourself! I also have a couple of flamingoes living in the garden (albeit plastic ones) The house has a drive big enough for 2 cars so if you need a parking space you can of course

neighborhood_overview: It's great place right in the heart of Northenden Village Really near the M56 and M60. A short walk from some cracking pubs and restaurants and bars in Didsbury. On a frequent bus route to the airport and city centre. A good parade of shops a stones throw away. Virtually on the banks of the river Mersey which is perfect for an evening stroll or pedal along.... I love living here!
notes: I don't have any pets
transit: There is a bus stop a stones throw away. There are frequent and direct services to Manchester Airport, Manchester city centre, Altrincham and Didsbury. The nearest Metrolink station is Didsbury Village. The airport is 7 minutes away by car (£10 in a taxi)

Our village has a selection of shops  ie bakers, chemist, supermarket, restaurants, bars etc and again, all within walking distance.
notes: If you need transporting from the airport, train station or to other location in Manchester we can arrange to collect you for a cost of £12.50 per trip.  We have internet throughout the home and guests can tap into this.   We are all animal lovers so pets are not a problem as we have an enclosed garden and plenty of space outside for walking etc.  However you must take care of your pet ie cleaning, feeding etc and we do not  allow pets in the bedrooms.       Bed linen is changed on a weekly basis.
transit: The bus stop into the city is very close to our home and the journey takes 20 - 30 minutes depending on traffic.  We are also very close to Manchester Airport.   We also have two tram stations within 10 - 15 minutes of our home.  Manchester is a vibrant city and it is very easy to use public transport to move around landmarks such as Old Trafford Footbll stadium and Trafford Centre.  In our village we have a good selection of restaurants and bars.   if you want something  more lively than very close to our home is Didsbury,  Chorlton or Manchester City Centre with something for everyone.
street: Homewood Road, Northenden, Manchester, England M22 4DG, United Kingdom

neighborhood_overview: West Didsbury is a modern cosmopolitan area,  with the population largely consisting of young professionals and families.  The flat is a stones throw away from the main highstreet, which contains wonderful independant restaurants, cute bars and boutique shops, along with the essentials such as a supermarket and a post office.
notes: Flat is located on the first floor.
transit: Bus and tram stops are 2 minutes walk away from the flat, which provide links to both Manchester Airport and Manchester city Centre, with the tram journey to either destination taking only 10 minutes. The neighborhood is located just off the M60 ringroad and motorway network, which puts all of Manchester and the North West easily within your grasp. The Lake District, North Wales, Peak District, Yorkshire Dales, Liverpool, Chester, Leeds, York and Blackpool are all less than two hours away by car.

name: Large room, good access city centre
space: Hello, thanks for reading this. Our house is situated in Didsbury, one of Manchester's liveliest areas with lots of busy bars restaurants and cafes within a short walk. The house is very close to excellent 24 hour, high frequency bus services to the city centre, universities and hospitals. Didsbury has now been linked up to the city's tram system. We are 3 minutes walk from the West Didsbury tram stop, which connects with the city centre via Chorlton. Although close to local amenities, the street is quiet and does not suffer from traffic noise.   We have three rooms that are listed on Airbnb. Two are large en-suite rooms and there is a smaller room, which is not en-suite but which has an attractive adjacent bathroom. The other rooms are listed under "Dbl Room good access to city centre" and "Comfortable en-suite room, Didsbury".  The room you are viewing is our largest room, with generous wardrobe space and has a king-sized bed. There is also plenty of room for a cot. The large en-suit

host_about:
I retired early (4 years ago) from a professional role in order to spend more time with my camera. The camera bit didn't really work out as I spend most of my time keeping house and looking after our wonderful guests. Christine works in admin. We live in a largish Edwardian semi. We are a very sociable couple and we enjoy the social life in our community. When she is not out at work Christine is the nice one who makes cakes, bakes bread and makes our guests feel relaxed and welcome. I do most of the meeting and greeting, preparing our guest rooms, fixing breakfasts, researching local information and all the other little bits and pieces that help to make your stay memorable and enjoyable.

We both love cooking (and eating) and we enjoy preparing food for, and dining with, our guests. We try to remove processed foods from our diet as much as possible and we follow the same ethos when catering for our guests. Most of the foodstuffs we use for breakfast are home made. The meals that we provide in the evening are all cooked from fresh ingredients.

Guests seem to enjoy our house. Our house is clean but It is certainly not the tidiest house you will have seen. There are usually a few bits of clutter lying around. Books, newspapers and grandchildren's art work are often sprinkled around the place. I always tell Christine that a bit of clutter adds atmosphere to a home. She doesn't always agree.
street: Sandileigh Ave, Manchester, M20 3LN, United Kingdom

name: 3 Bed Lux House Didsbury Manchester
summary: A luxurious modern 3 bed 3 bath 3 storey house slap bang in the heart of vibrant West Didsbury and 10 minutes from Manchester Each room is very spacious and comfortable and there is a cinema room to unwind which also acts as the third bedroom-It has a large bed that covers nearly the whole room that has plenty sumptuous cushions as a back rest perfect for a lazy Sunday watching Sky/Netflicks, DVDs or playing the X Box on a huge  3metre screen! Private parking for 2 cars.  Met stop v close
space: The Cube is the perfect balance of modern and comfort. With its sociable open plan kitchen and lounge to its second floor master bedroom with large balcony en suite, dressing room and king size bed, it has a lot to offer. All the rooms have large flat screen tvs, sky television and fast wifi.  Ground floor: The kitchen is equipped with everything you need to make cooking easy and enjoyable. The high gloss kitchen table even extends to give you more room for entertaining. The double doors open out onto an urban garden with designer cube furniture, tall trees and plants.   The lounge is an enjoyable room to relax in and entertain with underfloor heating below a solid oak floor-perfect for winter evenings with candles lit. There is a spacious bathroom on the ground floor and a cloakroom. First Floor: There is two bedrooms on this floor one double room and a cinema room come bedroom this room can sleep two people comfortably as the bed is nearly the size of the room with big sumptuous cush

neighborhood_overview: West Didsbury is one of the most sought after Manchester locations to live in.  With over ten top restaurants and cafes, including Sunday Brunch, Celebrity Chef Simon Rimmer's Vegetarian restaurant, Greens, The Lime Tree, a multi award winning restaurant in the top ten of Manchester restaurants, Picolinos and The Rose Garden to name a few. There are also some beautiful furniture, jewellery,gift shops, designer clothing and vintage clothing stores lining the streets of Burton Road and Lapwing Lane that are all a stones through away from The Cube. Burton Road boasts five vibrant late night bars all individual, with special ales and cocktails to choose from. Plus the infamous Metropolitan Pub is less than a 20 second walk away. If this isnt enough to entertain you there is a metro line that can take you to Didsbury Village (East Didsbury) for shops bars and cafes that are similar to West Didsbury. The Burton Road stop and the West Didsbury stop are both 20 metres either side of The Cube.
notes: In the house you will find handy things to make your stay comfortable, relaxing and as easy as possible.  Things such as Hairdryers per room Designer toiletries such as Shampoo and Conditioners, Bubble Bath and Shower Gel.  Nespresso Machine (Please note only one sachet of 20 capsules are left at a time, please bring more if desired). Selection of Teas, sugar and instant coffee. A bottle of Prosecco on arrival.
transit: If this isnt enough to entertain you there is a metro line that can take you to Didsbury Village for shops bars and cafes that are similar to West Didsbury. The Burton Road stop and the West Didsbury stop are both 20 metres either side of The Cube. It is also a £10, 10 minute, taxi ride into the city centre, or again The Metro can take you there in 20 minutes which is a stones through from the house
street: Claremont Avenue, Manchester, M20 1JN, United Kingdom

host_about:
Hello, I'm Claudia and I live in West Didsbury, Manchester. I'm a Chemical Engineer from Venezuela and I have been living in Manchester for over 6 years.

My husband and I would be happy to welcome you to our lovely neighborhood surrounded by a great variety of traditional & international restaurants, bars and local independent businesses which make this manchester suburb a very unique, multicultural and vibrant area with a great atmosphere.

Our aim is to provide you with a comfortable stay and we will be more than happy to assist with tips and recommendations for getting around the city. 

Feel free to ask any questions and we look forward to welcome you to Sunny Manchester.

We hope you enjoy your stay!

name: Spacious Double Room in quiet area
summary: Bright double room, with spacious kitchen and garden in a quiet area (in West Didsbury) but conveniently situated near a bus stop to the city centre and a trendy area with shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.
space: Beautiful, spacious and bright double room with a king size bed, bedside table and wardrobe. There is an upstairs bathroom with a nice hot shower and a downstairs toilet. The lounge has two couches and a widescreen TV. The kitchen is very spacious with plenty of cooking tools! - including oven, stove, kettle, top range food prcessor/blender and high quality juicer! There is also a dishwasher and washing machine.  There is a quaint garden outside with decking and a BBQ.
description: Bright double room, with spacious kitchen and garden in a quiet area (in West Didsbury) but conveniently situated near a bus stop to the city centre and a trendy area with shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. Beautiful, spacious and bright double room with a king size bed, bedside table and wardrobe. There is an upstairs bathroom with a nice hot shower and a downstairs toilet. The lounge has two couches and a widescreen TV. The kitchen is very spacious with plenty of cooking tools! - including oven, stove, kettle, top range food prcessor/blender and high quality juicer! There is also a dishwasher and washing machine.  There is a quaint garden outside with decking and a BBQ. I will give you your own set of keys so you can come and go as you please. It is situated in a very quiet area with a walking path along the River Mersey just
neighborhood_overview: It is situated in a very quiet area with a walking path along the River Mersey just around the corner where many people walk their dogs and go jogging. The house is located just 10 mins walk away from Burton Road - a trendy part of West Didsbury with many cool cafes, bars and restaurants.
transit: There is a bus stop just around the corner on Princess Road with frequent buses into the centre of town. You can take the (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) and 109.
host_about: I like to think of myself as an open minded and sociable person. I love languages, travelling, cooking, sports.... I'm very health conscious and I love staying fit and cooking healthy food. I've used Airbnb a lot to travel and I've met a few cool people along the way. I hope to meet some more both travelling and hosting.

space: Warm welcoming large house with plenty of space for you to enjoy a bit of privacy in pleasant surroundings.
description: Our Victorian mid-terrace is located in leafy fashionable South Manchester - 30m from the city centre by tram/bus. Our two bedrooms  - a double and a single - are south-facing with views of our leafy neighbourhood. Access to shared bathroom & kitchen Warm welcoming large house with plenty of space for you to enjoy a bit of privacy in pleasant surroundings. You have access to the kitchen, living rooms and garden. We are here to help with advice about what to do in central Manchester and our local fashionable conservation area of West Didsbury. We love walking 10 minutes to Marie-Louise Gardens - a local arboretum. Burton Rd is just a stones throw away, with award-winning bars, eateries, restaurants  - also there is an excellent speciality micro-brewery beer store and Reserve  a highly regarded wine shop, whose owner now appears on the Food & Drink programme. West Didsbury is a conservation area full of grand old trees, and with elegant Victorian & Edwardian homes. There is a bus stop 2m
neighborhood_overview: We love walking 10 minutes to Marie-Louise Gardens - a local arboretum. Burton Rd is just a stones throw away, with award-winning bars, eateries, restaurants  - also there is an excellent speciality micro-brewery beer store and Reserve  a highly regarded wine shop, whose owner now appears on the Food & Drink programme. West Didsbury is a conservation area full of grand old trees, and with elegant Victorian & Edwardian homes.
notes: We have two cats - Bruno & Molly Moo - who are brother and sister.
transit: There is a bus stop 2m from the house with frequent buses into town and the airport. We also have 2 tram stops both a 5 minute walk away. A linear cycle route takes you all the way into the city centre from our home.

name: Large single ensuite in Didsbury
summary: Right in the heard of Didsbury Village. Fantastic location for visiting Manchester, particularly short work assignments as great transport links, easy local grocery and dining options.
space: I live in a luxury open-plan apartment on the second floor of a building formerly known as the 'Clock Tower'. The apartment is made up of two bedrooms (both with ensuites), and a large living space/kitchen - the apartment is usually flooded with light due to the 8 large bay windows in the main room, overlooking the rooftops and out to the hills. The location is the thing. Right on Didsbury Village High Street, full of cafes and bars. A particular favourite pub is the Dog and Partridge across the road, and the Deli cafe is a fantastic place for lunches and all-day breakfasts 2 minutes down the road. We can cook together if I'm around, but the high street does tend to tempt you out ... Your room is ensuite with a large single (1.2) bed, table with 2 drawers, and with underfloor heating, and you have full use of the living room/kitchen of course. This is furnished with vintage 50s G-Plan sideboard, table and easy chair, and a modern comfy chaise longue. Broadband is easy to connect and th

neighborhood_overview: I love that within 2 minutes of the front door, on Didsbury High Street, you can find: Butcher (Axons), fishmonger and greengrocer (Evans) and Asian grocers.  Then you have Aldi, Tesco, M&S and Co-op on top of those. And if you're not eating in, same walking distance there are around 10 different places to eat out.
transit: The East Didsbury tram line is a 2 minute walk (Didsbury Village). Several buses go past the door. East Didsbury train station (10 mins to Piccadilly) is a 15 minute walk. Manchester Airport is a 10 minute taxi ride, about £12. Parking is in local side streets.
host_about:
Lived in China for 8 years, now split time between Moganshan, China and Manchester, UK!
Love the outdoors, particularly open swimming. Liking travel less and visiting friends more, running a small business and trying to find that elusive balance between what you want to do and what you have to do!

neighborhood_overview: Didsbury is one of the hottest neighbourhoods in Manchester. Home to media types, musicians, young professionals and young families it's a very nice neighbourhood to be in. West Didsbury particularly is a little more independent than East with a strip of independent bars/shops/restaurants just a 5 minute walk away. You won't be short of places to eat and drink and we can certainly recommend our favourite spots! You will be staying right on the historic Lapwing Lane arcade which has a Pizza Express/Post Office/Pharmacy/Deli/General store and Wine Bar! The Fletcher Moss botanical gardens are a short bus ride away and also a large entertainment centre (cinema/bowling/casino) is a 5 minute tram ride away. Getting to the city centre is incredibly easy through public transport and there you will find a huge amount of museums/shops/music venues & theatres to explore to your heart's content. We can help with suggestions for wherever your interests lie :)
notes: As I live along an arcade of shops my next door neighbour is a (fabulous!) wine bar. From time to time there will be a little noise from them but I will endeavour to let guests know when to expect a little more noise (the usual Friday/Saturday, however they are only open until midnight)
transit: The flat is incredibly well positioned for transport.  The West Didsbury tram stop is across the road which connects you to all of Greater Manchester, 15 minutes to Trafford Bar (for Old Trafford) and 25 minutes to the centre.  Buses run from outside the flat and round the corner to Universities/city centre (£1 single) and also the 24hr airport bus can be found within a 3 minute walk of the flat.  Taxis to/from the airport should cost around £12.
host_about: Hello! I'm Jemma and I live in Manchester but originally from York. Currently I'm studying for an MA in Visual Anthropology at the University of Manchester. I have personally had great AirBnB experiences with friends all over the world and are now hosting. Any questions do ask!

neighborhood_overview: When we moved to Manchester from London we chose West Didsbury as we think it is by far the best place to live. It is a buzzing, friendly area. It has lots of green spaces and Victorian houses, and Burton road is full of independent shops, restaurants and bars. Getting to central Manchester is easy so it has the best of both worlds! We are more than happy to give you restaurant, bar and shopping recommendations.
notes: Between my partner and I we speak English, Italian, French and Spanish.  When contacting us, please tell us a bit about yourself, what you do for a living, etc, and when you would like to check in. Without this information we will not consider you, particularly if you do not have any (website hidden) verifications or reviews.
transit: We are 7 minutes walk from Burton Road tram stop, which takes you into central Manchester in 15-20 minutes. There are also numerous buses at the end of our road which go to central Manchester, Wythenshawe, the Trafford Centre, Stockport and more. We are very close to the M60 and M56 motorways (though not so close that you can hear them :-)) and Manchester airport is a 15 minute drive away. A cab from the airport costs less than £20. The area really is very well connected.
host_about:
Hey...
I'm Marco. I'm originally from Sydney Australia and moved to Manchester with work about 18 months ago. I'm a project manager in the power generation industry.  I live with my partner Jacinta, a lawyer, and our Spaniel dog, Dexter in West Didsbury. 

We love to travel and explore, eat out and, when we're feeling healthy, go to yoga and pilates classes. I really enjoy cycling and music - I play the guitar, although not as well as I would like to! 

We both love meeting new people and learning about different cultures. We were lucky enough to have an amazing 4 month trip last year to a real mix of countries including Iran, Mongolia, Japan and Thailand. We stayed in lots of AirBnB places (although there weren't any i Iran!) and really enjoyed the experience.

That's about all from me.

Look forward to meeting you.

neighborhood_overview: West Didsbury has everything you could need from a local neighbourhood - shops, bars, restaurants, cash machines ... Tram (on the corner) and bus links take you to the city centre, universities, airport, media city, Lowry Centre ...  The Mersey Valley is a short bus ride away if you like fresh air (and this part of Manchester has lower than average rainfall for the UK!) and National Trust properties like Styal Mill and Tatton Park (both with lovely walks) are 20 minutes by car.
notes: This is a peaceful block of flats and noise is prohibited before 9.00 am and after 11.00 pm.  However, if you like noise and bustle, there are several lively bars and eateries from two minutes walk away.
transit: Buses and trams are on the doorstep. They link with mainline stations to Liverpool, Leeds, Sheffield ... (And London is two hours on the train)

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is a 2 minute walk from Didsbury village where you will find innumerable restaurants, cafés, bars and pubs. There are superb local shops including an award winning cheese/deli  and fishmonger as well as the usual supermarkets: Tesco, Aldi, Co-Op and M&S Food. Didsbury Park is about a five minute walk away.
transit: This super apartment is situated 6 miles south of Manchester City Centre. Didsbury village, which is just a short walk of 200 yards away, is a very lively, cosmopolitan area of South Manchester. There are countless restaurants, pubs and coffee shops as well as some great speciality food shops, an M&S food store and all local amenities. The apartment is ideally situated for the Christie Hospital which is just 1 mile along Wilmslow Road or 4 stops on the bus. Wilmslow Road, which runs through the village, has very frequent bus services. Didsbury Village Metrolink tram station provides access into the city centre and beyond. Manchester Airport and Stockport are 5.5 and 4 miles away respectively. Parrs Wood cinema and entertainment complex and several family-style restaurants are all less than 5 minutes drive. Further afield, you can get to the beautiful Peak District in under an hour and the magnificent Lake District in under 2 hours.

I'm looking for short-term rentals, usually up to 2 weeks, but this can be negotiable. Shared bathroom, kitchen, living room and dining area. I'll be here to settle you in to the apartment.  I'm in and out all the time but I'm always contactable by phone if you need me.  I'm a really easy-going person to live with and I'm always happy to meet new people :) I love west didsbury!  It's
neighborhood_overview: I love west didsbury!  It's a lovely, safe neighborhood with a really nice vibe to it.  The apartment is 5 min walk from trendy Burton Road; a beautifully maintained leafy village with unusual shops, bars and restaurants.  Across the road from my apartment is a post office, chemist, wine bar, off-license and deli.   Trust me, you'll love it!
transit: The location couldn't be more transport-friendly!  There are bus stops outside the apartment and West Didsbury tram stop is across the road which gives you access to all areas of Manchester (20 min ride to the city centre).   Manchester International Airport is a 10 min drive away.

name: Huge Open Plan Apartment, Didsbury
summary: Welcome to our home - it's a beautiful open plan apartment in the heart of Didsbury Village, full of light and music. Please read our detailed description below for the complete lowdown. We are looking forward to having you to stay!
space: We would love to to welcome you to our home! We live in a great apartment in Didsbury Village, on the first floor of a building formerly known as the 'Clock Tower'. Apart from the guest bedroom (equipped with an ensuite bathroom), there is also a huge open plan living space for you to enjoy. The apartment is usually flooded with light due to the 8 large bay windows in the main room, overlooking the village.

Apart from the guest bedroom (equipped with an ensuite bathroom), there is also a huge open plan living space for you to enjoy. The apartment is usually flooded with light due to the 8 large bay windows in the main room, overlooking the village. Your bedroom is at the other end of the flat, and is completely soundproof, should you wish to retreat. Along with an newly renovated ensuite, there is a comfy double bed, and underfloor heating to keep you toast warm in the winter. There is also an additional mattress for you to use, should you wish to stay with three people.  We also have wireless fibr
neighborhood_overview: We are super close to a number of great galleries, bars, restaurants, and museums, including the Whitworth Art Gallery, Manchester Art Gallery, and Manchester Museum. In addition to this, we have loads of personal recommendations, so ask away and we will do our best to help you out! Soph and I are both freelance musicians, working with the BBC Phil, Hallé, and Royal Liverpool Phil amongst others, so we also have a pretty good handle on the music scene.
notes: If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to get in touch. We look forward to welcoming you to Manchester, and our home!
transit: We are about 20 minutes out of the CBD, which means that the area is quiet, but close enough to commute easily should you want to see the sights. The 142 and 42 buses into town stop directly outside the apartment, so transport is a cinch. Didsbury Village Tram stop is just over the road, so that also opens up a gamut of travel options. We also have buses nearby that take you straight to the Trafford Centre, should you be in the mood for a monster shopping trip! Finally, there is a cab company just down the road that will take you to Manchester Airport for £12, and pick you up whenever is convenient. The trip takes about 15 mins.
host_about:
My name is Adam, and I am a cellist currently based in Manchester, UK. 

Together with my girlfriend, Sophie, we live in a lovely apartment in Didsbury Village. Our place is big, filled with light, and there is generally music playing and something cooking. It's a good place.

neighborhood_overview: West Didsbury is a modern cosmopolitan area,  with the population largely consisting of young professionals and families.  The flat is a stones throw away from the main highstreet, which contains wonderful independant restaurants, cute bars and boutique shops, along with the essentials such as a supermarket and a post office.
notes: Flat is located on the ground floor.
transit: Bus and tram stops are located a few minutes walk away from the flat, which provide links to both Manchester Airport and Manchester city Centre, with the tram journey to either destination taking only 10 minutes. The neighborhood is located just off the M60 ringroad and motorway network, which puts all of Manchester and the North West easily within your grasp. The Lake District, North Wales, Peak District, Yorkshire Dales, Liverpool, Chester, Leeds, York and Blackpool are all less than two hours away by car.

name: South Manchester Apartment
summary: A thoroughly charming, hugely spacious and rather unique apartment perfectly positioned between West Didsbury, the coolest suburb in Manchester and Didsbury Village, where you will find fine food, drink and character aplenty, 5 minutes from the tram!
space: A lovely, spacious apartment occupying the ground floor of a Victorian semi, full of character but also fully modernised. There's a record player with stacks of classic vinyl, DVD projector and hundreds of world cinema titles, tv and radio also. You can help yourself to cereal & juice and make use of herbs, spices and condiments should you wish to cook. Double brass bed and a single Futon should you require an extra bed for a child. Large garden, and a kitchen full of everything you might need should you wish to  have a quiet night in. Five minutes walk away is Didsbury Village where you'll find a tram stop to the City Centre, as well as loads of great pubs, restaurants and parks. Ten minutes walk or a two minute tram hop is Burton Road with exceptional restaurants, bars and shops where you can find the best craft beer selection and eat the best British, Asian and European food outside the city centre, without the crowds. Plenty to do and explore with the majestic Fletcher Moss botanic

neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is second to none, dozens of top end restaurants and bars, such as The Rose Garden, Solita, Volta, Green's, The Lime Tree, The Metropolitan and the multi award winning Great Khatmandu within walking distance. For a small suburb we've got an amazing selection of good pubs, from real ale stalwarts to bars serving the latest craft beer delights both local and far flung. We've splendid parks in Fletcher Moss and Marie Louise gardens. On the last Sunday of the month we hold a Makers Market on Burton Rd with live music, street food and craft stalls all day. All within five or ten minutes walk. The apartment itself however is on a really nice, quiet and leafy street tucked away behind Didsbury village.
notes: Check in after 1pm and vacate by noon please.
transit: Trams to Manchester every 12 minutes. East Didsbury rail station a five minute drive away.

neighborhood_overview: West Didsbury is an awesome neighbourhood! Both Didsbury village and Burton Road are a few minutes walk away and are jam packed with independent shops, cafes and bars. Home to media, music and arts-types, young professionals and young families, it's a really nice neighbourhood to live in. If you want any ideas for shops/bars to visit, just ask. The river, water park and Fletcher Moss botanical gardens are close by and perfect for a walk, run or cycle. There's also a large cinema a few minutes away on the tram and a couple of gyms within walking distance.
transit: By car it takes 15 minutes to drive to the city centre and university. There is unallocated off street parking outside of the building. By tram it takes about 35 minutes door to door. West Didsbury and Burton Road tram stops are both a 5-10 minute walk from the flat. By bus it takes about 45 minutes to get into town. Buses can cost as little as £7.50 for a weekly pass. By taxi from the centre of town to the flat can cost between £10 (uber) and £16 (black cab). For further info on all options you can check (URL HIDDEN)
host_about: Trying to see the world (and eat all of the food) whenever I have a few pennies and a couple of days off work. Love exploring cities, running by the beach, reading in cafes, hiking up hills and wandering around castles.

name: Dbl Room good access to city centre
space: Hello, thanks for reading this. Our house is situated in Didsbury, one of Manchester's liveliest areas with lots of busy bars restaurants and cafes within a short walk. The house is very close to excellent 24 hour, high frequency bus services to the city centre, universities and hospitals. Didsbury has now been linked up to the city's tram system. We are 3 minutes walk from the West Didsbury tram stop, which connects with the city centre via Chorlton. Although close to local amenities, the street is quiet and does not suffer from traffic noise.   We have three rooms that are listed on Airbnb. Two are large en-suite rooms and there is a smaller room, which is not en-suite but which has an attractive adjacent bathroom. The other rooms are listed under "Large Room good access city centre" and "Comfortable en-suite room, Didsbury".  The room you are viewing is our smallest room. host_about:
I retired early (4 years ago) from a professional role in order to spend more time with my camera. The camera bit didn't really work out as I spend most of my time keeping house and looking after our wonderful guests. Christine works in admin. We live in a largish Edwardian semi. We are a very sociable couple and we enjoy the social life in our community. When she is not out at work Christine is the nice one who makes cakes, bakes bread and makes our guests feel relaxed and welcome. I do most of the meeting and greeting, preparing our guest rooms, fixing breakfasts, researching local information and all the other little bits and pieces that help to make your stay memorable and enjoyable.

We both love cooking (and eating) and we enjoy preparing food for, and dining with, our guests. We try to remove processed foods from our diet as much as possible and we follow the same ethos when catering for our guests. Most of the foodstuffs we use for breakfast are home made. The meals that we provide in the evening are all cooked from fresh ingredients.

Guests seem to enjoy our house. Our house is clean but It is certainly not the tidiest house you will have seen. There are usually a few bits of clutter lying around. Books, newspapers and grandchildren's art work are often sprinkled around the place. I always tell Christine that a bit of clutter adds atmosphere to a home. She doesn't always agree.
street: Sandileigh Ave, Manchester, M20 3LN, United Kingdom

name: Bright & Characterful 2 Bed Flat!
summary: Hello! Welcome to this 2 bed duplex flat in the heart of West Didsbury!
space: The flat is positioned smack bang in the middle of Didsbury over 2 floors and is accessed through an alleyway and up some stairs.  It comprises of 2 bedrooms (one King and one Super King) a large living room, toilet, bathroom and kitchen. Everything you might need is in the flat, from kitchen bits and bobs, through to wifi/computer access, Sky TV, central heating, the lot!  It would be perfect for a weekend stay for friends looking for something a little more personal than a hotel or a home away from home for longer stays.
description: Hello! Welcome to this 2 bed duplex flat in the heart of West Didsbury! The flat is positioned smack bang in the middle of Didsbury over 2 floors and is accessed through an alleyway and up some stairs.  It comprises of 2 bedrooms (one King and one Super King) a large living room, toilet, bathroom and kitchen. Everything you might need is in the flat, from kitchen bits and bobs, through to wifi/computer access, Sky TV, central heating, the lot!  It would be perfect for a weekend stay for friends looking for something a little more personal than a hotel or a home away from home for longer stays. You will have access to the entire flat, the yard and entrance is shared with another neighbour but the flat will be yours for your stay. I should be there on arrival to show you around and help with any questions you might have about Manchester/the flat :) I will let you know when booking. Didsbury is one of the hottest neighbourhoods in Manchester. Home to media types, musicians, young professi
neighborhood_overview: Didsbury is one of the hottest neighbourhoods in Manchester. Home to media types, musicians, young professionals and young families it's a very nice neighbourhood to be in! West Didsbury particularly is a little more independent than East with a strip of independent bars/shops/restaurants just a 5 minute walk away. You won't be short of places to eat and drink and I can certainly recommend my favourite spots! You will be staying right on the historic Lapwing Lane arcade which has a Pizza Express/Post Office/Pharmacy/Deli/General store and Wine Bar! The Fletcher Moss botanical gardens are a short bus ride away and also a large entertainment centre (cinema/bowling/casino) is a 5 minute tram ride away. Getting to the city centre is incredibly easy through public transport and there you will find a huge amount of museums/shops/music venues & theatres to explore to your heart's content. I can help with suggestions for wherever your interests lie :)
notes: The flat is located next to a bar (which won CityLife Best Bar in Manchester 2015! So highly recommended!) so inevitably noise comes through from time to time, weekend evenings mainly. They do however stop serving at midnight so noise should stop shortly after. It's worth taking this into consideration if you like an early nights sleep on a weekend, however most guests haven't found it to be a problem.
transit: The flat is incredibly well positioned for transport.  The West Didsbury tram stop is across the road which connects you to all of Greater Manchester, 15 minutes to Trafford Bar (for Old Trafford) and 25 minutes to the centre.  Buses run from outside the flat and round the corner to Universities/city centre (£1 single/20mins to uni/25mins to town) and also the 24hr airport bus (no.43) can be found within a 3 minute walk of the flat.  Taxis to/from the airport should cost around £12. There is parking directly outside but it is limited to 2 hours between 8am and 6pm, however on street parking can be found in the street behind the flat easily :)
host_about: Hello! I'm Jemma and I live in Manchester but originally from York. Currently I'm studying for an MA in Visual Anthropology at the University of Manchester. I have personally had great AirBnB experiences with friends all over the world and are now hosting. Any questions do ask!
street: Lapwing Lane, Manchester, M20 6UR, United Kingdom

summary: Lovely double room and breakfast in quiet area, close to Chorlton village w/cafes, bars. Full use of kitchen, living room, bathroom. Airport pickup. 50MB wifi. Tram station 5 mins walk, links to City Centre, Airport. Parking. Euro exchange.
space: A lovely double bedroom in a quiet residential area close to Chorlton village. Metrolink (Tram) links to Manchester City Centre and Airport. Breakfast included. Bedroom includes double bed with memory foam mattress, electric blanket, and king-size duvet for extra comfort. Extra blankets are available. The bed has a gas lift (see pics) for extra storage underneath - perfect for bags or suitcases. Also included in the room are fresh clean bed linen, towels, a TV with freeview, a chest of drawers, hairdryer, desk, a clothes rack, and a chair. A stereo system is also available. Toothpaste, shower gel etc are in the bathroom. Airport pickup - we can pick you up / drop off at Manchester Airport, we don't charge for this, we just ask that you pay the parking charge. This is usually £2.90 to £5, depending on how long it takes. For drop off there is no parking charge. No charge for fuel. A taxi will be around £30 return. Going to Manchester city centre? We can advise you on sights to see, place
