neighborhood_overview: On the well-regarded Beech Road, just under a mile away, we have plenty of cafes, restaurants and bars. In particular we recommend the upmarket 'Laundrette' which is great for both food and drink. There is also a Tapas Bar, gastropub The Parlour, a Thai restaurant and lots of other eateries and drinkeries. Another few minutes walk takes you to Chorlton Village with dozens more cafes, bars, restaurants and shops. We recommend the Beagle for food or drink, and Pi, which serves delicious homemade pies and world beers. Just over a mile in the other direction is West Didsbury, likely the nicest area in all of Manchester, outside the city centre. Dozens of cafes, bars and restaurants including TV Chef Simon Rimmer's 'Greens' Restaurant, and a nightclub / late bar called M20 if you don't fancy the city centre. We can give a lift to and from these areas if you fancy an evening out. There is also Barbakan, a very popular and award winning Polish bakery, and Unicorn Grocery which stocks locally
notes: The living room sofa has a pull out single bed for a third guest. Smoking - there is a large covered outdoor area out the back with table and chairs. No smoking in the house - sorry! No pets – sorry!
transit: There is a tram (Metrolink) station about 5 minutes walk away. The name of the station is Barlow Moor Road. We can pick you up / dropoff no problem if needs be. The tram takes you direct to the Airport, Manchester United's football ground Old Trafford (get off at 'Trafford Bar' metrolink stop) and to the City Centre (change at Cornbrook station) within about 20 minutes, a very regular service. Unfortunately airbnb doesn't allow weblinks, so for more details you can just ask us, or (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) 'metrolink manchester' Nearest train stations are East Didsbury and Burnage. Driving: the M60 is a few minutes away, come off at Junction 5 and take the A5103 towards the city centre, then turn left onto Barlow Moor Road. From the M56 northbound, follow the signs for the A5103 and then turn left onto Barlow Moor Road.
host_about: We are a Brazilian and Irish couple. We love cooking, travel, film, sport and love living in Chorlton.
street: Meachin Avenue, Manchester, M21 7HY, United Kingdom

space: Our apartment is on Burton Road in West Didsbury surrounded by cafes, delis, bars, wonderful restaurants, parks, walks and more!We are situated on the first floor above a little shop and it is very quiet with only two other flats in the building (all professionals). I love to cook and so there is a well equipped kitchen plus a lovely dining table. There is a very big lounge with lots of lovely comfy seating+sofa and a BIG window to sit and have your morning coffee by (great for people watching!) TV has SKY (plus all sports), there is full internet and wifi and gas central heating. There are lots of lovely features in the flat including stripped floors, original fire places and an old record player and collection which you are free to use!

summary: A 2 dbl bed luxury ground floor flat with french country chic decor. A private entrance on a picturesque street a short stroll from West Didsbury's bustling bars and restaurants. Features include a Jacuzzi tub, Hypnos mattresses and heated floors.
space: A large space with a lounge and dining area, 2 large double bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, a main bathroom with Jacuzzi tub and an en suite to the master bedroom. description: A 2 dbl bed luxury ground floor flat with french country chic decor. A private entrance on a picturesque street a short stroll from West Didsbury's bustling bars and restaurants. Features include a Jacuzzi tub, Hypnos mattresses and heated floors. A large space with a lounge and dining area, 2 large double bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, a main bathroom with Jacuzzi tub and an en suite to the master bedroom. The flat boasts luxury features and amenities including heated bathroom floors, a dishwasher, a Bose Docking station, a coffee machine, 150MG free Wifi, board games, Virgin TV and a communal garden with access to a fire pit, BBQ and garden furniture. Guests will have access to the flat through the private front entrance. There is free street parking on the no-through road the flat is situated on. There is also access to the communal garden around the side of the house with keys to access the shed for garden furniture. We are contactable at any time before and during the stay. W
neighborhood_overview: West Didsbury is a beautiful, safe, chic and popular neighbourhood in South Manchester close to a whole host of amenities and transport links. The flat is a couple of minutes walk to Burton Road which is a lively street all week round full of boutique stores, independent cafe's, pubs, bars and restaurants.  It's very easy to spend a few days discovering the delights that West Didsbury has to offer. In the opposite direction a 5 min walk from the flat is a lovely walk along the river Mersey, which borders various golf courses. Take in the beautiful scenery and enjoy the fresh air. Either head towards East Didsbury (another chic and popular neighbourhood with great bars and restaurants) or in the other direction to Chorlton Water park, which has a lovely lake to walk around.
notes: We live in this apartment when guests are not staying and so you will find our family pictures and general items here and there but don't worry as you will have plenty of space for your things, we aim to please.
transit: West Didsbury is perfectly equipped with a whole host of transport links. There is a bus stop around the corner from the flat and a tram station on Burton road, both can take you to Manchester city centre, Hale, Altrincham, Chorlton and many other places. The M60 and M56 motorways are both a minutes drive from the flat as is Princess Parkway which can take you directly into Manchester city centre. The Airport is a 10-15 minute drive away as is Stockport train station. There is a taxi firm called Tripps around the corner from the flat and there are always plenty of Uber Taxi's around.

neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is located in a little suburb of South Manchester called West Didsbury. It is a bustling, friendly and safe area, full of quaint and original shops to lose an entire day in and upmarket bars you will want to stay in all night. There are plenty of cafes, parks and restaurants within a 5 minute walk, with even more to choose from in the surrounding areas such as Chorlton, Altrincham and Hale.  The apartment is also conveniently located close to the Didsbury tram metro link making Manchester city centre and/or Manchester airport easy to reach.
notes: When we don't have guest we do live in this apartment- therefore our things will still be there, however we do ensure there is plenty of space.  We have a kitten called Stanley who we book into a cattery when we have guests. However if you are cat friendly and don't mind him keeping you company please let us know.
transit: We are closely situated between  bus stops and tram stops with easy access into Manchester city centre.  We're also a 5 minute drive away from the motorway, making it easy to escape to the countryside or catch a plane.

name: Bright double room Chorlton
summary: Hi, we'd love to have you come and stay with us. We have a bright and comfortable bedroom available, looking out over our back garden in the popular area of Chorlton. All the usual amenities available- bath/shower, use of kitchen/fridge, internet etc
space: We bought our flat last June in a leafy area of Chrolton about 4 miles from the city centre. Chorlton is a great place to be based. It has a vibrant community atmosphere and there is always loads going on. If you want to see a bit more of Manchester than the standard city centre experience then this is definitely the place to be. However, this doesn't mean you should miss out on Manchester's classic sights as the city centre is very close by  with easy tram and bus links to the town centre and Victoria or Piccadily station. If you're more energetic then cycling is possible too, I cycle to work and it takes about 35 mins. We're also really well placed for the airport which is accessible in 15 mins by tram ( the stop is 10 mins walk from the house) Alternatively you can take a short taxi trip for £12.  If you're interested in visiting some of the national parks of the North West then we are conveniently placed for the peak district which is about 40 mins drive and there is free parking o
description: Hi, we'd love to have you come and stay with us. We have a bright and comfortable bedroom available, looking out over our back garden in the popular area of Chorlton. All the usual amenities available- bath/shower, use of kitchen/fridge, internet etc We bought our flat last June in a leafy area of Chrolton about 4 miles from the city centre. Chorlton is a great place to be based. It has a vibrant community atmosphere and there is always loads going on. If you want to see a bit more of Manchester than the standard city centre experience then this is definitely the place to be. However, this doesn't mean you should miss out on Manchester's classic sights as the city centre is very close by  with easy tram and bus links to the town centre and Victoria or Piccadily station. If you're more energetic then cycling is possible too, I cycle to work and it takes about 35 mins. We're also really well placed for the airport which is accessible in 15 mins by tram ( the stop is 10 mins walk from the
host_about:
My partner Jill and I have been living in Chorlton for a few years and finally bought our first home last summer. We love having friends and family to stay and would like to extend this welcome to people looking to explore Manchester, or simply stopping over for the night. 
Manchester is a great city, Jill grew up here and I moved up here in 2010. We can give you pointers on good places to go for food and drink, how to get around and some of the most popular sights. 
Chorlton is 4 miles to the south of the city centre. It is a really vibrant local community with more pubs, cafes and independent deli's than you could know what to do with! If you're an ale drinker then you could definitely pass a few happy evenings in one of our locals! We enjoy going for walks in the Peak District with our dog Willow, sampling local beers with friends in the pubs and cafés of Chorlton and relaxing at home with Willow and our cat Mavis.
We've both done lots of traveling in India, Australia, Kenya, Costa Rica, USA and Europe and want to do much more; the Northern Lights and Argentina are high up on the list! Because of this we thought it'd be fun to open our house up other to other travelers no matter how long or short your trip. Whether you're backpacking in the UK or just stopping over in Manchester for a one off trip we hope you would enjoy staying with us.
street: Barlow Hall Road, Chorlton, Manchester, Lancashire UK, M21 7JJ, United Kingdom

You are a five minute stroll from Beech Road and Tram Stops into the City. The apartment is a two bedroom, two bathroom (one ensuite) with balcony overlooking the local allotment and park.  There is a kitchen with dishwasher, Tassimo machine, fridge freezer and washer dryer. It is a lovely warm apartment but heating can be turned on if you feel a chill.  The apartment has Sky, Apple TV, Wireless Speakers and Wifi.  The bedroom on offer has recently been painted, with a new bed and mattress! It is super comfy.  Towels, toiletries and the basic food essentials are all provided. You can access the whole apartment bar my ensuite and bedroom. In terms of accessing the building I will give you a code (there are two, one for the front gate and one for the block) You will often have the apartment to yourself (lucky you!) but I
neighborhood_overview: Chorlton has a reputation of being the bohemian, alternative part of Manchester. There are tons of bars, restaurants and quirky shops on your doorstep here as well at the park, woodland and local transport links to get you about easily and into Manchester quickly.) There is free parking around Chorlton.
notes: If I am away for the weekend, my Boyfriend will greet you with a key and plenty of info for your stay. :)
transit: The Local Tramstops (Barlow Moor Road and Chorlton) are both 5-10 minutes walk away -For info on Manchester's Trams have a look at the MetroLink site or App. ( It is approx 20 mins into town, there are plenty of places to cycle and park your car.  All Chorlton nightlife is walking distance and Didsbury is only a couple of stops on the tram. We are also on the Airport tram line :)

space: A beautifully appointed, newly built boutique mews cottage located in the fashionable suburb of West Didsbury. Quietly tucked away, but still close to many top restaurants, bars & wonderful independent shops. We are also convenient for the motorway network, airport & just a short drive or tram trip into the city centre. This unique architect designed property has been fitted out to a very high standard in both materials & furnishings, all the spaces are luxurious & relaxing. The building is very highly insulated with thermostatically controlled underfloor heating on the ground floor & the heating / hot water is ecologically produced from an air source heat pump. The property also has two designated off road parking spaces. Everything in the house is there for your enjoyment. Included in the tariff is free wifi, 'youview' tv, with tv & dvd players (in both the living space & master bedroom), i-pod dock, fully fitted kitchen with all neff appliances & washing machine. neighborhood_overview: West Didsbury is a very vibrant & exciting area of Manchester with a real sense of community & a destination in it's own right. Some of Manchester's top restaurants are located in the area & we have a fantastically eclectic mix of bars & wonderful independent shops. The river Mersey & water parks are a short walk away & you can go walk / run / cycle along the banks or even take a canoe trip which is a great way to see the wildlife! West Didsbury is very conveniently located being only 5 miles from the city centre & on the newly opened tram line. We are also close to the ring road & an extensive motorway network, which puts all of Manchester & the North West easily within your grasp. Day trips can easily be taken to The Lake District, North Wales, Peak District, Yorkshire Dales, Liverpool, Chester, Leeds, York & Blackpool are all less than two hours away by car. We are also just 10 minutes away from the airport.
host_about: I'm the architect who designed the mews cottage. In my spare time I enjoy taking part in many sports to keep me fit and healthy, but am still run ragged by our dog Barney!

neighborhood_overview: Chorlton has many cafes, bars and restaurants. It also has independent specialist shops selling a range of things from food to fashion to presents.  There is a large, local park and the end of the road with tennis courts, football pitches, a children's play area and more. There is a newly-built leisure centre a short bus/tram ride away (or around 30 minute walk) with swimming, gym, squash courts, sauna and more. Weare close to many attractions including Manchester United Football Club group (15 minutes by tram), museums, art galleries and more.  Manchester is also ideally located for trips to countryside including the Peak District (1 hour by train/car), North wales/ Snowdonia (1.5 hour by train/car).
notes: Other people in the house are me and my 10 year old son (some of the week). We have no pets, but lots of hospitality!
transit: Chorlton is well-served by public transport. We are on a tram route into town (30 minutes), airport (around 40 minutes), town centre and train stations (30 minutes). A taxi from the airport is around £10-15 and takes 15 minutes.

name: Double En Suite B&B Chorlton
summary: A beautiful, spacious double ensuite attic bedroom available in the vibrant and ever popular suburb of Chorlton cum Hardy. Just minutes walk from all the local bars restaurants and amenities, and on the doorstep of St Werburghs Road tram station!
space: Come stay in our gorgeous, light and spacious en suite attic bedroom. Amenities in the room include a private bathroom with shower, loo and sink (including shampoo, conditioner and shower gel, handy things to not have to pack!!) hairdryer, tea and coffee, desk/office area, and WiFi. There is also an iron and iron board set up for use in another room in the house should you need it.  The room will comfortably sleep two, and even more comfortably sleep one! We would be happy to accommodate families with children too, though we could probably only fit in a maximum of two, on fold out mattresses on the floor.
description: A beautiful, spacious double ensuite attic bedroom available in the vibrant and ever popular suburb of Chorlton cum Hardy. You can also make yourself welcome in the kitchen if you wish to prepare light meals, which you may take to your room, the dining room, or c
neighborhood_overview: Chorlton is a fantastic place to visit, even if the reason for your stay will be taking you elsewhere. It's a really vibrant place with loads going on, heaps of lovely bars, cafes and restaurants that cover most of the world with their culinary delights. You'll find lots of live music in the bars over the weekend, it's a good night out! There is the near by Chorlton Meadows and water park, which is a huge nature reserve with acres of woodlands and fields to explore, so bring your walking boots! Closer to home, a stones throw from the front door is Chorlton Park, with gardens, play areas, basket ball and tennis courts. I've also discovered that it is a perfect mile track around the perimeter which is great for keen runners!
notes: We have a one year old female border terrier called Judy! She is a lovely, friendly, well behaved, non-malting dog! Who does not spend time chilling in the attic room between visits, promise.
transit: The house is on the doorstep of St Werburghs Road tram stop, which will have you in Manchester Piccadilly in 10-15 mins. Alternatively, we are a five minute walk from Chorlton bus station, 15/20 minute taxi ride from the airport.

space: The house is perfectly sized for a family/group of 4 with 2 double bedrooms.  Happy to take an extra guest by making use of our comfortable sofa. There is plenty of space to cook and/ or relax in the open plan kitchen / lounge area downstairs, with home comforts and touches to make your stay feel like a home-from-home. Towels and bedding are provided so no need to worry about bringing your own. We have all the usual kitchen amenities included and available to use: double oven, microwave, kettle, toaster, smoothie maker etc, and a nespresso coffee machine (which we love!).  House also includes good wifi, Freeview TV (in living room and master bedroom) with Netflix access, DVD player and Wii console (great for children). We want our guests to be able to truly make theirselves at home, and welcome feedback if anything is missing or could be improved.

neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in West Didsbury - a beautiful, bustling area in South Manchester.   There are plenty of bars, cafes, parks and restaurants within a 10 minute walk, with even more to choose from in the surrounding areas such as Chorlton, Didsbury Village, Altrincham and Hale. It is also conveniently located to reach Manchester city centre, with 2 tram stops only a short walk away and quick tram journey to town. The tram line is also well connected to Old Trafford - a popular destination for Man Utd fans! For fitness fans: a new leisure centre has just recently been built nearby which includes large swimming pool, health suite, gym and classes - all of which can be booked pay as you go. Also for keen cyclists, we are lucky to have Transpenine Cycle Network and River Mersey on our doorstep, with many routes to choose from and explore.
notes: Note the house is lived in i.e. Not a full time holiday home, therefore our things will still be there, however we do ensure there is plenty of space. It's perhaps not hotel standard accommodation, but we take a real pride in our house with regular cleaning services between all guests to maintain high standards.
transit: We are closely situated between 2 tram stops with easy access into Manchester city centre. We're also 5 minute drive away from the motorway, making it easy to escape to the countryside and Greater Manchester area. And less than 10 minute drive to Manchester airport.

space: We have a great little apartment right in the heart of Manchester's Northern Quarter. Historically the home of Manchester's cotton industry, the area is now a wonderful mix of industrial warehouses and the city's coolest bars and restaurants!  /// We're currently looking to do a longer let from mid April for at least a month, or even a few months. We can't manage lets of just a few days at the moment I'm afraid. /// The apartment's a very attractive and modern one-bed, and with the addition of a really comfy sofa bed in the lounge can sleep four. Recently refurbished to more of a loft-style apartment, the kitchen, lounge and bedroom areas are new, with beautiful reclaimed pine flooring.  There's pretty much everything you should need - washer-dryer, wifi, very comfy double bed, wardrobe space, well-equipped kitchen and a nice little balcony for an evening drink with views of Manchester's famous Arndale Tower! We can provide bedding and towels.  *****************************************

host_about:
I am a 21 year old graduate that recently graduated from the Manchester Metropolitan University studying International Business and German. Myself and my girlfriend have this gorgeous apartment that has such potential and I feel as though it is going to waste, which is why I have decided to rent it out. 

I am a fun lovely, bubbly person that loves to meet new people and have a good time. Five things I cant live without would definitely be my car, my passport, my girlfriend, my family and definitely Franky & Benny's pizza!

I am out and about quite a lot so can definitely give you tips and advice when it comes to places to visit in the Manchester area. I hope that all guests are friendly, reliable and most importantly respectful as this is my apartment and I like to look after it.

All our guests will be expected to make themselves at home, we have a comfortable lounge, and a bright sunny kitchen with a breakfast table for you to help yourself to. neighborhood_overview: We're part of a brand new and exciting development close to the city, making it a great location for getting around. The ever growing city and its Northern Quarter are just 15-20 min walk away, we've included a few of our favourite places to eat and drink in our description, we also have the infamous Ethiad stadium around a 15 min walk away too!! We are also close to Manchester's gay village and were completely gay friendly! Also there are loads of galleries and libraries to check out, and of course plenty of shopping to be done!
transit: Our house is located within 20 mins walking distance to the city centre and manchester Piccadilly train station. There are buses and trams to take you into town if you'd prefer, maps will be in your room and we'll be happy to help with anything you need.
host_about:
Hi we are Clare and Hannah from Manchester, and we love our city!
Lived in the city a number of years so have a good knowledge of places see and things to do, so don't be afraid to ask for help/advice.
Huge fans of the ever growing Northern Quarter, and it's abundance of quirky/cool restaraunts and bars.
Also close to the Ethiad Football Stadium for those wanting to see a match whilst in the city.

name: Quirky & cool STUDIO apt NQ MCR (2)
summary: Part of a block of 14, with a mix of 2 bedroom apts & studios. We love having a whole building to ourselves, as we can accommodate *LARGER GROUPS* occupying a whole floor, or keep an area of the building quieter for business travelers and families.
space: Quirky and cool. A small and perfectly formed studio sleeping two on a sofa bed, with full kitchen, dining area, separate bathroom and super cool furnishings. In terms of the space, you will find a sophisticated open plan living area with eclectic pieces from our Agola range throughout the apartment. Including a dual purpose TV that doubles as a mirror! The kitchen has everything you need to cook up a storm and serve in style in our dining area. There is a luxury leather double sofa bed in the living room, perfect for counting those sheep. The modern bathroom features a jet shower with a bath tub, just waiting for bubble bath. This pad is part of a block of 14, with a mix of two bedroom apartments and studios.  We love having a whole building to ourselves, as we can accommodate larger groups occupying a whole floor, or keep an area of the building quieter for business travellers and families.  For larger groups who want to share a floor please also take a look at apartment 1 and 3. The

neighborhood_overview: This apartment is on one of the coolest streets in the vibrant and exciting community that is the Northern Quarter.  The Northern Quarter is famed for its independent shops and boutiques, where you can pick up designer or retro clothes, rare  vinyl's, collectable comics, unusual furniture and superb art.  Today it is equally famed for its social scene, with the beautiful restaurants, cool bars, quirky coffee shops and city spas, pulling many young professionals to live in the beautiful old buildings that line the streets. The joy of the Northern Quarter is that it provides a central base to explore the whole of the city and beyond.   You will find lots of shops and the central hub of shopping in the Arndale centre. Or if you are after something a bit more unconventional, check out Afflecks Palace an “emporium of eclecticism" which is a 5 minute walk away. For designer shops head to Selfridges, Harvey Nichols or Spinningfields. Here are a few of our favourite places in the city -  To ea
notes: Parking. There are 2 car parks in very close proximity and several more you can freely choose.  There is a car park on Tib Street, which is about a 5 minute walk away. There is also a large multi storey car park on Church Street also about a 5 minute walk away. Although depending on what your plans are if you are driving around Manchester get in touch and we will do our best to help with suggestions.
transit: The apartment is super close to all of the major transport links. It takes 14 minutes to walk from Manchester Piccadilly, an easy walk, unless you have heavy luggage and need to jump in a cab. Free bus service – Outside Piccadilly Station on Station Approach is the bus stops for all the free city centre buses. They cover a huge area, they are reliable and regular and best of all they are free, so use them!  Buses – Buses can be caught from Piccadilly gardens.  Tram – Trams can also be caught from Piccadilly gardens.  Taxis – 5 minutes away just outside a large department store called Debenhams is a  taxi rank allowing you to get out and about quickly if you're in a rush, or to prevent a drenching in the rain if heading to another part of town.  Manchester is not a big place and you can walk to the other side of the City in 20mins, unless taking a leisurely pace, which can be quicker than a cab in rush hour.  The Trafford Centre – Hop on the X50 bus from Piccadilly Gardens. Etihad Stadi
host_about:
Mummy of two little boys - my husband and I remember the days we travelled far and wide before they arrived. With airbnb we can do it once again, with them too of course. 
Dream regularly of travelling around the world with a credit card, an iPad, my beautiful family and the airbnb app and just making it up as we go along.... one day!!

name: Stunning Tobacco Factory City Apt
summary: Welcome to the listing of our high spec 2 double bedroom, 1000 square foot New York style apartment.  Just 2 minutes walk from the hustle and bustle of the Norther Quarter, this stunning conversion is perfectly located to city centre amenities.
space: The Tobacco Factory was built in the 1800s and converted into apartments in the late 1990s. There is a beautiful leafy park called Angel Meadow just opposite the flat which is perfect for sun bathing, a BBQ or a light stroll for some fresh air. With a bright and airy feel thanks to the 3m ceilings and the largest windows you will have seen in a city centre dwelling, the apartment offers the luxury of a modern apartment with the alluring features of a period building. The master bedroom boasts a Super King Sized bed with luxury pocket sprung mattress and en suite bathroom. The furniture in this room is made from solid teak that was salvaged and recycled from an Indonesian jetty.  The second bedroom has a comfy double bed, plenty of draw space and a large double breasted pine wardrobe to put plenty of clothes in. All bed linen is fresh and plenty of towels are included for your stay. The place has super fast broadband so should you wish to work from the apartment or simply browse of an e

Just 2 minutes walk from the hustle and bustle of the Norther Quarter, this stunning conversion is perfectly located to city centre amenities. The Tobacco Factory was built in the 1800s and converted into apartments in the late 1990s. neighborhood_overview: The flat is located in a nice part of town with the perfect balance of convenience of location and quietness. You can be in town shopping in the Manchester Arndale Centre or supping a delicious cafe machiato in a bar in the Norther Quarter within a few minutes walk. Trof is a popular hangout with its bearded bar staff serving up some delightful refreshments and their Royal Breakfast is a must try if you like a challenge. The surrounding area has just undergone huge regeneration work with the building of the landmark Coop European Headquarters - this is literally at the end of our road and is quite something to behold as a piece of engineering design work.
transit: Transport is all around you: A short walk into town if you are able bodied or if not you can hale a cab and be back at the flat within a couple of minutes. The tram network has undergone huge expansion just recently so you can get from shudehill tram stop to just about anywhere in Manchester should you wish to. The Phones 4 U(Previously MEN) arena is a short walk away so the apartment is conveniently located for any gigs you might have tickets for. Manchester is steeped in heritage and the apartment offers the perfect base for you to go explore the galleries, museums, cafes and restaurants. Equally, the flat is a nice place to be in itself. It has a nice aura my partner says :D
host_about:
Hello!

We're an early 30s couple in Manchester who love the city and all it has to offer both culturally and for a tipple on a friday night.

We have owned our apartment for 8 years and have only recently listed it on AirBnB but we're already enjoying the social aspect of having people come and stay. We really take pride in people having a nice experience when they come to visit the city!

Aside from this, we both enjoy yoga and host retreats over in Ibiza now and then with our company called Retreat My Soul. We're also lovers of interiors and very much enjoy popping off to other AirBnB properties around the country / world to soak up some unfamiliar territory and see what experiences we can get involved with.

As a host you will find us extremely helpful, willing to ensure your stay in our home is as good as it can be.

As guests you will find us respectful and with a smile on our faces - we just came back from tenerife just yesterday where we enjoyed a fabulous stay in an AirBnB apartment in Playa Paraiso.

name: The Captain - Boatique Boating
summary: The Captain is a home from home, a luxury city centre boat that will cater for your every whim.  Beautifully designed by  Will Trickett this is not your average canal boat!
space: The boat is officially a wide beam narrow boat - meaning it is the same shape as a canal boat but double the width, giving you space to stretch and spaces to play hide and seek.  The boat is pretty unique and the perfect place for families, couples and friends to stay over whilst also being pretty perfect for business too.   It is a cosy sanctuary minutes away from the city bustle in the heart of Cottonopolis.  It is a unique boatique experience and one which have you going home and packing it all in to come and join the river rats.
description: The Captain is a home from home, a luxury city centre boat that will cater for your every whim.  Beautifully designed by  Will Trickett this is not your average canal boat! The boat is officially a wide beam narrow boat - meaning it is the same shape as a canal boat but double the width, giving you space to stretch and spaces to play hide and seek.  The boat is pretty unique and the perfect place for families, couples and friends to stay over whilst also being pretty perfect for business too.   It is a cosy sanctuary minutes away from the city bustle in the heart of Cottonopolis.  It is a unique boatique experience and one which have you going home and packing it all in to come and join the river rats. Guests can treat themselves to a long hot bath or fire up the Aga to enjoy a cosy evening in. They are welcome to use the boat as their own and all fresh laundry will be provided plus a bottle of wine on arrival.  The boat is moored 10 minutes from the Northern Quarter and has marina fac
neighborhood_overview: Ancoats is awesome! take yourself over to taste the finest pizza in the city at Rudy's or get a ticket to see the Halle performing just across the marina.  Pop into the city - only 5 minute walk away to The Northern Quarter and a skip and jump to Piccadilly. Manchester is an ace city with loads of museums, exhibitions, concerts and shows, please do ask us any questions and we will help arrange your stay.
notes: The boat is moored on a beautiful spot looking out over New Islington Marina. There are few things to note... 1. the loo is not a normal loo so NEVER EVER throw wipes, sanitary or any thing but... down it. You will be charged for a call out plumber to fix it if this happens.  2. The boat functions just like a house, with the odd tick - please look at the Captains manual we have made for you and this should answer all your questions - if not then give me a call and I can tell you all.
transit: Piccadilly is 600 m away New Islington Tram station in 100 m  Uber arrives in minutes Everywhere is walkable
host_about: I make films and ride waves.  We love our boat nearly as much as we love our baby. Being a host is ace, I can welcome people to stay on board the most unique boat on the canals and it gives me an excuse to get away at weekends.

name: Stunning 1 bedroom apartment
summary: Stunning 1 bedroom apartment in the heart of Manchesters vibrant Northern Quarter. The property is set to a high standard and comprises of: hallway, living room with open kitchen complete with white goods, double bedroom and bathroom with shower.
description: Stunning 1 bedroom apartment in the heart of Manchesters vibrant Northern Quarter. The property is set to a high standard and comprises of: hallway, living room with open kitchen complete with white goods, double bedroom and bathroom with shower. The Northern Quarter has quickly become the most popular place to go for a night out with some of Manchester's best independent bars and traditional pubs to be found here. Located around the revamped High Street and the 'original Northern Quarter' on Oldham Street, it's next to both the Arndale Centre and Piccadilly Gardens, and is named after the M4 postcode where it sits. The Northern Quarter has always been famed for it's emporiums and independent shops, selling all sorts of weird and wonderful products, from retro clothing and rare vinyl, and collectable comics, to unusual furniture and superb art. Today it is equally famed for its nightlife and is the most vibrant area of Manchester, with many young professionals living in the Northern Qu
neighborhood_overview: The Northern Quarter has quickly become the most popular place to go for a night out with some of Manchester's best independent bars and traditional pubs to be found here. Located around the revamped High Street and the 'original Northern Quarter' on Oldham Street, it's next to both the Arndale Centre and Piccadilly Gardens, and is named after the M4 postcode where it sits. The Northern Quarter has always been famed for it's emporiums and independent shops, selling all sorts of weird and wonderful products, from retro clothing and rare vinyl, and collectable comics, to unusual furniture and superb art. Today it is equally famed for its nightlife and is the most vibrant area of Manchester, with many young professionals living in the Northern Quarter's flats. There's a whole host of privately owned coffee shops, bars and pubs in the Northern Quarter, with new establishments seemingly opening up on a monthly basis, each offering a fine array of coffee/ cake, foreign beers, local brewed ca
transit: Located close to the main shopping area, there is a constant supply of buses and easy access to the tram. Both Piccadilly Train station and Bus Station are only a short walk away. By car the ring road is easily accessible linking to the M56 and Manchester International Airport.

name: Luxury City Centre Apartment
summary: Gorgeous corner aspect two bedroom apartment located a stones throw away from City Centre, Arndale, MEN, NQ and Victoria train station.  Includes all mod cons (Purified H/C drinking water, coffee machine,Home Cinema, Sky TV sports and movies, Internet and gym) Free parking for 1 car.
space: Having lived in it myself for over 4 years, i can first handedly say the apartment is as good as it gets living in the hustle and bustle of the city centre. neighborhood_overview: The Northern Quarter is an area of Manchester city centre, England. It was an invention of the 1990s, defined and named as part of the regeneration and gentrification of Manchester. A centre of alternative and bohemian culture, is popular today for its numerous bars and cafes, as well as its mix of music and clothes shops. Amongst these is Affleck's Palace, a former department store which has been turned into a multi-storey bazaar for alternative clothing and nick-nacks.
transit: Less than 10 min away from the apartment, you will find a tram stop, plenty of buses around the area even after midnight and Piccadilly Train Station, where you can reach by train every corner of the country.

neighborhood_overview: This apartment is on one of the coolest streets in the vibrant and exciting community that is the Northern Quarter.  The Northern Quarter is famed for its independent shops and boutiques, where you can pick up designer or retro clothes, rare  vinyl's, collectable comics, unusual furniture and superb art.  Today it is equally famed for its social scene, with the beautiful restaurants, cool bars, quirky coffee shops and city spas, pulling many young professionals to live in the beautiful old buildings that line the streets. The joy of the Northern Quarter is that it provides a central base to explore the whole of the city and beyond.   You will find lots of shops and the central hub of shopping in the Arndale centre. Or if you are after something a bit more unconventional, check out Afflecks Palace an “emporium of eclecticism" which is a 5 minute walk away. For designer shops head to Selfridges, Harvey Nichols or Spinningfields. Here are a few of our favourite places in the city -  To ea
notes: Parking. There are 2 car parks in very close proximity and several more you can freely choose.  There is a car park on Tib Street, which is about a 5 minute walk away. There is also a large multi storey car park on Church Street also about a 5 minute walk away. Although depending on what your plans are if you are driving around Manchester get in touch and we will do our best to help with suggestions.
transit: The apartment is super close to all of the major transport links. It takes 14 minutes to walk from Manchester Piccadilly, an easy walk, unless you have heavy luggage and need to jump in a cab. Free bus service – Outside Piccadilly Station on Station Approach is the bus stops for all the free city centre buses. They cover a huge area, they are reliable and regular and best of all they are free, so use them!  Buses – Buses can be caught from Piccadilly gardens.  Tram – Trams can also be caught from Piccadilly gardens.  Taxis – 5 minutes away just outside a large department store called Debenhams is a  taxi rank allowing you to get out and about quickly if you're in a rush, or to prevent a drenching in the rain if heading to another part of town.  Manchester is not a big place and you can walk to the other side of the City in 20mins, unless taking a leisurely pace, which can be quicker than a cab in rush hour.  The Trafford Centre – Hop on the X50 bus from Piccadilly Gardens. Etihad Stadi
host_about:
Mummy of two little boys - my husband and I remember the days we travelled far and wide before they arrived. With airbnb we can do it once again, with them too of course. 
Dream regularly of travelling around the world with a credit card, an iPad, my beautiful family and the airbnb app and just making it up as we go along.... one day!!

name: New Large Luxury Central Apartment
summary: A new large apartment with a high quality, modern finish. Located in the city centre Northern Quarter & 5min walk from Piccadilly Gardens this is perfect for a stay in the city. Very quiet & secure with a range of free amenities. Feel free to ask Qs
space: New, large 600sq ft apartment finished to a luxury standard and located just a stones through away from the northern quarter, and a 5 minute walk from Piccadilly Gardens / market street. The property is secure / quiet and is a great place to relax if you are looking for a good rest or work.  •There's a shop very close to the apartment where you can buy food, alcohol, cooking ingredients and most other things you will need. •Free unlimited wi-fi internet use. •You will have the whole apartment to yourself, it is not shared with anyone else. •You will have your own set of keys so you can come in and out whatever times you like. •You are welcome to use the whole kitchen, fridge, washer and dryer. •All kitchen utensils and cutlery provided so you can cook and eat as comfortably as if you were at home. •Fresh towels provided. •The bathroom has a bath and a shower, with plenty of hot water all day. •I can also advise you on all things Manchester. I can also help you with directions, travel,
description: A new large apartment with a high quality, modern finish. Located in the city centre Northern Quarter & 5min walk from Piccadilly Gardens this is perfect for a stay in the city. Very quiet & secure with a range of free amenities. Feel free to ask Qs New, large 600sq ft apartment finished to a luxury standard and located just a stones through away from the northern quarter, and a 5 minute walk from Piccadilly Gardens / market street. The property is secure / quiet and is a great place to relax if you are looking for a good rest or work.  •There's a shop very close to the apartment where you can buy food, alcohol, cooking ingredients and most other things you will need. •Free unlimited wi-fi internet use. •You will have the whole apartment to yourself, it is not shared with anyone else. •You will have your own set of keys so you can come in and out whatever times you like. •You are welcome to use the whole kitchen, fridge, washer and dryer. •All kitchen utensils and cutlery provided so y
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is literally across the road from the Northern Quarter - being able to enjoy the NQ at such close proximity but be in a brand new property is unique. Piccadilly Gardens/Market Street is a 5 minute walk away and piccadilly train station is less than a 10min walk. You can access anywhere in the city centre within walking distance as Manchester is quite compact. Taxi's are cheap in Manchester and is an easy option
notes: I receive a lot of questions regarding the security deposit - This is a safety feature put in place by Air BnB for any damages, the policy works the same way as hotels and is only needed to pay if requested. You do not need to pay it upfront. I am yet to have to utilise this facility.
transit: Due to the central location, everything is close - there is usually no need for public transport but if necessary, taxis to even the other side of the city centre are only cheap and there is a tram stop and main bus hub 5mins away.
host_about:
After moving to Manchester from Sheffield to study at university, I fell in love with the city and secured a city centre job post graduation. I recently purchased a new city centre apartment that I live in the majority of the time.

I enjoy all sports, and spend my free time at the gym or out and about the city bars, restaurants and nightclubs with my mates. I love going to festivals and travelling when possible.

name: City Centre Duplex Apartment
summary: Located just a 7 minute walk from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private Apartment in Manchester City Centre's vibrant Northern Quarter neighbourhood.
space: Built in the early 1910's, the building is the former Royal Mail Post Office for Manchester City Centre which was converted to spacious apartments with a unique outdoor Japanese garden area.
description: Located just a 7 minute walk from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private Apartment in Manchester City Centre's vibrant Northern Quarter neighbourhood. Built in the early 1910's, the building is the former Royal Mail Post Office for Manchester City Centre which was converted to spacious apartments with a unique outdoor Japanese garden area. The whole apartment is yours to enjoy, so make yourself at home and feel free to use the... Tea, coffee & milk Chocolate goodies Cooking ingredients (that are available) Ice cubes DVDs Soap, shower gel & shampoo  Towels Washing powder & dishwasher tablets Whether your stay is for business of pleasure, I want you to have the best experience possible! BEFORE YOU ARRIVE... Tell me the purpose of your trip (Birthday, Wedding, Concert, Theatre, Football, Shopping, Conference, Meeting or Airport Transfer etc) and i'll do whatever I can to 'Make It Happen' for you! DURING YOUR STAY... You'll be met upon arri
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in Manchester City Centre's cool and trendy NORTHERN QUARTER, which is a mix of independent cafes, restaurants, bars, tea rooms, boutique shops and small businesses selling unique items.   The Northern Quarter has previously been described as "a centre of alternative and bohemian culture" which is fitting!
notes: BEDS... The apartment contains ONE king size bed and ONE double size sofa bed.  A sofa bed is not the same as a double bed, so if you and your fellow traveler(s) intend to sleep on the sofa bed, please be prepared for that!  (Have a good look at every photograph before you book to avoid any disappointment when you arrive) HOTEL STANDARDS... All bed linen and towels are professionally washed and ironed by a national laundry company, so you can look forward to a hotel standard when you arrive!
transit: WALK... It Is possible to walk to all parts of Manchester City Centre within 15 minutes.  Its a concentrated place with lots of things to do within a very short walk! FREE SHUTTLE BUS... Metroshuttles are free buses linking the main rail stations, car parks, shopping areas and businesses in Manchester city centre. Metroshuttle buses run from Piccadilly, Salford Central, Victoria, Oxford Road and Deansgate rail stations. There are three circular routes covering the main areas in the city centre. TRAM... Metrolink is a light rail tram system that covers Greater Manchester.  The network consists of six lines which provide access from Manchester City Centre and along routes to Altrincham, Ashton-under-Lyne, Bury, Didsbury, Eccles, and Rochdale. DRIVING... You'll be staying in the M1 post code of Manchester City Centre - it doesn't get any more central than this!  If you can, leave the car at home and use public transport as parking will cost you either £10 or £20 per night depending on whi
host_about:
I am a Creative and work on various projects in Photography, Brand Development & Marketing to name a few.

My interests include... Photography, Travel, the Sea, Friends, Family, Design, Nature, Ideas, Culture, Tech, Food, Coffee, Music & Autobiographies.

I love to travel whenever I can as the stimulus of meeting new people, discovering new places and seeing different ways of life excites me (and keeps me young at heart).

I believe and follow the mottos "make it happen" and "the world is run by those who turn up."

name: Private room in Northern Quarter
summary: Private and comfortable bedroom in a secure and quiet apartment on fifth floor (has a lift!) in the heart of the Northern Quarter. Great location for the bars and cafes in the NQ and good access to train and bus stations.
space: Flat is super light and airy with floor-to-ceiling glass on both sides of the lounge area, with a south-facing terrace which gets sunshine all day round.  It's set slightly higher than the surrounding buildings and so is not overlooked. There is only one other flat on the floor: hence no noise from neighbours bouncing around! The bedroom has a brand-new kingsize bed with new mattress, topper and super nice bedding. There is a fitted triple wardrobe with plenty of space for luggage.  Also a small desk with lamp and stool.
description: Private and comfortable bedroom in a secure and quiet apartment on fifth floor (has a lift!) in the heart of the Northern Quarter. Great location for the bars and cafes in the NQ and good access to train and bus stations. Flat is super light and airy with floor-to-ceiling glass on both sides of the lounge area, with a south-facing terrace which gets sunshine all day round.  It's set slightly higher than the surrounding buildings and so is not overlooked. There is only one other flat on the floor: hence no noise from neighbours bouncing around! The bedroom has a brand-new kingsize bed with new mattress, topper and super nice bedding. There is a fitted triple wardrobe with plenty of space for luggage.  Also a small desk with lamp and stool. Superfast fibre wifi. Sky & Apple TV.  Bose wifi music system. Shared large bathroom with shower in bath, large private cabinet for toiletries. Fresh set of hotel standard towels supplied.  Large well-equipped kitchen with fridge, freezer, double oven
neighborhood_overview: It's the Northern Quarter! The bars, cafes and restaurants make it a great little neighbourhood. From my favourite pizza at Slice to coffee at Fig & Sparrow, it's all there.  It has a great buzz and general feeling of creativity and there's always something interesting happening.
transit: The flat is 1 minute from Shudehill bus station and 10-15 minutes walk from Piccadilly train station. Parking is not included, however there are two NCP car parks within a couple of minutes walk.
host_about:
I am a professional who has worked and travelled extensively in the US and Europe. I now work for the family business, based in Manchester, whilst still maintaining some property as the owner and landlord. 

I love seeing new places, experiencing new things, especially anything food, art, or history related. 

I like to travel in comfort and have a relaxed setting with good access to interesting things to do in the daytime and evening.

My twin sister rents space on airbnb and I've met quite a few guests of hers - some of whom have been super nice people and this has convinced me to try it out!

Quiet residential purpose built 1 bed apartment with off road parking is the perfe
neighborhood_overview: Quiet residential purpose built 1 bed apartment with off road parking is the perfect location for visiting sports events & venues at the nearby Sport City, the Etihad stadium, Manchester City training Academy or the Veldrome. No car is required, the flat is accessible by bus, Metrotram or taxicab its approx 2.5 miles away from the city centre. Manchester is a really great city, there's plenty of places to dine & wine, fabulous theatres on par with London's West End, shopping galore & some top class museums & gallery's.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in Manchester City Centre's cool and trendy NORTHERN QUARTER, which is a mix of independent cafes, restaurants, bars, tea rooms, boutique shops and small businesses selling unique items.   The Northern Quarter has previously been described as "a centre of alternative and bohemian culture" which is fitting!
notes: HOTEL STANDARDS... All bed linen and towels are professionally washed and ironed by a national laundry company, so you can look forward to a hotel standard when you arrive!
transit: WALK... It Is possible to walk to all parts of Manchester City Centre within 15 minutes.  Its a concentrated place with lots of things to do within a very short walk! FREE SHUTTLE BUS... Metroshuttles are free buses linking the main rail stations, car parks, shopping areas and businesses in Manchester city centre. Metroshuttle buses run from Piccadilly, Salford Central, Victoria, Oxford Road and Deansgate rail stations. There are three circular routes covering the main areas in the city centre. TRAM... Metrolink is a light rail tram system that covers Greater Manchester.  The network consists of six lines which provide access from Manchester City Centre and along routes to Altrincham, Ashton-under-Lyne, Bury, Didsbury, Eccles, and Rochdale. DRIVING... You'll be staying in the M1 post code of Manchester City Centre - it doesn't get any more central than this!  If you can, leave the car at home and use public transport as parking will cost you either £10 or £20 per night depending on whi

I love to travel whenever I can as the stimulus of meeting new people, discovering new places and seeing different ways of life excites me (and keeps me young at heart).

I believe and follow the mottos "make it happen" and "the world is run by those who turn up."

neighborhood_overview: The Northern quarter is a vibrant and eclectic place to live with an abundance of cafe's, bars and galleries the area always has a new place to discover. galleries nearby. There's fantastic shopping opportunities with Manchesters iconic Afflecks Palace at the bottom of the road and the apartment is situated just a 2 minute walk from the Arndale Shopping Centre and the National Football Museum.
notes: The apartment is very central in the Northern Quarter and has the added bonus of being quiet in the evenings (even on busy Friday and Saturday nights) so you're sure to have a good nights sleep.
transit: There are lots of transport options around the immediate area with bus connections to the outskirts of the city and Shudehill Metrolink at the end of the street which gives convenient connections to Manchester City and Manchester Utd football grounds.
host_about:
I am a freelancer working in the entertainment industry and aspiring writer, I love Manchester and found many an inspiration from the City. Returning to live here after some years away I've moved to a completely new area and have made some great friends here. I love meeting new people and have enjoyed hosting with my ex partner in my apartment for which we received some fantastic reviews since I pride myself on guests having a lovely stay.

I have a few passions, such as climbing, cooking and watching films. I spend time going to comedy gigs and the theatre or walking in the countryside. I enjoy peoples company when they have visited my place in the past and have prepared meals for a few of the guests while they were visiting, as a kind of culinary cultural exchange! I used to co host on this site but since we have gone our separate ways I have set up my own profile. This should give you some idea of what to expect room wise and certainly reviews too.

I'm very relaxed and happy to leave people to their own devices should that be what you want and excited to meet all the guests I will hopefully host. I'm more than happy to offer advice on the nice places to eat and hidden gems of Manchester that very few tourists see or hear about as local knowledge goes a long way! Always happy to help make your stay here as pleasant as possible so feel free to ask me anything, including if discounts are available for longer stays ;)

Jac

We sometimes hold parties to invite our friends from abroad, and you will be more than welcome to join us and get to know interesting, well-educated people. You will have your own room, which has a spacious, queen-size bed, a small closet for your clothes, and an ergonomic armchair for you to use when working. Howe

You are, truly, in the centre of everything!
notes: We have a spacious, 2 bedroom apartment on. Please note you might be either with us living in the apartment or with other guests staying in the other bedroom.
transit: We are 5-7 minutes walk from Manchester Piccadily -- it is so close the taxi driver will refuse to take you. There are free shuttle buses at Piccadily, where you can take to get around the city. 10 minutes from our place is the Central Tram and Metro stations, which you can take if you need to go further the city centre. Taxis and Uber are available upon request.

name: Modern & chic city-centre apartment
summary: Location, Location, Location! A fabulous, city-centre apartment, very close to Manchester Piccadilly Station, and just a 15 minute walk from the trendy Northern Quarter with its many bars, restaurants and independent shops.
space: A spacious, double room in a modern and light apartment perfect for single travellers or couples. With superb access to the city-centre, it's just a 10 to 15 minute walk into town.  There is a tram (Metrolink) stop just outside the building which is super handy for getting all over Manchester and the neighbouring suburbs, and great for getting home after a night out!   The apartment is on the 6th floor (there's a lift!), with wonderful views of Manchester and beyond, especially at night when all the lights are twinkling!  The sunsets are also amazing and definitely worth seeing.  There is a generous balcony which is perfect for eating breakfast on warmer days, or for a glass of something in the evening! The apartment is next to the canal which is perfect for a calm and peaceful walk (into town or in the opposite direction), away from all the hustle and bustle!
description: Location, Location, Location! A fabulous, city-centre apartment, very close to Manchester Piccadilly Station, and just a 15 minute walk from the trendy Northern Quarter with its many bars, restaurants and independent shops. A spacious, double room in a modern and light apartment perfect for single travellers or couples. With superb access to the city-centre, it's just a 10 to 15 minute walk into town.  There is a tram (Metrolink) stop just outside the building which is super handy for getting all over Manchester and the neighbouring suburbs, and great for getting home after a night out!   The apartment is on the 6th floor (there's a lift!), with wonderful views of Manchester and beyond, especially at night when all the lights are twinkling!  The sunsets are also amazing and definitely worth seeing.  There is a generous balcony which is perfect for eating breakfast on warmer days, or for a glass of something in the evening! The apartment is next to the canal which is perfect for a calm
neighborhood_overview: Whether you're a shopper, foodie, museum-goer, theatre-lover, or you just want to experience the brilliant social scene in Manchester, the location could not be better.  The big, beating heart of Manchester is just minutes away! The area is architecturally and historically interesting with lots of converted mills from Manchester's industrial boom times.  And Ancoats was once famous for its hat-making; the building sits on the site of a former hat box factory, hence the name Milliners Wharf! If you're heading to the Etihad Stadium for a concert it's just a short walk along the canal.  You can avoid busy trams (they get packed when there is a concert on) or expensive taxis and walk there at your leisure!
notes: There is an iron and ironing board if you need it, as well as a hairdryer. I provide towels and toiletries for all guests. I have WiFi which guests can log into. There is an on-site concierge and the building is secure and gated.  You will have your own set of keys during your stay so you are able to come and go as you please.
transit: Manchester Piccadilly station is just a 10 to 15 minute walk away, or one stop on the tram.  It's the main railway station in Manchester and can take you to any location locally or further afield.  There is a tram stop next to the building which takes you into the city centre and beyond.  To get to the apartment by tram you will need the Ashton line; the stop is New Islington. The apartment is easily accessible by train and, if you are flying, there are frequent trains from Manchester Airport which take about 15 to 20 minutes.  There is a 24-hour car park (£2 for up to 24 hours) if you are travelling by car. If you have any questions about reaching the apartment please do ask.
host_about:
After a great Airbnb experience as a guest in Valencia, I decided to try it myself as a host.  I love that there's always someone different to stay, people travelling from all over the world, all with a story to tell!

I love exploring and experiencing new places and am always grateful for recommendations on places to see/ eat/ drink from locals! I try to do the same for my guests; if guests need recommendations I always try and suggest somewhere I think they'd like, based on what they've told me.  It makes me feel a bit like a tourist in my own city, and definitely makes me appreciate Manchester more!

host_about: I have a base in Manchester, where I work in recruitment during the week, but my partner Tom and I have our home in Nottingham where he works in sustainability for a power company. I really enjoy my garden, particularly veg growing. I always have a book on the go, see lots of theatre and not enough film and am a regular runner. We both enjoy travel to islands and have visited nearly all of the Hebridean Islands and been to the Isles of Scilly over a number of years. It's now time to travel to islands beyond the UK.

name: Central Northern Quarter Loft
summary: With vaulted ceilings over 15ft high, large wooden beams, exposed brickwork, fire place feature, design lighting and modern touches throughout, our Loft provides a relaxing and calm environment in the heart of Manchester's Northern Quarter.
space: Smithfield Buildings formerly known as Affleck and Brown was a destination Drapers and Furnishing House where the upper crusts shopped for bespoke garments. With a reputation for quality it became known as the Harrod's of the North. Located in the heart of the Northern Quarter, this iconic building has lost none of its historic charm. When approaching the Smithfield you will notice its character enhanced by independent shops, coffee houses, restaurants and bars which surround it. On entrance you will notice the large wooden door and staircase leading to a relaxing courtyard. Our loft is located on the top floor with views across the city. The loft itself is large, spacious and open plan. With two double bedrooms (one accessed by ladder, hence the nickname The Tree House) it is ideal for two people but will comfortably accommodate four.

host_about:
My wife and I have lived in Manchester's Northern Quarter for 5 years now and love the vibrancy and variety it offers. There are lots of places to eat, drink, grab a coffee and relax, and with a wealth of music venues, independent shops and vintage bargains on offer, there really is something for everyone! 

We are offering our apartment out to rent as we have recently had a baby and open plan living and babies are not the best mix sadly. We decided on air BnB as we are a big fan of the network, having used it to book accommodation around the world, including California, Paris and Budapest. 

We hope you will enjoy staying at our loft style apartment as much as we have enjoyed living there.

name: Simple Home Sleeps 5 by Velodrome
summary: A clean home within 3 minutes walk to velodrome, Etihad stadium, metro link, bus stop and 24 hour ASDA supermarket. Offering quiet nights sleep only 15 minutes away from the city, a perfect stay for groups and families to enjoy Manchester.
space: We recently refurbished the entire house from an old, unloved shell, it is airy, bright and cosy. There is no TV, probably never will be, plenty of books and magazines, but we find human companions are still the best.
description: A clean home within 3 minutes walk to velodrome, Etihad stadium, metro link, bus stop and 24 hour ASDA supermarket. Offering quiet nights sleep only 15 minutes away from the city, a perfect stay for groups and families to enjoy Manchester. We recently refurbished the entire house from an old, unloved shell, it is airy, bright and cosy. There is no TV, probably never will be, plenty of books and magazines, but we find human companions are still the best. You are home away from home, so feel free to enjoy every part of the house. As much as I'd love to greet you in person and show you around, some times work commitments get in the way. But I'm always a phone call away, and happy to answer all your house or Manchester related enquiries. The area consists predominately working class families, everyone attends to their own businesses. You are free to come and go, there is no nosy neighbours sniffing around. 24 hour ASDA supermarket is less than 5 minutes walk away, so is velodrome and Natio
neighborhood_overview: The area consists predominately working class families, everyone attends to their own businesses. You are free to come and go, there is no nosy neighbours sniffing around. 24 hour ASDA supermarket is less than 5 minutes walk away, so is velodrome and National BMX Centre. Another 2 minutes walk you will find Etihad Stadium and Manchester City Football Academy.
notes: You may notice the boarded up houses opposite the house, simply blame Manchester council's lack of decision and initiative to turn them into homes for those in need. They have been left empty for years, despite the appearances, they pose no harm in anyway.
transit: Public transport: Metro Link (Velopark stop) and bus stops are 3 minutes walk away, takes you to city centre, Media City, Piccadilly railway station, just about anywhere you want to go in Manchester.  Taxi: pre-booked taxi from Piccadilly train station to the house costs approx £6.50; from Manchester airport to the house costs around £22 fixed fare. Hackney cabs may cost more.
host_about: We caught Airbnb bug during our travels, now we are offering the same experiences to fellow travellers!

name: Wonderfully walnut 2 bed NQ MCR (3)
summary: Part of a block of 14, with a mix of 2 bedroom apts & studios.  We love having a whole building to ourselves, as we can accommodate *LARGER GROUPS* occupying a whole floor, or keep an area of the building quieter for business travelers and families.
space: Wonderfully walnut.  A beautiful two bedroom apartment, with two bathrooms and a sofa bed in the lounge, sleeping up to 6 people.    In terms of the space, our light and bright open plan living area benefits from a plush sofa bed. Accented by our Morton range, and an awesome aviator lamp. The kitchen is ready for you to wine and dine, with the bonus of having a dining area. The master bedroom will ensure you get a great night's sleep on our snug double bed. There is lots of handy built in storage and of course an en-suite. The main bathroom features a jet shower and bath tub combo. The second bedroom has twin beds, with the option to be turned into a double bed if required, and plenty of integrated storage. This pad is part of a block of 14, with a mix of two bedroom apartments and studios.  We love having a whole building to ourselves, as we can accommodate larger groups occupying a whole floor, or keep an area of the building quieter for business travellers and families.  For larger

In terms of the space, our light and bright open plan living area benefits from a plush sofa bed. Accented by our Morton range, and an awesome aviator lamp. The second bedroom has twin beds, with the option to be turned into a double bed if required, and plenty of integrated storage. This pad is part of a block of 14
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is on one of the coolest streets in the vibrant and exciting community that is the Northern Quarter.  The Northern Quarter is famed for its independent shops and boutiques, where you can pick up designer or retro clothes, rare  vinyl's, collectable comics, unusual furniture and superb art.  Today it is equally famed for its social scene, with the beautiful restaurants, cool bars, quirky coffee shops and city spas, pulling many young professionals to live in the beautiful old buildings that line the streets. The joy of the Northern Quarter is that it provides a central base to explore the whole of the city and beyond.   You will find lots of shops and the central hub of shopping in the Arndale centre. Or if you are after something a bit more unconventional, check out Afflecks Palace an “emporium of eclecticism" which is a 5 minute walk away. For designer shops head to Selfridges, Harvey Nichols or Spinningfields. Here are a few of our favourite places in the city -  To ea
notes: Parking. There are 2 car parks in very close proximity and several more you can freely choose.  There is a car park on Tib Street, which is about a 5 minute walk away. There is also a large multi storey car park on Church Street also about a 5 minute walk away. Although depending on what your plans are if you are driving around Manchester get in touch and we will do our best to help with suggestions.
transit: The apartment is super close to all of the major transport links. It takes 14 minutes to walk from Manchester Piccadilly, an easy walk, unless you have heavy luggage and need to jump in a cab. Free bus service – Outside Piccadilly Station on Station Approach is the bus stops for all the free city centre buses. They cover a huge area, they are reliable and regular and best of all they are free, so use them!  Buses – Buses can be caught from Piccadilly gardens.  Tram – Trams can also be caught from Piccadilly gardens.  Taxis – 5 minutes away just outside a large department store called Debenhams is a  taxi rank allowing you to get out and about quickly if you're in a rush, or to prevent a drenching in the rain if heading to another part of town.  Manchester is not a big place and you can walk to the other side of the City in 20mins, unless taking a leisurely pace, which can be quicker than a cab in rush hour.  The Trafford Centre – Hop on the X50 bus from Piccadilly Gardens. Etihad Stadi
host_about:
Mummy of two little boys - my husband and I remember the days we travelled far and wide before they arrived. With airbnb we can do it once again, with them too of course. 
Dream regularly of travelling around the world with a credit card, an iPad, my beautiful family and the airbnb app and just making it up as we go along.... one day!!

space: Complete with unique artwork and finished in a clean, contemporary fashion (though music lovers will enjoy the original 1950's gramophone!), it won't take long to settle in and be ready for your day / night in the city. name: A perfect Home away from home
summary: A perfect relaxing place whether on holiday, business or just passing through Manchester .You  will never regret staying here. Very homely, welcoming and above all you will enjoy a good nights sleep.
space: A well maintained self contained two bedroomed flat with two seperate toilets, two showers and bath. One of the bedrooms has ensuite toilet and shower. Both bedrooms have televisions with free view channels. The living room has Sky TV which includes all music channels, Sky Sports channels, all news channels including CNN, Sky news, BBC, Aljazeera eNCA Africa and many more. The apartment also has unlimited internet access and broadband. Very close to city centre just less than ten minutes by bus and taxi and its a walking distance to town.There are a lot of buses and the most frequent ones running every ten minutes are numbers 76 and 77 from the Manchester City centre. They take between five and ten minutes from town to the apartment.   The apartment is next to the popular Rochdale Canal. There is plenty of open space by the canal and it is a pleasure to take a walk by the canal. It takes just about twenty minutes walk to town by the canal. Boats use the canal and it is a favourite for

summary: Part of a block of 14, with a mix of 2 bedroom apts & studios. We love having a whole building to ourselves, as we can accommodate *LARGER GROUPS* occupying a whole floor, or keep an area of the building quieter for business travelers and families.
space: This simply striking top-floor two-bed apartment, with two bathrooms and a sofa bed in the lounge, sleeps up to 4 comfortably  – with a balcony and views of the very cool Northern Quarter. In terms of the space, the open plan living area is the perfect setting to enjoy the exclusive panoramic views from our top floor apartment. With our stunning Monako oak and cosmopolitan chic interior it won't disappoint. The high spec kitchen is fully equipped with everything you might need to make perfect meals and enjoy in our dining area. The master bedroom features an elegant yet comfy bed, concealed storage and a modern en-suite. Our contemporary main bathroom has a jest shower and bath tub combination. neighborhood_overview: This apartment is on one of the coolest streets in the vibrant and exciting community that is the Northern Quarter.  The Northern Quarter is famed for its independent shops and boutiques, where you can pick up designer or retro clothes, rare  vinyl's, collectable comics, unusual furniture and superb art.  Today it is equally famed for its social scene, with the beautiful restaurants, cool bars, quirky coffee shops and city spas, pulling many young professionals to live in the beautiful old buildings that line the streets. The joy of the Northern Quarter is that it provides a central base to explore the whole of the city and beyond.   You will find lots of shops and the central hub of shopping in the Arndale centre. Or if you are after something a bit more unconventional, check out Afflecks Palace an “emporium of eclecticism" which is a 5 minute walk away. For designer shops head to Selfridges, Harvey Nichols or Spinningfields. Here are a few of our favourite places in the city -  To ea
notes: Parking. There are 2 car parks in very close proximity and several more you can freely choose.  There is a car park on Tib Street, which is about a 5 minute walk away. There is also a large multi storey car park on Church Street also about a 5 minute walk away. Although depending on what your plans are if you are driving around Manchester get in touch and we will do our best to help with suggestions.
transit: The apartment is super close to all of the major transport links. It takes 14 minutes to walk from Manchester Piccadilly, an easy walk, unless you have heavy luggage and need to jump in a cab. Free bus service – Outside Piccadilly Station on Station Approach is the bus stops for all the free city centre buses. They cover a huge area, they are reliable and regular and best of all they are free, so use them!  Buses – Buses can be caught from Piccadilly gardens.  Tram – Trams can also be caught from Piccadilly gardens.  Taxis – 5 minutes away just outside a large department store called Debenhams is a  taxi rank allowing you to get out and about quickly if you're in a rush, or to prevent a drenching in the rain if heading to another part of town.  Manchester is not a big place and you can walk to the other side of the City in 20mins, unless taking a leisurely pace, which can be quicker than a cab in rush hour.  The Trafford Centre – Hop on the X50 bus from Piccadilly Gardens. Etihad Stadi

name: Central Mcr quiet stylish 2bed loft
summary: An extremely bright, airy contemporary loft style two bedroom apartment. Situated on the second floor of this former warehouse with canal views. Located in a safe quiet street close to an abundance of brilliant bars, restaurants and transport links.  Discount: £924 per week
space: Junction Works is a beautifully converted warehouse which is part of the canal side Paradise Wharf Development.  Located on the edge of the Ashton Canal the apartment is literally a 5 minute walk from Piccadilly station, great for those needing to commute, get to the airport or simply want a central yet quiet location.  The building is accessed via secure entry system. There are lifts and stairs to all floors. My apartment is one of 3 through a second locked door, increasing security and reducing noise. Apartment consists of: hallway, 2 bright equal sized bedrooms, bathroom, open plan lounge/kitchen-diner.  There are lots of large windows and a Juliet balcony, which floods the apartment with natural light from morning til sundown. BEDROOMS... Bedroom 1: Four poster king size bed with new memory foam mattress, hanging space, mirror, side tables, reading lamps, black out blind. Bedroom 2:  2 x single beds with new med-firm mattresses, hanging space, reading lamps, wooden blind, desk. BAT

Located in a safe quiet street close to an abundance of brilliant bars, restaurants and transport links.
