Apartment consists of: hallway, 2 bright equal sized bedrooms, bathroom, open plan lounge/kitchen-diner.  There are lots of large windows and a Juliet balcony, which floods the apartment with natural light from morni
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on the edge of the trendy Northern Quarter which is bustling with independent bars and shops. Close enough to walk there in a couple of minutes, far enough away to be quiet at night!  There is a fantastic selection of Northern Quarter restaurants for all tastes on your doorstep, such as Almost Famous,  The Northern Quarter restaurant, Dough, The Bakery, Cane and Grain, The Blue Pig, Home Sweet Home and many many more. You really don't even need to leave the NQ if you don't want to! 10 minute walk to China town and Canal Street - you can walk straight down the Rochdale canal which is over the road from the apartment. Shopping: 10 minute walk to the main shopping areas: Arndale Centre, King Street, Selfridges, St Annes Square etc.  15 minute walk to Spinning Fields and Deansgate.
notes: Convenience: Sainsbury's, Waitrose and M&S food are open in Piccadilly station until 10pm: 5 min walk. PARKING: available nearby but charged per day: 1) Multi-story with security at £12 per day - Tariff st (over the road) 2) Non secure parking can be found for £6.50 per day in Dale Street Car parks (over the road)
transit: Nearest Stations: 5 mins walk - Piccadilly station & metro/tram 5 mins walk - Piccadilly bus station 15 minute walk - Oxford road station and Deansgate Very convenient for all major attractions in Manchester city centre, as well as for trams to the surrounding areas (Old Trafford, Media City, Chorlton, etc).  Manchester taxi facility - pay by paypal! Download the app! UBER
host_about:
Born and raised down south, I now live in Manchester but work in Birmingham and am often travelling around the UK for my job. This allows me to invite the right people stay in my home when I'm away. The apartment is my home, where I live, rather than a business so I only rent to people who can I can depend on to look after my home the way I would. 

I spend the majority of my free time in the bars and restaurants around the Northern Quarter and am a big GoT and Big Bang fan.

I aim to make my guests' experience as enjoyable as possible and provide loads of info on the area and extra touches. 

I ask that you respect my home and my belongings during your stay and treat my home and possessions as you would you own. Many are bits and pieces I have picked up from my travels, which I slavishly carried in my backpack for weeks on end :-)

I do require guests to be fully validated before accepting their requests and would like to hear a bit about you and your reason for visiting when you contact me.

I have a strict cancellation policy so please check terms before booking. 

If you have any other questions please just shout :)

Thank you

name: Nice room 10 minutes walk from town
space: I am renting out my spare room in a lovely flat located in Ancoats, Manchester! This is a perfect location for someone looking to move to central Manchester and needs a place to stay whilst house/flat hunting, or for someone who simply wants to visit and explore this amazing city! The apartment is situated in a very quiet pocket of Manchester city centre and receives plenty of light through out the day. There is also a gym nearby. Some of the facilities include  a lovely kitchen with fridge, freezer and  also a living room with TV , WIFI. Additionally, there is a gorgeous  balcony and also a nice and colorful bathroom.  Location wise : The apartment is located very close to the famous Northern quarter where you visit one of Manchesters well known Jazz Clubs "Matt & Freds", there is plenty more to see and do in this one-of-a-kind quarter! Also nearby is the flamboyant Harvey Nichols and Selfridges - great for that spot of retail therapy! The famous Old Trafford - home to Manchester Unit

host_about:
Hi everyone
My name is Ejike and I am an easy going, friendly individual. I am of Nigerian heritage, and I was born and live in Manchester. My passions are art (especially like Banksy and Gustav Klimt), music, cycle touring, playing badminton, reading poetry and prose, watching films, practicing pilates, nature and the universe.
I like watching Big Bang Theory, Jamie Oliver's 15 meals, Houses under the Hammer, Nature programmes and generally any documentary showing on BBC4. Favourite films are I Claudius, Betty Blue, Italian for Beginners, Dune.

name: Urban cottage south Manchester ❤️
summary: GRADE II LISTED COTTAGE. Sensitively restored and fully furnished two bedroom cottage decorated in vintage / cottage style plus gas central heating and all mod cons. TV and press featured and winner of 'May The Best House Win'.
space: The cottage is small but perfectly formed and a very unique property to stay in.  Double bedroom + double bed, wardrobe with clothes hangers, dressing table, hairdryer & feature storage. Single bedroom with feature storage and clothes rail, chair. Bathroom with bath and rain shower head and constant hot water. Large white fluffy bath sheets for all guests, shower gel and shampoo/ conditioner. Living room with small dining area and space for laptop work, wall lighting, flat screen TV (with DVD player) on wall. WiFi internet connection. Large free-standing style oak kitchen with belfast sink, Belling range oven, extractor hood, washing machine and fridge freezer. Lovely south facing garden with storage shed and outhouse.  There is limited, free parking just outside the cottage, down the footpath though for small cars only! Alternatively there is street parking on Ladybarn Lane or Cedar Grove. If in doubt, park up and walk down the footpath to assess space for your car.

name: Single room close to the university
summary: The room is in a well equipped 2 bedroom house with a piano, in a nice, quiet part of Rusholme, just by the Platt Fields Park. It is a short walk/bike-ride from the university and close to the famous Curry Mile. 15 min bus ride to the city centre.
space: This is a single room, with a bunk-bed (so having a guest every now and then is possible), in a 2 bedroom house. The house is our home and not a typical rental space, so it is considerably cleaner and better equipped than other properties in the neighbourhood. There is an upright piano in the house, a small dishwasher, a washing machine with a dryer and the kitchen is fully equipped. As it is our home we ask the guests to treat it with respect and to leave it as clean as possible. **The room is available from 4 July until 31 August. As for now the entire house can be rented for this period. This could be particularly convenient for a family with children. Please send a massage and ask for a special price if you want to rent the entire house **There is good fast wi-fi around the house**
description: The room is in a well equipped 2 bedroom house with a piano, in a nice, quiet part of Rusholme, just by the Platt Fields Park. It is a short walk/bike-ride from the university and close to the famous Curry Mile. 15 min bus ride to the city centre. This is a single room, with a bunk-bed (so having a guest every now and then is possible), in a 2 bedroom house. The house is our home and not a typical rental space, so it is considerably cleaner and better equipped than other properties in the neighbourhood. There is an upright piano in the house, a small dishwasher, a washing machine with a dryer and the kitchen is fully equipped. As it is our home we ask the guests to treat it with respect and to leave it as clean as possible. **The room is available from 4 July until 31 August. As for now the entire house can be rented for this period. This could be particularly convenient for a family with children. Please send a massage and ask for a special price if you want to rent the entire house *
neighborhood_overview: This is a great multicultural neighbourhood where you can buy great food (be it in the restaurant or in the shop) much cheaper than anywhere else. You will be minutes away from the famous Curry Mile, a minute away from the very pleasant Platt Fields Park and a walk away from the University of Manchester. Getting to Manchester Metropolitan University or the city centre is not complicated either.
notes: The fee does not include the gas & electricity bill. These are metered and in the summer can be around £20-40/month depending on your usage.  Also, as this is our home and not a typical rental property, we would appreciate knowing that you are a real, trustworthy person/people. Signing your introduction with your real full name is one way of making us feel more secure. :)
transit: The house is 5 minutes walk away from the Curry Mile from where you have a bus to the city centre every 1-2 minutes.
host_about: We are from Poland but for the last couple of years we were living in other countries, including the UK and Serbia. We enjoy good, vegetarian, possibly organic food and we love to cycle. We are parents to Miron (6) and Perla (3) but at times we travel alone. We value a farmers market more than a restaurant and opera or jazz more than disco :). As tenants we are not particularly picky - we are used to travelling and to living in all kind of spaces, big and small. And we are not kind of people who would call you and ask you to repair the curtain in the shower - either we repair it ourselves or we go to a pound shop and buy a new one :).

name: Comfy room in leafy Victoria Park
space: One of the unique characteristics of our house are the front doors, they are the original doors from the BBC's Northwest studio which located nearby and was demolished in the early 70's.  Names such as Jimmy Hendrix, The Beatles and many more stars of film and stage have walked through these doors, you could be next.  Enough of the nostalgia, we are pleased to offer a comfy room to rent in our 5 bedroomed, red bricked house on a quiet, leafy cul-de-sac in Victoria Park.  There are great public transport links just moments from the house with access to the airport and the city centre, which is just ten minutes away.   The Manchester Royal Infirmary is just a 5 minute walk and there are lots of parks nearby, not to mention the famous "Curry Mile" which is just a short walk away.  Most of the University buildings are also located nearby.  The house has Wifi, the room itself has a TV/DVD with Digital Freeview and has its own wash basin.  Guests will share the house with just one couple so

name: Cozy room in the curry mile!
summary: The location of our house is right in the middle of the Curry Mile There is a 24 hours carpark in front, many restaurants & shops, 1 minute walk to the bus stop, about 15mins busride to the city centre. Easy access to the airport. Breakfast included.
space: Our bedroom is equipped with a double bed, a cupboard, a desk, a swivel chair, and a water boiler. We have central heating, but if it gets too hot the room has an adjustable radiator.
description: The location of our house is right in the middle of the Curry Mile There is a 24 hours carpark in front, many restaurants & shops, 1 minute walk to the bus stop, about 15mins busride to the city centre. Easy access to the airport. Breakfast included. Our bedroom is equipped with a double bed, a cupboard, a desk, a swivel chair, and a water boiler. We have central heating, but if it gets too hot the room has an adjustable radiator. Guests will have 24 hours access to: - Common bathroom (shared) - Guest reception room The breakfast room will be open for access between 7 am until 10 am. For the remainder of the day this area will be off limits (it is our son's play area, it will be super messy so its for your own good ). The kitchen will be off limits only because it is a live kitchen were the wife will be cooking most of the day. If you don't mind the mess of cooking, then you're invited to join in. You may use our microwave if you need to, but limited to halal/vegetarian food only. If y
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is lively with a variety of asian cuisine and many shisha cafe's. The weekends are always the highlight of the week. There will be loud music from neighboring cafe's, but the guest bedroom is neatly tucked away at the back of the house, so the noise wont travel that far.
notes: Please be informed that we have a baby in the house! So please expect some baby activities during your stay such as baby babble, crying baby, baby knocking on your door, etc. Our son is a shy but curious one, but we promise to keep him tucked away during your stay. Your stay with us will include: •Breakfast  •Fresh towels •Ear plugs (in case our baby is being fussy!) We hope you'll enjoy your stay!
transit: Getting around is very easy. The busses run way pass midnight and the bus stop is just 1-minute walk away. Busses to the city centre and university will pass every 5 minutes or less. Cabs also frequently pass in front of our house, and uber taxi is always available if you are a user of the app.
host_about:
We are an Indonesian couple living here in Manchester. Yodha is a full time student and Amy is a full time mother of a cute lil one-year-old.

Yodha is into IT, and Amy loves cooking, traveling, shopping, and exploring. Yodha is your typical quiet programmer geeky type, and Amy is out-going, talkative and loves to share stories.

Oh, and the baby Abdur is also talkative. His hobbies right now is feeding mummy everything he can grab. Cookies, fruits, rocks, a piece of tissue, anything!

We can speak English, Malay, Korean, Japanese and Tarzan. We'd love to learn your language too!

name: Art Deco oasis
summary: A double room with its own sink in a large and airy first-floor flat with balcony in a Grade 2 listed Art Deco block only ten minutes bus to the city centre, with cheap buses every minute or so; a twenty-minute walk to the universities and hospitals.
space: Our spacious flat with a balcony is in a Grade 2 listed Art Deco building with private gardens for your use. We're opposite the lovely Platt Fields Park, with a beautiful heart-shaped lake and the Gallery of Costume in the Georgian building Platt Hall, which you can see from the room.
description: A double room with its own sink in a large and airy first-floor flat with balcony in a Grade 2 listed Art Deco block only ten minutes bus to the city centre, with cheap buses every minute or so; a twenty-minute walk to the universities and hospitals. Our spacious flat with a balcony is in a Grade 2 listed Art Deco building with private gardens for your use. We're opposite the lovely Platt Fields Park, with a beautiful heart-shaped lake and the Gallery of Costume in the Georgian building Platt Hall, which you can see from the room. Double guest bedroom with sink, family bathroom (toilet, shower, bath and washbasin), spare toilet, lounge/dining room, kitchen. We will be about all the time to help with directions and info on the city - there's a lot to do in Manchester and as we both work in the arts, we know about everything that's going on and can tell you about exhibitions, events, live literature, music gigs, films etc. We are in easy walking distance of the universities and Royal Nor
neighborhood_overview: We are in easy walking distance of the universities and Royal Northern College of Music one way and the much sought-after Didsbury with lots of independent bars and restaurants the other. Chorlton, with good delis and farmers' markets, is a pleasant bike ride or one-hour walk along an off-road path, as is Levenshulme with its Antiques Village and Radio 4 Food & Farming Award-nominated food market, while Rusholme's famous Curry Mile is five minutes' away. The Gallery of Costume is within view of the flat while the newly £15m refurbished Whitworth Art Gallery is just down the road and the brand-new arts centre HOME is a short bus ride. The city centre has plenty of entertainment and shopping opportunities, and is easy to get to.
notes: There is free parking at the block, although you will need to display a permit, which we can provide upon arrival. Towels and bedding are provided, and you are welcome to help yourself to our teas, coffee, sugar, milk, bread, butter, marmalade, jam and honey. There is WiFi and the room has a digital radio and an iPod docking station/speakers. There is a wardrobe with hanging space (and hangers) and shelves.
transit: Buses pass by every two minutes and most cost only a pound and take you to Piccadilly in the city centre in 15 minutes, passing Oxford Road Station and the national coach terminus. You can walk in to town in about 45 minutes. There are also plenty of black cabs and Uber taxis,  and a bicycle is available to guests too - so you can nip in out out of town and keep fit at the same time. There are also a number of bike hire schemes in the city.
host_about: Me and my partner Clare are both writers and we work in the arts. We love Manchester and living here this unique art deco block, and we tend to know what's going in the city.
street: Appleby Lodge, Manchester, Greater Manchester M14 6HZ, United Kingdom

name: Double room close to the university
summary: The room is in a well equipped 2 bedroom house with a piano, in a nice, quiet part of Rusholme, just by the Platt Fields Park. It is a short walk/bike-ride from the university and close to the famous Curry Mile. 15 min bus ride to the city centre.
space: This is a double room, with a double bed, in a 2 bedroom house. The house is our home and not a typical rental space, so it is considerably cleaner and better equipped than other properties in the neighbourhood. There is an upright piano in the house, a small dishwasher, a washing machine with a dryer and the kitchen is fully equipped. As it is our home we ask the guests to treat it with respect and to leave it as clean as possible. ** The room is available from 4 July until 31 August. As for now the entire house can be rented for this period. This could be particularly convenient for a family with children. Please send a massage and ask for a special price if you want to rent the entire house ** There is good fast wi-fi around the house**

neighborhood_overview: This is a great multicultural neighbourhood where you can buy great food (be it in the restaurant or in the shop) much cheaper than anywhere else. You will be minutes away from the famous Curry Mile, a minute away from the very pleasant Platt Fields Park and a walk away from the University of Manchester. Getting to Manchester Metropolitan University or the city centre is not complicated either.
notes: The fee does not include the gas & electricity bill. These are metered and in the summer can be around £20-40/month depending on your usage.  Also, as this is our home and not a typical rental property, we would appreciate knowing that you are a real, trustworthy person/people. Signing your introduction with your real full name is one way of making us feel more secure. :)
transit: The house is 5 minutes walk away from the Curry Mile from where you have a bus to the city centre every 1-2 minutes.
host_about: We are from Poland but for the last couple of years we were living in other countries, including the UK and Serbia. We enjoy good, vegetarian, possibly organic food and we love to cycle. We are parents to Miron (6) and Perla (3) but at times we travel alone. We value a farmers market more than a restaurant and opera or jazz more than disco :). As tenants we are not particularly picky - we are used to travelling and to living in all kind of spaces, big and small. And we are not kind of people who would call you and ask you to repair the curtain in the shower - either we repair it ourselves or we go to a pound shop and buy a new one :).

name: Comfy room in leafy Victoria Park
space: One of the unique characteristics of our house are the front doors, they are the original doors from the BBC's Northwest studio which located nearby and was demolished in the early 70's.  Names such as Jimmy Hendrix, The Beatles and many more stars of film and stage have walked through these doors, you could be next.  Enough of the nostalgia, we are pleased to offer a comfy room to rent in our 5 bedroomed, red bricked house on a quiet, leafy cul-de-sac in Victoria Park.  There are great public transport links just moments from the house with access to the airport and the city centre, which is just ten minutes away.   The Manchester Royal Infirmary is just a 5 minute walk and there are lots of parks nearby, not to mention the famous "Curry Mile" which is just a short walk away. Most of the University buildings are also located nearby.  The house has Wifi and our guests will share the house with just one couple so there is lots of space.  We look forward to welcoming our guests into our

summary: Very close to universities, city centre and hospitals. Large, peaceful private room in a beautiful Victorian house, very comfortable bed. Laid back hosts with lots of local knowledge,  lots of places to eat and drink nearby. Pet friendly.
space: This is a beautiful large Victorian town house on a quiet residential street in a desirable suburb of Manchester.  It's really easy to travel to anywhere in Manchester from here. Your bedroom is the best in the house - a double bay fronted room, very peaceful and calm with lots of natural light. The bed is super king size from Ikea and really comfortable. The bedding is 100% cotton from John Lewis. There is a clear desk in the room and fast wifi, so it's a great workspace too.

neighborhood_overview: You are within easy walking distance of Rusholme's famous Curry Mile, the universities, hospital and two lovely parks. Hip and happening Chorlton and Didsbury, with independent bars and restaurants are easy to get to (there's a direct bus to Didsbury from the end of the road and a bus to Chorlton near the Royal Northern College of Music which is about a 10 minute walk away). Levenshulme with its Antiques Village Food & Farming Award-nominated food market is just down the road. The new £15m refurbished Whitworth Art Gallery is just down the road and the brand-new arts centre HOME is a short bus ride. The city centre is also easy to get to. Ideal for parents visiting children staying in halls of residence as most of them are nearby, or for those taking courses at the university.
notes: I live here with my partner and I am out a lot so it's likely that you will get the house to yourself. It's a big house so it will feel spacious even if we are in.
transit: There is a bus stop at the end of the road - with buses passing every few minutes and costing about £1. Buses go to the city centre in one direction and to Didsbury in the other. There are also buses a short 5 minute walk away into Levenshulme (192), Salford Media City (number 50) and Stockport (192)
host_about: Hello, as travellers and hosts we are very laid back and relaxed. We like to make people feel welcome and we want friends and guests to treat our home as their own. I work in the charity sector and my partner works in film and TV. We have quite a busy social life and we are often out, but our home is a quiet sanctuary away from it all. I like films, reading, backgammon, good food and wine, travelling and spending time with the people who are in my life. It's just the two of us in the house so you will have peace and quiet during your stay.

name: The kindness of strangers
summary: Welcome to my home in Levenshulme a quiet suburb of Manchester, yet only minutes from the city center by road, rail, bus or bike.  This location is ideal for anyone wishing to visit Manchester or the North West of England.
space: The house is within 6 minutes walk of Levenshulme station, which is then just one stop from Manchester Piccadilly, which makes it ideal for exploring the city centre of heading off to Salford or Liverpool. But the house is also very convenient for visitors of Manchester Universities or the Central Hospital site all of which are on Oxford Rd a 10 minute bus ride or 40 minute walk away
description: Welcome to my home in Levenshulme a quiet suburb of Manchester, yet only minutes from the city center by road, rail, bus or bike.  This location is ideal for anyone wishing to visit Manchester or the North West of England. The house is within 6 minutes walk of Levenshulme station, which is then just one stop from Manchester Piccadilly, which makes it ideal for exploring the city centre of heading off to Salford or Liverpool. But the house is also very convenient for visitors of Manchester Universities or the Central Hospital site all of which are on Oxford Rd a 10 minute bus ride or 40 minute walk away Guests have access to their own double bedroom with fresh bed linen and towels. There is plenty of storage space in the room as well as a table and chair and WiFi for those who need to keep in touch with work or family. The room and street are very quite. You share a bath room with the female occupier. There is a good shower and bath. I welcome guests on arrival with a meal and also prov
neighborhood_overview: Levenshulme is a surprisingly quiet suburb of Manchester, though still within easy reach of the city centre. I have good neighbours and live in a very pleasant road. But it is still part of a big city and if you are on foot or using public transport I would come home after about 10.30 pm in a taxi, especially if you are a woman. This would cost about £6.00 from the city centre.
notes: There are plenty of books in the house!
host_about:
Manchester has been my home for the last 15 years but before that I have lived in other parts of the UK,  in Canada (for 3 years) and East Africa (for four year). So I really appreciate that whilst traveling it helps to be comfortable and that does not always mean stopping in the nearest Hilton! I have on many occasions known the 'kindness of strangers' many of which have become firm friends and colleagues.

 I very much enjoy company, sharing stories and passing on travel tips. But I also enjoy a good book, a movie and my own company and appreciate that other guests and hosts need these too. 

My background is in health care and I also work in higher education.

neighborhood_overview: Our area is only around 2 miles away to Attrinham, Wilmslow, Disbury, Hale Barn where most well known footballers in Manchester lives. Thus, it is known for a nice and safe neighbourhood with a lots of beautiful villas and garden house in our neighbourhood.
notes: We share the house with the host as we stay in one of the bedroom upstairs.  I prefer guests with two night stay minimum due to our house cleaning arrangement. But if you only need to stay for one night pls let us know as we might be able to accomodate this subject to an additional charge of £8 per room.  We have lots of green walking routes right behind our neighborhood and Gatley golf course is within walking distance from our house if you are a fan of golf.  Please let us know in advance if you have any special requirements or allergies
transit: 5 minute walk to local tram station  7' walk to local bus stop  10 minute walk to local train station  10 minute train journey from Manchester airport to our local Heald Green station 10 -15 minute by train from our local train station Heald Green to Manchester Piccadilly with quite frequent connections.  10' walking distance to local stores.  There are nice walking paths right in our neighbourhood within 5' from our house.  We also have tram connection to popular stops such as Manchester Airport, Disbury, Wilmslow, Attringham,.... right on the main road 5 minute walk from our  house. Both my husband and I own car and we are quite easy going with giving you a lift to Manchester city centre when we leave home for work in the city.  When we do food shopping for our family we dont mind if you would like a lift with us to do your own shopping or we can get stuff in our shopping journeys for you if you are busy.
host_about:
I came to the UK seven years ago to do my master degree in international development and met my husband who was a medical student living near my student house. We settled here in Manchester after my graduation in 2009.

We cant live without good food and my husband cant live without football.

We are very keen on getting to know other people and share with them our love of this city and our neighbourhood.

I used to travel alone a lot for my UNICEF work and there are times which I feel lonely in hotel accomodation. I love mingling & the feeling of home in a foreign coutry wherever I stay.  Thus, when I learn of bnb, this is what i need for my own travel and its nice for like-minded people to get together on this beautiful concept of making others feel like they are at home.

We enjoy getting involved in charity work in our free time and find great joy in our peaceful walks in the neighborhood followed by a romantic movie at home.

We love home made cooking and my husband is a good chef in our house. 

The reason why we set up bnb service using our spare bedrooms is to help generate some fund as a way to support my best friend's charity, which was set up as the first NGO aiming at raising awareness & creating hands-on projects on breast cancer support in Vietnam called BCVN fouded by Thuong Nguyen Sobey who suffered breast cancer herself at the time the NGO was founded. 

My husband is a great fan of football and he organises football every two weeks while I am working away with my own little projects for Vietnam. 

We find our way of socialising differently sometimes. He likes drinking regular coke with a meal while I prefer beer or a glass of wine with mine sometimes.

description: Private Bed & Breakfast Service suitable for professional gentlemen or ladies on business in Manchester/ North West of England. Situated in a quiet middle class private estate near Manchester International Airport, we offer a warm friendly service to international travellers in transit awaiting connecting flights and UK business persons in a warm friendly family environment.  The accommodation is comprised of a modern Tudor design detached  2 storey building with 6 bedrooms, 2 living areas dining area, large modern main kitchen and a guest kitchen, 2 studies, conservatory, log cabin with Jacuzzi installed and ample guest packing area. The hot tub is available for guests to relax in for a small extra charge. transit: How to get to our home Where are you? If your are at Manchester international Airport below is for your guidance! Our home is just over a mile from Manchester International Airport. You have the options of a black cab, mini-cab, buses or tram. The black cab can be a bit pricey at about £10 for the short trip but you travel in style. If you are in a hurry you can also book a minicab from a kiosk just outside the arrival hall and it will cost you only about £5. Alternatively you can get the Bus 369 for less than £1 but it can be a rather slow journey at the end of a long trip from where ever. Your best alternative to the mini cab at a low cost is theTram (Metrolink) - £1.60. There is one every 12 minute frequency between 09:00 -18:00 and 15 minute frequency before 09:00 and after 18:00. name: Modern family house with garden
summary: A modern family house for four with a through lounge and dining area, separate kitchen and  good sized double and twin bedrooms. One bathroom comprises bath with shower and toilet. There is an enclosed rear garden with patio table and chairs.
space: The through lounge/dining room has a large leather corner sofa, matching footstool, flat-screen TV and DVD, radio/CD player and coffee table. There is a glass dining table and four chairs. Patio doors lead out to the  enclosed garden where there is a table and chairs. The  kitchen is fully equipped with a hob, oven, fridge, freezer, microwave and washer/dryer. Crockery, cutlery and utensils are also provided. The bathroom includes a bath, overhead shower and toilet.  Gas central heating is accompanied by instant hot water and double glazing. There is also complimentary WiFi with tea, coffee, toiletries and towels on arrival. A complimentary weekly change of linen and towels is provided for guests staying longer periods. Parking is available in front of the house.

neighborhood_overview: Located in a quiet residential area, approximately 1 mile from Gatley village where there are local restaurants, supermarkets, cafes, takeaways and pubs etc.
transit: The house is 7 miles south of Manchester City Centre and about 1.25 miles from traditional Gatley village where there are local restaurants, supermarkets, pubs and cafes. Another half mile or so further is larger Cheadle village with all local amenities. Benchill Metrolink station  is a 7 minute walk away. From there you have access via the tram network to all parts of Manchester including the centre. Wythenshawe hospital is located just 2 miles away and Manchester Airport 3 miles away. Gatley train station is a mile away and you can park your car there before taking a train into Piccadilly station in Manchester which takes about 15 minutes.The impressive Trafford Centre shopping mall can be reached by car in less than 15 minutes. Don't forget the tour of Manchester United Football Club which is also just 15 minutes away by car. The nearby M56 & M60 motorways give access to the whole of the North West including the fantastic Lake District which is about 1.5 hours drive away.

host_about:
I am a humorous alternative-thinking type. I love the peaceful, quiet life. 

My preference is for people who are vegetarian or happy to be vegetarian at home. 

I have a passion for singing though most of my practice is at formal choir rehearsals. I also love to play sports, study and practice spirituality (e g yoga) and be as ecologically sound as practically possible. I am not a political person but have an interest in humanitarian issues.

The TV is hardly ever on as more and more I find myself studying or reading quietly, listening to music or connecting via (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN). 

Another huge hobby for me is improving my languages using the internet. I speak Spanish best but also speak French and German and my interest is always in people who transcend cultural and religious barriers.

name: Homely, Spacious Didsbury Apartment
summary: Our homely and spacious two bedroom apartment in Didsbury, a unique area of Manchester, offers easy access to the city centre by bus, tram or train. You will have your own double bedroom with access to a large lounge, kitchen and private bathroom.
space: Conveniently located only a few minutes' walk from the train station, tram stop and bus stop, our cosy East Didsbury apartment provides quick and easy access into central Manchester, whilst also being located a short walk from Didsbury Village, with all its unique bars, eateries, shops and parks. We are just a ten minute train ride from Manchester Airport and 11 minute train ride from the central Manchester Piccadilly station but the area maintains a community feel and has its own personality. There is a 24 hour Tesco on our doorstep, as well as a large entertainment complex complete with cinema, bowling and a selection of restaurants.
description: Our homely and spacious two bedroom apartment in Didsbury, a unique area of Manchester, offers easy access to the city centre by bus, tram or train. We are just a ten minute train ride from Manchester Airport and 11 minute train ride from the central Manchester Piccadilly station but the area maintains a community feel and has its own personality. There is a 24 hour Tesco on our doorstep, as well as a large entertainment complex complete with cinema, bowling and a selection of restaurants. Your bedroom comes with a double bed, DVD player, wardrobe and chest of drawers. You will also have access t
neighborhood_overview: East Didsbury is a quieter area away from the bustle of central Manchester but with fantastic transport links to all areas of the city. It has its own bars and restaurants and a real community feel for the traveller who likes their home comforts but also the ease to travel into the city centre at leisure. It's a very community-spirited and safe area. The nearby Wilmslow Road has plenty of street lighting and the area feels secure even at night - handy for it's 24 hour bus route!
transit: By Train - East Didsbury train station is just a minutes' walk away offering trains to and from the airport (takes 10 - 13 minutes) and into Manchester Piccadilly station (takes 11-15 minutes). This is our recommended method of travel as it costs around £2.50 - £3.50 return and is fast and regular. By Bus - There is a bus stop just across the road which has frequent buses into the centre and other areas of the city. These cost from £1 - £3 and take about 30 minutes on a clear day (traffic pending). By Tram - The tram stop is less than 5 minutes' walk away and comes frequently. This is an easy way to go to specific areas of town and costs around £2 - £4 return. If you are coming for football, this is the easiest way to get to Old Trafford. By Car - We are located just two minutes from junction 1 of the M56 (the main motorway into Manchester). name: Spacious Apartment near Parrs Wood
summary: A bright, modern two bedroom, two bathroom first floor apartment in Parrs Wood, Didsbury with fantastic links to public transport.
space: There is a combined lounge/dining area with two leather sofas, coffee table, flat screen TV and DVD, radio/CD player, glass dining table and four chairs. There are two sets of French windows with Juliet balconies. The master bedroom has an ensuite shower and toilet. There is also a twin bedroom and a separate bathroom with toilet. Both bedrooms have high quality fitted furniture.  The kitchen is fully equipped including a hob, oven, microwave, fridge/freezer as well as a washing machine and dryer. Crockery, cutlery and utensils are also provided. There is complimentary WiFi and tea, coffee, soap, shampoo and towels are provided for guests on arrival. For guests staying longer periods, there is a weekly change of linen and towels. A hairdryer is also provided. Off-road parking is available.
description: A bright, modern two bedroom, two bathroom first floor apartment in Parrs Wood, Didsbury with fantastic links to public transport. There is a combined lounge/dining area with two leather sofas, coffee table, flat screen TV and DVD, radio/CD player, glass dining table and four chairs. There are two sets of French windows with Juliet balconies. The master bedroom has an ensuite shower and toilet. There is also a twin bedroom and a separate bathroom with toilet. Both bedrooms have high quality fitted furniture.  The kitchen is fully equipped including a hob, oven, microwave, fridge/freezer as well as a washing machine and dryer. Crockery, cutlery and utensils are also provided. There is complimentary WiFi and tea, coffee, soap, shampoo and towels are provided for guests on arrival. For guests staying longer periods, there is a weekly change of linen and towels. A hairdryer is also provided. Off-road parking is available. Guests will have the exclusive use of the entire apartment during th
neighborhood_overview: Cosmopolitan Didsbury village, with its innumerable restaurants, cafes and speciality shops is about 1 mile away. Parrs Wood cinema and entertainment complex with various family-style restaurants is about 400m away as is  a Tesco supermarket. An M&S Food outlet situated about 300m from the apartment  is due to open in Autumn 2015.
transit: This super apartment is situated in South Manchester on the border of East Didsbury and has a fantastic location for public transport. Across the road is East Didsbury Metrolink station where you can take a comfortable tram in to the city centre and beyond. Manchester City Centre is 6 miles away and you can also get there in about 15 minutes from nearby East Didsbury train station which is a 5 minute walk away. Just a 400m walk away is Parrs Wood cinema and entertainment complex with several family-style restaurants as well as Parrs Wood bus terminus. Stockport is  3 miles from the apartment. Didsbury village, a mile away, is a very lively, cosmopolitan area of South Manchester. There are countless restaurants, pubs and coffee shops as well as some great speciality food shops, an M&S food store and all local amenities. The apartment is ideally situated for the Christie Hospital which is less than 2 miles away. Manchester Airport is accessible in 15 minutes by car or train. The Trafford
host_about: We are a friendly professional couple who have been providing high quality short-term serviced accommodation in South Manchester since 2003.

name: Spectacular Didsbury Village Home
summary: Welcome to our flat - it's a beautiful open plan apartment in the heart of Didsbury Village. Please read our detailed description below for the complete lowdown. We are looking forward to having you to stay!
space: Welcome to our home!  This is a great apartment in Didsbury Village, on the first floor of a building formerly known as the 'Clock Tower'. The apartment is made up of two bedrooms (both with ensuites), and one huge living space/kitchen - the apartment is usually flooded with light due to the 8 large bay windows in the main room, overlooking the village.
description: Welcome to our flat - it's a beautiful open plan apartment in the heart of Didsbury Village. Please read our detailed description below for the complete lowdown. We are looking forward to having you to stay! Welcome to our home!  This is a great apartment in Didsbury Village, on the first floor of a building formerly known as the 'Clock Tower'. The apartment is made up of two bedrooms (both with ensuites), and one huge living space/kitchen - the apartment is usually flooded with light due to the 8 large bay windows in the main room, overlooking the village. The two bedrooms in the flat both have newly renovated ensuite bathrooms, underfloor heating, and are soundproof. One bed is a double, the other is a king; we also have an additional double mattress for you to use, should you wish to stay with up to six people.  We also have wireless fibre-optic internet, free for you to use. It's very fast :) We are super close to a number of great galleries, bars, restaurants, and museums, includi
neighborhood_overview: We are super close to a number of great galleries, bars, restaurants, and museums, including the Whitworth Art Gallery, Manchester Art Gallery, and Manchester Museum. In addition to this, we have loads of personal recommendations, so ask away and we will do our best to help you out! Soph and I are both freelance musicians, working with the BBC Phil, Hallé, and Royal Liverpool Phil amongst others, so we also have a pretty good handle on the music scene.
notes: If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to get in touch. We look forward to welcoming you to Manchester, and our home!
transit: We are about 20 minutes out of the CBD, which means that the area is quiet, but close enough to commute easily should you want to see the sights. The 142 and 42 buses into town stop directly outside the apartment, so transport is a cinch. Didsbury Village Tram stop is just over the road, so that also opens up a gamut of travel options. We also have buses nearby that take you straight to the Trafford Centre, should you be in the mood for a monster shopping trip! Finally, there is a cab company just down the road that will take you to Manchester Airport for £12, and pick you up whenever is convenient. The trip takes about 15 mins.
host_about:
My name is Adam, and I am a cellist currently based in Manchester, UK. 

Together with my girlfriend, Sophie, we live in a lovely apartment in Didsbury Village. Our place is big, filled with light, and there is generally music playing and something cooking. It's a good place.

name: Peaceful Double room in Didsbury
space: Hi, my name is Joanne. I live in a really peaceful block of flats in Didsbury (on the ground floor), a walk away from Didsbury Village and West Didsbury where you will find a huge range of independent restaurants, bars, shops, cafes and pubs.  I am also very close to the city centre where you will have access to art galleries (Manchester Art Gallery, The Lowry to name just a few), theatres, clubs and all the activities the city centre can offer you. Chorlton is also near by. Didsbury is a in the suburbs, far enough from the city centre, with lots of parks and green spaces around but close enough to get around and see the sights. Your room has a comfy double bed, and is nice and quite (a rest bite after a days trekking around the city). Hi,

I'm happy to have found Airbnb to help travellers from round the world or even within the UK discover Manchester! 
When I can afford to travel myself I love the water, so anything near the sea so I can go scuba diving, fantastic.

name: Studio apartment Didsbury
summary: Self-contained and self-catering en-suite apartment with separate entrance (from main house), located in Didsbury, Manchester's suburb.
space: This en-suite apartment consists of one room and bathroom. In the room there is a large double bed (real, sprung mattress) on one side and a small kitchen on the other. There is a double wardrobe, a table and chair, and an armchair. In the bathroom there is a shower (but no bathtub). We provide towels, basic toiletries  and a hairdryer, so you don't need to bring yours.  The kitchen has a small fridge with a freezer, a microwave-oven, 2 hotplates, toaster, electric kettle so you can cook small meals or warm up any take-aways. We provide tea, milk, and breakfast cereals.  There is no TV as we don't watch TV and don't have a TV licence but we have wall-mounted 32" flat screen, so you can choose and watch a movie from our DVD collection.  We have free WiFi.  Iron and ironing board are available on demand. If you have any allergies (feathers, colours, etc.) please let us know in advance.

neighborhood_overview: We're in a quiet residential area at the end of a cul-de-sac (so no traffic at all) and right next to a park, Fog Lane Park. Didsbury in considered the most prestigious location in Manchester, situated between the centre and the airport. Didsbury village is at 7 minutes walking distance, with all its restaurants, shops, and take-aways.
notes: The aprtment is recently refurbished and very clean. This is a perfect location between airport and city centre but quiet and peaceful. However, to avoid any misunderstandings I have to say that if you're not driving but commuting by public transport, it might take from 20 to 30 min to the city centre.
transit: Please note, we are NOT in the city centre but in a quiet suburb. By car: 15 min from airport, 20 min from city centre, 15 min from university. Motorways M60 (junction 5) and M56. By train: 5 min on foot to nearest railway station, Burnage. From there 12 min direct train to airport, 14 min direct to Manchester Piccadilly ( =Manchester's main railway station). By bus: 25 min direct bus to university and 30 min to city centre. Bus stop is in 5 min walking distance from the house. By tram: 7 min on foot to Didsbury tram stop, from there 20 min direct to city centre
host_about: We're from Manchester, UK. I cannot really talk about myself only as we're together as a family when ever we travel, that is to say my husband, Eric, who's a military historian and would spend all days in museums of the boring type if it were up to him, myself is a bio-medical scientist currently working for The University of Manchester, and our now five-year old daughter Emily.

name: Bright Double Room near University
summary: Our cozy two-storey house has a true lovely feeling! The bright room comfortably fits two & is centrally located on a nice quiet street, only 15 min away from the city centre by bus. Enjoy a nice kitchen, a refreshing shower & a good night sleep! P.S - Please do not send us Airbnb requests if you aren't verified, don't have a profile picture, or have not filled out your profile at all. I understand some of you might be new to the website but I like to know a bit more about the people I host.
space: The accommodation available to guests is a spacious bright private room upstairs that faces the garden (lots of light during the day). We have a big double bed that is very comfortable and you would have full use of that room during your stay. Also you are welcome to use the second kitchen to cook and also the washing machine, oven, grill, blender, fridge, and bathrooms. We also have a garden in the back with a picnic table where you can smoke if you need to. Our house is situated in South Manchester in Victoria Park with regular buses to central Manchester, which take approx. 15 minutes. There are also tram services not to far away. There is a convenience store, supermarket, and several takeaways in the neighbourhood. We are both fairly busy but will be around to help out and offer travel tips if you need them. Tea and coffee will be provided, and we might be around occasionally to share a meal and maybe have a few drinks. We have Wi-fi which you are welcome to use. We also have one s
description: Our cozy two-storey house has a true lovely feeling! The bright room comfortably fits two & is centrally located on a nice quiet street, only 15 min away from the city centre by bus. Enjoy a nice kitchen, a refreshing shower & a good night sleep! P.S - Please do not send us Airbnb requests if you aren't verified, don't have a profile picture, or have not filled out your profile at all. I understand some of you might be new to the website but I like to know a bit more about the people I host. The accommodation available to guests is a spacious bright private room upstairs that faces the garden (lots of light during the day). We have a big double bed that is very comfortable and you would have full use of that room during your stay. Also you are welcome to use the second kitchen to cook and also the washing machine, oven, grill, blender, fridge, and bathrooms. We also have a garden in the back with a picnic table where you can smoke if you need to. Our house is situated in South Manchest
neighborhood_overview: We live a 2 min walk away from a bus stop (number 50 bus) into central Manchester which is extremely handy. We are less than a 5 minute walk away from the famous "Curry Mile". Here, there are some great Indian restaurants, cafes as well as couple of good exotic food shops. We also live very close to Birchfields Park (5 minute walk away) and Plattfields Park; they're both great and beautiful for a morning walk or to have a BBQ/Picnic on a sunny day.
notes: We have a small black female cat so do be aware if you have allergies. She is not allowed into the Airbnb room so even if you are allergic you should be fine because we clean the room and the house quite thoroughly very often. We also have laminate flooring everywhere other than the staircase so it makes it even easier to clean. P.S - We live with other housemates so your room will always be spotlessly clean, but do be aware we share common areas with our housemates so I can't guarantee the kitchen and the bathroom will always be spotlessly clean all the time.
transit: Very convenient transport links - very close to town, 2 minutes walk to the bus stop into town and Salford Quays (bus number 50 Stagecoach). There are 6 night buses the 143 bus, 142 bus, 43 bus, 42 bus which service the area throughout the night and are a ten minute walk from our house. One thing to note is that the 50 bus stops running at midnight.
host_about:
I'm a junior graphic designer / photographer and I live with my boyfriend James who is studying medicine (4th year) and 3 other friends doing Phd's, working, and finishing their bachelor degrees in a shared house in Victoria Park, Manchester. 

I guess I consider myself a free-spirited explorer of the world. I caught the travel bug a few years ago and have never stopped traveling. I'd say I'm a very spontaneous, fun, creative and friendly person. I've spent the last four years and a half living, working, and studying in different cities in Europe such as Amsterdam,Stockholm, Jonkoping, Linkoping, Madrid, Aarhus, Liverpool, Berlin, Munich, London, Barcelona and Manchester. 

James and I are also a part of the Couchsurfing community so we host as much as we can. We really enjoying meeting people from all over the world and making new friends, so Airbnb seemed like the next step after hosting people extensively through Couchsurfing previously.

Motto: Happiness is a journey, not a destination. 

Things we love: Travelling, collecting postcards, cats, brewing beer, cooking & good food, listening to all kinds of music, designing, drawing, reading meaningful books, and watching funny TV shows like Parks and Recreation.

Our house is situated in South Manchester in Victoria Park with regular buses to central Manchester, which take approx. 15 minutes. There are also tram services not to far away. There is a convenience store, supermarket, post office and several take aways in the neighbourhood. We are both fairly busy but will be around to help out and offer travel tips. Tea and coffee will be provided, and we will be around occasionally to share a meal and maybe have a few drinks. We have Wi-fi which you are welcome to use. We also have one small female cat called Bella.
description: Our fun & comfortable house has a true lovely feeling! Our cozy room fits two and is centrally located on a nice street, only 15 min away from the city centre. Enjoy a nice kitchen, garden access, and a good night's sleep! P.S - Please do not send us Airbnb requests until you are verified, have a profile picture, and have filled out the rest of your Airbnb profile. I understand some of you might be new to the website but I like to know a bit more about the people I will be hosting in advance The accommodation available to guests is a cozy private room upstairs (1st floor) that faces the street. We have a double bed that is very comfortable and you would have full use of that room during your stay. Also you are welcome to use kitchen, living room, washing machine, dryer, oven, grill, blender, fridge etc. We also have a garden with a picnic table, where you can smoke if you need to. Our house is situated in South Manchester in Victoria Park with regular buses to central Manchester, which
neighborhood_overview: We live a 2 min walk away from a bus stop (number 50 bus) into central Manchester which is extremely handy. We are less than a 5 minute walk away from the famous "Curry Mile". Here, there are some great Indian restaurants, cafes as well as couple of good exotic food shops. We also live very close to Birchfields Park (5 minute walk away) and Plattfields Park; they're both great and beautiful for a morning walk or to have a BBQ/Picnic on a sunny day.
notes: We have a small black female cat so do be aware if you have allergies!
transit: Very convenient transport links - very close to town, 2 minutes walk to the bus stop into town and Salford Quays. There are 6 night buses as well which service the area throughout the night and are a ten minute walk from our house.
host_about:
I'm a junior graphic designer / photographer and I live with my boyfriend James who is studying medicine (4th year) and 3 other friends doing Phd's, working, and finishing their bachelor degrees in a shared house in Victoria Park, Manchester. 

I guess I consider myself a free-spirited explorer of the world. I caught the travel bug a few years ago and have never stopped traveling. I'd say I'm a very spontaneous, fun, creative and friendly person. I've spent the last four years and a half living, working, and studying in different cities in Europe such as Amsterdam,Stockholm, Jonkoping, Linkoping, Madrid, Aarhus, Liverpool, Berlin, Munich, London, Barcelona and Manchester. 

James and I are also a part of the Couchsurfing community so we host as much as we can. We really enjoying meeting people from all over the world and making new friends, so Airbnb seemed like the next step after hosting people extensively through Couchsurfing previously.

Motto: Happiness is a journey, not a destination. 

Things we love: Travelling, collecting postcards, cats, brewing beer, cooking & good food, listening to all kinds of music, designing, drawing, reading meaningful books, and watching funny TV shows like Parks and Recreation.
street: Milverton Road, Manchester, M14 5PL, United Kingdom

name: Spacious City room with en suite
summary: It is a quiet and tranquil space for a city retreat and provides the balance between the busy city centre life. Located in Ancoats, it's next to manchester's main cultural centre: The Northern Quarter. Located 5 minutes from Piccadilly train station*
space: The room comes with stacks of books to indulge in, candles and natural shampoo and shower-gel at your disposal.  Toothpaste, travel adaptors, towels, breakfast also included. Enjoy the PRIVATE bathroom and FREE wifi.
description: It is a quiet and tranquil space for a city retreat and provides the balance between the busy city centre life. Located in Ancoats, it's next to manchester's main cultural centre: The Northern Quarter. Located 5 minutes from Piccadilly train station* The room comes with stacks of books to indulge in, candles and natural shampoo and shower-gel at your disposal.  Toothpaste, travel adaptors, towels, breakfast also included. Enjoy the PRIVATE bathroom and FREE wifi. The bedroom comes with an ensuite shower and toilet. The shower is spacious with a power shower and instantly hot water which can easily be adjusted to a temperature suited to you. My flatmate will be on hand to host and give you great tips to make sure you enjoy your stay. If you need anything please ask and we'll provide. If you'd like anything for breakfast and/or drinks, please let me know and we'll be sure to stock the fridge. It's a great place to live with incredible architecture celebrating Manchester's industrial past
neighborhood_overview: It's a great place to live with incredible architecture celebrating Manchester's industrial past. Rochdale and Ashton canals that run through Ancoats into the Northern Quarter so be sure to go for a walk; it makes for a  pleasant stroll in the evening. Take a walk around Cotton field which I believe is part of Islington wharf. It's a lovely, peaceful place.
notes: The apartment is situated in a large complex of apartments. Please enter via Harrison Street because we're located on the ground floor and close to this entrance.  In case you find it difficult to find Harrison Street (sometimes it doesn't come up on sat nav) look for Isaac Way and drop me a text so I can arrange for someone to meet you.
transit: Great room located 3 minutes from Piccadilly train station via tram* *Take the tram to New Islington. You'll need the train going towards Ashton-Under-Lyne. The apartment is located 3 mins walk from the tram station.  Tram ticket costs £1.70 for a day return ticket, £6.60 for weekly.  City centre tram stops to New Islington include: Piccadilly Gardens, Piccadilly station, St Peter's Sq (opposite central library and very close to Manchester Art Gallery so have a look at both of these incredible landmarks).

neighborhood_overview: We live on a new build estate not far from the city centre. Houses are being built around us therefore it can be quite noisy during the day. You can hop on a bus into the city which costs £1.80. Or there is a tram close to Sportcity. If you are feeling energetic you can always walk into the city which takes 25 minutes and is one straight road so you shouldn't get lost!
notes: We are happy to pick you up from Piccadilly Train Station depending on the time of day and if we are available :)
transit: Public transport is frequent and reliable. Taxis into and from the city are not bad - generally under £10 depending where you are going. A taxi from Piccadilly train station to our house is usually £5.00-£5.50.
host_about:
Hello! :) 

I'm Annie, I'm 25 and live with my boyfriend Lennard, also 25. I have lived in Manchester for 3 years now and feel I know the city pretty well. We love to go out for food and enjoy drinks at the weekend, so we have a list of restaurants and bars we could recommend. 

We both speak fluent English and German. 

I want to see the world.

name: Stylish flat to rent in Manchester
summary: Light, bright one bedroom flat, attractively furnished in a remarkable modern building close to the bars and shops of central Manchester
space: The property is a really bright, beautifully furnished one bedroom secure flat in the CHIPS Building, a one off Will Alsop designed building that really stands out from the crowd. The flat comfortably sleeps two, with a large bright kitchen/Living Areas with views over Manchester
description: Light, bright one bedroom flat, attractively furnished in a remarkable modern building close to the bars and shops of central Manchester The property is a really bright, beautifully furnished one bedroom secure flat in the CHIPS Building, a one off Will Alsop designed building that really stands out from the crowd. The flat comfortably sleeps two, with a large bright kitchen/Living Areas with views over Manchester Guest have access to the flat and also they can access the small roof terrace.  To get to it, take the opposite corridor door on the fifth floor, to the one to the flat on, then walk along the corridor and up one flight of stairs to the sixth floor, sorry it sounds a bit complicated but it is very easy I don't normally meet the guests and they pick up the keys at the Manchester Piccadilly Station  but I am available to chat promptly either via phone or email during their trip to sort out any problems or queries I love the fact this wonderfully colourful building is right besi
neighborhood_overview: I love the fact this wonderfully colourful building is right beside the Ashton Canal full of houseboats, wildfowl and travelling barges.  It is right on the doorstep of  the Northern Quarter, Manchester's 'bohemian' area full of vintage clothes shops, one off cafes and lively bars, and we have a great local cafe 'Cafe Vivid'  In the other direction it is very close to the Velopark, home of the UK's cycling team and also Manchester City grounds are fairly close too.
transit: You are right next to Manchester city centre and New Islington Metrolink tram stop is right outside the building  15 Minute walk from Piccadilly Gardens (Main Bus station and Metrolink stations).  10 minute walk from Piccadilly Station which has several free shuttle bus services around Manchester 5 Minute walk to the Northern Quarter's bars and restaurants.  From the AIRPORT there is a 14 minute train  to Piccadilly Station
host_about: I'm currently a development producer at the BBC in Salford, after years of working ind different parts of the UK and around the world.  I really enjoy being able to live here during the week because when I was growing up in the Highlands of Scotland, Manchester was an impossibly cool city packed full of bands like: The Smiths, The Buzzcocks, Guy called Gerald, Carmel, Joy Division, ACR and of course Factory Records and the Hacienda so living in this city still feels like a real thrill.

name: Luxury Mill Apartment City Centre
summary: Perfectly located on the eastern edge of the city centre, just minutes walk from the cool and trendy northern quarter and Piccadilly station. This large living space combines high end design with original exposed brickwork, beams and steel pillars.
space: The unique design of the space combines original features with modern, high end fittings and fantastic views across Manchester skyline. A secure car parking space is included. The master bedroom boasts a super-kingsize bed, fitted with 100% Egyptian cotton bedding. The space also contains a large fitted wardrobe and dressing area. The bathroom has all the regular fittings including a bath and shower with a fantastic wall-to-wall mirror. The open kitchen, complete with dishwasher, is a spacious and enjoyable cooking facility. The kitchen is incorporated into the open plan living space with the dining area and the living room. It's a spacious, light, relaxing space, with bespoke light fittings and large windows providing stunning views across Manchester, particularly at sunset. The living room has a 50" 3D smart TV, complete with Apple TV, a PS4 and a over a thousand movies to watch.

notes: I have a lot of questions regarding the security deposit, please see below a passage copied from Airbnb FAQ on the matter. Security deposits help cover accidents that occur during a reservation, like spilled wine on the rug, a broken window, or an unreturned key. Hosts must add a security deposit to their listing before a reservation is booked. Security deposits can't be handled off-site in cash, as off-site payments are a violation of our terms. When a reservation is accepted, the security deposit details and guest's payment information is stored. No charges or authorizations will be made to the guest's payment method unless the host needs to make a claim. A host has 48 hours after the checkout date to make a claim on the security deposit. If a host makes a claim on the security deposit, we mediate and collect payment from the guest, as necessary. Please read details on the claim process as a host or guest. After a reservation is made, you can verify the amount of the security deposit
transit: New Islington Metrolink is directly outside the front door providing instant access all over the city. There is also a multitude of free parking outside the development, however a secure parking space is included.
host_about:
Having graduated from Manchester University, I now work as a Regional Account Manager for Cadburys.

Three facts about me:
 
- I am a clean and tidy modern living individual and I love my first home.
- I love going out for a coffee or beer in one of Manchester's many quirky watering holes
- I have an unlimited supply of chocolate

I am new to Airbnb but looking forward to finding unique places to stay and offering my beautiful first home to other Airbnb-ers to enjoy!

name: Machester City Centre Double Room
summary: A location at the heart of things.  This part of the city centre has a  sharp and vibrant community, and is the next big thing! Secure off street parking is included in the price!
space: My Response time is generally 10 to 30 minutes, as I pick up any enquiries on my phone.  You get 1 bedroom with your OWN private luxury bathroom situated in a 2-bed, modern top floor apartment, which is set within the canal-side development Milliners Wharf.  The room has a floor to ceiling window and benefits from great views over Manchester city centre. The room has had very occasional use and can be considered new. The apartment has a contemporary design – plenty of glass for light and space, stylish balcony garden overlooking the canal, and high spec interior.   There is a nice sense of community within Milliners Wharf and it comes with the added bonus of a 24 hour on site concierge.  The apartment also offers a slice of heritage – hat-making was a fine Manchester trade and Milliners Wharf sits on the site of a former hat box factory.

neighborhood_overview: A splash of waterside living – the beautifully refurbished Ashton Canal flows alongside bringing you a share of peace and calm. The apartment is located right next to the New Islington Metro stop.  The Urban Exchange is a 10 minute walk away, where you will find a supermarket and gym, which can be used on a pay as you go basis of £5.  The buzz of city centre Manchester is a beat away.  You can walk to Manchester Piccadilly Station (10 mins), the City Centre (10-15 mins) and Northern Quarter (10 mins) .  Ten min walk to Eithad stadium.  So it's ideal for anyone visiting for the football and concerts.

space: The space measures approx 12ft by 25ft so is very large, and is currently set up as a living room with sofa and TV, and a bed room with desk like an apartment. Great for a couple or a small family

Great for a couple or a small family Guests will have access to front and back garden, car parking space, private room, shared kitchen, bathroom and wc.  All shared areas are cleaned weekly by me. There is also a portable bike in our shed which guests may use,  I do ask smokers to stay in the back garden. There is no smoking in the house. I'll usually be in my room downstairs or round the corner at my sisters house. If you need someone urgently just knock on Barry or Charlies door and they'll help you out. Otherwise ring me on (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). The house is beautifully close to the no
neighborhood_overview: The house is beautifully close to the northern quarter famous for its trendy bars and restaurants, only 5 minutes  from the Etihad Stadium where Manchester City FC play and only 15 mins from the city center and Manchester Piccadilly train station.  Lovely quiet area made up of mainly families and children, so if you stay out late, please be quiet when you return.
notes: As the room advertised is my bedroom,  I usually leave some of my personal belongings in the drawers or cupboards, if your staying for a long time and would like a bit more draw space just let me know.  Also 11pm is the cut of point for overly loud noise on a week day as we all work.
transit: The house is exactly 20 mins away from Manchester airport in a taxi.  2 mins on the 219 bus from Piccadilly Gardens. 15 minutes on foot from Piccadilly train station. And about 20 mins on foot from the university campuses on Oxford road. The house is perfectly situated for any keen cyclists and we also have a spare bike in the shed. Only 4 mins on a bike into the city center!
host_about:

Always up for a chat and looking for a new holiday destination.

Happy travels!!  :)

name: Relaxing Apartment in City Centre
summary: Stay in the up-and-coming Ancoats area, close to the heart of Manchester's industrial past, it's ever-expanding nightlife and serene surroundings of the Ashton Canal.
space: The building is known as 'Chips' and was designed by award winning architect Will Alsop. The apartment is spacious, minimal and comfortable. Ideal for a relax after a day of exploring the city or a long business trip!
description: Stay in the up-and-coming Ancoats area, close to the heart of Manchester's industrial past, it's ever-expanding nightlife and serene surroundings of the Ashton Canal. The building is known as 'Chips' and was designed by award winning architect Will Alsop. The apartment is spacious, minimal and comfortable. Ideal for a relax after a day of exploring the city or a long business trip! I rent out the spare bedroom, and you will have this private room to yourself during your stay. This includes the bed suitable for one guest. Bedding will be prepared for your arrival. Note that the bathroom and living/kitchen areas are shared with me, as the apartment is my primary home. Although I often work late, stay with friends or stay out at the weekends, I do not recommend booking if you require a private apartment. You can use any of the amenities in my apartment from the bathroom and living/kitchen area, such as the TV, Stereo, Playstation and WiFi. As I live in the apartment, you may see me around
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in Ancoats, an area in the north of central Manchester known for being its connections to the Industrial Revolution. This area is undergoing a building revival and walking along the canals will highlight the mix of old industrial and modern architecture. Within a 15 minute walk you can be in the Northern Quarter; Manchester's bohemian hub of independent restaurants, bars, shops and music venues. This is where you are likely to find me!
notes: You are more than welcome to use any cereals, juices, bread, teas, coffee or milk that are in the kitchen at any time. Note that stocks may be low during your period of booking, so feel free to make any special food shop requests if required. Clean bedding, towels and shower gel are supplied to every guest.
transit: I live opposite the New Islington Metrolink tram stop (only 1 stop to central Manchester), providing transport links to the wider train network and Manchester Airport. An Aldi supermarket is located within a 10 minute walk. Walking along the canal will get you to Piccadilly Train Station and the City Centre within 15 minutes.
host_about:
I work as a Town Planning Consultant in the centre of Manchester, where I have lived for 3 years now. I grew up in Bolton, a town on the periphery of Manchester, and so I am very familiar with this great city!  

I love travelling with friends and we use Airbnb regularly as an alternative to cramped, soulless hotel rooms. As such, I have a fair idea of what a unique and exciting Airbnb experience should be like as a way of ensuring I provide a welcoming and friendly experience for my own guests.

space: Bright and nicely presented double room in a 2 bedroom modern apartment with balcony (third floor). The room has a floor to ceiling window overlooking a canal. The price includes breakfast. Full access to the shared living space, which includes an open plan living room and kitchen, and a bathroom located directly opposite the room that is of your
neighborhood_overview: New Islington is situated between the Ashton canal and Rochdale canal in Manchester city centre. It is a really friendly neighborhood, full of young professionals and characterised for its mixed modern arquitecture and canals. At the heart of New Islington sits Cotton Field, a great water park with open spaces, sitting areas and beautiful swans and ducks. This is combined with the New Islington marina, which is always full of quirky boats. There are a number of local amenities nearby, including cafes, shops, gym and supermarkets. The Etihad Stadium, home ground of the Manchester City Football Club, is just a few minutes away too.
notes: N/A
transit: The main Manchester city centre areas and the trendy Northern Quarter are at walking distance from our apartment. However, if you do not fancy walking or want to travel a bit further, the following are the alternatives we recommend for getting around: Tram - The New Islington tram stop is part of the city centre area and is just in front of the main gate of the building (tram every ~5 min). A weekly pass that will get you unlimited travel within the city centre area costs £6.60. Train - Manchester Piccadilly station is just 10-15 minutes walking distance or 3 minutes away by tram. It has direct connections with Manchester airport (travel time 15-20 minutes from Piccadilly) and with most of UK main cities such as Liverpool, London, York and Leeds; although there are plenty of things to visit and experience in Manchester! Bike - You are welcome to bring your bike. There is a free and safe cycle storage available in the building. Car - There is a free and safe parking space in the buildin
host_about:
We are a friendly couple from Spain that has been living and working in different cities of the UK for the past few years. We moved to Manchester over a year ago, fell in love with the city and decided to finally settle!

We are both engineers working full time, but also enjoy offering our spare room to travellers and professionals. We do our very best to make our guests feel at home and help them have a great experience in Manchester.
      
We look forward to hearing from you!

Noelia & Adrian

description: A modern apartment in the city centre of Manchester. The comfiest bed you will ever have! A lovely community space near the famous Northern Quarter. About 10 minutes walk from Piccadilly train station and the city centre. Depending if I'm around, I'm available as much or as little as a guest would like. I know the neighbourhood and Manchester well, so able and happy to share tips on restaurants, bars, etc. Will always be available on the phone for whatever query and happy to help with any issues as I live next door The neighbourhood is up and coming with lovely architecture and newly refurbished mills from the industrial revolution. Ancoats is famous in Engels writing and used to be where the Italian and Irish community live. There is a lovely marina and canals next to the flat. So if you enjoy a run, this is definitely a good spot. Feel free to ask me more on this. Today it's only a few minutes from the hipster and cool Northern Quarter area and round the corner from the flat, Vivid c
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is up and coming with lovely architecture and newly refurbished mills from the industrial revolution. Ancoats is famous in Engels writing and used to be where the Italian and Irish community live. There is a lovely marina and canals next to the flat. So if you enjoy a run, this is definitely a good spot. Feel free to ask me more on this. Today it's only a few minutes from the hipster and cool Northern Quarter area and round the corner from the flat, Vivid caffe has probably the nicest Thai food that you will try in Manchester and a great selection of IPAs. A Costa coffee, Dominos, Aldi and Pure Gym are also across the road.
notes: There is no parking available although there are 6 free spaces on Vesta street and there is also a large (although non very good looking) car park at the end of the road. It is £2 per day.
transit: The New Islington tram stop is just a 2 minute walk across the canal. Piccadilly Train station is a 10 minute walk and with the flat being so close to Great Ancoats street, you are very close to any of the motorways around Manchester. The flat is also only a 20 mins (and usually maximum £20 taxi/uber drive) from the airport
host_about: I love Manchester, music, travelling and meeting new people.

space: Absolutely stunning two double bed apartment in new islington. Canal view from all rooms. Secure parking included. Chain free property. Milliners Wharf is situated in the constantly developing New Islington. New Islington is fast becoming the place to buy on the direct outskirts of the city centre. The development is built in Manchester's historic hat making district, hence the name Milliners Wharf. The apartment is stylishly appointed throughout, has been extremely well cared for by the current owner and looks as new. This apartment has 679 square foot of space, is located on the second floor and benefits from canal views.
