Located in a great newly developed area called New Islington next to the famous Manchester Canal and walking distance to the Best area in Manchester The Northern Quarter! As the commercial and cultural capital of Lancashire, Manchester is a noted center for the arts, media, and higher education. Together with Salford and eight other municipalities it forms the metropolitan county of Greater Manchester, in which some 3 million people now live. Like Liverpool, Manchester has undergone something of a modern day Renai
notes: This apartment is located in a residential apartment block (this is not a hotel apartment block) therefore all queries on the apartment or building should be directed to me on the mobile provided. Check in is from 3pm unless otherwise arranged and we appreciate a guide to your expected arrival.  To ensure a smooth check in please contact us 1 hour before arrival on the mobile number provided. We must insist that you refrain from playing loud music and anything else that could result in the disturbance of your neighbours, anything less than the above could result in you losing your deposit.  I hope you understand...
host_about:
For more than 10 years now we run apartments for short term rental in Warsaw as well as in Manchester  UK and Marbella in Spain, where we run real estate and live for most of the year.
We are certain that you will find a suitable apartment with us, that will fit your needs. if you need an airport pick up or car hire  we can arrange that. City guide for sightseeing? No problem. A trip to Cracow or any other place in Poland? Done. We will do our best to fulfill your expectations.
Warsaw seems too cold in  winter? Come and visit us on the Costa del Sol in Spain! :)

W naszej ofercie na pewno znajdziesz apartament  odpowiadający Twoim wymaganiom. Potrzebujesz odbioru z lotniska lub  chcialbyś wynająć auto? Żaden problem. Zwiedzić z przewodnikiem nie tylko Warszawę, ale też np. Kraków? Załatwione. Można zamówić dodatkowo śniadania dostarczane przez firmę cateringową, możesz zamówić masaż relaksujący, zakupy, pakiet powitalny itp. 
Nasze biuro w Warszawie postara  się sprostać wszystkim Twoim oczekiwaniom! Zapraszamy! :)

name: Beautiful City Centre Apartment
summary: Located on the edges of Manchester City Centre, this modern yet cosy mill conversion apartment is within walking distance to Manchester Piccadilly station and perfectly positioned beside the city's major transport system, 'Metrolink'.
space: This beautiful, modern and self-contained apartment is part of what was a fully operational mill. In a nod to NYC's loft-style living concept, this converted mill is sympathetic to its charming history and many of its original features such as high ceilings, steel beams and exposed brickwork have been lovingly restored.  Inspired by the simplicity of Danish style, this space is fairly minimalist throughout.  The kitchen/diner and lounge is open plan and spacious with a large window which lets an incredible amount of light into the apartment.  In the bedroom, white cotton bedding adorns the double bed and fresh towels will be provided at no extra cost. There is also a desk which doubles up as a workspace area and a hanging rail complete with hangers for your belongings.  The bathroom is spacious and has been fitted with stylish fixtures: bath, shower, sink and toilet. It also has a large mirror and marble shelf for toiletries and personal care.
description: Located on the edges of Manchester City Centre, this modern yet cosy mill conversion apartment is within walking distance to Manchester Piccadilly station and perfectly positioned beside the city's major transport system, 'Metrolink'. This beautiful, modern and self-contained apartment is part of what was a fully operational mill. In a nod to NYC's loft-style living concept, this converted mill is sympathetic to its charming history and many of its original features such as high ceilings, steel beams and exposed brickwork have been lovingly restored.  Inspired by the simplicity of Danish style, this space is fairly minimalist throughout.  The kitchen/diner and lounge is open plan and spacious with a large window which lets an incredible amount of light into the apartment.  In the bedroom, white cotton bedding adorns the double bed and fresh towels will be provided at no extra cost. There is also a desk which doubles up as a workspace area and a hanging rail complete with hangers for yo
neighborhood_overview: The new and upcoming 'New Islington' neighbourhood - where we are located - is often referred to as a 'visionary' neighbourhood. It is particularly unique in that it balances close proximity to the hustle and bustle of the city centre and famous football stadia with the serenity of its peaceful canals, walk and waterways nearby.  Within ten minutes you can find yourself at the heart of the infamous and ultra cool neighbourhood, the Northern Quarter where you'll find cafe culture well and truly alive as well as a plethora of independent shops,bars and restaurants. We're also just two tram stops from Manchester City's football ground, the Etihad Stadium.
notes: Please place your towels in the bath after use.
transit: Points of interest (on foot) 1) Etihad Stadium - 0.8 miles (1.3km) 2) Manchester Piccadilly train station - 0.8 miles (1.3km) 3) Northern Quarter - 0.7 miles (1.2km) 4) Piccadilly Gardens (City Centre) - 0.9 miles (1.5km) If you don't fancy the walk, the whole of Manchester is connected by its convenient tram network, Metrolink. We are positioned directly opposite New Islington tram stop where the city centre and beyond is easily accessible.  Trams are every ten minutes and network maps can be downloaded from Metrolink's website.
host_about:
Hi all,

I'm Valerio (originally from Italy), Manchester is now my surrogate home. I work in academia and am finishing a PhD within the Economics field. It's commonplace for my research to take me out of the country which means my home is sitting empty and I would therefore like others to enjoy it as much as I do. 

I'm very passionate about food and travel and love to explore new places all the time.

When hosting, I would like for guests to feel welcome and at home, and to fully enjoy their time in this fair (if sometimes rainy) city of Manchester. But don't let a little shower put you off - it really is an incredible place to be! 

"The thing is, it all comes from here." Noel Gallagher on Manchester

Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions. 

I hope to see you soon!

Valerio

host_about:
I am a fun loving, laid back, genuine gal.  I love to travel thus available to rent my apartment which I love! It's my peace haven, my stylish hub to relax in after a long hard day at work with a glass of vino looking out at my lovely view with my I-pod cranked up (neighbours are cool!).  I go to the Northern Quarter in Manchester a lot as I do like to socialise with friends and get out and about to local gigs. I love cooking and enjoy my open plan kitchen to chat with friends whilst cooking.  I have sky with full film package as I do love a good film from an Action Thriller to a good ole chick flick, as long as it's not Marley and Me!!! 

My moto in life is to have an adventure each month so if that's packing up and visiting a random place for the weekend or even venturing into a new bar another time then that is perfect for me.  

I would like to visit as many cities as possible through my life and since turning 30 I am having a challenge a year - living with a Tribe last year for 10 days, this year Ben Nevis and possibly do the penine way next year.  Live life and have fun.

space: Cozy modern apartment. Comfortably fits 4. Nice quiet block. Rarely any noise from other residents in the block. One bed is a sofa bed in the front room that sleeps two. The other bed is a double bed in the bedroom. On the edge of Manchester vibrant city. Walking distance or £3 in a cab.

Located 550 yards from Manchester Arena in Manchester, this apartment features a balcony with city
neighborhood_overview: Located 550 yards from Manchester Arena in Manchester, this apartment features a balcony with city views. The apartment is 0.9 miles from Deansgate.  A dishwasher and an oven can be found in the kitchen and there is a private bathroom. A flat-screen TV is available. Other facilities at the Apartment include a balcony  Canal Street is 0.9 miles from the Apartment, while The Opera House is 1 miles from the property. The nearest airport is Manchester Airport, 9.3 miles from the property.
notes: Parking is available yet it is not joined to the building it is on the street outside. Please take note everyone from the block parks here. You will always get a spot but sometimes it may be a bit further up the road. One bed is a sofa bed. If you are sleeping in separate bed it is a must you let us know prior your arrival so we can have the bed sorted for you. .
transit: Local bus and metrolink 5 minutes walk City centre is walking distance.  Local cab firm (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)

summary: This beautiful and spacious house is our whopper! And it is perfect for use by larger groups of people or families who are travelling to Manchester. Furnished to a very high standard. Can accommodate up to 22 guests.
space: This beautiful and spacious house is our whopper! And it is perfect for use by larger groups of people or families who are travelling to Manchester. Furnished to a very high standard and offering a sleeping configuration of three double beds, two double/single riser bunk beds, one single/single riser bunk bed, two single beds, a double sofa bed and one single sofa bed, this house easily and comfortably accommodates 22 guests. There are two family bathrooms and an En-Suite bathroom with a shower. The kitchen is fully equipped with all of the mod cons that you would expect to find in your own home and there is a large conservatory complete with extra sofas and a dining table for meal times making this the perfect home away from home experience.

summary: Hi and welcome to my home  This is a comfy one bedroom apartment located in a quiet area 5 minutes' walk from the city centre. The apartment can accommodate 4 guests at a push but would be more comfortable for a couple or a group of 3.
space: One bed apartment - spacious, well furnished and well equipped for a few night's stay in the city centre 1 double bed in the bedroom (sleeps 2) 1 sofa in the living room (sleeps 2) *extra inflatable mattress can be provided on request  Open plan living room with dining area and well equipped kitchen including cutlery, crockery, toaster, kettle, coffee maker (Nespresso) Flat screen TV is provided with freeview channels and WiFi is free ***Please contact me for discounts on 2+ nights stays*** There is also a lovely little balcony with the view to a fountain and gardens so the apartment is very quiet and peaceful day and night

name: Self contained 1 bed flat.
summary: A conveniently situated, double bedroom apartment on a private estate one mile from Manchester City Centre.  Recently refurbished, it provides a self-contained, tranquil space whilst being close to city centre and all that Manchester has to offer.
space: This private, self-contained, one bedroom apartment was renovated and redecorated in autumn / winter  2015. It has a stunningly new bathroom, new flooring and new furniture throughout. Well-proportioned rooms and high ceilings make for a great space to relax and unwind in after a day in the city, ideal for a single traveller or couple.  There is Wifi internet access in the flat which is linked to our account The kitchen is fully equipped with fan oven, halogen hob, externally vented cooker hood, kettle, toaster dishwasher etc. There are pans, utensils, and plenty of crockery if you wish to stay in and cook at home. Alternatively a variety of restaurants, pubs and take-away cuisines are only a short walk away.  Although Manchester may not be most famous for its sunny weather, there is a shared courtyard to the rear of the property with a bench and plant pots with various shrubs / bamboos which you are more than welcome to venture out to, should it take your fancy. neighborhood_overview: Waterloo Park is a private estate built in the 1930's and refurbished in the 1980's. There is one main driveway, which cars can easily access and a second larger access gate, which we have a key to open if required. The estate sits in its own mature grounds and a team of gardeners tend to the whole estate. It is safe, secure and well lit. It is a generally quiet place but with good road links. We are very close to the city centre with all the restaurants, shops, bars, clubs and amenities Manchester has to offer. We are also close by to the National Football Museum Media City, Imperial War Museum and Lowry Theatre. The flat is excellently situated for access to Salford University, North Manchester General Hospital, Central Manchester Hospital and both of the major Manchester Universities. Likewise the Etihad Stadium and the Sportcity Complex.  Manchester Fort is less than 1/2 a mile away with shops including TK Max, Boots, Marks and Spencer's Simply Food etc.
notes: This private, self-contained, one bedroom apartment was renovated and redecorated in autumn 2015. It has a stunningly new bathroom, new flooring and new furniture throughout. Well-proportioned rooms and high ceilings make for a great space to relax and unwind in after a day in the city, ideal for a single traveller or couple.  The kitchen is fully equipped with fan oven, halogen hob, externally vented cooker hood, kettle, toaster dishwasher etc. There are pans, utensils, and plenty of crockery if you wish to stay in and cook at home. There is also a deep freeze available should you wish to use it. Alternatively a variety of restaurants, pubs and take-away cuisines are not far away.  Although Manchester may not be most famous for its sunny weather, there is a shared courtyard to the rear of the property with a bench and plant pots with various shrubs / bamboos which you are more than welcome to venture out to, should it take your fancy. The property is double glazed throughout and for a
transit: Taxis are easily hailed or ordered, any time day or night. The bus stop into city centre is opposite the flat with regular services. Taxi fares from Manchester Piccadilly to the flat are typically around £7-8.  The nearest Metrolink station is Manchester Victoria. We are within walking distance of the Manchester Arena and Manchester Printworks (approx. 15 mins at a steady stroll)
host_about:
I have lived in Manchester now for 25 years after coming to cover a six month job. I work at University of Manchester . I have a husband - Dan and we have been together 20+ years. 
We both enjoy travel and have been to may places - we currently enjoy cruses and like the days at sea as much as the shore visits. 
We enjoy eating in at home and out - Dan is a vegetarian and I eat meat. Likewise books, films, and we are both arvid watches or Coronation Street which is filmed in Manchester.

name: Manchester Centre Double Room
summary: A Boutique Hotel situated in Manchester, close to Manchester City Centre. The building is a magnificent listed historic Victorian property, formerly owned by The Earl of Derby, and has a fascinating "Downton Abbey" history.
space: Highly Convenient Location close to Manchester City Centre. A refurbished Boutique Hotel, a Victorian house with many original features. A complementary Continental  Breakfast buffet is served. Situated in Cheetham Hill, Manchester, 5 minutes walk away from the City Centre and Phones4U Concert Arena.  It is on the First Floor of the newly refurbished Media House Hotel. It is perfectly situated to enjoy the many attractions Manchester City Centre, the nightlife, and surrounding area. Getting around is easy as the Metrolink and bus services stop immediately outside the Hotel, providing quick and easy transport to Manchester City Centre and surrounding areas. Travelling from Picadilly station, Victoria Metrolink station is a short walk away and travels throughout Manchester, including to the City Centre, Old Trafford - Manchester United Football Club. name: CITYCENTRE modern quiet balcony gym
summary: Modern apartment at the Green Quarter. 5 min walking to Arndales shopping centre, Victoria Station, Deansgate and the Northern Quarter. Fully equipped kitchen, washing maschine, free WIFI and balcony. Parking available near by. 1 bed room, 1 bath room, living room, kitchen, storage. Elevator available.
space: Cozy, modern place, fully equipped, balcony, gym, pool, very well located.
description: Modern apartment at the Green Quarter. 5 min walking to Arndales shopping centre, Victoria Station, Deansgate and the Northern Quarter. Fully equipped kitchen, washing maschine, free WIFI and balcony. Parking available near by. 1 bed room, 1 bath room, living room, kitchen, storage. Elevator available. Cozy, modern place, fully equipped, balcony, gym, pool, very well located. It is a two bed room apartment with two bathrooms. You will have 1 bathroom and 1 double bed room for your private use. In case I am in town during your stay (that's rather not the case, but could be) we will share living room, kitchen and the balcony. In case it matters to you weather I am at home while you stay please ask me in advance and I will let you know as I know my schedule very well. For any questions you can contact me anytime. Once you have booked you will receive a guide line by email explaining all necessary things to you and providing my full contact details. First of all, there is a co-operative fo
neighborhood_overview: First of all, there is a co-operative food store in the same building, so in case you've forgotten anything it is quite convenient to buy it downstairs. They sell almost everything what you need for daily life.  The Radisson Hotel is also next door. There is a SPA, gym & pool in the Radisson Hotel and you can use is (fees apply). You also can request any service at the hotel, such as ironing (there is an iron and a board in my apartment), business centre, etc. (fees apply).  The NQ4 (Northern Quarter) is just a few steps away. It's famous for al its bars and clubs, Printworks, etc. You can get food late in the night over there and have a fantastic evening.  If you like to go out for a fancy dinner I recommend Deansgate and Spinningfields. There are many decent places to enjoy, to many to name them.  The Manchester Arndales is the biggest shopping centre in the city centre.   It is linked to Selfridge next door.  If you like football you will find Old Trafford and Etihad Stadium quite c
transit: The apartment is next to Victoria Station (5 min walking) and Shudehill Bus Station (10 min walking). Piccadilly Gardens is also quite close and Piccadilly Station is no more than 15-20 min walking or £5-6 by taxi.  You can arrange a fix fare with Streetcar Manchester from/to Manchester Airport. The fix fare is £20-24 depending on the day time you travel.  You will reach Liverpool Airport by bus from Shudehill within 50 min. (be aware the bus could be delayed due to heavy traffic), a return ticket with (URL HIDDEN) is £12. If you plan a trip to London you will reach Euston within 2:08 hrs. and Edinburgh within appr. 3 hours.
host_about: Hi there! I am traveling a lot for business so I give my apartment for short stays. I might be at the apartment myself during your stay, but I might be traveling as well. In this case my cleaner will give you the keys. I am used to have guests and I don't mind you coming home late or having a cigarette on the balcony. Feel free to ask any question.

name: Double room with afternoon sun
summary: It's a sunny room in my home on a quiet estate just outside the city centre. It overlooks the garden. The house is only three miles outside Manchester, with great bus and tram links. It's pretty close to lots of green spaces like Heaton Park.
description: It's a sunny room in my home on a quiet estate just outside the city centre. It overlooks the garden. The house is only three miles outside Manchester, with great bus and tram links. It's pretty close to lots of green spaces like Heaton Park. You can have the run of the house except my room. There are lots of buses from Rochdale Road that take you straight into town, it's about a 7 minute walk- left out of the house, through the cut through then right. Walk to the end of the road (there's a Co-op along there for groceries too), then right and across the road.  The nearest tram stop is Crumpsall, it's about a 17 minute walk- turn left out of the house, then left at the end and down to the main road. Walk up the hill to the left, at the top there's a crossroads. Turn right and keep walking and it's on the other side of the road. Trams are about every 6-12 minutes. It's about 10 minutes into town.

summary: Up for grabs is one lovely double bedroom in our friendly house!

description: Up for grabs is one lovely double bedroom in our friendly house!  The room is clean, quiet and light, a peaceful space overlooking the back garden. It is furnished with a comfy double bed, wardrobe, chest of drawers and large mirror. All bedding and towels are provided. We're very happy for you to enjoy the rest of the house including the large bathroom and the living/dining room. Our kitchen is fully equipped and we are happy for you to cook a meal or simply make yourself a cup of tea. Our patio garden is a great place to enjoy breakfast in summer.  The house is on a quiet, safe street with a gated alleyway to the rear. There's free on street parking at the front of the house.  When we're at home we happily hang out with guests as much as they like. We're a 5 minute cab ride away from Manchester's buzzing neighbourhoods Didsbury and Chorlton with their many shops, bars, restaurants and cafes. It's a 3 minute walk to the bus stop on Wilmslow Road. Buses run every few minutes, 24 hours,

space: The Pad has been designed (by us!) with luxury, comfort and elegant touches for the overnight guest or guests (2 max). With a palette of greys and pops of colour, the room is warm and welcoming as well as super stylish.  The bed is wonderfully comfy, the furnishings unique and bespoke, and the kitchen well equipped for an overnight stay or longer.  The images reflect the high standards of the accommodation, which also benefits from a beautiful garden area downstairs. Lots of drawer and clothes hanging has been included, surface areas for your bits and bobs, plus there is a freeview TV and wireless internet.  And the most gorgeous rocking chair this side of heaven ;)

You could come for a weekend in West Didsbury and not have to leave, it's that great but Manchester is only a short bus / tram ride away. Check out (URL HIDDEN) for details of the area around The Pad.
notes: We can help arrange meals, taxis, etc, just ask :)

neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is located in Fallowfield. This is probably one (if not the best) neighborhood in Manchester. The neighborhood is mostly students as the university is located closeby * 5min walk from Pubs (The 254, IQ Fallowfield, WhetherSpoon, Revolution) * 10min walk from Grocery Stores (Tesco Express, Sainsbury's) * 10min walk from bus stop * 10min walk to Lloyds Pharmacy * 10min walk to Starbucks, Macdonalds, Domino's Pizza
transit: Buses ((PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)) will take you to the city centre in 30 minutes at most. Bus 43 going to the other way will directly take you to the Manchester Airport Please note that Magic Bus (£1 ride) are running frequently on this road as well. Weekly bus pass you can buy from the driver - we would recommend getting megarider = £13.50 for 7 days. That entitles you to unlimited bus rides A cheaper alternative would be £7.50 for 7 days with Magic Buses 142/143, they're both pretty frequent, run every 3-5mins
host_about:
Hello,

I'm Dylan, originally from a small town of Brittany (France), I then, moved quite a lot. Moved to Sheffield (UK) for a few years before experiencing the Canadian life in Toronto for another few years. I finally decided to move back closer to my roots and settled in Manchester.

I personally enjoyed meeting people from all over the world and learned a lot about cultures in different countries.

I practice different kind of sports, but Football is what I play the most (huge fan of Olympique de Marseille for those who have any idea about the French Ligue 1). 
I also play Tennis, Squash... I run a lot too. I heard it's the best way to keep in shape.

Anyway, I'm really easy going and I'm sure we'll get along. I'm also really available in case you'd need any help to find your way around the city or would like to know the "places to be" in Manchester.

neighborhood_overview: Withington has everything you need on the doorstep - banks, libraries, cafes, restaurants and bars.  It is also a stones' throw from the very cosmopolitan Didsbury - with every kind of drinkerie / eaterie you can imagine just 10 minutes walk from the front door. It's a safe neighbourhood, with walking around past midnight being no problem whatsoever. There is a park on the same road with benches and picnic tables, and an even bigger park just a 15 minute walk away.
transit: Situated 2 minutes walk from Wilmslow Road and the 'busiest bus route in Europe' getting around couldn't be easier! The bus into town takes approximately 20 minutes. Alternatively, the tram is just a 10 minute walk and will take you into town in 10 minutes. We are a 5 minute drive from the M60 motorway.

neighborhood_overview: The area is mainly filled with young adults and post-students so the crime rate is quite low. That said, crime happens in all cities so please be safe. The flat is a stones throw away from the main highstreet, which contains wonderful independent restaurants, cute bars and boutique shops, along with the essentials such as a supermarket and a post office.
notes: If you have a laptop, I would recommend bringing it for the TV. I supply one if not.
transit: Bus and tram stops are located a few minutes walk away from the flat, which provide links to both Manchester Airport and Manchester city Centre, with the tram journey to either destination taking only 10 minutes. The neighborhood is located just off the M60 ringroad and motorway network, which puts all of Manchester and the North West easily within your grasp. The Lake District, North Wales, Peak District, Yorkshire Dales, Liverpool, Chester, Leeds, York and Blackpool are all less than two hours away by car.

name: Double bedroom  ensuite Bathroom
summary: Located in West Didsbury off Burton Road you will find a friendly welcoming home within a large Victorian Semi detached house. close to all amenities and the trendy West Didsbury.  clean warm and with every facility your stay will be pleasant.
space: This bedroom is a large double with its own en-suite Bathroom. The room and En-suite is on the first floor of a 4 floor house that includes cellars. the house was built in 1893 and is Victorian with all the usual period features you might expect. it is also tastefully refurbished to make it more comfortable and pleasant to live there. The bedroom has the benefit of a wall mounted TV, fridge, coffee and tea making facilities. There is access in the house to a washing machine and clothes can be dried on the washing line (subject to the weather!) Guest are welcome to sit out in the landscaped and lawned garden. the accommodation is situated on the first floor of a large Victorian semi detached house in which the owner and his wife live on the second floor. name: Big Quiet Room close to M60 & Tram
summary: You will find the room big, bright and quiet. Newly decorated with plenty of space as well as tea/coffee making facilities. Use of a separate, equally bright living room, with all  modern conveniences can be arranged. High Speed Fiber Wifi included.
space: We are warm and welcoming and you will be included as much or as little as you feel comfortable with.  We provide Egyptian cotton towels, bathrobe and slippers. The room has tea and coffee making facilities, as well as fresh filtered water. You will have a choice of pillows, feather, memory foam, firm or soft and a down and feather duvet. An inviting chaise longue for relaxing and reading is also provided. If requested we can offer a static exercise bike and/or a vibration plate. A black out blind and curtains make sure you have a relaxing undisturbed sleep. For the dog owners we can provide a dog bed and bowls.

There is also a small, but well groomed backyard with a deck and sitting area, w

notes: Animal friendly, non homophobic, would be preferred,  we have very friendly rescue dogs.  A light breakfast can be provided. Our own happy hens provide us with fresh eggs everyday and from next year on we shall have our own honey also. In the meantime home made jams will have to do :-)
transit: We are in walking distance to the tram station (Failsworth) that takes you via 4 stops directly into the city centre. Access to the M60 is within a mile.

name: Large sunny room, 7mn to Piccadilly
summary: Bedroom on top floor to yourself, with double bed, wardrobe, corner closet, desk, large coffee table, pot plants, rocking-chair + bookcases. Sunny and large.  In 2-storey South Manchester flat 7min away from city centre.  2 housemates + 1 lovely cat.
space: We live above a newsagent/shop on Albert Road in South Manchester (M19). To access this flat you climb up a pretty steep flight of steel steps off the alley next to the railway bridge. It's no problem for most people, but if you have particularly bad hips or knees, or a real terror of steep flights of steps, it might not be for you!
description: Bedroom on top floor to yourself, with double bed, wardrobe, corner closet, desk, large coffee table, pot plants, rocking-chair + bookcases. Sunny and large.  In 2-storey South Manchester flat 7min away from city centre.  2 housemates + 1 lovely cat. We live above a newsagent/shop on Albert Road in South Manchester (M19). To access this flat you climb up a pretty steep flight of steel steps off the alley next to the railway bridge. It's no problem for most people, but if you have particularly bad hips or knees, or a real terror of steep flights of steps, it might not be for you! You are free to roam between the kitchen, living-room, bathroom, hallway, and your bedroom. If Sophie is away, you are likely to only interact with one person, Ben. The two other residents (each in a similar bedroom to your one) are Sophie and Ben: we are brother and sister. We are quite happy to help you out and can readily text you if you need to ask about something and we're not in. (Sophie is a PhD research
neighborhood_overview: The off-road Fallowfield Loop runs west from Levenshulme to Fallowfield and Chorlton and north-east to Gorton: head across Albert Road and down Marshall Road, then past the school and left down onto the Loop. Going a few minutes north-west, you'll come to Highfield Country Park, the site of an old clay pit and now (since 2008) a nature reserve. The "Manchester" page on Wikivoyage is: (URL HIDDEN)
transit: We live right next to Levenshulme train station, which means that it takes no time at all (think 7-8 minutes) to get to the centre of town (Manchester Piccadilly). In many ways it's faster to get into town from here than it is from almost any other neighbourhood (most don't have train stations).  Next train to Manchester / last train back today (URL HIDDEN) / (URL HIDDEN) The 192, 191, and several other busses go up and down Stockport road (less than a 1-minute walk away) and can easily take you to and from the centre of town. In addition: the 168, 169 and 197 busses stop right in front of our address (in front of the shop). For all of these, you can get a Day Rider or a Mega Rider (week-long pass).
host_about: Hi! I'm Sophie. I'm a researcher at the University of Manchester and the other person who lives at this address is my brother, a quiet musician called Ben. We both speak completely fluent French, in case you are francophone and would like the extra comfort of that! We're pretty hospitable and are always very helpful to people staying with us, but we also keep ourselves to ourselves. We look forward to meeting you and welcoming you to Levenshulme.

neighborhood_overview: The house is on a quiet leafy residential street right in the heart of Levenshulme. It's a friendly vibrant neighbourhood not far from the city centre, with loads of things to do. There's a local cafe serving delicious food and drinks a stones throw away, great curry houses, an artisan bakery selling the best sourdough, an antiques village and a local food market every Saturday.
notes: I've only just listed my space so I'm offering it at a special discounted rate to my first few guests to allow me to build up some hosting reviews. Get in early and grab a bargain!
transit: The house couldn't be better located, only 3 minutes walk from the station. Trains run four times an hour and it's only one stop - a 6 minute ride - to Piccadilly in the centre of Manchester. From there you can easily get to the airport, to Salford, Liverpool or further afield. One stop the other way takes you to Stockport and the beautiful Peak District beyond.  There are also plenty of buses and great cycle paths, many off-road. You can park your car in the driveway on request.

neighborhood_overview: A neighbourhood stretching along Stockport Road, Levenshulme has a bustling, close-knit community feel and is popular with families. The new Lev Inspire centre, built inside a refurbished church, has become a hub of community activities. The area has also seen a resurgence of new, independent businesses opening up alongside established ones such as Levenshulme Antiques Village housed in the historic former police station building. The annual Levenshulme Festival brings hundreds of free music, art, food and sport events to the neighbourhood each year. With a weekly market - (website hidden) and local restaurants and deli's including POD, Post Office Deli, just up the road from the apartment.

neighborhood_overview: Levenshulme is one of the most trendy suburbs of Manchester. Home to people of all walks of life, it is a very nice place to be. There is a weekly Levenshulme market every Saturday only 10 minute walk from the house, Antiques centre only 5 minutes walk, popular cafes such a Trove only 5 minute walk and beautiful park accessible at the end of the road.  Supermarkets, takeaways, cinemas and leisure centres all within easy access of the house.
notes: We have 2 very friendly outdoor cats, Ned and Dexter who live downstairs in the house.
transit: Manchester City centre is incredibly easy to get to through public transport. Levenshulme train station to Manchester Piccadilly is a 6 minute journey. Buses to city centre also run at the top of the street. Manchester Airport should cost around £12 in taxi. Fallowfield loop is only a 2 minute walk.

summary: Comfortable, cosy room with  double bed to rent to a single guest or  couple. My home is  full of quirky things and eclectic through out  A  traditional terraced house  on a tree-lined quiet avenue, 2 miles from city centre, and 6 miles from airport

My desire is you leave my home wanting to come back but also talking about your experience in Manchester  I share my home with the lovely Charlotte my step daughter who is 22 and Ben the dog. neighborhood_overview: Where I live is classed as South Manchester and can be described as very diverse, urban, arty and cool. Its mixture of students, single professionals, young professional families and   people who have lived here for generations. It's a real melting pot and everyone gets on very well. We are very near to the bohemian neighbourhoods of Chorlton and elegant Didsbury. They both   have great local independent cafes and bars. Alexandra and Platt Fields parks are nearby and are 2 fantastic vibrant and beautiful parks both within 5 minutes walking distance.  If you want to venture into the city centre, Manchester is one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe. There are plenty of music venues and great places to eat and drink [and I know them all well].There are no shortages of museums to visit and I recommend the Football Museum, John Ryland's Library, Whitworth Art gallery, Manchester Cathedral, and the Museum of Science and Industry.  Close by and within 20 minutes walking distance there
notes: I'm also a grandma and sometimes have my grandson staying over usually about once a week. As children are, he can be  loud and boisterous - so please bear this in mind.
transit: Lots of parking space outside my home. Metro link is 10 minutes walkaway.   The bus stops are 2 minutes walk away or a 5 minutes walk to Oxford/Wilmslow  rd where buses run every 2 minutes into Manchester City Centre. My home is 2.8 miles from Manchester City Centre and Piccadilly train station.
host_about:
Hi my name is Heather, I'm 48 years young and  a mother of two daughters who are 23  and 29 . I'm also a grandma.  I live with my youngest daughter Charlotte and very old staffie dog called Ben. . He loves people and is very friendly so I hope you like dogs. However he is too old and can't jump up anymore so won't bother you.

I'm quite a sociable person and  love going to music events, but prefer the small more intimate venue, of which there are plenty in Manchester. I have an eclectic music taste, but if I had to choose I would say reggae, soul and  funk are my favourites. I love eating out, and visiting  Manchester diverse range of restaurants. I'm also into meditation, and try and meditate most days. I'm active in my community and  a member of the local residents group.

I decided to become host after hosting for local language students studying nearby.  I genuinely enjoy sharing my home, and meeting and hearing about other people's experience and ways of life.  My language students described me as their English mum, however as much as I will take care of you I also know when someone wants to be left alone. I have also stayed as a guest on Airbnb in Berlin, my exceptional host made all the difference to my holiday.
My eldest daughter has travelled extensively, so my approach to hosting is to  treat my guests just how I  would expect my  daughter to be treated when she travels far and wide - with love, respect and TLC.

I was born and bred here so there is not much I don't know, about Manchester and  more than happy to share that with you. I'm very proud of my city, and all it has to offer. My desire is that you leave my home wanting to come back but also talking about your experience in Manchester

name: Modern Apartment & Secure Parking
summary: A moderately sized bedroom in a modern, stylish 2-bed/2-bath apartment; situated pretty central to Manchester, only minutes away from the Universities and Central Manchester hospitals on Oxford Road. Comes with secure parking included.
space: Guests will be able to relax in this peaceful apartment in the heart of Manchester and use this as a base to venture out and enjoy the many wonderful attractions of the city. The apartment comes with secure gated parking included in the price.  There is a TV with freeview. The Kitchen has all basic amenities and utensils. The bathroom will have towels and basic toiletries.  Note: guests can also access the ensuite to the master bedroom to use the shower facilities as there are currently none in the family bathroom. The bedroom has a large wardrobe, chest of drawers and a bedside table for your use. There is also space to store your luggage under the bed.

name: Convenient, friendly and homely.
summary: Minimalist double Room in an Edwardian period terraced house with a host who loves Airbnb and has a cute dog! Modern decor, comfy beds, quality linen. Ideal for Universities, hospital and town. 15 mins from airport by car , 20 mins from uni walking.
space: Hi there. Please don't be put off with cancellations. It's always due to work commitments and I've always given plenty of notice. I'm not a big chain hotel after all.  Thanks for looking at my listing. My house is set in a lovely tree lined street. I've taken the time to completely renovate my house and make it into the home I want to live in. I live here with Oscar my beautiful furry dog a miniature schnauzer.  The house is a lovely Edwardian Terrace that Manchester is Famous for. It's a fairly large house with plenty of room to work and relax. The house has a beautiful open and airy feel. it's clean and uncluttered and very comfortable. Please just relax and use the house, make yourself at home. I'm offering a double room for either  a solo traveller or a couple with a simple healthy breakfast.
description: Minimalist double Room in an Edwardian period terraced house with a host who loves Airbnb and has a cute dog! Modern decor, comfy beds, quality linen. Ideal for Universities, hospital and town. 15 mins from airport by car , 20 mins from uni walking. Hi there. Please don't be put off with cancellations. It's always due to work commitments and I've always given plenty of notice. I'm not a big chain hotel after all.  Thanks for looking at my listing. My house is set in a lovely tree lined street. I've taken the time to completely renovate my house and make it into the home I want to live in. I live here with Oscar my beautiful furry dog a miniature schnauzer.  The house is a lovely Edwardian Terrace that Manchester is Famous for. It's a fairly large house with plenty of room to work and relax. The house has a beautiful open and airy feel. it's clean and uncluttered and very comfortable. Please just relax and use the house, make yourself at home. I'm offering a double room for either  a so
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is a really mixture of all sorts of people and attractions. You'll find gentrified homes with university professionals and working class people living next to each other happily. You'll find a million different cultures and languages being spoken on the street. This adds to the exciting feeling of the area. Manchester is on it's way to becoming a world city. You'll love. like I have for the last 12 years.
notes: You've probably realised that I live with a dog Oscar, he never goes on furniture and never upstairs to the sleeping areas, so the house is always clean and tidy. He's a very friendly dog and no doubt will love to go on a walk with you if your want. Please have a Airbnb profile up and running. I'd like know a little about the person coming to stay. Maybe have a few references ready as well  as little about yourself and interests so I can suggest things you'll be interested in. The room is a double room, all linen and towels are provided so you don't need to pack these with you. Plenty of pillows etc. you'll sleep on a new mattress and have a lovely stay.
transit: The house is also well served By major bus routes. Picadilly bus station is about 20 minutes away with the bus stop 20 metres away from the house. Travel all day for £4.20 is you wish.  The bus is the 111. If you fancy the more tourist route you can catch the 142 bus from the same area and travel past all the universities and museums and curry mile. Stop off and get a falafel, shisha or a samosa if you wish. Stay on that bus to take you to the very trendy Didsbury for your latte.  The best thing about the location is the closeness to the airport. I live just 15 minutes away in car or taxi. That'll cost you about £15 to £20. If that's too expensive you can also get the bus number 43. That'll get you super close to my area and a very short walk to the house.  If you are driving there is plenty of free parking on the street with no competition for spaces.
host_about:
Hi I'm Narinder. Really excited about hosting people in my lovely home I share with Oscar, my wonderful dog.

Things I really like are; Spotify, walking the dog, vinyasa yoga, my job, meeting new people and eating out!

Things I couldn't live without are, my friends, exercise, good chocolate, coffee and of course my family including Oscar.

My favourite places to visit have been, Manchester of course, Mumbai, Tokyo, Barcelona, Ghent and Antwerp and Glasgow. All amazing places.

My favourite food  is really difficult, love eating everything. Really like Indian, Lebanese, Vietnamese and Italian. I wish every meal was Ice cream.

My favourite music is also very difficult to answer, I love everything from classical to pop. Currently listening to Sia and Portland Street Cello Project.

My favourite aspect of being a host is getting to share my home with new people and being a good host. I like to meet independently minded people who prefer to stay in home rather than hotel. My travelling experiences involve luxury to hostelling to couch surfing all very enjoyable. I like to travel to places to feel the real city rather than just the brochure. 

For a profession I'm a lecturer at a University in Geography Education so I'm well experienced to point you in the right direction to explore the great city of Manchester! What's my life motto.... Don't believe in luck alone!

name: Cosy Double Room, Manchester
summary: A cosy double bedroom apartment (penthouse) with a breathtaking view in Manchester. Easy access to city centre, Salford & Old Trafford with good public transport link & just walking distance to Rusholme Street. Free parking & 24 hours free WIFI.
space: 1) Third-floor, Stunning and Cosy Penthouse Apartment. Safe Neighbourhood. 2) One room equipped with one double bed is available. Many previous guests left the heater ON when there were not in the room. This is very serious matter, do act like you are at your house, bef
neighborhood_overview: 1) Secured apartment with gated parking spaces. 2) Third-floor apartment (penthouse) with lift. 3) Travelling by car/bus: Rusholme halal Restaurants - the Curry Mile Manchester - 5 mins Piccadilly Garden bus station-10 mins National Express Coach Station- 10 mins Picadilly train station- 10 mins Oxford Road train station- 5 mins Arndale Shopping Mall-10 mins Old Trafford Stadium - 15 mins China Town-10 mins University of Manchester-5 mins Manchester Metropolitan University -5 mins Alexandra Park -5 mins by walking
notes: It's a very privacy environment with a stunning view from the top of the apartment and refreshing air from the balcony.  I'm live here with my lovely wife. We will do our best to make your stay as smooth as it can. We will also glad to help you to fulfill any request or inquiries during the stay in our home. This apartment have two bathrooms, which one bathroom specifically allocated for guest without sharing with us. This will make our guest feel more privacy with their own space.  Please be considerate to not making too much noise, and ensure your own safety by using the door lock when you are using the bathroom or inside the room during the night. Pick up from/to Manchester Airport is available upon request for odd hours with reasonable charges. Children are always welcome. No extra charges for a kid below 3. Washer (washing machine) is available with extra charges (Please request first).
transit: Travelling by bus from Piccadilly Garden, bus stop 'M' to our apartment: *Bus 85-Alexandra Rd/Moss Lane East (Stop D) -- nearest stop to the apartment *Bus 86-opposite Chichester Road/Loretto College *Bus 15-Moss Lane West/Chichester Road (Stop C) Distance by duration from our apartment to local attractions:- By car/bus: *Piccadilly Garden bus station: 15 mins *National Express Coach Station: 15 mins *Picadilly train station: 20 mins *Oxford Road train station: 8 mins *Arndale Shopping Mall: 15 mins *China Town: 10 mins *Old Trafford Stadium: 13 mins *MMU University: 5 mins  *The University of Manchester: 5 -10 mins depend on faculty/campus Preferred by walking:  *Grocery (ASDA, B&M, ARGOS, Pound Stretchers) - 3 mins walking *Local fish market & superstore (halal) - 2mins *Local eateries (Pizza, crunchy Mc chicken, Caribbean restaurant, all halal) - 3 mins  *Local mosque/church  - 4 mins

neighborhood_overview: It's a proper cosmopolitan inner city neighbourhood. Full of British people whose heritage is from all over the world. Very local highlights include 5 mins from the world famous Curry Mile, 5 mins from the Whitworth Art Gallery when it reopens in the autumn, 10 mins from the City Museum with its Dinosaur and overstuffed walrus and Birthplace of the computer. Royal Northern College of Music, Contact Theatre, Manchester Royal Infirmary, Manchester Met and the University of Manchester campuses all within 10 mins and the city centre about 25 min walk away. However Oxford Rd, is Europe busiest bus route, so buses throughout the day and night serve both the city centre and South Manchester including the Airport!
transit: Very easy access to the city centre. Guests report the walk between 20 and 30 mins and there are regular buses from just outside all the the day and late into the night.
host_about: Lone parent with family home in Manchester, has 2 grown up children were living independently, current economic climate brings them home for a few months ( thats the plan!) Works in Edinburgh and Derbyshire, mostly with young people. Multi skilled creative, lover of life,a ceramicist, poet, playwright, director, producer, project manager, researcher........

name: Single Room in Three Bed House
space: I have a comfortable single room available. Where you can relax and stay rest assured you are in a safe and secure home. The kitchen and bathroom is new, clean and functioning with microwave and shower respectively. I also have a sleeping bag if there is 2 of you and one doesn't mind sleeping on the floor. There is a local bus network and the Curry Mile is just a 10-15 minute walk away. In addition there is cash machine around the corner, a grocers and much more. I am part of a local Community Allotment so if you're here on a weekend and find your self a free morning come along and join in! The room is fully furnished with a pillow and duvet (includes covers). Any other linen/items will need to be bought along with you. Sometimes people leave things in the room so feel free to use anything in the room :) Any Qs just drop me a mail!

neighborhood_overview: What I love about my neighbourhood is the diversity that you find on my street especially. I get on with all the neighbours I know and the others I've never seen!
notes: As I no longer live there I can't guarantee the current long term guests will have loo roll around so please if you use it, bring your own!
transit: There is a bus stop 2 minutes walk away that has a regular bus every 8-10 minutes, there is one nearer however that bus is once every hour. Best check tfgm online for further details as there is a bus stop 2 minutes away.
host_about:
I'm Mancunian born (near enough) and bred without the accent! Love being active, animals, nature, healthy debates, learning new things interacting with good people, eating nice food and enjoying life! Also I'm a practising Muslim, which means no alcohol, non halal meat or music however, I still know how to have a good time! My dog* and I would love to stay with some good people!

Best holiday in my last 29 years was Egypt, my sister and I back packed around it in 2 weeks and 2 days!

If you're not happy with something in life, CHANGE it :)

*my dog no longer lives with me however would come along for any trips I make in the UK.

name: Cosy apartment with cats & parking
summary: We are 15-20 minutes walk from Manchester Town centre, Gay Village, and close to Manchester United's Old Trafford, and we have free parking. We have 2 cats who will need feeding and looking after, you must be experienced cat lovers!
space: As travellers who love Air B&B, we love staying in places that have pets; it's like staying at home away from home.  This our home that we love, and we hope you'll love it too.  If you're not used to living with pets, cats in particular, then this place might not be for you - the flat will be clean but depending on the length of your stay; you may need to change the cat litter You have 2 double bedrooms (one king and one smaller double) with plenty of storage, as well as a sofa bed in the lounge. Sky TV is available in the lounge, and there is one TV in the main bedroom. We also have free wifi, a balcony (smokers welcome), and free secure parking. This apartment is on the 3rd floor with no lift so may be unsuitable if you have reduced mobility.

neighborhood_overview: Cool cafes, bars, great transport link right outside the door, local shop within 1min walk
transit: We can give you vouchers for free cab journeys, and there is a bus stop into town literally outside our door. If you are coming from the airport, you are about 20min away (£15-20 in a taxi) If you are coming from the train station, this would be approximately 20-25min walk or 5-10min in a taxi (£6-7)
host_about:
I share my home with my girlfriend Sophie, and our 2 house cats Theodore and Mimi. We loving living in Manchester, being so close the Old Trafford, and town; there's always so much to busy ourselves with! But we also love travelling, and so for the times we are away, we've decided to offer our flat out, and give others the opportunity to discover our wonderful city.

As well as being hosts, we frequently use Air B&B when we travel, so we're also up for house/flat swapping for a weekend here or there, just say hi! :)

neighborhood_overview: The Northern Quarter While Manchester's bohemian quarter is fast being discovered by the hordes, there are still plenty of cool, independent bars which haven't yet been tinged by the dreaded 'mainstream'. The main concentration of bars in the N4 are focused around the High Street/Thomas Street crossroads, but wander over to Tib Street and Oldham Street where you'll be rewarded with some great bars and clubs and a slightly more laid back vibe. Our favourites include 2022nq, Common, Cord, Centro and the excellent Matt and Phred's, where you can enjoy live jazz most nights of the week. Oxford Road Beginning at MMU's All Saints campus and heading all the way down to central Library, the Oxford Road corridor is awash with great bars and venues, and tends to carry the same laid back spirit as the Northern Quarter but with a slightly more studenty vibe. The Deaf Institute, Kro2, Odder, Sound Control and Space are all generally safe bets for a great night and good crowd.   Deansgate Locks Oppo
notes: like all major citys around the world manchester has its small share of criminals so be safe with your items like bags wallets jewlery and money try to blend in dont look like a tourist and dont look lost dont walk around with your mobile to your ear as there is a new trend for people on bikes to snatch them from you so go in a shop or bar and make a call i am happy to go anywhere with you if you are a lone tourist just ask
transit: Buses Greater Manchester has an extensive bus network operated by various commercial operators. All Transport for Greater Manchester information is comprehensive and impartial; provided independently to any of these companies. A list of these commercial operators can be found via the links on the left of this page, should you wish to contact them direct. Many buses start their journey or pass through a Transport for Greater Manchester operated bus station. If you are using one of our bus stations, look at the 'Bus Station Departures' link where you will find a list of the services using the bus station, together with a bus station plan showing the stands used by these buses. Timetables are available for all bus services running in Greater Manchester and can be obtained from local Travelshops, by post from Transport for Greater Manchester, ring (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) (calls from BT landlines cost 10p a minute, mobile and other landline networks may charge an additional tariff), or throug

name: Gay Hosts - Secure - Castlefield
summary: Based in Castlefield just 15 minutes stroll from the Deansgate Hilton along the cobbled tow path canal please be aware WE ARE NOT ON DEANSGATE. 100Mb Fibre Broadband free for you. One of the more desirable and fashionable areas with security and CCTV
space: Me, Myself and I (Paul) along with him (David), the two of us, openly gay, offer our double spare room to easy going Airbnbers! The apartment is in the historic Castlefield area off Deansgate next to the Bridgewater Canal. It is an historic area regenerated with a feeling of not being in the city as it escapes the noise and public of most of the city. The Apartment Block has won architecture awards for its design and build. Please note that this is a 15 minute walk from the main street of Deansgate so there is a short enjoyable walk to get to mine through some historic warehouses, some over 200 years old. This is one of the safest low crime areas of Manchester. Not one of my guests has ever reported to me of any trouble or concern in the two years I have been offering up the space.

neighborhood_overview: Cut through by the world's oldest industrial canal, studded with red brick warehouses and built on the partially excavated site of a roman fort, Castlefield Urban Heritage Park is an area that wears its past well. It is also an area that speaks volumes about Manchester's continuing ambition. Many of those old warehouses have been turned into upscale apartment buildings, while plans for the soaring Victorian viaduct to undergo a High Line-style garden. The constant chattering of trains and trams overhead forms a backdrop to the dominant silhouette of Beetham Tower. The 47-storey building is the tallest in the city by some distance. Visitors find the building particularly handy; it's difficult to get too lost when you have a 171-metre monolith to use as a reference point – it even used to hum tunes on a windy day.  Once a hub of industrial activity, Castlefield is now one of the city's most tranquil spots. That's thanks, in part, to its designation in 1982 as the UK's first Urban Heritag
notes: I do not prepare a breakfast but you are more than welcome to use any cereals, juices, teas, coffee or milk that are in the kitchen at ANY time at no cost to you. Clean bedding, sheets and towels are always supplied to every guest. Also more towels if you need them at any point as I do not ration you. Long term guests I will always change bedding once a week and hoover the room clean for you and you can help yourself to fresh towels when needed. Now with hyperoptic 100Mb Fibrebroadband
transit: I live right in the City Centre the nearest Metrolink tram stop is Deansgate Castlefield or Cornbrook if you have suitcases. I also am near the mainline Deansgate Station cross over the road follow the historic cobbles along the canal.

summary: This modern 2 bedroom apartment, with its boutique furnishings, boasts views along the river irwell. A peaceful location between Salford Quays and the City Centre. Close to the trendy bars of Castlefield Locks and 5 mins from Cornbrook Metro Station.
space: This fully refurbished 2 bedroom apartment is located on the 3rd floor  and benefits from exquisite views of the River Irwell, with the peaceful sounds of its natural waterfowls and the occasional rower or river cruise passing by! Manchester is famous for its industrial past and the backdrop of the metro trams that run across its infamous railway arches are a reminder of this. A south facing, open plan apartment, with floor to ceiling windows ensure guests have a wonderful view of a tranquil side of this buzzing cosmopolitan city. Whether its the start of a weekend or the end of a busy day, The Mill Residence is sure to provide guests with a relaxing experience. For bars & restaurants Castlefield Locks is a short 5 minute walk across the river, and a further 10 minutes and you'll reach Deansgate Locks. The Lowry and Salford Quays are just 20 minute walk away and the home of Manchester United at Old Trafford is just a 20-25 minute walk. For local attractions, our favorite is the Manches

Manchester is famous for its industrial past and the backdrop of the metro trams that run across its infamous railway arches are a reminder of this. A south facing, open plan apartment, with floor to ceiling windows ensure guests have a wonderful view of a tranquil side of this buzzing cosmopolitan city. Whether its the start of a weekend or the end of a busy day, The Mill Residence is sure to provide guests with a relaxing experience. For bars & restaurants Castlefield Locks is a short 5 minute walk across the r

neighborhood_overview: The Northern Quarter While Manchester's bohemian quarter is fast being discovered by the hordes, there are still plenty of cool, independent bars which haven't yet been tinged by the dreaded 'mainstream'. The main concentration of bars in the N4 are focused around the High Street/Thomas Street crossroads, but wander over to Tib Street and Oldham Street where you'll be rewarded with some great bars and clubs and a slightly more laid back vibe. Our favourites include 2022nq, Common, Cord, Centro and the excellent Matt and Phred's, where you can enjoy live jazz most nights of the week. Oxford Road Beginning at MMU's All Saints campus and heading all the way down to central Library, the Oxford Road corridor is awash with great bars and venues, and tends to carry the same laid back spirit as the Northern Quarter but with a slightly more studenty vibe. The Deaf Institute, Kro2, Odder, Sound Control and Space are all generally safe bets for a great night and good crowd.   Deansgate Locks Oppo
notes: like all major citys around the world manchester has its small share of criminals so be safe with your items like bags wallets jewlery and money try to blend in dont look like a tourist and dont look lost dont walk around with your mobile to your ear as there is a new trend for people on bikes to snatch them from you so go in a shop or bar and make a call i am happy to go anywhere with you if you are a lone tourist just ask
transit: Buses Greater Manchester has an extensive bus network operated by various commercial operators. All Transport for Greater Manchester information is comprehensive and impartial; provided independently to any of these companies. A list of these commercial operators can be found via the links on the left of this page, should you wish to contact them direct. Many buses start their journey or pass through a Transport for Greater Manchester operated bus station. If you are using one of our bus stations, look at the 'Bus Station Departures' link where you will find a list of the services using the bus station, together with a bus station plan showing the stands used by these buses. Timetables are available for all bus services running in Greater Manchester and can be obtained from local Travelshops, by post from Transport for Greater Manchester, ring (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) (calls from BT landlines cost 10p a minute, mobile and other landline networks may charge an additional tariff), or throug

Modern, stylish and well equipped, each of these bedrooms are a welcoming atmosphere with plenty of natural light, tasteful décor and a range of modern conveniences to ensure a relaxing and refreshing stay.

I aim to make your stay in Manchester as fun as possible.included in your stay is your laundry two meals a day and WiFi as well as clean bedding, towels and parking (private or street).

Your stay does include a lift back to the airport for a small tip just so you don't have the hassle of taxi guys charging you over the odds and public transport  running behind time :)but you need to arrange this when making your booking

notes: As this is my house and I live here, I'd appreciate a completed profile including photos before I accept any bookings - Thanks. For my foreign guests: If you need a UK SIM card for your phone, I have some available for a small fee (not including air time credit). Please request at the time of booking so I can make sure I have some in stock.
transit: Getting around is easy. By the time you've read this sentence, you could be at the nearest bus stop. By the time you've read this paragraph, you'd be at the nearest tram stop. host_about:
Things I like:
From the sublime to the ridiculous, spontaneous and outgoing, lets do something that you wouldn't normally do kind of guy, the things that make you tick, things that make you question and expand your understanding.

Mottos:
- Live life like someone left the gate open.
- You only live this life once, make the most of it.

Favourite Travel Destinations:
Fuerteventura, Spain, Switzerland, Scotland.

Favourite Music:
Something I can dance my socks off to and dance like no one is watching.

Favourite Food:
Thai or Spanish.

Things I like doing:
Anything from abseiling to cinema to scuba diving. If there's something to try/do, I'll probably say yes!

neighborhood_overview: - Our home is round the corner from Hulme Park. A gem in the spring and summer months, Hulme Park has facilities for basketball, football, skating, children's playing area, walking, or just sitting on the grass and chatting.  - We are within walking distance of convinience stores and an ASDA supermarket. Nearby you will also find takeaways, Hulme High Street, a Post Office, a Vegan Cafe and Kim by the Sea which serves good food all day as well as provide wifi and a comfortable atmosphere
transit: Stretford Road is 3 minute walk away and from here you can catch buses to virtually anywhere.  Deansgate Tram stop is also close by which makes the iconic Salford Quays and Media City very accessible. Here you can enjoy music and theatrer at the Lowry, get active with watersports in the Quays and enjoy food and shopping along the Quays and at the Lowry Outlet.  Depending on your preference you can walk or bus (we usually walk) into the City Centre and visit places like Matt and Phreds Jazz Club in Manchester's alternative Northern Quarter. The centre is also home to a variety and voume of shops to keep even the most addicted shopaholics happy. The clubbing scene is strong for those who fancy a little bit of dancing.  Deansgate, Castlefields and Spinningfields are all easy to walk to and boast enough bars, restaurants, clubs, pubs and shops to keep anyone busy and happy for ever and ever.  For those who like history and culture there is no shortage of museums and galleries nearby. The M
host_about: I am married to a beautiful Irish woman, Aoife. We live in Manchester where Aoife is finishing off her undergraduate degree in French and European Studies. I am a furniture maker and I run a little workshop round the corner from our house. I mainly work to commission, but do also produce small batch items.

name: River views with free parking
summary: Corner flat with huge balcony over looking the river Irwell  - spectacular views. A real hidden gem! Short enjoyable walk down the river to town, Media City or Old Trafford. 10 min walk to the famous Dukes 92 bar & 10 min walk to Cornbrook tram.
space: You will be staying with me and my fiancé, we want to be a great host & want to give you the opportunity to explore a truly wonderful city! Our flat is located just off Regent rd, Ordsall lane over looking the river Irwell with truly spectacular views. 10 min walk to Cornbrook tram where you can get any tram in any direction. 3min walk to Regent rd where you can find Sainsbury's, local shops, casino or treat yourself to a Mcd's or KFC. Our flat has 2 double rooms, 2 bathrooms, open plan spacious lounge & kitchen. Living room has 3 floor to ceiling window sliding doors making most of the natural light. Flats have electric gates & secure, free parking available.

neighborhood_overview: We are short walk (roughly 10 mins) to trendy Castlefield area with great bars, further 10-15 min walk & you will be in the city centre. If you walk in the opposite direction Media City, Old Trafford & LCCC (cricket ground) is roughly a 20 min walk. Peaceful walk down the river where you will see the local rowing club in action & canal boats. Loads of trendy bars around if you fancy a drink, home to the MOSI (Museum of Science & Industry), close to Man Utd or Lancashire Cricket ground. cheap as chips in a taxi if you having a late one.
notes: Please take extra care of the keys, gate fob is £50. If you lose the keys you will be required to pay the full amout to replace them
transit: Stroll down the river to Castlefied, City Centre, Media City or Old Trafford. If you not up for the walk Cornbrook tram is 10 min walk away, Old Trafford 1 stop, Deansgate 1 stop, Piccadilly Gardens 2 stops, Piccadilly train station 3 stops.  Cornbrook is the central hub tram station where you can get anywhere in any direction that you now can get to/from the airport. Bus stop 2 mins around the corner roughly 15 mins to town. If driving there is easy access to motorway networks via the M602. Free secure parking
host_about:
Hi Guys,

Layed back guy from South Africa, 30 yrs old :( & recently engaged to my gorgeous Lucy Gregg. 

My fiancé & I love to travel / explore & meet new people. We just wanna help our fellow travellers who feel the same way & welcome you into our home! 

Big sports enthusiast, literally can watch any sport! Play cricket & rugby myself, play some golf but not enough. We're pretty chilled, enjoy a good old pint occasionally & welcome anyone who wants to explore Manchester!

neighborhood_overview: Hulme has been announced greatest Neighbourhood of Great Britain. (URL HIDDEN) and Manchester has been announced greatest city to live in (URL HIDDEN) Hulme is an inner city area and electoral ward of Manchester, England. Located immediately south of Manchester city centre, it is an area with significant industrial heritage. Historically in Lancashire, the name Hulme is derived from the Old Norse word for a small island, or land surrounded by water or marsh. Hulme is south of Manchester city centre, beyond the River Medlock. The part of Hulme nearest to Old Trafford is known as Cornbrook from the Corn Brook, a tributary of the River Irwell. The Bridgewater Canal passes through Hulme. Public parks are St George's Park in the northwest and Hulme Park (29 acres)
notes: Hope you have a great time!
transit: Literally just up the road you shall find amazing public transport: Bus 263 (Arriva) Bus 250 Bus 265 Bus 53(Stagecoach) Bus 53 (Finglands) But, for a more wider description: 5 MIN away: Metrolink Trams Metroshuttle, 2 Piccadilly Place, Manchester Piccadilly Station, 111 Piccadilly Oxford Road Train Station 10 MIN away: Shudehill Interchange, Manchester Stagecoach Buses, Gay Village Finglands Coachways, Rushholme All major attractions are 5 MIN by Taxi, 10 MIN by Public Transport or 20 MIN walk away from the apartment, such as Piccadilly, Oxford Road, UoM, Arndale, Deansgate Locks, Printworks, etc.  But the ones which are less popular, but hidden gems of Manchester and also maximum of 20 MIN walk away are:  - Museum of Science and Industry - Manchester United - National Football Museum - John Rylands Library - Manchester Museum - Cornerhouse - People's History Museum - Imperial War Museum North - Manchester Cathedral - The Trafford Centre - Manchester Arena - Heaton Park - Chinatown Man
host_about:
Hey future friend! My name is Azeem, originally from Amsterdam the city of love and education. 

Currently studying in Manchester trying to become a barrister at a private Law School located on Oxford Road. 

Do you love Sky Channels, WiFi, Netflix, Good cook, Great host, Deansgate Locks, Hilton, Manchester United, Oxford Road and all other major Manchester attractions? Make sure to come and stay here in Hulme. 

Located on Stretford Road, it has gorgeous public transport facilities taking you from Manchester Airport to all the major attractions. I am also an event-manager, and as you can see in my reviews, if I will not have time to show you around Manchester myself, then if you happen to stay here with me whilst I have a gig, I shall make sure that you will be there as an Access All Areas ticket. 

If I am not around, all major attractions are 5 MIN by Taxi, 10 MIN by Public Transport or 20 MIN walk away from the apartment, such as Piccadilly, Oxford Road, UoM, Arndale, Deansgate Locks, Printworks, etc. But the ones which are less popular, but hidden gems of Manchester and also maximum of 20 MIN walk away are: 
Museum of Science and Industry, Manchester United, National Football Museum, John Rylands Library, Manchester Museum, Cornerhouse, People's History Museum, Imperial War Museum North, Manchester Cathedral, Manchester Arena, Heaton Park, Chinatown Manchester, Royal Exchange Manchester, Museum of Transport, Manchester Art Gallery, Manchester Town Hall, Whitworth Art Gallery, Urbis, Palace Theatre, Bridgewater Hall, Wheel Of Manchester (Will be taken off mid-june 2015), Manchester Jewish Museum, The Hidden Gem, Granada Studios, Manchester Opera House, Fletcher Moss Botanical Garden, Band on The Wall, The Ritz, Belle Vue Stadium, Centre for Chinese Contemporary Art, and many many more!

Apart from that, sit back, relax and enjoy your stay! 
PS: If you stay here, I shall give you 46 reasons as to why Manchester is the greatest city on Planet Earth!

host_about:
Male, very friendly, out-going, helpful, good cook, fun to be around.

I am Offering an excellent central location close to Piccadilly Gardens, within easy reach of a fantastic range of shops, bars, restaurants and entertainment venues, these two homes in Manchester provide an ideal base for any visitor. Whether your stay is on business or for pleasure, l have two great locations with convenient transport links nearby, so that everything you need is close by.

Modern, stylish and well equipped, each of these bedrooms are a welcoming atmosphere with plenty of natural light, tasteful décor and a range of modern conveniences to ensure a relaxing and refreshing stay.

I aim to make your stay in Manchester as fun as possible.included in your stay is your laundry two meals a day and WiFi as well as clean bedding, towels and parking (private or street).

Your stay does include a lift back to the airport for a small tip just so you don't have the hassle of taxi guys charging you over the odds and public transport  running behind time :)but you need to arrange this when making your booking

notes: I class myself as Gender Fluid.What this means is that at times I dress & appear as a woman.I tend not to 'Dress' at home ,but will at times.I practice a daily Meditation in my living room so that area will be off limits for an hour or so.

host_about: I consider myself Transgender/Gender Fluid.I believe in having a Healthy lifestyle i.e Good Diet = Vegan Mainly Organic with some raw foods ,greens/juices ,Regular Exercise I practice Chi Kung,Yoga & I also cycle most places.I enjoy cooking,playing Guitar, Dancing,Good Conversation,Live Music,Films ,Reading.I believe we are here to understand ourselves/heal which in turn allows others to heal... =)

name: Stay at a Hippie Haven
summary: Hi! This is a large apartment in Hulme, which is close to Manchester city centre. We are a gay couple but as we are away during Pride this year, we thought we would let out our home out over the bank holiday. It's not a shiny showhome, but it is quirky and there is a lovely energy about the place as we have had a lot of great times here. There are two double bedrooms and one single bed, with space for one more on the sofa. There is SKY TV, wifi and a sound system. Make yourself at home!

name: Peaceful vegan flat
summary: An artist-owned green oasis with good connections & parking just fifteen minutes from the city centre. A warm, quiet and comfortable flat that looks out onto trees and blends quirky old furniture with a minimalist design ethic. Good (vegan) food, home comforts & coffee always a priority. Last minute bookings only!
space: A calm oasis owned by a musician & just minutes away from the bustling city. Sleep in a comfortable bed and enjoy waking up to birdsong and good coffee on the small balcony. Read, eat, rest, explore, make yourself at home.  NB: Please read note at end before sending a request! You'll be staying on the top (second) floor of a low-rise, late 1940s block containing just three flats. The flats were originally council flats but were taken over by a 'social landlord' a few years ago. Since then, the kitchens and bathrooms have been replaced, double glazing and a new heating system has been installed in all of the flats. I have also put in laminate flooring & the flat's decorated in pale colours / white.   The flat has two bedrooms, a small kitchen, bathroom, an office / third bedroom and a large and sunlit living room. Due to the fact it's from the 1940s, the flats have a slightly deco feel to them and if you look out along the road from the balcony you'll see that they're set at a gentle cu
description: An artist-owned green oasis with good connections & parking just fifteen minutes from the city centre. A warm, quiet and comfortable flat that looks out onto trees and blends quirky old furniture with a minimalist design ethic. Good (vegan) food, home comforts & coffee always a priority. Last minute bookings only! A calm oasis owned by a musician & just minutes away from the bustling city. Sleep in a comfortable bed and enjoy waking up to birdsong and good coffee on the small balcony. Read, eat, rest, explore, make yourself at home.  NB: Please read note at end before sending a request! You'll be staying on the top (second) floor of a low-rise, late 1940s block containing just three flats. The flats were originally council flats but were taken over by a 'social landlord' a few years ago. Since then, the kitchens and bathrooms have been replaced, double glazing and a new heating system has been installed in all of the flats. I have also put in laminate flooring & the flat's decorated in
notes: IMPORTANT: Please note! I am unable to accept booking requests any more than a couple of weeks in advance due to the nature of my touring work & commitments. I need to be there to let you in & also to ensure high standards are kept up! ; ) if you'd like to stay, please do get in touch but be aware that I can't give you a yes very far in advance! I really want to make sure your stay is a happy one!
transit: Manchester's very flat & easily walkable. It's a short walk into town from the room & a brand new arts centre called Home is just a stone's throw away, as are the Universities & two swimming pools.

neighborhood_overview: The new European city break destination? Manchester, the UK's second city, is home to 2.6 million people, is going through a massive renaissance and is a fast riser amongst the major European city break destinations. In 2004 there were 88 million tourism visits to Manchester, only beaten in England by London. The city is also tied with Edinburgh for second place in terms of international visitors. So what does Manchester have to offer? Does it deserve it's status as one of the fastest growing city break destinations in Europe? Lets have a look at what there is to find. Museums and Galleries Manchester has one of the broadest selections of museums and galleries in the UK, including some of national standing as well as the only national millennium project for the arts. Listed below are the best on offer. heatre & Concerts Whether you're into the contemporary scene, are more a fan of classical music or simply want to catch a show, Manchester has something to suit everyone's taste. Two sym
