summary: Bright and clean 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom loft in Castlefield, Manchester City Centre, M15 4NU. With character and charm, please do make yourself at home in this top floor loft apartment.
space: Welcome to my apartment, built inside a converted 1920's Art Deco warehouse by Urban Splash. Upon completion it won the RIBA Architecture Award, it really is a lovely building! Bright, spacious and airy this south west facing top floor loft apartment boasts original features; evoking Manchester's rich industrial heritage whilst also showcasing beautiful modern fittings like a cubic glass bathroom and underfloor heating. The semi open plan nature of the apartment creates a great feeling of space whilst also inventing little pockets and areas to help you go around your daily business, and pleasure. With 2 double beds, a sofa bed and 2 bathrooms the apartment can comfortably cater for up to 5 people, but please ensure you're comfortable with the semi open style living space before booking! The galley kitchen features an oven, halogen hob with extractor fan, microwave, toaster, kettle and all the utensils and pots and pans you could dream of. There's even a dishwasher to stop pots piling u

neighborhood_overview: Castlefield is a wonderful, historic and picturesque area of Manchester City Centre. It's safe, quiet and quaint.  The immediate area outside my apartment consists of a cornershop (McColls) with free cash withdrawal, two cafebars/restaurants (The Banyan Tree and Binary Bar) all within 60 seconds of the front door. There is a nice feeling of community, seclusion and safety. There is a larger supermarket (Sainsburys) a 10 minute walk away if you wanted to stock up on provisions. Castlefield is built on an ancient Roman Fort, and was designated as a conservation area in 1980 and the United Kingdom's first designated Urban Heritage Park in 1982.  There's is plenty to see and do, with the Museum of Science and Industry just up the road, you can truly submerge yourself into Manchester's Industrial History, have a walk along the canals, and sit on a bench and feed the ducks, or the aggressive geese! There's even an outdoor carpark a 20 second walk from the front door.  The car park charges: B
notes: Longer stays are welcome, please message for pricing.
transit: You're only a 2 minute walk down the Canal towpath to the Castlefield Basin and a whole plethora of quaint bars, restaurants and cafés. Be sure to get down to Duke's early if the sun's out! Grab some lunch and sit and eat at the Roman Forts and soak up a bit of heritage. You're a 10 minute walk from the hustle and bustle of Deansgate, Spinningfields, The Gmex, The Beetham Tower, HOME, The Palace Theatre and Oxford Road Station. You're never more than a 25 minute stroll to Piccadilly Station, Victoria Station, Canal Street, The Northern Quarter and The Arndale/Market Street.  Head towards Salford, and you're a 25 minute walk to Salford Quays, or 30 minutes to Old Trafford. Don't feel like walking? The free bus shuttle service runs outside the Museum of Science and Industry. The Metrolink Tram service runs here there and everywhere from the Deansgate-Castlefield Tram Stop, just 2 minutes from Castlefield Basin allowing easy access from Manchester Airport Tram Stop.  It's a 5 minute bus r

neighborhood_overview: It's a great location because you're close enough to the city centre, without the noise! Less than a minute walk to a great couple of bars which have gorgeous food (including all day breakfasts), a ping pong table and mix of decent beers. There is also a corner shop that provides all the basic supermarket stuff. If you're feeling lazy McDonald's is about 8 minute walk away, and very close to a Sainsbury's, TK Maxx and Boots Chemist. We're also happy to give takeaway food recommendations if you don't feel like cooking.
notes: You're welcome to help yourself to tea, coffee or hot chocolate in the cupboard.
transit: We're just about a 10 minute walk from Deansgate with more clubs, bars, restaurants and shops. Uber taxis are easily available and you can usually get one in less than a few minutes.  If you let us know if you're driving, taking a train or a flight we can also let you know the cheapest/quickest possible way to get here.

Hello! My name is Grace, I'm 29 and currently taking some time out of work to study an MBA. I love movies, travelling (as most AirBnB people do!), Thai food, pub quizzes, art... I like to keep busy and explore new places when I have free time.

I live with my girlfriend Victoria who is a scriptwriter. She enjoys fitness, movies, wine and is currently learning to cook.

name: Friendly, near city, with parking
summary: Our 3 storey town house has the living room on the top floor with a great sense of space and light.  We are 1 mile from the city centre, very close to local amenities (Supermarket, take aways, local shops) with regular transport links to the city.
space: The bedroom is a standard double room on first floor, with plenty of wardrobe and drawer storage, recently decorated.  The living room and kitchen are on 2nd floor - a great social space with dining area, two balconies and surround sound TV.
description: Our 3 storey town house has the living room on the top floor with a great sense of space and light.  We are 1 mile from the city centre, very close to local amenities (Supermarket, take aways, local shops) with regular transport links to the city. The bedroom is a standard double room on first floor, with plenty of wardrobe and drawer storage, recently decorated.  The living room and kitchen are on 2nd floor - a great social space with dining area, two balconies and surround sound TV. Guests can access the bedroom and the communal areas of the house - living room and kitchen, main bathroom, downstairs cloakroom and laundry room. We are very friendly and happy to interact with guests as much as they like, but we also understand that some guests value privacy, which we also completely respect.  We are happy to help with local info and will cook and eat together if that is the kind of thing you'd like to do.  We are happy to be led by your wishes. Hulme had quite a reputation in the 1980s
neighborhood_overview: Hulme had quite a reputation in the 1980s - the local history is interesting and can be studied at various local arts centres and public spaces.  It underwent a huge process of regeneration from late 1990s and has become a really great place to live.  A real mix of cultures all living alongside, a range of shops and services as a result.  I have lived here for 12 years and have a real affection for the place, which only continues to improve.
notes: Manchester is a great city for culture and fun.  The house is perfectly situated to be just out of the hustle and bustle of the city, but near enough to access all the excitement easily.
transit: There are 2 bus routes through Hulme that travel between the city centre and Chorlton - the nearby area that has lots of bars and restaurants (and hipsters!).  A taxi into the city costs around £5.  We are also close to Manchester United, Manchester City and Phones For You Arena - all within a £10 taxi ride.
host_about:
I work as a mentor for young people and like to explore the world!

As a host
I live in a lovely house with housemate Tom.  He's a musician and I'm in the creative sector, so between us we have plenty of tips about where to go and what to see.  We are always interested to meet new people and are happy to spend as much - or as little - time with you as you would like.  We both know the ins and outs of Manchester and will gladly help out with a bit of local knowledge.

The house has plenty of ornaments and stuff I've collected over the years (You've noticed the mermaid tail in the pictures, I suspect!) including some offensive crockery.  It's not a 'showroom' house, but we do try to keep things tidy.  We hope you'll feel comfortable and warm whilst you stay with us :)

As a guest
I rent rooms in my house out myself so I feel I can understand a renter's perspective.  I always treat anywhere I stay as if it were my own - actually a bit better if I'm honest!

name: Spacious 2 Bedroom Loft Manchester
summary: Stunning and secure loft apartment just minutes from the city centre in quiet, professional surroundings.
space: Large (c 1200 sq ft) architect-designed loft apartment in Castlefield, Manchester city centre.   Please Note: the apartment is in a quiet residential block and is not available for parties or noisy social events. 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms + 1 double sofa Bed in living room available, so I can accept up to 5 - 6 guests.  The apartment has been designed with a modern, open plan format, so the two double bedrooms (which are physically separate) have no doors as such but private corridors which lead to the  main room  - so you may need to reassure yourselves that you are comfortable with this style of living before booking.  The property retains many original features including exposed brick walls, steel roof beams and large windows. Internally the property is spread over approx 1200 sqft with an impressive split level lounge and kitchen area measuring approx 600sqft. Externally the apartment has a walled balcony accessed from the living area which overlooks the communal gardens and canal. T

neighborhood_overview: Castlefield is one of the oldest parts of Manchester with a number of well-preserved Roman remains just a short distance from the apartment. The Museum of Science and Industry is also close by. There are bars and cafes within a 100 metres, and within 5 minutes' walk any number of cafes, bars, pubs and restaurants. You walk pretty much out of the apartment into the city, but when you want peace and quiet after a long day (and nights!), enjoying Manchester, the apartment provides as much peace and seclusion as you might need
notes: It's also very close to Man Utd football ground, and a little further on, Old Trafford cricket ground. The Manchester City ground is easily accessible by metro (light rail). Walking distance to all the main attractions
transit: The apartment is basically at the edge of the city centre, and all parts of the city are easily accessible by the canal towpath which passes directly in front of the apartment. Metro/mainline train stations are within 10 minutes' walk for connections to Manchester airport and rail travel.

name: Double Room in Central Apartment
summary: A clean and tidy double room in Central Manchester available to working professionals and visitors.  All bedding is provided and I'll do my best to make your stay comfortable. If you have any questions just ask.
space: Double room featuring a good sized double bed with a memory foam mattress and will fit up to 2 adults. Facilities are available for self-catering between 10am-8pm.  I shall endeavour to be a most hospitable host to you.  Checkout is at 10am unless agreed otherwise in advance.  If you have any queries please do just ask.
description: A clean and tidy double room in Central Manchester available to working professionals and visitors.  All bedding is provided and I'll do my best to make your stay comfortable. If you have any questions just ask. Double room featuring a good sized double bed with a memory foam mattress and will fit up to 2 adults. Facilities are available for self-catering between 10am-8pm.  I shall endeavour to be a most hospitable host to you.  Checkout is at 10am unless agreed otherwise in advance.  If you have any queries please do just ask. Guests have access to the kitchen facilities between 10am-8pm.   Guests have 24hr access to shower/bath facilities.   We have our own off-street secure guest parking, very handy for walking into the city and not having to worry about parking costs. There is also a small balcony area for quiet cups of coffee, tea or hot chocolate (with or without cream and yummy marshmallows).   We also have a washing machine and dryer available for use if required. I'm a sociabl
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is generally quiet, clean, polite and respectful.  Our location is very good for getting around on public transport as we are very central, a mere 2 minute walk to the Royal Northern College of Music and both Central Manchester universities (MMU & UoM).   We are a 5 minute walk to the Manchester Museum of Natural Life.  We are also very well located for all major transport routes into and out of the city.   Buses travel regularly to and from the airport as well as to popular attractions such as The Trafford Centre, Old Trafford Stadium the home turf of Manchester United and Sale Water Park.  We are a two minute bus ride from Piccadilly Gardens and the famous Manchester Deansgate Hilton where you can enjoy a traditional cream tea in Cloud23 on the 23rd floor with views across of Greater Manchester.   The Anthony Burgess foundation is a mere 8 minute walk from us and we are very well placed for accessing many more Central Manchester attractions such as our sensational C
notes: I'm a 33 year old working professional (gentleman). I appreciate it if guests could be respectful of my home and of my neighbours.
transit: Public transport is sensational in our area.  Oxford Rd train station is a short walk.  Buses into Piccadilly Gardens or south to and from the airport to all locations operate regularly. The tram is also a short walk away.
host_about: I'm a 33 year old designer, I moved to Manchester from London just over 2 years ago.  I've been lucky to have visited some interesting places over the years and met many interesting people from a multitude of cultures.  Some of the best experiences and friendships I have ever had often started with meeting people whilst travelling.  As such I decided to join the social revolution of AirBnB and open my doors to host Manchester's guests.  Welcome to our city and home! I hope you have a great stay.

name: Cosy modern near central Manchester
summary: Cosy double room in modern townhouse shared with live in owner. Use of kitchen, living room, garden. Free parking. Wifi. Shared guest bathroom. Quite residential area close to local shops. 30 mins walk to City centre. Very good bus links.
space: Chic, Modern and tastefully decorated accommodation. One of two private rooms rented in three storey townhouse sharing communal areas with live in female owner.
description: Cosy double room in modern townhouse shared with live in owner. Use of kitchen, living room, garden. Free parking. Wifi. Shared guest bathroom. Quite residential area close to local shops. 30 mins walk to City centre. Very good bus links. Chic, Modern and tastefully decorated accommodation. One of two private rooms rented in three storey townhouse sharing communal areas with live in female owner. Free Wifi. Bedding, towels, tea and coffee provided.  Pet free and smoke free house but smoking is permitted outside in the garden. Communal areas are shared with me as live in owner however depending on my work schedule you might find you have the house much to yourselves.  Shared use of ground floor kitchen/diner includes all cooking equipment, crockery, cutlery, fridge/freezer, gas hob, electric oven, microwave, dishwasher, large dining table and six chairs, cupboard space for you to store your own food.  Shared use of ground floor utility room includes washing machine and heated clothes ai
neighborhood_overview: Quiet residential neighbourhood.  Local grocery shops and newsagents close by.  Big asda supermarket and several home stores less than 10 min walk away.  Independent local bar "Kim by the Sea" does great English pub food and Mediterranean mezze boards, approx 8min walk. The bar is opposite a small community garden centre, which has lovely nature gardens you can stroll round as well as buy plants from. The Hulme Community Garden Centre also runs special events from time to time which provide entertainment for all ages. Several local cafes and a post office are approx 10 minutes walk.  For more bars and restaurants either go to Manchester City centre or go to local suburb Chorlton (30mins walk/10min drive/15min by bus) which has lots of great independent restaurants, bars and artisan shops.  Two parks close by great for jogging. Also two gyms and a swimming pool within 10-15minute walk which you can use on a pay as you go basis.  Several bus stops within 5 min walk with frequent services
transit: Free parking in residents car park to rear of property.  Bicycles are welcome. There is a secure shed for them in the garden.  Many destinations are walkable. City centre is approx 1.5 miles walk. Approx 30 mins.  Several bus stops within 5 min walk. Frequent bus services to many parts of Manchester including City centre, Chorlton, Old Trafford, Media City Salford, Lowry Theatre Salford, The Trafford Centre. City centre approx 10-15 min bus journey. Single fare approx £2. Day ticket £4.50. Week ticket £13.50. Buses run until 23:00-00:00 week days, and until 02:00-03:00 at weekends. Many local taxi firms are cheap and reliable. Taxi to City centre approximately 8-12 mins and £5-10. Taxi to Manchester airport approx 15-20 mins and £20.  Manchester piccadilly rail station is just 2 miles away. Approx 35 min walk. 10 min drive. £8-10 in a taxi. Alternatively walk approx 6 mins to piccadilly bus station and take one of several buses. Bus journey approx 10-15mins. House is under 5 min walk f
host_about:
I'm a young professional musician. I have a job in a classical symphony orchestra in Manchester playing double bass. Don't worry I don't practise at home. 

I have been renting out my two spare rooms for the last few years to help with the mortgage, mainly to theatre professionals on short term stays. 

My work schedule is varied which means sometimes you'll have the house all to yourself.  Even if I am in the house there is plenty of room for everyone to have some space and I'm always very happy to socialise with guests. 

My hobbies include baking, yoga and gardening. I also enjoy watching films and theatre.

name: Walk into Manchester centre..
summary: 20 minutes walk to the city centre a light & spacious double room in 1930's style redbrick flat. Located in an area with a unique community feel and green space's this clean & cosy apartment is only 15 mins walk from University of Manchester & MMU
space: I love my flat and have worked hard to create a warm, comfortable and homely environment  - I hope you will find it a relaxing place to be. It is always a pleasure to meet new people and I am happy to suggest ideas for places to visit, recommend galleries, museums, walks or point you in the direction of a good café, restaurant or local bar. Manchester has been my home for many years, it's such a great city and I am happy to share any local knowledge which may enhance your visit.
description: 20 minutes walk to the city centre a light & spacious double room in 1930's style redbrick flat. Located in an area with a unique community feel and green space's this clean & cosy apartment is only 15 mins walk from University of Manchester & MMU I love my flat and have worked hard to create a warm, comfortable and homely environment  - I hope you will find it a relaxing place to be. It is always a pleasure to meet new people and I am happy to suggest ideas for places to visit, recommend galleries, museums, walks or point you in the direction of a good café, restaurant or local bar. Manchester has been my home for many years, it's such a great city and I am happy to share any local knowledge which may enhance your visit. You will have access to the bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, balcony with light use of the lounge. I will be home some of the time and happy to explain how things work and chat about your visit to Manchester. The area where I live is quite unique. The art deco style flats
neighborhood_overview: The area where I live is quite unique. The art deco style flats where actually built in the 1940's. There are just 3 streets in this design. The flat looks out onto Hulme park. The area area is conveniently close to the city centre yet has lots of mature trees and two community gardens. The neighbourhood is quite alternative with lots of artists, musicians and environmentalists etc living locally. There is a strong sense of community which I really appreciate. Within a short walk or 5 min bus ride are: HOME Mcr Arts cinema & theatre, Manchester City Art Gallery, Museum of Science and Industry, Royal Exchange Theatre, Spinningfields, Manchester University, Manchester Metropolitan University, Manchester Museum, Phones 4u Arena, the Bridgewater Hall, Palace Theatre, Cornerhouse cinema, John Rylands Library as well as the many and varied city centre shops of Market Street, St Anne's Square and Northern Quarter.
notes: I live a quiet life at home and so if you are looking for a party pad after a night clubbing - this won't be the place for you! If however you want a warm, comfortable and restful place to stay whilst you explore, work, shop or study in the city then please be my guest.
transit: The flat is near to Hulme Park, Castlefield, Deansgate and perfectly located for Manchester City Centre with Albert Square/town hall just a 15 minute walk away. HOME Mcr Arts cinema & theatre is a 5 mins walk. There a great transport links for all areas of the city, Old Trafford, Salford Quays, Media City, The Lowry Centre and the Trafford Centre. Manchester Oxford Road Station is a 10 minute walk, and Manchester Piccadilly a short bus ride.
host_about:
HI, I am Isa from Manchester, England. I love cinema, music, coffe & cake! I enjoy spending time with friends (and making new ones), I like to be kind and be around other gentle, thoughtful people. I love exploring new places and different cultures. I enjoy meditation, learning about myself and about life. Recently I took up photography and am still learning how to take good pictures. I have been grateful to be a guest in other people's lovely homes and now look forward to being a host myself. 
I've lived in Manchester a quarter of a century! I love the city and all it has to offer and always happy to help if you need directions or tips on where to do. I like my creature comforts too and enjoy a quiet life at home.

transit: Buses Greater Manchester has an extensive bus network operated by various commercial operators. All Transport for Greater Manchester information is comprehensive and impartial; provided independently to any of these companies. A list of these commercial operators can be found via the links on the left of this page, should you wish to contact them direct. Many buses start their journey or pass through a Transport for Greater Manchester operated bus station. If you are using one of our bus stations, look at the 'Bus Station Departures' link where you will find a list of the services using the bus station, together with a bus station plan showing the stands used by these buses. Timetables are available for all bus services running in Greater Manchester and can be obtained from local Travelshops, by post from Transport for Greater Manchester, ring (phone number hidden) (calls from BT landlines cost 10p a minute, mobile and other landline networks may charge an additional tariff), or throug
host_about:
Male, very friendly, out-going, helpful, good cook, fun to be around.

I am Offering an excellent central location close to Piccadilly Gardens, within easy reach of a fantastic range of shops, bars, restaurants and entertainment venues, these two homes in Manchester provide an ideal base for any visitor. Whether your stay is on business or for pleasure, l have two great locations with convenient transport links nearby, so that everything you need is close by.

Modern, stylish and well equipped, each of these bedrooms are a welcoming atmosphere with plenty of natural light, tasteful décor and a range of modern conveniences to ensure a relaxing and refreshing stay.

I aim to make your stay in Manchester as fun as possible.included in your stay is your laundry two meals a day and WiFi as well as clean bedding, towels and parking (private or street).

Your stay does include a lift back to the airport for a small tip just so you don't have the hassle of taxi guys charging you over the odds and public transport  running behind time :)but you need to arrange this when making your booking
there is now a £5 for parking the car for 24hrs

name: Quiet and spacious loft Manchester
summary: Huge apartment close to Manchester's new international arts centre, Home. Old Trafford, Manchester United's ground is less than a mile away. The apartment overlooks the Bridgwater canal which gives direct access to the city centre. Secure parking.
space: Very large (c 1100 sq ft) architect-designed loft apartment in Castlefield, Manchester city centre. Note: the apartment is in a quiet residential block and is not available for parties or noisy social events.  It has a great feeling of space, guests often comment. It's also very close to Man Utd football ground, and a little further on, Old Trafford cricket ground. The Manchester City ground is easily accessible by metro (light rail). Walking distance to all the main attractions (Manchester isn't a big city, so nowhere is that far away from anywhere else).  Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, one en suite. The first of award-winning developers Urban Splash' 'design your own' apartment initiatives, every one of Box Works'  apartments is completely unique. My apartment was designed by Urban Splash' own in-house architects.     In a converted warehouse with original industrial architecture (original brickwork and girders etc.) and modern fitments - including free-standing cubic glass bathroom -

host_about:
I'm a 32yo techie, born and living in Manchester, half-Chinese/half-English despite being paler than most Eurasians! An IT graduate, but now running a Home Care Agency looking after Older People in their own homes.

I couldn't live without my phone, a tv or my car!

With me as your host, you've got someone reliable and close at hand for any problems. I know Manchester inside & out, so if you're after a place to eat, drink, pamper yourself, play golf, watch football etc I'm your man. I'll be honest and up-front with you, tell you the pubs to go and the pubs to avoid, and even tell you the secret little places that I enjoy. I'm a bit of a foodie, so sharing these places with visitors is great, in the hope that you'll come back to visit Manchester in the future!

summary: Modern, newly decorated bedroom with double bed settee in very nice four bedroomed house in the Trafford area of Manchester.  House has a lovely kitchen diner and you will be living with us + one or two other people. Walkable into the city (20 minutes), 10 minutes by tram. Breakfast included! :)
space: This is very nice room with lots of light, there is a desk just in front of the window which looks out onto the yard. It is a study/music room so you will have access to a keyboard :). There is a good sized bathroom and the downstairs is an open plan living room diner with a dining table, sofa, TV (amazon stick and Apple TV) and various boardgames. Outside there is a private yard with chairs and table.
description: Modern, newly decorated bedroom with double bed settee in very nice four bedroomed house in the Trafford area of Manchester.  House has a lovely kitchen diner and you will be living with us + one or two other people. Walkable into the city (20 minutes), 10 minutes by tram. There is a good sized bathroom and the downstairs is an open plan living room diner with a dining table, sofa, TV (amazon stick and Apple TV) and various boardgames. Outside there is a private yard with chairs and table. You are welcome in all areas of the house. We are friendly people who are happy to help with your holiday/business trip. We have hosted homestays for several years and so are experienced in welcoming and supporting people find their way around. We both work full time but are around in the evening
neighborhood_overview: Trafford is a convenient place to stay as it is a 10 minute tram ride to the city. Close by in Chorlton we have some lovely cafes and places to eat, live music venues and really great bars, a local market selling handmade gifts, fresh produce, an organic food coop, a library, leisure centre and metro link with routes across greater Manchester :).
notes: We do have a cat called Jake, he wanders around not really bothering anyone other than to get a bit of fuss but worth mentioning in case you have allergies.
transit: There are three transport options: train, bus or bike. We are 5 mins from a very well linked train station, a frequent bus service runs along oxford road that runs well into the early hours and there is traffic free cycle route.
host_about: Relaxed, easy going, loves to travel. I really enjoy meeting new people, sport (biking, walking, climbing, squash), hanging out in coffee shops, reading, traveling on trains. I work as a lecturer in the UK in the education department of Manchester Metropolitan University.

neighborhood_overview: Levenshulme is a pleasant, edgy and bohemian up and coming leafy suburb of Manchester and in easy reach of both Manchester, 3 miles and Stockport, 4 miles. There is lots of green space with Greenbank Playing Fields and Ashton Vale across the road. Highfield Country Park is nearby.
notes: Plenty of eatries and cafe's in Levenshulme should you fancy eating out for breakfast
transit: From Stockport Road you can access buses and the train. Its 1 stop and 7 minutes into Piccadilly train station. 2 stops and 10 minutes to Stockport train station.  The 192 bus is very frequent and runs till 3:00am on a Friday and Saturday. Parking is on–street outside the house. There is usually plenty of space believe it or not and there are no restrictions or charges. Catch a local/Uber cab into town for £7-8 and black cab home at night for £10-11. There is also a bus service that can take you to Chorlton, West Didsbury and Ashton under Lyne where the IKEA is located. The M60 is close by, 2 miles to the East, junction 24. There is access to Trafford Centre without the use of the motorway, 30 minutes through Fallowfield, Chorlton and Stretford.
host_about:
Friendly, laid back, approachable and very helpful.

Enjoy life while you can!

Hi everyone
My name is Ejike and I am an easy going, friendly individual. I am of Nigerian heritage, and I was born and live in Manchester. My passions are art (especially like Banksy and Gustav Klimt), music, cycle touring, playing badminton, reading poetry and prose, watching films, practicing pilates, nature and the universe.
I like watching Big Bang Theory, Jamie Oliver's 15 meals, Houses under the Hammer, Nature programmes and generally any documentary showing on BBC4. Favourite films are I Claudius, Betty Blue, Italian for Beginners, Dune.

The bedroom has a double bed, and there is ample space on the carpet or sofa to accommodate extra people. The entire flat will be yours during your stay. The complex has it's own parking and a frontward, which are also open to use. P.S: If you are looking to book it between the 18th of December 2016 - 3rd Jan 2016, I will be in the flat and staying on the sofa in the living room, so this would be a booking for the bedroom, which has a double bed and ample space, and a door for privacy. I usually stay out of the flat so I won't be there to infringe on privacy but PLEASE NOTE it will not be an entire flat. I will always be available via email and text message, but because I am travelling myself, unfortunately will not be around to physically interact with the guests. Located right next to Victoria Baths, in a beautiful building, this flat
neighborhood_overview: Located right next to Victoria Baths, in a beautiful building, this flat is a great place to use as a base while travelling around the area. There are two public transport routes a short walk away, with easy access by bus to the city centre and other parts of Manchester. It is also very conveniently located near many local shops for groceries and other needs.
notes: I am renting my flat out while I am away on business so please note that there are some things that may be out of my control! If there are any issues during the stay, I urge guests to contact me and respond immediately, being of any help I can, but please understand at the same time, some things are very difficult for me being in another country. I send in my cleaners, and have to trust that they do a good job, so you are as comfortable as possible. For these reasons, I have priced it as cheap as I can so I ask that my guests amend their expectations accordingly. I wouldn't want you to be disappointed after having booked it and leave me a bad review so please understand this before you book! Also please note I don't provide towels because it is impossible for me to monitor the cleanliness and changing while I am away!

name: Small But Perfectly Formed House
summary: In the heart of the University Campus and next door to the MRI hospital, my small—but perfectly formed—house is in the perfect spot. Close enough for all the benefits of the city but also tucked away to enjoy the sanctuary of the quiet neighbourhood.
space: Please note: My house is a home—it's where I live—and not a party venue. I'm sure you'll respect that.  You get the use of the entire house for the duration of your stay. Recently decorated, it's the perfect size for an individual, couple or small group. With one generously size double bedroom, a sleek modern bathroom, comfortable lounge, well equipped kitchen, and garden space—you'll find yourself at home here. The space comfortably sleeps two people, but there are two wide sofas in the lounge that can sleep an additional two people or there is a double airbed (and plug-in pump) available on request. Ideally located for excellent transport links along Oxford Road (the busiest bus route in Europe!) or a short 15-minute walk into the City Centre for those brave enough to take on the Mancunian weather, my small—but perfectly formed—house benefits from both being close enough to feel part of the beating-heart of the exhilarating city centre whilst also providing the sanctuary of being hid

Ideally located for excellent transport links along Oxford Road (the busiest bus route in Europe!) or a short 15-minute walk into the City C
neighborhood_overview: Friendly Northern accents and cobbled streets, ambling about in Manchester sometimes you can feel like you've fallen into an Alan Bennett play. It's quite strange, before moving to Manchester I had never felt a sense of civic pride about a place, in fact I'd argue that to feel emotion towards geography would be quite absurd—yet since moving here for University a few years ago I have found myself flying the Mancunian flag in arguments amongst friends, defending its heritage and waxing lyrical about its musical contributions to the world. Big enough to keep your interest, always have something to capture your imagination and take you by surprise and yet also somehow small enough to feel welcoming and personal. I feel very fortunate to live in Manchester, the centre of the universe.
transit: Lots of regular transport options are available: busses down Oxford Road; trains to Manchester Piccadilly; Metrolink trams; and the airport just a stone's throw away, all make getting around incredibly easy. I suggest you use the CityMapper app to navigate your way around our brilliant local public transport system, or Uber if you're in need of a taxi. But for the most part I've found most places are within walking distance.
host_about:
Hello, my name is Nick Hurley and I'm a young web designer living in Manchester city centre, I fell in love with this city and just never left after moving here a few years ago for University.

I like cups of tea and nice typography.

summary: Renting out one double room. We share one bathroom, kitchen and living room. 10 minutes bus to town centre and supermarkets. 3 minutes to Subway, mcdonalds, burgers, convenience store and bus stop (buses approx 5am to 3am).
space: Last check out date is 25 MAY !! Dates after this would be REJECTED! I believe the room is spacious for most guests and enough for two people for short stay, but for the living room and kitchen would be a bit messy as shown in the photos.  You can store the food in the fridge and have simple cooking. After receiving some feedback from some guests, I believe it is essential to give you an idea about the amenities. We share the shampoo, facial wash, body wash and toothpaste together.  What I'm trying to say is I try my best to provide you the best that I can, I know I'm not the cheapest but I tried my best to serve every guest. It may sound rude but I just want to clarify some facts and you can choose a better host if you think my place is not good enough for you.  My price is low because I only host female and my timetable is not stable, therefore I confirm the check in and check out time with the guests before I accept the bookings, also because this is not a professional hostel. neighborhood_overview: Castlefield has a nice selection on very popular bars less than 100 meters from the apartment. You can also take the canal walk into town if you fancy the more scenic route and that would take you about half an hour.
notes: This is a residential block so it is pretty quiet. Please keep this in mind as the other residents are hard working families, couples and singles who need their beauty sleep!
transit: Taxi services are a quick and efficient way of getting around the city. Street Cars are reliable and the biggest taxi company. It costs about £20 to get a taxi from Manchester Airport.  Deansgate tram/train station are only a 5 min walk away from the apartment.

I'd like to have friendly guests who are considerate of the people and environment around them. I really want guests staying at my apartment to feel welcome and comfortable so they can enjoy their stay. Guests can rely on me as I'm more than happy to help :)

name: Entire Penthouse
summary: My Flat is a lovely 2 bed place in the heart of Manchesters' vibrant Northern quarter. There is a fully fitted kitchen and bathroom
space: Please feel free to use all the amenities in the apartment during your stay (apart from the telephone landline). I have wi-fi and a TV (with Netflix) should you want to relax in the evening and watch films. There is a big balcony should you wish to dine outside.
description: My Flat is a lovely 2 bed place in the heart of Manchesters' vibrant Northern quarter. There is a fully fitted kitchen and bathroom Please feel free to use all the amenities in the apartment during your stay (apart from the telephone landline). I have wi-fi and a TV (with Netflix) should you want to relax in the evening and watch films. There is a big balcony should you wish to dine outside. Guests have access to the entire flat and living areas, including a wrap around balcony, the kitchen is fairly well stocked with utensils and equipment etc. I will be on hand during your stay so if there's any issues then please feel free to give me a call and I'll do my best to accomodate anything you might need. The Northern Quarter is a fantastic area for nightlife and boasts a multitude of cafe's, restaurants and galleries nearby. There's a multitude of shopping opportunities with Manchesters Iconic Afflecks Palace at the bottom of the road, the Arndale Shopping Centre and The National Footbal
neighborhood_overview: The Northern Quarter is a fantastic area for nightlife and boasts a multitude of cafe's, restaurants and galleries nearby. There's a multitude of shopping opportunities with Manchesters Iconic Afflecks Palace at the bottom of the road, the Arndale Shopping Centre and The National Footbal Museum, all just a 2 minute walk from the apartment.
notes: The apartment is very central in the Northern Quarter and has the added bonus of being quiet in the evenings (even on busy Friday and Saturday nights) so you're sure to have a good nights sleep.
transit: Theres lots of transport options around the area with Shudehill Metrolink at the end of the street and bus connections to the outskirts of the city and football grounds. Easy access to train links directly with the North East and Manchester Airport.
host_about:
I am a freelancer working in the entertainment industry and aspiring writer, I love Manchester and found many an inspiration from the City. Returning to live here after some years away I've moved to a completely new area and have made some great friends here. I love meeting new people and have enjoyed hosting with my ex partner in my apartment for which we received some fantastic reviews since I pride myself on guests having a lovely stay.

I have a few passions, such as climbing, cooking and watching films. I spend time going to comedy gigs and the theatre or walking in the countryside. I enjoy peoples company when they have visited my place in the past and have prepared meals for a few of the guests while they were visiting, as a kind of culinary cultural exchange! I used to co host on this site but since we have gone our separate ways I have set up my own profile. This should give you some idea of what to expect room wise and certainly reviews too.

I'm very relaxed and happy to leave people to their own devices should that be what you want and excited to meet all the guests I will hopefully host. I'm more than happy to offer advice on the nice places to eat and hidden gems of Manchester that very few tourists see or hear about as local knowledge goes a long way! Always happy to help make your stay here as pleasant as possible so feel free to ask me anything, including if discounts are available for longer stays ;)

Jac

summary: Our stylish 2BR flat on the fourth floor comfortably fits up to six people. At the heart of the Northern Quarter and just one step away from Piccadilly Gardens, experience living in a landmark conversion with a bright and unique living room !
space: We are at the very heart of Manchester! The unusually spacious apartment on the fourth floor is only a 10-minute walk from Manchester Piccadilly Rail Station; 20 seconds from Piccadilly Gardens; and a minute away from the vibrant Northern quarter with restaurants, bars and entertainment.  Legendary Printworks and the Manchester Football Museum are a 5-minute walk away. We've got a typical Manchester pub and lovely French restaurant as well as local Tesco's just downstairs, so you won't have to walk far.  (If you love Bikram Yoga and don't want to live without it away from home: the Manchester studio is just across the street!) You will have free high-speed WiFi, a contemporary kitchen with washer, dryer and dishwasher and all other necessities.

This pad is part of a block of 14, with a mix of two bedroom apartments and studios.  We love having a
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is on one of the coolest streets in the vibrant and exciting community that is the Northern Quarter.  The Northern Quarter is famed for its independent shops and boutiques, where you can pick up designer or retro clothes, rare  vinyl's, collectable comics, unusual furniture and superb art.  Today it is equally famed for its social scene, with the beautiful restaurants, cool bars, quirky coffee shops and city spas, pulling many young professionals to live in the beautiful old buildings that line the streets. The joy of the Northern Quarter is that it provides a central base to explore the whole of the city and beyond.   You will find lots of shops and the central hub of shopping in the Arndale centre. Or if you are after something a bit more unconventional, check out Afflecks Palace an “emporium of eclecticism" which is a 5 minute walk away. For designer shops head to Selfridges, Harvey Nichols or Spinningfields. Here are a few of our favourite places in the city -  To ea
notes: Parking. There are 2 car parks in very close proximity and several more you can freely choose.  There is a car park on Tib Street, which is about a 5 minute walk away. There is also a large multi storey car park on Church Street also about a 5 minute walk away. Although depending on what your plans are if you are driving around Manchester get in touch and we will do our best to help with suggestions.
transit: The apartment is super close to all of the major transport links. It takes 14 minutes to walk from Manchester Piccadilly, an easy walk, unless you have heavy luggage and need to jump in a cab. Free bus service – Outside Piccadilly Station on Station Approach is the bus stops for all the free city centre buses. They cover a huge area, they are reliable and regular and best of all they are free, so use them!  Buses – Buses can be caught from Piccadilly gardens.  Tram – Trams can also be caught from Piccadilly gardens.  Taxis – 5 minutes away just outside a large department store called Debenhams is a  taxi rank allowing you to get out and about quickly if you're in a rush, or to prevent a drenching in the rain if heading to another part of town.  Manchester is not a big place and you can walk to the other side of the City in 20mins, unless taking a leisurely pace, which can be quicker than a cab in rush hour.  The Trafford Centre – Hop on the X50 bus from Piccadilly Gardens. Etihad Stadi

Mummy of two little boys - my husband and I remember the days we travelled far and wide before they arrived. With airbnb we can do it once again, with them too of course. 
Dream regularly of travelling around the world with a credit card, an iPad, my beautiful family and the airbnb app and just making it up as we go along.... one day!!

space: I will be away for a couple of months this summer and looking for someone clean and fun to take over my room for a bit! The space is fully furnished and you will have access to all the amenities of the house 24/7. There is plenty of shelving space for all your clothes and extra storage in the cabinets. Towels and bedding will be provided. The bedroom is carpeted keeping it nice and warm with a window just above the bed which keeps you cool. No air con but fan provided. The room is located in the back of the apartment with window opening to the blocked off alley way keeping the room nice and peaceful during the night.  The main living space is divided between the living and dining and open plan into the kitchen. Lots of light and huge table for workspace. Windows look right out onto the street, great for people watching.

space: This flat is perfect for up to 4 people. The living/dining area is huge with the balcony just out side. Two bathrooms, both with top specs.
description: Our large, airy and comfortable flat has all amenities. It is very central, close to the Gay Village, Chinatown & Northern Quarter, and is surrounded by great eating, drinking and entertainment. Music, museums and football is Manchester's mantra! This flat is perfect for up to 4 people. The living/dining area is huge with the balcony just out side. Two bathrooms, both with top specs. Access to all areas. Of course a meet and greet to hand keys over, and any other time you would need us. The gay village is busy, vibrant and alive. name: Airy private room heart of the city
summary: Bright and airy flat located in the heart of Manchester's city centre. A 5 minute walk from Piccadilly Station in one direction, and the main bus/tram terminals in another. High ceilings with heavy doors for privacy, and looks out over the canal!
space: You will have the full master bedroom to yourself, with a small desk, king-sized bed, clothes storage, and plenty of power outlets. We also have plenty of power adapters if you're travelling from abroad. You also have a wall heater in the bedroom that you can set as you like, and huge windows that look out over the centre of Manchester's night life, and the canal. The bathroom is right next to the bedroom, with a shower with excellent water pressure. We have fresh, clean towels and sheets, with extra new toothbrushes and toiletries if you need them.  There is also a washing machine and dryer available if you need it, with space reserved in the fridge. Feel free to use the kitchen tools as you need!

neighborhood_overview: The area is great for night life - there are tons of clubs and pubs in the streets around. You're also a very quick walk from several grocery stores and restaurants in every direction.
notes: The area is great and we love the flat, but a previous tenant marked a lot of the carpet with ground-in dirt stains. We've deep-cleaned it so it is as clean as new, but don't be surprised by some stains (we're hoping to replace them entirely over the summer). This flat is also in the very centre of Manchester's night life, so while you do have two fire door's of privacy from us, you can hear some of the partying on the streets outside on some nights.
transit: 5 minute walk from the Manchester Piccadilly train station, 2 minute walk from the main coach terminal. About 5 more minutes from the terminal is Piccadilly Gardens, the main bus and tram hub for the city.  This is one of the most well-connected spots in all of Manchester!
host_about:
I am an American economist from Chicago, I usually travel with my French Canadian girlfriend. We previously lived in Montreal, but recently moved to Manchester. We use AirBnb often, most of our reviews are under her account: https://www.airbnb.co.uk/users/show/6808001

We usually spend a lot of time walking while travelling; we both currently work from home so we might bring our work with us if we are staying on weekdays. I work for a company that teaches personal finance to high school and college students.

We usually do not spend very much time at places we stay, sleeping at night and going out to adventure during the day (unless we have some work to do before we can go out!)

name: Trendy NQ flat. Perfect location.
summary: Hello! The flat is clean, well-kept and in an excellent location. I've listed this as a private room, but I travel a lot for work so there is a good probability you'll have the place to yourself. If I'm around there's a double bedroom and also a double airbed if you need it - and if I'm away there's another double bedroom available too. Just let me know what you're looking for when you get in touch. I love my flat and it's definitely the perfect base for you to have an amazing time in MCR.
space: The space itself is pretty cool (we're talking curved TV, surround sound) and is set up for you to have a great stay. There is loads of character in the place - exposed brickwork, high ceilings, beams, wooden floor and original features from when it was a cotton mill. The double bedroom is a decent size with a memory foam mattress, chest of drawers and mirror - I can also set up a spare TV in there if you would like. If I am away, you're also welcome to stay in the larger bedroom which has a king size bed with stupidly comfortable mattress/bedding. There is the option for a double airbed too, so the space will accommodate 1-6 guests. Just let me know what you're looking for and I'll do my best to get you set up perfectly. The location of the flat is exceptional (more details below) but you are right in Northern Quarter and next to pretty much all transport links. Despite being seconds from bars, restaurants, shopping etc. - the flat itself is very quiet so you can enjoy a lovely nights

The double bedroom is a decent size with a memory foam mattress, chest of drawers and mirror - I can also set up a spare TV in there if you would like. If I am away, you're also welcome to stay in the larger bedroom which has a king siz
neighborhood_overview: I live right in Northern Quarter which (in my opinion) is the best place to enjoy Manchester. The area is jam-packed with the trendiest restaurants and bars in Manchester as well as being the best place for vintage boutiques and vinyls. There's a good guide, top link when you search for 'northernquartermanchester'. You're also within a minutes walk of the Arndale shopping centre for all your shops from New Look and TopShop to Selfridges and Harvey Nichs. The Arndale has a food market bit which I would recommend - particularly for the butchers.  You're ten minutes walk from the Gay Village and eight minutes walk from the MEN/Phones4U Arena. The University of Manchester and MMU are about twenty minutes walk, Salford University is about twenty five minutes walk. There are regular buses (including a free bus to Salford Uni) available to all of the universities too. The area is really lovely and hugely convenient - I'd be happy to help with suggestions on how to enjoy the best bits.
transit: There is a bus stop as you step out of the flat building, the tram stop is about five minutes walk away and Manchester Piccadilly and Victoria are both about ten minutes walk away. For more information and journey planning, check TFGM (Transport for Greater Manchester). Parking is also around (although prices vary) - for information on where to find the cheapest and most convenient spots, check Parkopedia. And if all else fails: Uber is available in Manchester.

name: City centre warehouse conversion
summary: Modern, comfortable & spacious loft apartment in converted warehouse right in the heart of Manchester. Stylish bedroom including comfortable king size bed. Your room is tastefully presented and we look forward to welcoming you to our home.
space: A stunning warehouse loft conversion overlooking the canal. A king size bed in a private bedroom with shared bathroom. Shared living room & kitchen. A light breakfast of cereals, fresh fruit, toast, tea & freshly brewed coffee included. Everything you could ever need from a city centre location. Piccadilly train and Tram stop on your doorstep along with great airport links - Manchester Airport is 17 minutes away by train. MediaCity, Manchester Arena, Manchester United and Manchester City football grounds and Manchester Central are all within easy access of your accommodation. Full access to the kitchen, bathroom & living room. Always happy to share ideas of things to do whilst in this great city, offer suggestions and recommendations....just ask. Everything you will ever need is on your doorstep. Bars, restaurants, theatres, art galleries and museums are all within easy walking distance.

transit: Piccadilly train & Tram (Metro) stop is less than a 5 minute walk away. Manchester international airport is a 17 minute train journey away.

name: New! Lovely DB in NQ  loft
summary: Nice DB  in a superb warehouse apartment, on a quiet central Northern Quarter street. Truly CENTRAL Manchester, moments away from the action and is comfortable for 2. Great for those needing to get around and a great place to stay!
space: 11-21 Turner street is a beautifully converted warehouse on a quiet Northern quarter street, moments away from the action. The flat contains a very bright, airy and spacious open plan lounge/kitchen-diner, with exposed brick and iron columns, lots of windows, all mod cons including a 42" media center, with lots of films, music and an iPod (classic) doc. Your bedroom is a generous double bedroom, with new mattress, lots of space to hang your clothes, bedside tales and lights. The apartment has recently been refurbished to the highest standards including a brand new bathroom. The bathroom has a bath and shower with "on demand" hot water. The apartment has both lift and stairs access (2nd floor).
description: Nice DB  in a superb warehouse apartment, on a quiet central Northern Quarter street. Truly CENTRAL Manchester, moments away from the action and is comfortable for 2. The apartment has both lift and stairs access (2nd floor). The apartment will be cleaned and ready for your arrival. Towels
neighborhood_overview: We are located on int he heart of the Northern Quarter, on a quiet street opposite the Buddhist Center. On the doorstep is a host of independent bars, restaurants and shops for all tastes such as Almost Famous, The Northern Quarter restaurant, Dough, The Bakery, Cane and Grain, The Blue Pig, Home Sweet Home and many many more. You really don't even need to leave the NQ, you may not want to! It is however, 5 minutes to Arndale Centre, printworks and only a 10 minute walk to: Deansgate, Manchester Arena, China town and Canal Stree, King Street, Selfridges, St Annes Square and 15 minutes to Spinning Fields
notes: We do ask that you are respectful to your neighbors and do not make too much noise, too late. There are many convenient supermarkets/grocers nearby. Among many others, Church Street secure Car park is nearby. (entrance off Turner Street)
transit: Nearest Stations: 2 Minutes wilk to Sude Hill Interchange 5 Minutes walk to Market street Metro stop 10 mins walk - Piccadilly station & metro/tram 5 mins walk - Piccadilly bus station 15 minute walk - Oxford road station and Deansgate station Very convenient for all major attractions in Manchester city centre, as well as for trams to the surrounding areas (Etihad Stadium, Old Trafford, Media City, Chorlton, Didsbury, etc).
host_about:
Hi, I'm Richard - a local lad, who has traveled extensively around Australia, SE Asia, India, Nepal, America, South America, Europe and Africa. I lived in London for 5 years, but love being back in Manchester, where I work as a Psychologist. 
I know Manchester well and love eating out. I am happy to help with your trip, or just let you in and wish you well.
x

name: Comfortable double room Manchester
summary: Located in Manchester City Centre near Oxford Road train station(2 mins), Palace Theatre, HOME and Universities with FREE WIFI & own bathroom. Easy access to local attractions and amenities. Help yourself to a continental breakfast of cereals & toast
space: Having been Airbnb guest for most of our travels and have had a wonderful time, we are inspired to become Airbnb hosts ourselves and give back the same experience of sharing our beautiful city of Manchester to you. Our home is located very near Oxford Road train station and within walking distance to HOME, Universities, Chinatown, Whitworth Art Gallery and more.  You will be welcomed with a comfortable double bedroom in Manchester City Centre with FREE WIFI in centrally located apartment with sole use of the main bathroom.  Your room is equipped with clothing storage, luggage rack, mirror, hair dryer, lamps and alarm clock. Clean towels and bedding are provided. Iron and ironing board is also available (please let us when you book). You will have your own key and fob to the apartment.  Our apartment though in the city centre is slightly enclosed from the hustle and bustle of the noise of the buses and cars.  Smoking is strictly not allowed in the apartment.  We welcome both leisure and

neighborhood_overview: There's a lot going in our area and all within immediate vicinity:  Supermarkets: Sainsbury, Tesco, Spar (24/7), Morrisons Coffee – Java, Starbucks, Café Nero and Costa  Quick bites – Subway, Greggs, McDonalds, Panchos, Nandos, Bakchich Restaurants – Gorilla, Zouk, Wasabi and Southern River.  Live gigs - Ritz, Gorilla and Sound Control
notes: It may get a little noisy during the day due to construction nearby however it's only during the day (when you are off wandering the sights of Manchester) and will not affect your resting time in the evening and sleep! We also provide fresh disposable ear plugs if you do require them :)
transit: Our apartment is in a great location for easy access to Palace Theatre, HOME, Oxford Road train station, Manchester Piccadilly train station, Chinatown and the Universities. Take the FREE Metroshuttle bus no.2 to the Museum of Science and Industry (MOSI) or the shops – bus stop is less than 2 mins away and buses are very frequent (every 10 mins).  5 minute to Manchester Town Hall, Bridgewater Hall, Chinatown, Deansgate Locks, Castlefield 10 minutes to John Rylands Library, Spinningfields, Northern Quarter, Arndale Centre, University area, Whitworth Art Gallery Easily accessible by frequent regular buses (bus stop less than 2 mins away) - Manchester Arena, Whitworth Art Gallery, University of Manchester, Manchester Metropolitan University, Manchester United Old Trafford Stadium, Manchester City Etihad Stadium.  To get from/to Manchester Airport:  Train from Manchester Oxford train station and Manchester Piccadilly train station. No.43 Stagecoach bus (outside Palace Theatre) Off street p
host_about:
Originally from Malaysia, we have been living in the UK (mostly Manchester) for more than 10 years. We love Manchester very much as it is such a vibrant city and has much to offer. We hope you find it as lovely as we do. 

We both love to travel and try to visit a new country each year. Last year we went a little crazy (just a little) and have been to Croatia, Bosnia, Slovenia, Greece, Denmark and Iceland. The country that makes us want to quit our jobs, pack our bags and just forget about everything is definitely Iceland (having visited there twice!). One of the reasons we have decided to become Airbnb hosts is so that it can help us fund our travels and explore more of the great big world. 

Our work revolves around international students at the Universities and we are very open to meeting new friends from different countries and cultures.

name: Stunning penthouse apartment
summary: This is a brand spanking new penthouse apartment in the heart of Manchester's bohemian Northern Quarter. The apartment features a large entertaining area, 2 bedrooms, bed deck and a luxury bathroom with a jacuzzi massage bath
space: This brand new apartment is located on the top floor of a lovingly refurbished Victorian building and located on Dale Street - the filming site of Marvel's Captain America: The First Avenger. Some scenes for the film were actually recorded in this building! This is the only apartment on the top floor and once you go through the front door you will access a spacious hallway which leads on to two double bedrooms, staircase access to the mezaninne. From the hallway double doors lead into an extensive living and dining area featuring exposed brickwork, sash windows, fully fitted, high-spec kitchen and a dining island. This is a perfect space for entertaining if you're visiting with a large group! My team and I have developed this apartment based on previous experience with Manchester Arena Apartments and Hen Retreat by Stylish Stay Manchester - see the links below. So, if you are worried about lack of previous reviews for Eleska's penthouse, by following the links below, you can see that t

neighborhood_overview: Eleska's penthouse is located on Dale Street - only 5 min walk away from Piccadilly Train Station, 2 min walk from Piccadilly Gardens, Market Street, Portland Street, China Town, The Village. As you can see, there are plenty of places to visit and explore nearby. We are in the heart of Northern Quarter, the place to be for Manchester's vibrant night-life. Tariff and Dale is good for relaxed drinks and bar food, Pen and Pencil is just a minute's walk away on Hilton Street and the bar food is amazing (tappas style), The Whiskey Jar being just across the road too as well as Lammar's bar and restaurant. There is a Tesco's and Costa Coffee at no.1 Piccadilly, so one minute walk away.
notes: Please note that one of the double beds is located on the mazaninne (the bed deck) which is accessed via a staircase.
transit: Manchester's transport links are at your door step - Manchester Piccadilly train station is 5 min on foot as well as all the Metrolink (tram) links from Piccadilly Gardens. The coach terminal is 10 min walk away and local busses all stop at Piccadilly Gardens too.

name: City Centre Boutique Penthouse
summary: Located just a 3 minute walk away from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private boutique penthouse in Manchester's vibrant City Centre.
space: Built in 1875, this is a beautiful four storey Grade 2 listed building with original wood, stone and metal decor & architecture throughout.
description: Located just a 3 minute walk away from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private boutique penthouse in Manchester's vibrant City Centre. Built in 1875, this is a beautiful four storey Grade 2 listed building with original wood, stone and metal decor & architecture throughout.   The whole penthouse is yours to enjoy, so make yourself at home and feel free to use the... Tea, coffee & milk Chocolate goodies Cooking ingredients (that are available) Ice cubes DVDs Soap, shower gel & shampoo  Towels Washing powder & dishwasher tablets Printer / photocopier (If the ink is available) Whether your stay is for business of pleasure, I want you to have the best experience possible! BEFORE YOU ARRIVE... Tell me the purpose of your trip (Birthday, Wedding, Concert, Theatre, Football, Shopping, Conference, Meeting or Airport Transfer etc) and i'll do whatever I can to 'Make It Happen' for you! DURING YOUR STAY... You'll be met upon arrival at a time & lo
neighborhood_overview: The penthouse is located on the dividing line of two very different neighbourhoods... PICCADILLY is a mix of chain hotels, corporate offices and mainstream high street retailers, whilst the NORTHERN QUARTER is the complete opposite, and is a mix of independent cafes, restaurants, bars, tea rooms, boutique shops and small businesses selling unique items.   The Northern Quarter has previously been described as "a centre of alternative and bohemian culture" which is fitting!
notes: BEDS... The apartment contains ONE double bed and ONE king bed. HOTEL STANDARDS... All bed linen and towels are professionally washed and ironed by a national laundry company, so you can look forward to a hotel standard when you arrive!   CYCLING... If you are a keen cyclist, feel free to bring your bike with you!  An open plan but secure cycle area is situated within one of the light wells of the building.  Bring a lock and all will be fine!
transit: WALK... It Is possible to walk to all parts of Manchester City Centre within 15 minutes.  Its a concentrated place with lots of things to do within a very short walk! FREE SHUTTLE BUS... Metroshuttles are free buses linking the main rail stations, car parks, shopping areas and businesses in Manchester city centre. Metroshuttle buses run from Piccadilly, Salford Central, Victoria, Oxford Road and Deansgate rail stations. There are three circular routes covering the main areas in the city centre. TRAM... Metrolink is a light rail tram system that covers Greater Manchester.  The network consists of six lines which provide access from Manchester City Centre and along routes to Altrincham, Ashton-under-Lyne, Bury, Didsbury, Eccles, and Rochdale. DRIVING... You'll be staying in the M1 post code of Manchester City Centre - it doesn't get any more central than this!  If you can, leave the car at home and use public transport as parking will cost you either £10 or £20 per night depending on whi
host_about:
I am a Creative and work on various projects in Photography, Brand Development & Marketing to name a few.

My interests include... Photography, Travel, the Sea, Friends, Family, Design, Nature, Ideas, Culture, Tech, Food, Coffee, Music & Autobiographies.

I love to travel whenever I can as the stimulus of meeting new people, discovering new places and seeing different ways of life excites me (and keeps me young at heart).

I believe and follow the mottos "make it happen" and "the world is run by those who turn up."

summary: An amazing, large 2 Bedroom apartment in a Mill conversion with exposed brick work, steel columns and best of all, its own outside patio terrace for sunny breakfast mornings.  Please see our other 4 apts for reviews, we're at superhost status!
space: The apartment is spectacular and we have some nice places. If exposed brick work, steel columns and wood beams plus double height ceilings and old mill conversions are your thing, look nowhere else. There's 2 double bedrooms , large bathroom but no ensuite and then a beautiful living area with Kitchen, and lounge (dining space is coming very shortly). Coming of the lounge are patio doors onto the large, private, ground floor patio within the secure estate with table and chairs for dining outside. We only do fabulous places across Manchester and this is nothing short of special.

summary: Situated right in the heart of the city centre of Manchester, the flat is next to all the major train stations (walking 7 minutes), University of Manchester, MMU, or Manchester College. It is also near the pubs and bars, Chinatown, and supermarkets.
description: Situated right in the heart of the city centre of Manchester, the flat is next to all the major train stations (walking 7 minutes), University of Manchester, MMU, or Manchester College. It is also near the pubs and bars, Chinatown, and supermarkets. You will have access to your own private bedroom, the shared bathroom, and the shared kitchen (which is in the living room where I am). There are doors between us for your own privacy. Across from Bannatyne's Health Club and a Japanese restaurant called Samsi (the shop with red banners), this flat is also located near Sackville Garden and the gay village. 7 minutes walk from Manchester Piccadilly station, or Manchester Oxford Road. If you are arriving at Manchester Piccadilly station, go down the escalators near Platform 9-10 (near Sainsbury's and the toilets). You will see the taxi stand outside the station. On the right, you will find the traffic lights on London Street. Just cross the road and keep walking straight for about 5 minutes. M
neighborhood_overview: Across from Bannatyne's Health Club and a Japanese restaurant called Samsi (the shop with red banners), this flat is also located near Sackville Garden and the gay village.
notes: The flat is on the street level at a major road junction. So noise from traffic and party-goers can be a distraction, if you are a sleeper in need of complete quiet. This is the hustle and bustle of city living - and I love it. I hope you do too.
transit: 7 minutes walk from Manchester Piccadilly station, or Manchester Oxford Road. If you are arriving at Manchester Piccadilly station, go down the escalators near Platform 9-10 (near Sainsbury's and the toilets). You will see the taxi stand outside the station. On the right, you will find the traffic lights on London Street. Just cross the road and keep walking straight for about 5 minutes. My building is on the left, just after the University of Manchester. You will see a big number 53 on top of the building door. Just call me on my mobile phone and I will come and get you (as the door system does not work for my flat).
host_about: I'm a postgraduate student at the University of Manchester, UK, researching in theatre and cultural practices. I'm originally from Singapore, so I'm taking the opportunity to travel as much as I can while in the UK to European cities and elsewhere.

name: Lovely Traditional Narrow Boat!
summary: Welcome to my cosy traditional narrow boat which will be your home for the weekend! I am in the heart of Manchester city centre, the perfect location for historic walks, cultural trips or contemporary music and art.
space: Tir-Na-Nog is an old Irish name translating as a land where you never grow old, so enjoy your youthful city break on the historic canals of Manchester! So my lovely boat is ideal for a couple or three friends; there's a small double bed and a really comfy sofa bed. No parties please, only respectful people that want to enjoy the city and the gentle calm of life on the waters!  There is a bathroom with a small shower and toilet. The kitchen has a working cooker and fridge if you want to cook. In the cold evenings you can light the wood burner and sit cosily by the fire or visit some of the great pubs and bars that Manchester is famous for. If you need anything or have a problem I will be nearby to come and help you out. Please be aware there are no plug sockets onboard so get your iphones juiced up before you arrive! The boat can't be moved unfortunately but you are very close to Deansgate tram stop and in a central location to the city centre, it's about a 15 minute walk to Market Stre

neighborhood_overview: Castlefield is a great and historic location in the heart of Manchester, it has a rich history of industry and trade through it's ancient railway bridges and canal routes. You will be staying in the heart of that in one of the oldest parts of Britain's canals. You can take a trip to the Northern Quarter and visit one of its many independent cafes, music venues and record stores. The Wharf is a great food and drink venue right across the way, there are many delicious restaurants just up the way including Spanish, Indian and Japanese cuisine, and a traditional chippy!
transit: It is very close to Deansgate Tram Station and fairly close to Oxford Road train station. There are lots of buses to take you about and taxis 24hrs.
host_about: I'm a helpful, friendly person with a love for music and travelling and art. I'm an artist and photographer that does community workshops. I love local products and supporting artists in the area. Hopefully I can advise you on great things to do whilst you're in Manchester!

neighborhood_overview: You will be staying in the trendy Northern Quarter, Manchester's most iconic place. The Northern Quarter is a fashionable Bohemian area with lots of independent shops (its streets are famous for the sale of vintage clothes and vintage stuffs ), bars and restaurants. Must see are the Affleck's Palace -a building full of shops for alternative clothing and vintage objects- and the Craft & Design centre - where local artists display their handmade works of art-.
transit: You will be RIGHT INTO THE HEART OF THE CITY. EVERYWHERE in the city centre will be at WALKING DISTANCE . **The free city centre bus stop is 5 minutes walking**. 5 minutes walk to Piccadilly Station  7 Minutes walk to Piccadilly Gardens (Main Bus station - Metrolink (tram) stations).  2 Minutes walk to the Northern Quarter's famous bars and restaurants.  12 minutes walk to the Arndale shopping centre  Just over 10 minutes walk to the MEN arena.  12-15 Minutes walk to the Manchester Central Conference and Exhibition Complex.  12 minutes walk to The Printwork.  10 minutes walk to Deansgate.  15 minutes walk to Oxford Road.  10-15 minutes walking to the main Universities. Less than 5 minutes walk to the local food shops. --From the *AIRPORT* there is a train that in 14 minutes takes you to Piccadilly Station--  (Alternatively, from the airport there are also the Metrolink and the Bus)

name: Waterside central 2 bed Apt (6)
summary: Your home-from-home awaits in our 2 bed/bath 780 sq ft beautiful apartment. 3mins walk from Piccadilly station. Waterside location. Fully furnished to the highest spec, minutes from everything but the peaceful location guarantees a good nights sleep!
space: PLEASE CLICK ON MY PROFILE TO SEE OUR OTHER PADS, ALL WITH NEAR PERFECT REVIEWS, MAKING OUR APARTMENTS ‘THE' PLACE FOR YOUR STAY IN THIS WONDERFUL CITY. MORE ABOUT LIVING ….. The apartment has been completely renovated and all furniture is top quality kit, so you should find everything you need for your stay.  The apartment has 2 large double bedrooms, both with designer furniture and carpeted. The main bedroom is ensuite with a shower whilst the flat has a further main bathroom with bath and shower.  The entrance hall has 2 further rooms; one a large storage and coat room and then a further laundry room with washing machine.  The living/dining area benefits from a 6 person designer sofa which is also a sofa bed, designer glass coffee table and glass dining table fitting 6. We have 4 dining chairs, an additional 2 are available upon request in advance. We allow a maximum of 6 guests in any one visit. There are patio doors off the living area to a Juliette balcony looking over the water

neighborhood_overview: MORE ABOUT LOCATION ….. The apartment couldn't be better placed to suit the Manchester visitor or regular business traveller.  Malmaisson, Hilton Doubletree, Premier Inn, Max apartments and Abode Hotel are within 200 yards of Ducie Wharf, paying testament to its location. It takes 3 mins to walk from Manchester Piccadilly allowing quick access from the train station, easy even with heavy luggage.   At the end of the road is a large taxi rank allowing you to get out and about quickly if you're in a rush, or to prevent a drenching in the rain if heading to another part of town.  Manchester is not a big place and you can walk to the other side of the City in 20mins, unless taking a leisurely pace, which can be quicker than a cab in rush hour.  Further along is a 24-hour Spar and Tesco meaning you're never more than a few minutes away from anything you need. The apartment is 5 mins walk to Northern Quarter, Canal Street with Deansgate and Spinningfields being 10 minutes away.  Literally 15
notes: A few minor points for the bathroom. For the sink plug it is manual, there is no lever to release it. The bathroom door handle is very stiff , please be gentle when shutting the door.
transit: MORE ON GETTING OUT AND ABOUT ….. The apartment could not be better located. Some hints and tips for getting about; - Taxis - walk out of the apartment back down Ducie Street (turn left out of Junction House, left again) and when you come to the cross roads with Cafe Nero and Malmaisson, you'll see a cab rank opposite Malmaisson. - Free Bus Service – Outside Piccadilly Station on Station Approach is the bus stops for all the free city centre busses. They cover a huge area, they are reliable and regular and best of all they are free, so use them! - Supermarket - further along from the taxi rank, there is a 24hr Spar, 24 Hour Tesco (opposite the spar), Greggs, 2 or 3 mainstream bars, Fatso's for sandwiches.  A little further down is Piccadilly Gardens with banks, restaurants, shops etc. If you have a particular destination (football stadiums, museums, theatres, neighbourhoods for going out like Northern Quarter, Spinningfields, Canal Street, Deansgate Locks etc), or any question not cove

name: Manchester City Centre Bedroom
summary: Double Room in a large 3 bed Victorian Apartment in a Grade II Listed Building. The apartment is split into Left and Right Hand Suites and is located in the heart of City Centre Manchester at the doorstep of Piccadilly Gardens in Northern Quarter.
space: This is truly a wonderful fully refurbished large 3 bedroomed apartment. Having 2 double rooms and one large suite which is what we are describing here. The apartment is located on the corner of Lever Street and Back Piccadilly, this cannot get any more central or convenient for those who wish to either work, shop or holiday in Manchester City Centre.   A renowned business person calls it the M1 postcode!! Centre of the Universe as far as Manchester City Centre is concerned. The Apartment is fully laminated throughout with quality high gloss walnut flooring. The bathroom is Travetine Tiled with electric shower and generous sink and original cast iron bathtub. The Kitchen has been fully refurbished equipped with most mod cons, electric oven and hob, washing machine and dryer, fridge freezer, kettle and toaster. The space is also covered with sky broadband!
