neighborhood_overview: Northern Quarter, City Centre Shopping, the offices, Piccadilly Gardens, Piccadilly Train Station the coach station the bus station the Trams, the Arndale Centre, St Anne's and St Albert's Square, China Town, King, Cross and Market Street, Wherever you wish to go whatever you wish to do you are in the heart of life at the Northern Quarter and Piccadilly!!
notes: This property is in a Grade II listed. Building on the top floor. It is right at the door step of Piccadilly Gardens. When you come out of the building look to your left and walk 20 yards you will arrive at the corner of Market Street and Lever street overlooking Piccadilly Gardens. Walk left on Market STreet towards the Arndale shopping centre. Alternatively when you come of the building look to your right and walk down lever street to the corner of Lever street and Stevenson square. You are now in the heart of the Northern Quarter. Turn left onto Stevenson square and walk up to Thomas street.
transit: You are in the heart of Piccadilly and the Northern Quarter.  Access to all the bars, cafes and pubs. Perhaps you wish to have Breakfast in Tea Cup the Northern Quartner. Lunch or a drink in the Trough on Thomas Street. Maybe you prefer to go shopping down Market street towards the Arndale, Marks and  Spencer or turn over to the Print works further up or shop in Selfridges or Harvey Nichols. Why not take a walk to the end of Market street towards Deansgate and visit the House of Frazer and dine, lunch or breakfast in the most exclusive and tasteful Italian Tapas style five start restaurant Ciccetti or San Carlo. If you are a lover of fine steaks try the Argentinian Gauco's by the side of House of Frazer for the best Medium Rate Filet on earth!

DURING YOUR STAY... You'll be met upon arrival at a time & location yo
neighborhood_overview: The studio is located on the dividing line of two very different neighbourhoods... PICCADILLY is a mix of chain hotels, corporate offices and mainstream high street retailers, whilst the NORTHERN QUARTER is the complete opposite, and is a mix of independent cafes, restaurants, bars, tea rooms, boutique shops and small businesses selling unique items.   The Northern Quarter has previously been described as "a centre of alternative and bohemian culture" which is fitting!
notes: BEDS... The apartment contains ONE king size bed that pulls down at the click of a button, and closes by gently elevating the bed. HOTEL STANDARDS... All bed linen and towels are professionally washed and ironed by a national laundry company, so you can look forward to a hotel standard when you arrive!   CYCLING... If you are a keen cyclist, feel free to bring your bike with you!  An open plan but secure cycle area is situated within one of the light wells of the building.  Bring a lock and all will be fine!
transit: WALK... It Is possible to walk to all parts of Manchester City Centre within 15 minutes.  Its a concentrated place with lots of things to do within a very short walk! FREE SHUTTLE BUS... Metroshuttles are free buses linking the main rail stations, car parks, shopping areas and businesses in Manchester city centre. Metroshuttle buses run from Piccadilly, Salford Central, Victoria, Oxford Road and Deansgate rail stations. There are three circular routes covering the main areas in the city centre. TRAM... Metrolink is a light rail tram system that covers Greater Manchester.  The network consists of six lines which provide access from Manchester City Centre and along routes to Altrincham, Ashton-under-Lyne, Bury, Didsbury, Eccles, and Rochdale. DRIVING... You'll be staying in the M1 post code of Manchester City Centre - it doesn't get any more central than this!  If you can, leave the car at home and use public transport as parking will cost you either £10 or £20 per night depending on whi

I love to travel whenever I can as the stimulus of meeting new people, discovering new places and seeing different ways of life excites me (and keeps me young at heart).

I believe and follow the mottos "make it happen" and "the world is run by those who turn up."

summary: This little Studio Apartment is in a Grade II Listed Victorian Building in the heart of City Centre in the Northern Quarter, at the doorstep of Piccadilly Gardens. Quiet and comfortable yet in the middle of everything! Shop, work or dine!
space: This is a cosy space which is so much more convenient than staying in a hotel room. You have your own little living/dining area, a separate bathroom, a small kitchenette with fridge freezer, microwave oven and electric hob rings and kettle which lead to the loft bedroom with double bed, desk and chair and a clothes rail to hang and store clothes.

neighborhood_overview: Norther Quarter, City Centre Shopping, the offices, Piccadilly Gardens, Piccadilly Train Station the coach station the bus station the Trams, the Arndale Centre, ST Anne's and St Albert's Squoare, China Town, King, Cross and Market Street, Wherever you wish to go whatever you wish to do you are in the heart of life at the Norther Quarter and Piccadilly!!
notes: This property is in a Grade II listed. Building on the top floor. It is right at the door step of Piccadilly Gardens. When you come out of the building look to your left and walk 20 yards you will arrive at the corner of Market Street and Lever street overlooking Piccadilly Gardens. Walk left on Market STreet towards the Arndale shopping centre. Alternatively when you come of the building look to your right and walk down lever street to the corner of Lever street and Stevenson square. You are now in the heart of the Northern Quarter. Turn left onto Stevenson square and walk up to Thomas street.
transit: You are in the heart of Piccadilly and the Norther Quarter.  Access to all the bars, cafes and pubs. Perhaps you wish to have Breakfast in Tea Cup the Northern Quartger. Lunch or a drink in the Trough on Thomas Street. Maybe you prefer to go shopping down Market street towards the Arndale, Marks and  Spencer or turn over to the Printworks further up or shop in Selfridges or Harvey Nichols. Why not take a walk to the end of Market street towards deansgate and visit the House of Frazer and dine, lunch or breakfast in the most exclusive and tasteful Italian Tapas style five start restaurant Ciccetti or San Carlo. If you are a lover of fine steaks try the Argentinian Gauco's by the side of House of Frazer for the best Medium Rate Filet on earth!

neighborhood_overview: LOCATION The apartment couldn't be better placed to suit the Manchester visitor or regular business traveller as it is on Oxford road. Oxford Road stretches from the edge of the Curry Mile in Rusholme right up to Central Library, and along its length you'll find such artistic gems as the Whitworth, Manchester Museum and the University of Manchester campus, atmospheric live music venue Deaf Institute and indie bars Big Hands, Kro and Black Dog Ballroom. For more information see: (URL HIDDEN)  The building is next to Palace theatre, 15 minutes' walk to Market street where you can go shopping, or head to the Northern quarter for the best cafés and bars in Manchester. If you want to party, the gay village, Deansgate Locks, Castlefield and Spinningfields are also walking distance (10 minutes). Chinatown is 10 minutes' walk  You can walk to both MMU ( 5 minutes walk) and to Manchester Uni ( 10 minutes). TRAIN AND TRAM: It takes 3 mins to walk from Manchester Oxford Road and 15 Minutes to Pic

host_about:
My name is Jacqueline and I am a museum collections technician originally from Canada. I've worked in various institutions throughout Canada, and New Zealand. I currently live in Toronto, which is a sprawling, buzzing city that is made up of a collection of very eclectic neighbourhoods. I love subversive art, collecting cameras, the conflation of traditional and modern architecture, running and then eating carbs, adventuring places with my English partner Edward, and well-made pastries. :) 

I love the sense of comfort I feel when staying in an Airbnb location, and the challenge of new neighbourhoods, people and way-finding it presents. I also love to cook, and hotels just don't offer the same level of home-away-from-home Airbnb does so well.

name: The Fig + Sparrow Loft Apartment NQ
summary: Open plan loft with exposed brickwork, wooden beams + huge factory style windows in the heart of Manchester's creative Northern Quarter. The hosts also own Fig + Sparrow, a design shop + coffee bar on the next street where guests can enjoy a free breakfast
space: This apartment has been our home for the last 3 years and we absolutely adore it. But alas we are moving out of the city and into a house. We run a design shop + coffee house 2 minutes walk from the flat and we'd like to run a genuine, albeit different take on, Bed & Breakfast. Our guests can enjoy staying in a fantastic urban loft in one of the cities' most sought after residential buildings and, unlike most Air BnB arrangements they can also enjoy a free breakfast over the road at Fig + Sparrow.
description: Open plan loft with exposed brickwork, wooden beams + huge factory style windows in the heart of Manchester's creative Northern Quarter. The hosts also own Fig + Sparrow, a design shop + coffee bar on the next street where guests can enjoy a free breakfast This apartment has been our home for the last 3 years and we absolutely adore it. But alas we are moving out of the city and into a house. We run a design shop + coffee house 2 minutes walk from the flat and we'd like to run a genuine, albeit different take on, Bed & Breakfast. Our guests can enjoy staying in a fantastic urban loft in one of the cities' most sought after residential buildings and, unlike most Air BnB arrangements they can also enjoy a free breakfast over the road at Fig + Sparrow. Our guests will have access to the whole apartment. It centres around a large open plan corner space with large factory style windows and a double aspect looking over both Tib and Hilton Street. This main space contains the kitchen as well
neighborhood_overview: Our affection for Manchester's Northern Quarter is evident, we made it our home and launched and located our business here. It's a physical realisation of the best that Manchester has to offer... self made, creative, original and inspiring businesses have generated a whole 'village' and it continues to grow and expand in all the right ways... independent galleries, cafés, shops, restaurants, bars, music venues, comic book stores, hair salons, specialist beer shops, butchers, boutique flower shops, record shops, a sunday market, second hand book stalls... they all make up our neighbourhood and behind them all lie an array of colourful, creative and talented  people offering an escape from the monotony of the high street.
notes: We are right in the heart of all of the activity in the Northern Quarter... even within the building beneath the flats you can find a restaurant, 2 bars, 2 newsagents, a barbers and an array of shops... this makes it a perfect location for visiting but it obviously comes with a soundtrack! There are 82 residential flats in the building with people living happily, however if you are a light sleeper we provide a constant supply of clean, fresh earplugs.
transit: We are literally in the heart of the city, 5 minutes walk from piccadilly gardens where you will find the main city tram and bus stops. It's 10 minute walk from both piccadilly and victoria train stations which is easily doable with small bags or suitcases on wheels. There is a main National Express bus stain at the bottom of our street connecting you to all of the major routes including Liverpool Airport and London. There are regular trains and trams to Manchester airport.
street: Tib Street, Manchester, M4 1LA, United Kingdom

notes: This property is in a Grade II listed. Building on the top floor. It is right at the door step of Piccadilly Gardens. When you come out of the building look to your left and walk 20 yards you will arrive at the corner of Market Street and Lever street overlooking Piccadilly Gardens. Walk left on Market STreet towards the Arndale shopping centre. Alternatively when you come of the building look to your right and walk down lever street to the corner of Lever street and Stevenson square. You are now in the heart of the Northern Quarter. Turn left onto Stevenson square and walk up to Thomas street.
transit: You are in the heart of Piccadilly and the Northern Quarter.  Access to all the bars, cafes and pubs. Perhaps you wish to have Breakfast in Tea Cup the Northern Quartner. Lunch or a drink in the Trough on Thomas Street. Maybe you prefer to go shopping down Market street towards the Arndale, Marks and  Spencer or turn over to the Print works further up or shop in Selfridges or Harvey Nichols. Why not take a walk to the end of Market street towards Deansgate and visit the House of Frazer and dine, lunch or breakfast in the most exclusive and tasteful Italian Tapas style five start restaurant Ciccetti or San Carlo. If you are a lover of fine steaks try the Argentinian Gauco's by the side of House of Frazer for the best Medium Rate Filet on earth!

name: Eleska 2
summary: This is a brand new apartment, lovingly refurbished to an exceptionally high standard to incorporate a mixture of modern design and original features. Some of the scenes of Captain America The First Avenger were recorded in this very apartment!
space: Located in the heart of Manchester's bohemian Northern Quarter, this brand new apartment adds a touch of style and opulence to your night out in Manchester. With a whole host of bars, cafes and restaurants on your doorstep, this is the place to be!  The apartment is located on the first floor of a Grade II listed Victorian building which has been lovingly refurbished to an exceptionally high standard. From the apartment door you enter a large hallway with a seating area. The corridor opens to 2 double bedrooms - one with 2 double beds and the other with 2 triple bunk beds (sleeps 6). There is further sleeping space in the living room on 2 double sofa beds (total sleeping 4 - bedding inside the sofas) There is also a fully fitted and equipped kitchen, including a dishwasher and a modern stylish bathroom with a double shower.

name: Luxury City Centre Apartment
summary: Located right in the city centre just off Deansgate, with Manchester's shopping, restaurants, bars, and nightlife all within a few minutes walk.  Double ensuite (guests have their own floor of  our duplex apt), Parking, WiFi, and breakfast included.
space: The available double ensuite room is located on the top floor of our duplex apartment which you have to yourself. It's a quiet, leafy complex, just off Deansgate - One of the main streets for great restaurants, bars, and shops in Manchester. The room is furnished with a black out blind, comfy orthopaedic mattress, duck down duvet, towels & toiletries, and lovely view of the Beetham Tower.
description: Located right in the city centre just off Deansgate, with Manchester's shopping, restaurants, bars, and nightlife all within a few minutes walk.  Double ensuite (guests have their own floor of  our duplex apt), Parking, WiFi, and breakfast included. The available double ensuite room is located on the top floor of our duplex apartment which you have to yourself. It's a quiet, leafy complex, just off Deansgate - One of the main streets for great restaurants, bars, and shops in Manchester. The room is furnished with a black out blind, comfy orthopaedic mattress, duck down duvet, towels & toiletries, and lovely view of the Beetham Tower. You will have access to use our kitchen and lounge, and breakfast is included (with Nespresso coffee). Wifi and parking are also included. We may be present at the property during your stay & are sociable, easy going people. If we are not around during your stay, we will arrange to meet to give you keys to our home so  you can come and go at your leisure.
neighborhood_overview: Porchfield Square is great as you feel as if you're in a quiet leafy rural setting whilst being in the heart of central Manchester. Guests can enjoy all the city centre amenities just a short walk away, or nice local walks down the canal and around the historic Castlefield area. The Opera House is at the end of our Road, as is Spinningfields, offering fantastic dining and bars. One of the most recent to open is Manchester House (hoping to become Manchester's' first Michelin star restaurant). There is also an AMC cinema across the road.
notes: Distance from our apartment to local attractions you may want to visit: Old Trafford Football Ground - 9 minute drive or 1 stop on the tram Cinema - 1 minute walk Train stations - Deansgate, 5 minute walk. Theatre - 2 minute walk Spinningfields - 2 minute walk Northern Quarter - 20 minute walk or approx. £5 taxi Deansgate - 1 minute walk Castlefield - 2 minute walk  Trafford Centre - 10 minute drive Eitihad Stadium - 10 minute drive Aquatics Centre - 7 minute drive Museum of Science & Industry (MOSI) - 1 minute walk PLEASE NOTE: We only accept bookings from adults, therefore we have to decline any reservation requests which involve accommodating children.
transit: There is parking on site if you want to get around by car, or alternatively we are less than a mile away from Deansgate train station, and Piccadilly and Victoria stations are also within walking distance.  There are great tram and bus links to other parts of the city and surrounding areas of Manchester.
host_about: I'm a laid back and easy going female in my twenties. I love to travel, and want to see as much of the world as I can. I enjoy theatre, music, playing and writing piano, baking, and good food (and wine!).

summary: Large, light and airy mill conversion.
space: A converted mill apartment with high ceilings, big windows and wooden floors.
description: Large, light and airy mill conversion. A converted mill apartment with high ceilings, big windows and wooden floors.  Aside from your king room, you will have access to the lounge/kitchen/diner and the main bathroom. I have my own room with en-suite facilities. I work regular hours through the day. I am usually out and about in the evenings, but always on hand to help make your stay as fulfilled as possible. The apartment is in the Northern Quarter, a vibrant bustling, part of the city. Cafes, vintage shopping, galleries, restaurants, bars galore on the doorstep. NCP car park across the street for parking. Being very centrally located in such a popular area, it is important to note that it can be noisy at times, particularly Friday & Saturday evenings. If you like peace and quiet, this probably isn't for you. name: Manchester City Centre Apartment
summary: Grade II Listed Victorian Apartment in the Heart of City Centre at the doorstep of Piccadilly Gardens. The property is tucked away in a Victorian Building and has its own New York Style courtyard. High celings with large windows very quiet and comfortable. In the centre of everything!
space: Imagine yourself in a New York Style apartment with cosy and quite courtyard in the middle of City Centre Manchester. This apartments has very high Victorian Ceilings and gigantic original Sash Windows. The apartment is fully laminated throughout and is equipped with most mod cons including wifi broadband and a smart TV. Two good sized double bedrooms an open plan living dining area and a separate kitchen and bathroom. The kitchen has a door that opens up into the middle of the buildings that surround where you can perhaps have a smoke if you are a smoker! The apartments is spacious and is really what you need as it is quiet, warm and comfortable and right in the middle of it all. Piccadilly Gardens and Northern Quarter are at your doorstep.

neighborhood_overview: Northern Quarter, City Centre Shopping, the offices, Piccadilly Gardens, Piccadilly Train Station the Coach Station the bus station the Trams, the Arndale Centre, St Anne's and St Albert's Square, China Town, King, Cross and Market Street, Wherever you wish to go whatever you wish to do you are in the heart of life at the Norther Quarter and Piccadilly!!
notes: This property is a large Victorian 2 Bedroomed Apartment within a Grade II listed Building on the First floor. It is right at the door step of Piccadilly Gardens. When you come out of the building look to your left and walk 20 yards you will arrive at the corner of Market Street and Lever street overlooking Piccadilly Gardens. Walk left on Market Street towards the Arndale Shopping Centre. Alternatively when you come  out of the building look to your right and walk down Lever Street to the corner of Lever street and Stevenson square. You are now in the heart of the Northern Quarter. Turn left onto Stevenson square and walk up to Thomas street.
transit: You are in the heart of Piccadilly and the Northern Quarter.  Access to all the Bars, Cafe's and Pubs. Perhaps you wish to have Breakfast in Tea Cup the Northern Quarter. Lunch or a drink in the Trough on Thomas Street. Maybe you prefer to go shopping down Market street towards the Arndale, Marks and  Spencer or turn over to the Printworks further up or shop in Selfridges or Harvey Nichols. Why not take a walk to the end of Market street towards Deans gate and visit the House of Frazer and dine, lunch or breakfast in the most exclusive and tasteful Italian Tapas style five start restaurant Ciccetti or San Carlo. If you are a lover of fine steaks try the Argentinian Gauco's by the side of House of Frazer for the best Medium Rate Filet on earth!

name: City Centre Heritage Penthouse
summary: Located just a 3 minute walk away from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private heritage penthouse apartment in Manchester's vibrant City Centre.
space: Built in 1875, this is a beautiful four storey Grade 2 listed building with original wood, stone and metal decor & architecture throughout.
description: Located just a 3 minute walk away from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private heritage penthouse apartment in Manchester's vibrant City Centre. Built in 1875, this is a beautiful four storey Grade 2 listed building with original wood, stone and metal decor & architecture throughout. The whole loft apartment is yours to enjoy, so make yourself at home and feel free to use the... Tea, coffee & milk Chocolate goodies Cooking ingredients (that are available) Ice cubes DVDs Soap, shower gel & shampoo  Towels Washing powder & dishwasher tablets Printer / photocopier (If the ink is available) Whether your stay is for business of pleasure, I want you to have the best experience possible! BEFORE YOU ARRIVE... Tell me the purpose of your trip (Birthday, Wedding, Concert, Theatre, Football, Shopping, Conference, Meeting or Airport Transfer etc) and i'll do whatever I can to 'Make It Happen' for you! DURING YOUR STAY... You'll be met upon arrival a
neighborhood_overview: The loft is located on the dividing line of two very different neighbourhoods... PICCADILLY is a mix of chain hotels, corporate offices and mainstream high street retailers, whilst the NORTHERN QUARTER is the complete opposite, and is a mix of independent cafes, restaurants, bars, tea rooms, boutique shops and small businesses selling unique items.   The Northern Quarter has previously been described as "a centre of alternative and bohemian culture" which is fitting!
notes: BEDS... The apartment contains ONE double bed. HOTEL STANDARDS... All bed linen and towels are professionally washed and ironed by a national laundry company, so you can look forward to a hotel standard when you arrive!   CYCLING... If you are a keen cyclist, feel free to bring your bike with you!  An open plan but secure cycle area is situated within one of the light wells of the building.  Bring a lock and all will be fine!
transit: WALK... It Is possible to walk to all parts of Manchester City Centre within 15 minutes.  Its a concentrated place with lots of things to do within a very short walk! FREE SHUTTLE BUS... Metroshuttles are free buses linking the main rail stations, car parks, shopping areas and businesses in Manchester city centre. Metroshuttle buses run from Piccadilly, Salford Central, Victoria, Oxford Road and Deansgate rail stations. There are three circular routes covering the main areas in the city centre. TRAM... Metrolink is a light rail tram system that covers Greater Manchester.  The network consists of six lines which provide access from Manchester City Centre and along routes to Altrincham, Ashton-under-Lyne, Bury, Didsbury, Eccles, and Rochdale. DRIVING... You'll be staying in the M1 post code of Manchester City Centre - it doesn't get any more central than this!  If you can, leave the car at home and use public transport as parking will cost you either £10 or £20 per night depending on whi
host_about:
I am a Creative and work on various projects in Photography, Brand Development & Marketing to name a few.

My interests include... Photography, Travel, the Sea, Friends, Family, Design, Nature, Ideas, Culture, Tech, Food, Coffee, Music & Autobiographies.

I love to travel whenever I can as the stimulus of meeting new people, discovering new places and seeing different ways of life excites me (and keeps me young at heart).

I believe and follow the mottos "make it happen" and "the world is run by those who turn up."

neighborhood_overview: Hulme has had a chequered and interesting social history, the name Hulme is derived from old Norse meaning small island as it is surrounded by the rivers Irwell, Medlock and Cornbrook. Before the industrial revolution Hulme was a farm, thereafter has gone through many demolitions. From the 70s Hulme has been the citys bohemian anti establishment heart, being home to many an artist, activist and anarchist. Hulme is going through a new era with the building of a new MMU campus and cultural quarter, inc galleries and arthouse cinema. We have experienced more community here and feel safer than anywhere else in Manchester
notes: We have a young friendly dog

We get out of the city when ever we can for walks and pub dinners. We stay in Portugal every summer where we have a yurt and some land we are nurturing

name: City Centre Heritage Apartment
summary: Located just a 3 minute walk away from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private heritage apartment in Manchester's vibrant City Centre.
space: Built in 1875, this is a beautiful four storey Grade 2 listed building with original wood, stone and metal decor & architecture throughout.
description: Located just a 3 minute walk away from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private heritage apartment in Manchester's vibrant City Centre. Built in 1875, this is a beautiful four storey Grade 2 listed building with original wood, stone and metal decor & architecture throughout. The whole apartment is yours to enjoy, so make yourself at home and feel free to use the... Tea, coffee & milk Chocolate goodies Ice cubes Soap, shower gel & shampoo  Towels Washing powder & dishwasher tablets Whether your stay is for business of pleasure, I want you to have the best experience possible! BEFORE YOU ARRIVE... Tell me the purpose of your trip (Birthday, Wedding, Concert, Theatre, Football, Shopping, Conference, Meeting or Airport Transfer etc) and i'll do whatever I can to 'Make It Happen' for you! DURING YOUR STAY... You'll be met upon arrival at a time & location you specify and taken directly to the apartment. I'll point out the best bars, restaurant
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on the dividing line of two very different neighbourhoods... PICCADILLY is a mix of chain hotels, corporate offices and mainstream high street retailers, whilst the NORTHERN QUARTER is the complete opposite, and is a mix of independent cafes, restaurants, bars, tea rooms, boutique shops and small businesses selling unique items.   The Northern Quarter has previously been described as "a centre of alternative and bohemian culture" which is fitting!
notes: BEDS... The apartment contains TWO  double beds. HOTEL STANDARDS... All bed linen and towels are professionally washed and ironed by a national laundry company, so you can look forward to a hotel standard when you arrive!   CYCLING... If you are a keen cyclist, feel free to bring your bike with you!  An open plan but secure cycle area is situated within one of the light wells of the building.  Bring a lock and all will be fine!
transit: WALK... It Is possible to walk to all parts of Manchester City Centre within 15 minutes.  Its a concentrated place with lots of things to do within a very short walk! FREE SHUTTLE BUS... Metroshuttles are free buses linking the main rail stations, car parks, shopping areas and businesses in Manchester city centre. Metroshuttle buses run from Piccadilly, Salford Central, Victoria, Oxford Road and Deansgate rail stations. There are three circular routes covering the main areas in the city centre. TRAM... Metrolink is a light rail tram system that covers Greater Manchester.  The network consists of six lines which provide access from Manchester City Centre and along routes to Altrincham, Ashton-under-Lyne, Bury, Didsbury, Eccles, and Rochdale. DRIVING... You'll be staying in the M1 post code of Manchester City Centre - it doesn't get any more central than this!  If you can, leave the car at home and use public transport as parking will cost you either £10 or £20 per night depending on whi

I believe and follow the mottos "make it happen" and "the world is run by those who turn up."

space: Designed to be a little bit different, this apartment takes inspiration from Manchester's thriving industrial heritage, but also its innovative and forward-thinking outlook. The modern urban vibe of this apartment captures the edgy individuality for which Manchester is renowned, and the overall effect is one of sophisticated simplicity.

name: Bright Modern City Centre Apartment
summary: A clean, cosy & comfortable base in Manchester city centre for up to 4 people, right in the heart of things.
space: This modern, convenient, fully-furnished apartment has all the amenities you need to enjoy your trip to Manchester.  The location is excellent - only a few minutes' walk from the major train stations, shops, historic sights, theatres, restaurants and nightlife. The apartment is in a secure residential building, and you'll have the space to yourself with a fully equipped kitchen and living room. The bedroom has a double bed with bed-linens and towels provided, and up to two additional guests can be accommodated on the comfortable sofa-bed in the living room. The bathroom has a full bathtub as well as a shower, and an ironing board & iron are provided for your use.  The apartment also has fast WiFi which you can use for no additional cost, a TV and a DVD player with a selection of films for you to enjoy.  The main door to the building has a secure video entry system, there is a lift inside, and double-glazed windows so you get a good night's sleep.  The apartment will be for your exclusi
description: A clean, cosy & comfortable base in Manchester city centre for up to 4 people, right in the heart of things. This modern, convenient, fully-furnished apartment has all the amenities you need to enjoy your trip to Manchester.  The location is excellent - only a few minutes' walk from the major train stations, shops, historic sights, theatres, restaurants and nightlife. The apartment is in a secure residential building, and you'll have the space to yourself with a fully equipped kitchen and living room. The bedroom has a double bed with bed-linens and towels provided, and up to two additional guests can be accommodated on the comfortable sofa-bed in the living room. The bathroom has a full bathtub as well as a shower, and an ironing board & iron are provided for your use.  The apartment also has fast WiFi which you can use for no additional cost, a TV and a DVD player with a selection of films for you to enjoy.  The main door to the building has a secure video entry system, there is a li
neighborhood_overview: Manchester is characterised by its industrial heritage buildings and this apartment is situated right between the 19th century railway arches and the 18th century canal, a short walk from the historic Town Hall and all the modern facilities of the city.  There are lively bars, restaurants and clubs just down the street, and it couldn't be easier to get to the conference centre, theatres, concert halls, museums and historic buildings.  A few minutes' walk along the canal towpath brings you directly into the nightlife hotspots of the Gay Village, or Castlefield. A short hop on the tram will take you swiftly to Salford Quays, and a wealth of shopping options, from quirky to luxury, is right on your doorstep.
notes: A Fair Usage policy applies to electricity use in the apartment. You will be able to see your usage on a meter and most guests find that they have plenty for their heating and cooking needs, but if an excessive amount of electricity is used an additional charge may be applied.
transit: The apartment is less than 2 minutes walk from Oxford Road train station, or 10 minutes from Piccadilly. A free local bus service passes right by the apartment, and an excellent network of trams, buses and trains is at your fingertips to explore anywhere in Manchester and beyond.
host_about:
Friendly 40-something, living in Manchester's coolest neighbourhood! 

I came here for university and liked it so much I've stayed for over twenty years. I know a fair bit about the local history of Manchester, I enjoy cooking and entertaining, knitting, theatre and music, and especially singing with my acappella choir! 

I'm gay (so no homophobes please!) a bit 'leftie' and fond of wine & cats.

I've had guests staying from all over the world - feel free to browse my reviews - and really enjoy helping people discover Manchester, which is a great city to live in with loads going on all through the year. 

I manage 4 listings, each with their own unique character:

1. If you're interested in staying with me in the private room in my own home, I will ask you to tell me a bit about yourself and your trip, and I will do my best to answer any questions you have. It's very relaxed at my house - you'll have your own key and be able to come and go as you please. Let me know how I can make your visit memorable.

2 & 3. I also manage a self-contained 1-bedroom apartment in the City Centre, and a self-contained 2-bedroom house in Salford, both of which you can book for your exclusive use. You'll still get my personal service with booking and check-in and I'll be available if you have any problems. 

4. I also manage the bookings for a private room in a large & beautiful house in Whalley Range. Georgia is the homeowner and lives in the property - I will deal with your enquiries and booking arrangements, but during your stay you'll be sharing the space with Georgia and her friendly cats.
street: Whitworth Street West, Manchester, M1 5ND, United Kingdom

name: City Centre Heritage Loft
summary: Located just a 3 minute walk away from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private Loft Apartment in Manchester's vibrant City Centre.
space: Built in 1875, this is a beautiful four storey Grade 2 listed building with original wood, stone and metal decor & architecture throughout.
description: Located just a 3 minute walk away from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private Loft Apartment in Manchester's vibrant City Centre. Built in 1875, this is a beautiful four storey Grade 2 listed building with original wood, stone and metal decor & architecture throughout.   The whole loft apartment is yours to enjoy, so make yourself at home and feel free to use the... Tea, coffee & milk Chocolate goodies Cooking ingredients (that are available) Ice cubes DVDs Soap, shower gel & shampoo  Towels Washing powder & dishwasher tablets Printer / photocopier (If the ink is available) Whether your stay is for business of pleasure, I want you to have the best experience possible! BEFORE YOU ARRIVE... Tell me the purpose of your trip (Birthday, Wedding, Concert, Theatre, Football, Shopping, Conference, Meeting or Airport Transfer etc) and i'll do whatever I can to 'Make It Happen' for you! DURING YOUR STAY... You'll be met upon arrival at a time & l
neighborhood_overview: The loft is located on the dividing line of two very different neighbourhoods... PICCADILLY is a mix of chain hotels, corporate offices and mainstream high street retailers, whilst the NORTHERN QUARTER is the complete opposite, and is a mix of independent cafes, restaurants, bars, tea rooms, boutique shops and small businesses selling unique items.   The Northern Quarter has previously been described as "a centre of alternative and bohemian culture" which is fitting!
notes: BEDS... The apartment contains TWO double beds. HOTEL STANDARDS... All bed linen and towels are professionally washed and ironed by a national laundry company, so you can look forward to a hotel standard when you arrive!   CYCLING... If you are a keen cyclist, feel free to bring your bike with you!  An open plan but secure cycle area is situated within one of the light wells of the building.  Bring a lock and all will be fine!
transit: WALK... It Is possible to walk to all parts of Manchester City Centre within 15 minutes.  Its a concentrated place with lots of things to do within a very short walk! FREE SHUTTLE BUS... Metroshuttles are free buses linking the main rail stations, car parks, shopping areas and businesses in Manchester city centre. Metroshuttle buses run from Piccadilly, Salford Central, Victoria, Oxford Road and Deansgate rail stations. There are three circular routes covering the main areas in the city centre. TRAM... Metrolink is a light rail tram system that covers Greater Manchester.  The network consists of six lines which provide access from Manchester City Centre and along routes to Altrincham, Ashton-under-Lyne, Bury, Didsbury, Eccles, and Rochdale. DRIVING... You'll be staying in the M1 post code of Manchester City Centre - it doesn't get any more central than this!  If you can, leave the car at home and use public transport as parking will cost you either £10 or £20 per night depending on whi
host_about:
I am a Creative and work on various projects in Photography, Brand Development & Marketing to name a few.

My interests include... Photography, Travel, the Sea, Friends, Family, Design, Nature, Ideas, Culture, Tech, Food, Coffee, Music & Autobiographies.

I love to travel whenever I can as the stimulus of meeting new people, discovering new places and seeing different ways of life excites me (and keeps me young at heart).

I believe and follow the mottos "make it happen" and "the world is run by those who turn up."

name: Private room in the heart of NQ
summary: The apartment is located right in the heart of the city, in the vibrant Northern Quarter. Surrounded by independent coffee shops and eateries. You have access to a private room, double bed, with its own dedicated bathroom.
space: The building is a converted warehouse, meaning that it comes complete with authentic sash windows and beautiful exposed brick featuring throughout the apartment. The bathroom is modern and includes a power shower and bath, so feel free to have a soak and wind down before you hit the town and discover everything the area had to offer!
description: The apartment is located right in the heart of the city, in the vibrant Northern Quarter. Surrounded by independent coffee shops and eateries. You have access to a private room, double bed, with its own dedicated bathroom. The building is a converted warehouse, meaning that it comes complete with authentic sash windows and beautiful exposed brick featuring throughout the apartment. The bathroom is modern and includes a power shower and bath, so feel free to have a soak and wind down before you hit the town and discover everything the area had to offer! You'll have full access to the apartment, bar my room. You're welcome to use the kitchen space, watch TV, listen to music, etc. I work in the day, but when I'm in I'm happy to give advice on what to do and where to go; you're even welcome to chill with me in the week and watch a bit of TV or even join me for a few drinks with friends if you're looking to socialise. Entirely up to you. If you stay over the weekend then expect to awaken to
neighborhood_overview: The Northern Quarter is the place to be to experience the best of Manchester. Some of the best restaurants, bars and independents in the city are all located a stone's throw from the apartment.
transit: The apartment is a two minute walk from the metro, though it's easy enough to walk around the city centre without transport, and actually much nicer to walk around in my opinion. Near the metro is the bus depot, again for if you are wanting to go a little further afield.
host_about: I'm a laid back, easy going guy. I work hard in the week, so tend to just chill at home when I get in during the week, though enjoy going out on weekends.

name: Cosy room in a City Centre flat
summary: I've owned this flat for 6 years now & love it! The City Centre is 10 minutes walk away & there are bars/restaurants close by. I'm happy to help wherever I can. Kerry :)
space: My flat is clean, tidy and I'm confident you'll have a enjoyable stay. The showers are great, the bed is comfy and you will have access to the kitchen so you can make meals should you want to. The room available is mine, (purple room) however if both myself and my flatmate are away then the white room might be available too so you'll either have the flat to yourself or on occasions there may be another guest in the flat but I will advise you before you complete your booking.
description: I've owned this flat for 6 years now & love it! The City Centre is 10 minutes walk away & there are bars/restaurants close by. I'm happy to help wherever I can. Kerry :) My flat is clean, tidy and I'm confident you'll have a enjoyable stay. The showers are great, the bed is comfy and you will have access to the kitchen so you can make meals should you want to. The room available is mine, (purple room) however if both myself and my flatmate are away then the white room might be available too so you'll either have the flat to yourself or on occasions there may be another guest in the flat but I will advise you before you complete your booking. I will either exchange keys with you or I'll arrange for you to pick these up from the concierge. I'll pre-arrange this with you to make checking in hassle free. I'm more than happy to help prior to you arriving with regards to places to visit in the city, good bars/restaurants and so on. I often won't be around when you're visiting as I'll be on h
neighborhood_overview: The flat is situated near Deansgate Locks and over the road from First Street where there is a theatre, Pizza Express and a few other places. Nice part of Manchester and 10 minutes to the City Centre. There is a Sainsbury's at the end of the road too which is pretty useful!
notes: I have written a handbook so have a read if you're unsure of check in/check out times, how to use appliances etc.
transit: There are bus routes all around my flat and Deansgate Castlefield tram stop is just round the corner which will take you to various places around Manchester (I'd recommend downloading the Metrolink app if you decide to do this). Otherwise, just walk and explore the city.
host_about: Hello, I'm Kerry, I'm 30 and have lived in Manchester since I was 18 when I came here to go to Uni. I absolutely LOVE the City so anything you need to know, just ask me. I enjoy going out, meeting new people, travelling, reading, eating out and cooking in the flat and love listening to music. There are speakers in the flat so go for it with your tunes. My flatmate Fatima may well be in the flat when you are - she's great and will be happy to help if you need anything. Don't spend too much time in the flat though, there is loads to explore and some fab places to eat and drink! You only live once so enjoy!! :)

space: A large, light room to rent in an artist's flat. Newly decorated and inspiring space to call home whilst located in manchester. Located on Whitworth Street, a mere hop and skip away from the Home art cinema, the Village, Oxford Road, the Northern Quarter, a huge bundle of restaurants and bars, cafes and shops, as well as all the creative amenities that the city has to offer. You are literally on the city's doorstep! This bohemian flat has WiFi and a good DVD selection (though no TV), a simple bathroom, with a bath and a plastic shower attachment (please note this when booking so it is not a surprise to you :-)), and an agreeable and friendly hostess! name: City Centre Artistic Studio
summary: Located just a 3 minute walk away from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private Studio Apartment in Manchester's vibrant City Centre.
space: Built in 1875, this is a beautiful four storey Grade 2 listed building with original wood, stone and metal decor & architecture throughout.
description: Located just a 3 minute walk away from Manchester Piccadilly Train Station, you will soon feel at home in your very own private Studio Apartment in Manchester's vibrant City Centre. Built in 1875, this is a beautiful four storey Grade 2 listed building with original wood, stone and metal decor & architecture throughout. The Entire studio apartment is yours to enjoy, so make yourself at home and feel free to use the... Tea, coffee & milk Chocolate goodies Cooking ingredients (that are available) Ice cubes DVDs Soap, shower gel & shampoo  Towels Washing powder & dishwasher tablets Whether your stay is for business of pleasure, I want you to have the best experience possible! BEFORE YOU ARRIVE... Tell me the purpose of your trip (Birthday, Wedding, Concert, Theatre, Football, Shopping, Conference, Meeting or Airport Transfer etc) and i'll do whatever I can to 'Make It Happen' for you! DURING YOUR STAY... You'll be met upon arrival at a time & location you specify and taken directly to the
neighborhood_overview: The studio is located on the dividing line of two very different neighbourhoods... PICCADILLY is a mix of chain hotels, corporate offices and mainstream high street retailers, whilst the NORTHERN QUARTER is the complete opposite, and is a mix of independent cafes, restaurants, bars, tea rooms, boutique shops and small businesses selling unique items.   The Northern Quarter has previously been described as "a centre of alternative and bohemian culture" which is fitting!
notes: BEDS... The studio apartment contains ONE double cabin bed, and ONE double sofa bed below.  A cabin bed & sofa bed are not the same as a 'normal' double bed, so you and your fellow traveler(s) should be prepared for that!  (Please have a good look at every photograph before you book to avoid any disappointment when you arrive) HOTEL STANDARDS... All bed linen and towels are professionally washed and ironed by a national laundry company, so you can look forward to a hotel standard when you arrive!   CYCLING... If you are a keen cyclist, feel free to bring your bike with you!  An open plan but secure cycle area is situated within one of the light wells of the building.  Bring a lock and all will be fine!
transit: WALK... It Is possible to walk to all parts of Manchester City Centre within 15 minutes.  It's a concentrated place with lots of things to do within a very short walk! FREE SHUTTLE BUS... Metroshuttles are free buses linking the main rail stations, car parks, shopping areas and businesses in Manchester city centre. Metroshuttle buses run from Piccadilly, Salford Central, Victoria, Oxford Road and Deansgate rail stations. There are three circular routes covering the main areas in the city centre. TRAM... Metrolink is a light rail tram system that covers Greater Manchester.  The network consists of six lines which provide access from Manchester City Centre and along routes to Altrincham, Ashton-under-Lyne, Bury, Didsbury, Eccles, and Rochdale. DRIVING... You'll be staying in the M1 post code of Manchester City Centre - it doesn't get any more central than this!  If you can, leave the car at home and use public transport as parking will cost you either £10 or £20 per night depending on wh
host_about:
I am a Creative and work on various projects in Photography, Brand Development & Marketing to name a few.

My interests include... Photography, Travel, the Sea, Friends, Family, Design, Nature, Ideas, Culture, Tech, Food, Coffee, Music & Autobiographies.

I love to travel whenever I can as the stimulus of meeting new people, discovering new places and seeing different ways of life excites me (and keeps me young at heart).

I believe and follow the mottos "make it happen" and "the world is run by those who turn up."

name: Quirky 2 bed | Superb location
summary: This quirky 2 bed flat is perfectly located in Northern Quarter, Manchester. It is a 5min walk from Piccadilly Train Station and is surrounded by excellent bars, restaurants and shops. Exellent transport links to football stadiums, theatres and more!
space: Two spacious double bedrooms with two comfortable double beds! The flat attracts a lot of light throughout the day and is a great space to relax and unwind during your stay. The flat comes complete with bedding, towels and all the necessary items to cook up a great meal.  The apartment is situated in Northern Quarter, Manchester's coolest arts neighbourhood, and is literally a five minute walk from Manchester Piccadilly train station. The station is only a 20-minute train ride away from Manchester Airport and connects the city to London, Liverpool, Edinburgh, Glasgow, Newcastle, Birmingham and more. The station will also connect visitors to nearby football and concert venues, such as Manchester United or Manchester City. Other fantastic spots are literally a walk away - including Gay Village, Deansgate Locks, Castlefield, the Arndale shopping centre, the Printworks, the Manchester Christmas Markerts (during winter!), Spinningfields and the city's vibrant student district.
description: This quirky 2 bed flat is perfectly located in Northern Quarter, Manchester. It is a 5min walk from Piccadilly Train Station and is surrounded by excellent bars, restaurants and shops. Exellent transport links to football stadiums, theatres and more! Two spacious double bedrooms with two comfortable double beds! The flat attracts a lot of light throughout the day and is a great space to relax and unwind during your stay. The flat comes complete with bedding, towels and all the necessary items to cook up a great meal.  The apartment is situated in Northern Quarter, Manchester's coolest arts neighbourhood, and is literally a five minute walk from Manchester Piccadilly train station. The station is only a 20-minute train ride away from Manchester Airport and connects the city to London, Liverpool, Edinburgh, Glasgow, Newcastle, Birmingham and more. The station will also connect visitors to nearby football and concert venues, such as Manchester United or Manchester City. Other fantastic sp
neighborhood_overview: Northern Quarter is Manchester's arts and independent retailers area and attracts a very cool and easy-going crowd. There's dozens of excellent cafes and coffee shops, bars and restaurants, vintage clothes stores and more... It is truly a wonderful place just waiting to be explored. The neighbourhood is safe and well-lit and there's usually people coming and going until quite late at night. There can be some noise on weekends but generally the real "heavy partying" takes place elsewhere in the city so getting a good night's sleep shouldn't be a problem!
notes: There are a couple of guide books to the city in the flat - please feel free to use but kindly return them for other guests to use :)
transit: Piccadilly Train Station - 5 minute walk Manchester Airport - 20 minute train Nearest tram stop is Piccadilly Train Station Nearest car park - Piccadilly Basin car park opposite the flat £12 per 24 hours
host_about:
Manchester is the perfect city if you want culture, cuisine, sport, entertainment or anything that's not overpriced like capital cities - we're also northern and therefore much friendlier.

Due to  my nature of work I am regularly involved in the city's goings on and can therefore offer advice and tips about where's best to eat out, visit or anything that you need to know about the city!

As I often work around the UK it will be myself who will wait for you to arrive and hand over the keys.

neighborhood_overview: MORE ABOUT LOCATION ….. The apartment couldn't be better placed to suit the Manchester visitor or regular business traveller. name: CASTLEROSE Boat Stay - Castlefield
summary: Book a fantastic City Break holiday in Manchester on our brand new wide-beam canal boat offering apartment hotel style self catering accommodation for upto six. 2 Bedrooms.  2 Bathrooms.  Fully fitted kitchen. All mod cons.
space: We can accommodate upto six people in comfort: There are two luxury bedrooms, a master double with en-suite bathroom and a second bedroom which can be configured either as two singles or a super-king bed. The bedrooms are individually furnished taking inspiration from our inland waterways & hedgerows . The beds are made up in luxury linen with duvets and the bathrooms have full size showers with unlimited hot water, soft white towels and flush toilets! The open plan Lounge – Dining – Kitchen area draws inspiration from the traditions of canal living and includes log fire and chimney, armchairs in patchwork colours and decorative art pieces!  This homely space can be used in a multitude of ways: Relax around the log fire, enjoy dinner for upto six around the dining table or at the end of the day turn the room into a sumptuous double bedroom. The fully fitted galley kitchen includes gas cooker, microwave, fridge freezer, wine cooler and dish washer.  A modern diesel fired central heating

neighborhood_overview: Our fantastic mooring at Castlefield Basin in the heart of Manchester is a great location from which to enjoy a short stay City Break holiday.  We are moored in a tranquil spot amid the ducks, swans and neighbouring restaurants & inner city dwellers of Castlefield.  We are a hop to the landmark Hilton Hotel with Cloud 23 Cocktail Bar, a skip to the the Bridgewater Hall and a jump to the many exciting experiences that await in this vibrant city!
notes: In the interests of all of our customers we have decided not to allow pets on-board. Sorry!  Also we are a non-smoking boat.
transit: Castlefield Basin is a four minute walk from Manchester Deansgate train station & tram stop. If travelling from Manchester Piccadilly or Victoria train stations you could jump on the free Metroshuttle bus or you could get a taxi and ask to be dropped off next to Alberts Shed restaurant at 20 Castle Street, Manchester, M3 4LZ. CASTLEROSE is moored on the “other" side of the canal so walk over the white Merchants Bridge and follow the canal round. We're also near The Wharf pub.  For your satnav our address is Bridgewater Canal Tow Path, Manchester, M15 4PR
host_about: We are husband & wife couple Steve & Stephanie who are getting started on AirBnB - and just launching our unique accommodation business in central Manchester.  Castlerose has been two years in the planning so we hope you come to love her as much as we do!  Any questions please get in touch.
street: Bridgewater Canal Tow Path, Manchester, M15, United Kingdom

summary: This modern and fully equipped 2 bedroom apartment is set in Manchester City Center. This  comes with a bathroom, master ensuite and a balcony over looking the River Medlock. Close by you have the night life of Deansgate Locks and shopping center.
space: Fully furnished city center apartment comfortably fits 4 people. Two bedrooms each with with standard double beds, bed side tables and wardrobes. The master bedroom has an en-suite and there is a main bathroom with a bath tub. The apartment comes fully furnished with an open plan living / dining / kitchen. There are floor to ceiling windows and there is also a small balcony. The apartment comes with Wide screen TV with built in freeview and a DVD player. The kitchen is fully equipped with all equipment available. There is a washer / fryer, dishwasher and microwave. There is wifi available free of charge throughout the apartment. There is also a lift and car parking available at an additional cost of £10.

Bars ad restaurants are withing walking distance. Deansgate Locks around the corner with bars and Deangate with some of Manchester's best restaurants.
notes: Check in time is from 2pm up to 10pm. I can be flexible with earlier check in times if possible. name: Heart of the City
summary: Cosy, modern apartment located in the city centre of Manchester
space: Modern, cosy city centre based apartment. 1 Bedroom, bathroom, kitchen and living area plus balcony. Modern facilities including shower, wifi, dishwasher, washing machine, etc.  The apartment is surrounded by several restaurants, bars, cinema, bowling alley, the Science and Industry Museum as well as the historic Castlefield area. Deansgate, the city's main road containing many restaurants, bars and clubs is a 2 minute walk from the apartment. The Arndale shopping centre is a 10 minute walk from the apartment and the universities (Manchester Metropolitan and the University of Manchester) are located a 15 and 20 minute walk, respectively.  The apartment has excellent transport links to Deansgate Train Station, St Peter's Square Tram stop as well as several buses (including the city's free metro shuttles). Piccadilly Train Station is a 20 minute walk (or a 10 minute bus ride using the number 3 free metro shuttle).

space: 5th floor apartment with 2 large double bedrooms, 1 large bathroom and 1 en suite.  Open plan kitchen and lounge. Balcony off the second bedroom. Next to Piccadilly station, a short walk from the Northern Quarter and the Arndale Centre.   The 5th person can either sleep on the couch or on an inflatable mattress in the lounge. Very conveniently for all major attractions in Manchester city centre, as well as for trams to the surrounding areas (Old Trafford, Media City, Chorlton, etc.).  There are some great local bars and restaurants in the Northern Quarter (which is a five minute walk away) such as Common, Odd Bar, the Alchemist and The Terrace, and fantastic restaurants such the The Northern Quarter Restaurant, Ning, SoLiTa and Simple.  The Arndale Centre is a 10 minute walk away, as are Deansgate, Castlefield and Deansgate Locks.

A little further down is Piccadilly Gardens with banks, restaurants, shops etc. If you have a particular destination (football stadiums, museums, theatres, neighbourhoods for going out like Northern Quarter, Spinningfields, Canal Street, Deansgate Locks etc), or any question not cove
